I didn't particularly hate this, but.. the mind-numbing lack of plot progress, lazy character development and characters that are incapable of protecting themselves or each other in ANY way really took it's toll on me. When I realized there's only 5 mins left, I got restless 'cos I thought nothing has really happened yet and the movie is ending. And then it ended and I was left with the feeling the movie-makers really had no idea what the movie was about. Yeah, throw in some personal tragedy, some weird neighbors, a struggling mother-son-relationship, FINE. Don't invest in any thought completely and you'll get a.. wet sandwich. Yeah, that's what describes this movie the best; WET SANDWICH. Now, I shall watch something better.

. The music was very dramatic and was used to slowly build up tension in the movie ........ leading up to a moment of NOTHING!The lead woman was in the shower and suddenly the water went cold . So then the 'horror type ' of dramatic music started . She went down to the basement and LIT THE BOILER . And that was it! This happened a few times in the movie . One time the son went to light the boiler too.
There was also a lady who had Alzheimer's . And a friendly Black guy , who of course got the chop. This movie was more like a boring , slow, drama than a horror . .
The ending had nothing to do with the entire movie ! I think this movie was secretly written by a 5 year old and the ending was added by an 11 year old

One of the worst movies I have ever watched literally. In every scene they try to create a tension but just swoons away in a moment and everything goes normal. That way you keep waiting for some shock which you never get. In the earlier parts they try to build some supernatural tension and in the end it suddenly becomes a serial killer. U don't even get to know who it is, why he is doing this, any of this. In one of the scenes a neighbourhood guy goes into the basement to have a look at the house and there is no closure to that scene. That is the harbinger of what is to come ie the movie also doesn't get any closure likewise and ends. All in all don't waste your time on this.

reviews.review_title: So bad that we had to laugh when it ended
reviews.content: This is by far the worst movie I have seen recently. Dont waste your time.

reviews.review_title: the most Dreadful Movie I've ever seen!
reviews.content: "the Open House" is one of the worst movies i've ever seen on netflix and pointless as well, the story is bland and so are the characters who are just stereotypical and dreadful.

Seriously folks...this movie goes absolutely NOWHERE! If you want to see a good review of this movie,look up "Elvis the Alien" on YouTube and he will shoot you the straight poop about this train wreck of a movie. At least when you watch his review,you will get WAYYYYYYY more enjoyment of watching that instead of wasting your time on the actual movie. Even if you can watch it for FREE...I recommend against it. I've never seen a movie that leaves you SO FLAT at the end that almost can't believe it. So go check out Elvis' review,and have a good laugh at this film's expense. Toodles.

reviews.review_title: There was just no Logic in this..
reviews.content: The movie started off similarly like any other movie with a little surprise element 'The father's death'. But the plot quickly became boring and illogical. Dylan Minette (famous for 13 Reasons Why) did a decent part in this otherwise flattered and nonsense suspense & psychological thriller..My Rating : 1.5/5

Just because you want to make something different doesn't necessarily make it good. There is no plot, no story, no explanation of absolutely anything and everything that happens is pointless. Build ups that go nowhere, mysteries that are created for no reason and are abandoned and unecessary drama in a movie that is not the worst I've ever seen but sure as hell is the emptiest.
Just close the house!

This movie was so awful I had to laugh at the end. There was no rhyme or reason. This movie was like it was written by someone in grade school. It was a lot of stuff tact together to make a movie..Dad gets killed with little explanation other than being hit by a car..why..who did it..the movie never says...mom and son go to live in mom's sister's house that is being sold and has open house on a day during the week..mom and son run into crazy lady in store that seems to know them but acts strange and she keeps showing up and always says weird stuff..things keep going on in house that scare mom and son...I would have already got into my car and left if that stuff was happening around me...killer guy shows up and moves around the house without mom and son seeing him...cute store guy shows up and gets murdered by man in black...we never know who he is...then he kills mom..son runs in woods and weird guy murders son and the last thing we see is murder guy driving down road to next open house.....the end....we never know who this man is or what is his motive for killing these people...like I said awful movie....

I said that this review may contain spoilers, but really, there are none to give away.This movie was really disappointing with a confusing ending, which was also far from happy!Did Matt Angel and Suzanne Coote go to film school and learn to write a movie? If they did then they should get their money back! They don't know how to write a beginning, middle and end! I'm not saying that I, myself, could do any better, but from other movies I've seen from other writers, this is one of the worst and botched jobs I've ever seen!They didn't give the characters any real depth, and the antagonist... they didn't bother coming up with a main identity, explaining to themselves and the audience who this antagonist is, apart from showing bits and pieces, and what his motivations are. The furthest we got was to determine that this person was a male and stocky in build. Other than that, nada. Another reviewer thinks that, from what little we saw, the antagonist looks like the plumber. Maybe they're right. Still, what is his motive?In thrillers and horrors, like any other genre, we're supposed to be cheering for the main character(s) to come out on top, but that can only be done with some depth of character, and this movie, as I previously said, lacks any sort of depth in both storyline and characters.There are holes in what is supposed to pass for a plot.All in all, it's a horrible movie and not worth being viewed even once!Netflix, I know you wanted 'original' Netflix movies, and I enjoy some of them, though I know that they're not 'original' Netflix movies - I've seen them before. But, you really should have skipped on this one, as it's horrible and does nothing for the reputation you're not only trying to build, but also maintain! If you keep "airing" s*** content like this, your reputation is going to follow them: down the toilet.Please, if you're looking for a thriller or horror movie, skip this one and chose one that makes more sense with better writing and character development.
Had great potential as a story but turned out to be really bad I can't believe the actors agreed to do this movie, its a shocker.

reviews.review_title: Terrible 3rd Act. Lets the whole film down.
reviews.content: I thought the first hour of this film was ok. Nice slow burn. And random characters added throughout as the possible 'intruder'. Sure the main characters do some stupid stuff to keep the plot moving forward, but for the most part I let it slide, because I was still entertained.The last 20 minutes however was just awful. I expected the movie to ramp up and get exciting with the mother & son making the intruder wish he'd picked another house ... but no, there was no fighting back. They both die and he leaves. And he was no one. They didn't even show his face, which was kind of stupid. Make it the crazy Neighbors husband or something. Anything but the nothing you chose.Also, hire some stunt people/stunt doubles. I know the film was made on the cheap, but that 3rd act needed some actual action and there was nothing. They couldn't even smash a table or have someone falling down the stairs - the basics. It was so dodgy.I'd recommend not watching. You'll just be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Well, I can't give 1 star just because of the ending but...
reviews.content: As with pretty much every other reviewer said, the film has no ending. I was actually enjoying the first 70 mins of the film, I was like yeah, this is cool, I wonder what the hell is going on with this family, but then events start to happen in the film and as soon as the moment we are supposed to figure it all out, then suddenly...

This movie is a complete waste of time.Now, most movies have three acts. Act I. II and III but this movie only has II Acts.In the first one, everything seems fine then goes bad in the second one everything gets worse and then it ends. There is no explanation for any of this, no background no nothing. It seems like half of the movie was cut off for some reason and only the unexplained bits are kept.Ugh, worst movie ever.

It was a terrible movie!! No hidden underlined message I promise!! Not one of those, maybe I missed something. It's not you, it's this movie! It was like the directors first story he wrote when he was a kid or something and always dreamed to see it turn into a movie. Do anything but watch this. It's random not scary with no plot... everything left unexplained for no reason...the dad was the worst dad casted ever... the suspense scenes were so drawn out for nothing. Just dumb!!!!!
I really like Dylan Minnette, but this movie straight up sucks. Watched the whole movie and I still don't understand the point of it. No explanation is given for anything...

I was all ready to give this fright flick 9 stars. It held me on the edge of my seat...right up until the last 2 minutes. The description read "Following a tragedy, a mother and her teenage son move to a relative's vacant vacation home where eerie and unexplained forces conspire against them." This is what's meant by 'truth in advertising'. Not only are the forces unexplained to the characters, but also to us, the audience. What were the producers and writers thinking? Did they not have any clue how to put closure to the story? What an insult to every viewer who stuck through this movie to the bitter end...and I am one bitter viewer. In actuality, the movie is a solid 8 or 9 stars, but 8 or 9 stars are taken away due to the pathetic ending. Inexcusable, inconsiderate and an embarrassment.

This movie is more like a TV production than a real movie. Many things go wrong here. Acting is not up to par. The director also fails to create other than low levels of suspense at the best. Several scenes look unrealistic and as a whole the movie is not convincing. Actors show minimal facial expression. The storyline has been done to death many years ago. The best part of this movie is the song by Shannon and the clams.

This "horror" movie was so pointless. They had so much build up as to what was going on and who was doing it to them, but it resolved to nothing as you never find out. Martha and Chris were just pointless characters that added nothing to the storyline. Everyone ends up dead anyway. The ending leaves you so unsatisfied with so many questions. Not worth your time.

reviews.review_title: One of the single worst *films* I've ever seen...
reviews.content: This is horrific. Absolutely nothing of significance happens, is explained, or has any meaning whatsoever.And it's slower than hell. Believe me, I love slow-paced films...when they're properly put together, or are interesting, or have interesting visuals.Or, I dunno, have something even remotely... there... on-screen.I apologize for to the films I've criticized before where I've said nothing happened.They don't even compare to to this nothingness of a film.
It was a good story but I felt something between angry and idiot when it suddenly ended, asking myself "what happened?". So, 1...

We're in the risky month of January once again and when it comes to watching new releases in entertainment, it's usually a coin toss as to whether or not a movie will actually be good. Ever since Netflix began to release original films, I've found myself holding out hope that fantastic independent films will slowly begin to make their way onto streaming services, instead of failing at the box office. Well, if one of Netflix's most recent films in The Open House is any indication, then we're still a very long way from something like that ever happening. Not only is this one of the most non-scary horror films that I've seen in recent memory, but it's also one of the worst films in general that I've seen in recent memory. People talk about how bad a movie is, but sometimes it just has to be seen to be believed. Now streaming, here's why I think you should check this movie out just to see how bad it truly is.Starring Dylan Minnette and Piercey Dalton star in The Open House, a film that (after a tragic event) follows them as they work on selling their home. Shacking up in a family member's house up in the mountains while they set up open houses, creepy things begin to happen to them. What's disturbing them? Well, without giving anything away, literally nothing is ever explained to you throughout the movie. It's almost a joke that this film was even made because not a single portion of this movie is terrifying and not a single plot point is interesting enough to hold your attention for two seconds.Look, I've said this before, but it's really not necessary to make a horror movie to scare the hell out of someone because it's all about atmosphere and visuals. When the It hit theatres last year, it wasn't the kind of film that needed to throw scares in your face, because it focussed more on its characters and made you just care about watching these kids hang out and hope they all make it out of the film alive. So, when a movie like The Open House manages to simultaneously provide incredibly weak characters, laughably cheap set pieces, jump scares that you can see coming over ten minutes before they happen (and that's not even an exaggeration), and a conclusion that's pretty much a slap in the face to every viewer for even watching the movie, then I have nothing good to say about it.From the small films that Dylan Minnette has appeared in, to his larger role in last year's new series 13 Reasons Why, I've always enjoyed watching his performances, but even he was incredibly one-note here. Every time something would happen in their house that was supposed to trigger chills from the audience, it felt forced and quite honestly, every single set piece was a re-creation of another horror film. Yes, it's practically impossible to not draw inspiration from other movies these days, but The Open House just felt uninspired from start to finish.In the end, I found myself chuckling if a character died, laughing hysterically at each jump scare, rolling my eyes when a new plot point arises that you already know the outcome to, or just plain being bored at the bland imagery. The funny thing is that this movie has an ending that I didn't exactly see coming, but the way it ends actually makes the movie worse than it already is. It's still very early in the year, but I'll be shocked if this doesn't stay my most hated movie of this year. The Open House is truly an awful film and unless you get a kick out of terrible horror films, then I would advise that you steer clear of this one.

reviews.review_title: I've never hated a movie so much in my entire life.. until this!
reviews.content: Oh, Netflix, how've you made a huge mistake. The first time I saw this trailer, I thought it had a neat concept. It had the potential of a great mystery. But, oh boy, was I dead wrong!The movie starts with Dylan Minette (I won't bother you with the character's name) whose father has a tragic accident as he witnessed it happened. The family has financial problems which prompts them to move. His mother's sister offers them an open house she has yet to sale in the meantime until they get back on their feet. As soon as they start staying there, weird things start to happen.The first few minutes starts well, but then descends into a black pit of turd. Why do I find it so horrible? I mean, the actors are fine, the camerawork's great, the cinematography's beautiful. It's just the execution and the storytelling.are so unfathomably stupid, clichéd, and have been done to death. False jump scares; weird, possible red herrings; characters who are oblivious to what's happening around them, who does stupid things. By the end, I was just laughing because of how ridiculous the conclusion is. The only saving graces are Dylan Minette and Piercey Dalton. They really tried to convince us with their conflict that stems from their grief. Their dramatic moments were the only highlight of this movie, which are so few and far in between.It's infuriating to see such hackneyed work that looks gorgeous and has some great acting. If this were to be released in theaters, it would flop so bad. Don't bother wasting your time on this.

reviews.review_title: Decent Scary Movie, despite what the other reviews say.
reviews.content:
I've been reading a lot of low reviews for this movie because people were disappointed in it. I can tell you that it was well worth the watch for me and I am recommending it to people. There were plenty of thrills. I watched it alone, in the dark. A boy and his mother relocate to the mountains to stay in a home away from their everyday life after a tragic accident. The home is owned by the mother's sister who is selling the home. While they're staying there an open house is scheduled to show the home to potential buyers. At first the home seems like it's haunted, then as the movie ends you find out it is something entirely different. SPOILER ABOUT THE ENDING!
I think most people were upset because the filmmakers switched the script on the film. It wasn't paranormal at all, but a psycho killer who plays with his victims for a while before he goes in for the final kill. This particular psycho likes to find his prey by visiting open houses and hiding in the house after the real estate agent leaves, then he slowly taunts his victims before deciding to kill them, and then he moves on to the next open house to find his next victims.

reviews.review_title: Netflix owes me 90 minutes of my life back
reviews.content: Whoever cut the trailer for this movie is much more talented than the writer. The trailer looks creepy and suspenseful and definitely hooked me in. The movie was hot garbage. I imagine the director and writer saying to each other "what if this movie had no real ending at all! We'll just throw a bunch of characters in the plot that have no purpose and let the audience figure out what it all means!" Then they high fived each other. I'm sure they were trying to be artistic and outside the box, but they just made a terrible movie with one of the worst endings in movie history. The biggest mystery is how did this junk get financing?

I don't understand the bad reviews here. It's not a gory horror supernaturally themed picture. It's a thriller and a pretty good one. Very well made, good acting, creeps and scary bits at the right place. Found this little gem on Netflix and enjoyed the goose bumps. I give it 8/ 10.

reviews.review_title: A comparatively decent horror film, although quite overly bleak for me
reviews.content:
Reading through the reviews on this site, this film has been getting quite a pummelling from the reviewers. First of all, I can fully understand why; the movie is basically a softcopy of Black Christmas, a movie in which a man in the house kills off its occupants one by one and we never see his face, except for an eyeball through a keyhole, and this is something that in the past worked really well but now, in a culture more in tuned and excited by the Serial Killer horror film, it doesn't quite excite. I've always preached that the monster that can be explained can be more scary than those that can't, as the purpose makes it more fleshed out.And by far the thing that makes this film very difficult to embrace or enjoy is the seeming omnipotence of the film's killer. He is massively overpowered, to the point where it literally feels like the movie's writing team trying to find ways to make a character suffer - he even manages to remove the contact lenses worn by Dylan Minnette's Logan with extreme precision. There's a point where the writer's should've had him make some mistakes, or let the character's get the upper hand on him because towards the tale's end, it just becomes uncomfortably exploitative.
He is well shot though, like the rest of the film - you get impression of his size compared to Minnette and Piercey Dalton, and enough details like the shape of his face and the colour of his skin to form an image in your head, but you are still annoyed by the vagueness of his character beyond a sadistic murderer.In fact, one thing I can praise this film for is how well made it is. The camerawork and the cinematography are particularly stellar, in how they very ably layout the property for you to see where everything is in relation to one another, show what's going on the background clearly, note things that matter, such as Logan's eyesight problems, or Naomi's photography hobby that played a role.The cast is small, which is something that doesn't help the film - it feels a bit too sparse, and the film is quite empty as a result - but they are reliable. Dylan Minnette is one of the best young actors today, who does a great job of acting realistically scared for someone in his position, and also pulling off the film's physical work, and Piercey Dalton in her feature debut as his mother, who is a very realistically grieving, conflicted person in this position.Other positives include the soundtrack design in how it builds both shock and tension, much like John William's Jaws score, and how it is comparatively more well made than horror films of a similar ilk. However, it's overly bleak, unfulfilling tone, whilst exceptional, is the big reason why I could never watch this film again.It is, however, CERTAINLY not as bad as some say it is.

reviews.review_title: Senseless and pure Waste of Time!
reviews.content: What can I say. The whole story is very rich in horror clichés. Well, the whole production is rather cold, bad and boring. If the film tries to be creepy, it ends up in a disaster of predictable jumpscares. Even if the newcomer main actor does everything, it doesn't save the film. I bet he is annoyed to have played there. When the end comes, you hope all the time for a smart and well thought out end. However, you will be extremely disappointed if you find out that it has nothing to do with each other. One of the worst films I've ever seen. Even attributing this rating was exhausting. Nevertheless I wanted to share my opinion.

I gotta admit I was as annoyed with the ending as most of the low star reviewers at first. Then I slept on it and woke up still thinking about this movie. I realized that the ending just fit the overall atmosphere of the story. There is SO much that is left unsaid and it dawned on me that it is by design. That was the whole point. We simply don't know for sure and probably never will, unless there is a sequel. I've decided I'm okay with this and it's made me apreciate the movie in a whole new way.I have my own theory as to what happened. If you pay attention, there are quite a few clues throughout the movie that point to a very likely conclusion. I hate that I will never be certain, but there are a million other movies I can watch if I crave that kind of closure. This is clearly not one of those movies. It made me think outside the cookie cutter thriller/horror box. It made me question my expectations. It made me realize that the reason we get upset by these frustrating, anti-climatic endings is because of our innate need to control and correct imbalance and injustice. Sometimes life is just unfair, bad things happen and we'll never know why. Give it a chance. The movie is decent. Not a masterpiece by any stretch, but well worth a watch.

How bad off is Netflix? Are they losing so much money that they had to fire the writing team halfway through production?First 40 minutes - this seemed like it had a chance. Then the wheels come off. I can only assume the budget collapsed, the writers left and Netflix brought in a few stray bonobo monkeys from the local zoo, temporarily stopped them from flinging feces at each other, and had them complete the script.My advice - watch the first 40 minutes. Turn it off. Then let your imagination run wild. Even if you have a "gump-ian" IQ, anything you come up will be better than the actual ending.

reviews.review_title: Horribly Written, Terrible Movie with an Idiotic Ending
reviews.content: I'm really getting sick of The Netflix Fodder School of Fimmaking. You don't have to understand basic storytelling they teach in Creative Writing 101. All you have to do is have a camera, some people to film and a place to shoot it. No need for story, whatsoever. This movie spends almost all it's time pretending it's a supernatural thriller, changes genres right at the end and then leaves you hanging. This is not because the writer was clever and wanted to create a genre bending movie, it's because they didn't have f#ck of an idea what they were doing.The other title I give these horrible attempts at movie making is 'participation trophy cinema'. This is the result of giving children trophies for accomplishing nothing. They grew up thinking they were 'special' and all they had to do is show up and world was there to kiss their underachieving ass. Well, they should've f#cking applied themselves because we don't deserve to be subjected to their lack of discipline and initiative. Do NOT watch this. It is a waste of your time and the creators didn't have any idea what they were doing and should never have been encouraged to make movies.

Everyone tried so HARD..acting (despite the paltry material) is quite good. Cinematography is A+. Beautiful set interiors of a gorgeous house-practically-mansion makes you want to go out house-buying. Problem is, what you have here is a cliche machine, churning out cliche nonsense after cliche nonsense same as you've seen so often in every suspense/horror movie you've every seen, that it makes you moan out-loud knowing what's coming 10 minutes before it happens. If you enjoy those long, interminablely slow tracking shots following a character walking and walking and walking and looking and looking (almost always with a flashlight) accompanied by the cliche scary music only to have an overly loud musical "bang," character jumps and yells -- you've got that here over and over again until you feel like you're stuck in a time-loop twilight zone episode...all of a sudden you realize it is YOU who are in a nightmare from which you can't wake up. You have seen all of this before, but what's worse, because the characters ARE likable and because you want at lease a reasonable resolution for them -- not to mention a reasonable, intelligent explanation of all the hokum for yourself -- you keep watching; alas, resolutions or explanations for the characters or for you as a reward for sticking with this lump of regurgitated trash is DENIED. What you are subjected to ikn the last reel, completely out of nowhere are violence and torture...and then an end credit roll that will make your blood boil. I won't reveal the ending, but all I will say is, it's not satisfying on ANY level; it resolves nothing and left me, anyway, wanting to find this director and break everyone of HIS damn fingers. Bottom line, it's an unfortunate waste of the talents of everyone involved...but then, they all got paid; you didn't...and trust me, your time and talents are worth more than this scam of a movie. S K I P I T !

reviews.review_title: Acting was decent, plot holes everywhere
reviews.content: This movie was so bad, not due to the acting or even the first hour (give or take). It does a pretty good job building the suspense, the characters are a bit one dimensional but at least believable for the most part. The problem is it's such a bad story, that literally goes nowhere. You never find out who is doing the killing, why they are doing the killing, how they are doing it (did they actually stay from the open house, where did they hide, how did the police not find them). The plot was so poor, I watched the ending credits thinking this was the biggest con job I had ever been part of. Rarely is a movie as much of a let down as this one was, don't waste your time with this, you'll just end up with more questions than answers by the end, and you'll have wasted the running time of the film to get them.

After reading reviews, am having trouble understanding the do gooders who feel this film was scary or in anyway artistic. Given the available budgets within the film industry, i think it is peoples rights to rate as 0 or 1 star.
To those who feel they should criticise the majority of reviewers, why do you think it is so great! Is it the low budget? Mediocre acting? Tedious drama? Or just that you think its thought provoking for you? Everybody has the right to rate. It makes me laugh when reviewers rate ten and then excuse their high marking by saying its not great. Film makers need public opinion so they dont waste money on efforts such as Open house.
Please dont waste your time! Really bad film with no outcome or real point.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie you can ever watch
reviews.content:
When i say this is the worst movie you can ever watch i mean it because there is nothing to watch
The movie is about a mother and a teenager moving to a mountain house and then nothing
The director trues to convince us that there is something terrifying is happening by this stupid music but actually nothing is happening and then at the very end of the movie some mysterious man kills the mother and her son and we don't know who he cause we don't see his face and we don't know why he killed them
It's pure stupidity i guess
Very very bad movie

This film has good acting and a solid foundation to be a good thriller, but it leads to nowhere. Besides being cruel - there are no hidden messages or twists, plot only goes one way where the family from the beginning of the film becomes more and more miserable, there isn't much to think about because they show you someone actually is in the house ~ he kills em' in cruel ways, the end.
Are you supposed to be left wondering? I honestly wonder what the guy that wrote the script was thinking.Anyway, a waste of my time.

reviews.review_title: 90% of the movie is actually great, but one of the worst movie endings ive ever seen
reviews.content: I wanted to love this movie. I waited weeks for this movie to come out on friday i couldnt wait any longer i was stoked to finally see it. I really enjoyed the first hour and fifteen minutes. I thought the acting was great, im a fan of dylan minnette since dont breathe back in 2016. Unfortunately because of the ending...he is the brightest spot of this movie. So much suspense and so many questions and then the movie just...ends? no ending at all its like the writers didnt want to blow it so they just said "hey lets have the last shot be of a mailbox and lets not explain anything".... i really hated that ending i think it is the worst ending of all endings, ever. I'm not even a person that hates unexplained stories, david lynch is one of my favorite directors of all time. But this story specifically needed a conclusion and i still want answers.. david lynch movies are open ended because his stories are so complex and open for interpretation.. but this movie is so far from lynchian... were they leaving the door open for an "open house 2?" i doubt it. I wasted my time on this one so i dont even wanna waste more time on a possible sequel.. 6 stars is very generous, this movie is a real-let down.

Do not listen to all the dumbed down reviewers here who always need a Hollywood style story and ending. This was a fantastic film thats keeps u confused and creeped out throughout whole movie. And the ending makes this movie significantly better. A real world ending. Not a Hollywood hero saves the day garbage!

reviews.review_title: haters always hate. most realistic horror as there can be.
reviews.content: This is a good movie despite what all the reviews say. The fact that you don't know who the killer is makes it very realistic. People are saying that they were stupid but NO WAY if this was happening to you no way would you be like "hey I think there is a sadist here we should go." This movie was extremely realistic. The killer was a sadist and was toying with them so they never had a shot to begin with. This was different from a lot of movies because their were no dumb moves. So if you find it unappealing then you need to tune your judgement. That is as nice as I can be about it because it was a very good entertaining movie

reviews.review_title: Why so many 1 ratings? This was a decent movie.
reviews.content: I don't understand why so many people had a hard time comprehending the plot of the movie - it is very simple.******** SPOILERS*********Open Houses can be bad for you.They will allow crazy people to gain access to your home, where they will hide and play mind games with you. Then they will torture and kill you.After which, they will get into their trucks and move on to the next Open House, probably to kill again. The point is made without knowing the killer's identity (not relevant) or needing any more information then that.So, my rating (7) is based on my opinion that there WAS a plot, acting was great, good locations, some suspense, a bit of horror and an ending that DID make sense.

reviews.review_title: Netflix owes me a month off my bill!
reviews.content: I was all in for the ride. Mystery death. Mystery big house. Mysterious things going bump in the night. Tunnels in the basement that lead to to nowhere (maybe that was a casual hint, darn it), unsettling new town and creepy next door neighbors.So many clues, like unnerving photographs, missing cell phones, contact lenses, a broken staircase, Olympic Running times... THAT MEANT ABSOLUTELY NOTHING.This movie is like riding a huge rollercoaster all the way to the very top then told to get out, take the stairs all the way down and expecting you to have enjoyed the ride!Epic, and I don't use this word lightly, FAILURE! (And not even in a fun way)

This movie was below average. the acting was decent but the story was bland. It had a couple good jump scares and a mini creepy moment but overall was a disappointment. The characters were dumbed-down so much just to make sure the killer had the advantage throughout the whole movie. what annoyed me the most was the obvious forced insertion of the first victim. the lazy set up to have him killed off just for the fear factor. writers/directors do yourself a favor and take notes on what doesnt work in every other horror movie and work from that. dont pull every cliche and slap a title on it and turn it in for A for effort but F for lack of creativity.

The reason this film is so terrible is because of its intrusive rudeness. I absolutely loathed it. I don't know if I've ever watched another film that made me actively angry. Why?I liked it. I liked the characters, the mother and son had the right amount of tension and isolation from each other after losing the husband/father in the beginning of the film. I was invested in these characters. I was expecting supernatural elements or something. I was expecting the fact that the son was training to run in the Olympics to be foreshadowing. Maybe he could outrun his pursuer?It's a slow burn through most of the movie. Things disappear from the house, or get misplaced. The house is broken into and vandalized. At this point, I'm thinking, "Where's the vengeful spirit?" Then I start thinking it's going to be another phrogging movie. Man, do those creep me out.No, no, no. The Open House is none of these things. So at this point, I'm reeled in, and then the perpetrator appears.Now the movie, in the LAST FIFTEEN MINUTES, becomes torture, literally. These characters do not even remotely deserve what happens to them. Suddenly, the kid is knocked out in the driveway and gets cold water poured on him, but it gets better. The mother is tied to a chair in the house, and the perp decides to break all of her fingers one-by-one, and then it looks like he busts out bolt cutters, or something similar. Now we have Hostel. What a disappointing, sickening way to end a movie.The kid, who is a runner, is kicked in the rear by the bad guy and told to run, presumably so he can be hunted. He can't run because he's half frozen. WHY INCLUDE THE OLYMPICS TRAINING?I feel violated by this film. I don't know if that was the intent behind it, but I feel like I should seek therapy after viewing this abomination.

Nice flick for the most part, but at its conclusion it leads to a rather bland and mundane feeling of nothingness or irrelevance, that this movie will be completely gone and forgotten from our heads immediately thereafter.

The movie was pointless there was no beginning and no ending. they didn't even care to tell us who was the murder. The trailer of the movie is not representative of the actually movie. the actors are good but in the end of the movie there are so many questions that no one can answer us. In conclusion in the end of the movie someone is wondering why did they spend so much time to see a silly movie such this one.

Fot those who's looking for supernatural horror movie. this is not it.
this terribly movie is a thriller about mother and son being randomly stalked and killed by open house serial killer.
this movie is so random.

reviews.review_title: True imagining of a real horror
reviews.content: The beauty of this movie is the reality it depicts. The noble premise, which I thought brilliant, is to take two utterly ordinary and defenceless people, driven by tragedy and circumstances to a huge rambling mansion, which, again by circumstance, they are forced to leave vulnerable and open to the public for long periods. This defencelessness is heightened by the lead's terrible eyesight, being effectively blind without contacts or glasses. This is very sophisticated drama, and the actors and director manage this with consummate skill. However, such realism, which by its very nature can be time-consuming to portray, may well not be everyone's cup of tea. And the length of the buildup does tend to immunise the viewer from a lot of the scares that repeat. It did for me, but not for my brother, whom jumped twice as often as I did. The tragedy mentioned is revealed only in the behaviour of the leads, a delicate thing, and why I give this piece a high score, with only one flashback late in the movie to make the circumstance specific. That was a plus for me. There is very little gore or splatter and certainly no special effects. It is an effective journey into an ultimate and very real horror, but it is also a very sad reflection on tragedy and vulnerability. I loved the message of this movie. This is an intelligent picture.

This was diabolical. It started okay, then about half way through I could tell it wasn't going to get much better but I waited for the plot twist or answers... There was none. It's one of those films that just ends. No rhyme or reason to the movie at all.

This how bad the film was. I made an imdb account just to write this. The film actually made me annoyed. It was just so bad. I recognised one of the characters from 13 reasons why series and liked him in that so thought it was worth a shot. Literally no story line, no answers to main events throughout and the ending felt like they just ran out of money.

reviews.review_title: Actually a really decent movie, until the VERY end
reviews.content: I honestly don't know what all these crappy reviews are about. Was it my favorite horror/thriller movie? No. But it was certainly suspenseful, tense, and certainly thrilling. It starts off a little slow, but it does an incredible job of building everything up until the end half hour. My only gripe with this movie is that the ending leaves a lot to be desired. It's very intense and adrenaline-pumping, but it doesn't quite answer *why*. I'm left wondering what exactly happened to them, and the reasoning behind it, especially given the back story generated. Still, the movie was very good, and it doesn't deserve the terrible ratings it is getting!!

This is a terrible film.It's en entire waste of getting involved in it, as the ending will leave you so angry and disappointed and frustrated...because there is no ending.You invest in these two 2 dimensional characters only for there to be no resolve. Lazy. Wasteful.Netflix are confused. This film is confused.It's utterly pointless with no arc, no development, utterly unbelievable story - call your sister you dumb woman! Call the police! Why would the sister not say that you can stay in an open house?Awful. Messy.

Mom of two and I never get a moment to myself to watch a movie. I was so excited to finally get to. Laid down to watch this. Started out good. God weird fast. Boring fast. And the ending. Well it wasn't even an ending. Left you hanging completely. You have no clue what or why. So stupid.

reviews.review_title: What a waste of 1 hour 34 minutes!
reviews.content: The end was infuriating. There is no conclusion or point to the whole entire movie. Very much a thumbs down, what a waste of money and time creating this film. Boooo

By any chance avoid this movie, scenes are absolutely illogical and absurd and there is basically no plot twist, still trying to comprehend what actually happened, trust me not worth it. The ending is dissapointing, there is barely any action and it is pointless jumpscares with basically no story behind it. The actors weren't bad , but with the script they was given, they couldn't really do much.Avoid this movie at any costs , and save your time watching something else.

reviews.review_title: Save your time, watch whatever else.
reviews.content: Worst movie ever. You get no explanation of anything at all in the movie. Just questions about everything.

I am not surprised by the low reviews, and the low score, I have to say I enjoyed it. I get that it doesn't have a black and white conclusion, that ambiguity in the end of a film can irritate some, but I'd like to highlight The Strangers, a similar outcome, but a masterclass in movie making, and while The Open House doesn't even come close it raises a few questions. The ending was probably done in that way to allow for a second, and I wouldn't be shocked to see an Open House Part 2 made. Solid performances, Dylan Minnette, who's always pretty good put in a solid performance, I thought the scenes where he lashed out in anger to his mother about his father's death were very well played out, films so often go way over the top, this had a sense of realism.When you think that the budget for this film was $100,000 I think it should be applauded, many films with budgets many times that size fail in so many ways, this was a good hour and a half of escapism.It's not to be taken too seriously, and we didn't get many answers, but that's life.

This movie was entertaining but it lacks any form of depth or detail. This movie is reminiscent to Strangers. If you liked that you might like this, but if you're not a fan of ambiguous movies with underdeveloped plots I don't recommend it.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst films I have seen in my life
reviews.content: This movie was so bad, I will not even spend any time writing a traditional review. it just isn't worth it. Plus, it seems like this movie is getting hammered by terrible reviews from everyone who is unfortunate enough to see it. So, instead of a review, I have a few questions;1. To the writers responsible for this abomination; have you ever seen a movie before? Do you understand basic story structure, and how every successful story has to have a clear beginning, middle and end? Where was your road map as to how this movie was supposed to unfold? I am just struggling to understand what the thought processes were here.2. The movie had everything going for it; Decent premise, a great trailer, an extremely talented cast, a nice soundtrack. How did it derail so profoundly, to the point of it almost appearing intentional? No one releases garbage like this and is proud to have their name prominently displayed in the credits, so what gives?3. If this is a suspense/thriller, why all of the jump scares? It's too tame to be a horror film and not smart enough to be a real thriller, so whom may I ask was the intended audience? There is salty language, nudity and some disturbing scenes, but everything rolls out like a Teen Nick special. Who were you targeting, and were you aware that you were going to fail everyone with this project?4. Lastly, what in the name of all that is sweet and pure in the world was the conclusion of the movie about? I would not even call it a real conclusion, as nothing is truly resolved, but were the film makers attempting to evoke a vastly superior film (Funny Games), failed miserably, and said, "You know what? The movie is done. Just release it as is. Someone is bound to like it"? I cannot for the life of me think of a single person I would recommend this film to. I just wouldn't do that to anyone.This is one of those rare movies that doesn't accomplish anything, which makes it that much more embarrassing as it had all the cards stacked in its favor. The writers should be ashamed that they unleashed this dirty diaper onto Netflix, and Netflix itself should be publicly shamed for allowing it to soil their service. One of the worst movies I have EVER seen, don't even bother watching it out of curiosity. Please, do not waste your precious time like I have.

reviews.review_title: before you write this one off completely....
reviews.content: This could contain spoilers.Yes, it was a total sh** show of a movie. While the acting was not completely horrible, the story was seriously lacking in ALL ways. There are so many threads the story could have used and built upon that were simply ignored. The plot wasn't even something you can rate because there wasn't one; at best it was lazy writing. Unless....Consider that many "crimes" happen exactly like this. There is no explanation. There is no understanding on the part of the victims as to why they are targeted, why they are dying at the hands of a stranger. Many criminals such as the one portrayed have no real reason that rational people would understand as to why they are killing people, why one family is targeted when others are ignored. The story is told from the point of view of the victims - they wouldn't know the reasoning or the rational behind the killer's choices.I'm not saying this excuses the laziness of the script. When you write a book or a movie you make a contract with the reader/viewer to meet certain expectations. This story failed in meeting those obligations.

reviews.review_title: Certain people enjoy it, others hate it.
reviews.content: I really enjoyed this movie since it's a lot different than other thrillers/ horrors. I don't entirely understand why people hate it so much to say it's the worst movie that they've ever seen. I appreciate that this movie has a lot tragedy in it, for instance the family mourns the death of the father/husband and decides to start new but gets killed in the end, I find it very realistic compared to other movies I've seen. The music is good and the acting is great. I also found it interesting how the killer was playing mind games with the main characters, by making loud bangs in the basement,. I wouldn't recommend this film to people who don't enjoy open endings.

reviews.review_title: An underrated, but still mediocre film
reviews.content:
The open house gets constant criticism for its story, characters, actors, etc. but I honestly thought it wasn't "The worst horror film from Netflix". It was about average for Netflix based film.
The cinematography has the same problem as most horror movies, "let's make the lighting bad to signify darkness" or "let's constantly zoom the cameras in and out to create suspense" blah blah blah, but it's not so bad that it's distracting. I think the DP did fine if I'm being honest, just relies on all of the stereotypical tips and tricks for cinematography.The acting is pretty meh, but I think Piercey Dalton was pretty good. The director, Matt Angel is an actor, and it seems like he doesn't really belong in the directors chair. The shots, the acting, everything just looks like it was done in one or two takes.And while certain parts of the story are silly, and it seems like one of the female characters (who had a lot of mystery around her) seems a waste of time, everything else is digestible enough. The biggest problem is the antagonist, who just does things to be evil. I won't go any further into detail since I don't want to contain some spoilers but it is a little silly.But the film does have good aspects. There is a lot of suspense and mystery within the film, and you are genuinely left guessing about what's happening next sometimes. Along with that the story is somewhat engaging. I do care about what happens to the leads and like I said, Piercey Dalton did a good job.All together, this is a deeply flawed, but somewhat redeeming film, that is worth checking out if you have a lot of free time. It's not "So bad it's good", I just feel like the production team had some talent mixed in with the unimpressive leadership behind its creation. I feel like that alone has a lot of critics flocking to insult it, but I feel like it gets an unnecessary amount of criticism. It's still not very good though.

This movie has no plot. Whatsoever. A lot of nonsense, not adding into a coherent story makes the first part of this movie, the torture porn is the second part. And that's it. It's like... It's like someone was too lazy to even write a full script for that movie, just wrote the beginning, plopped in a bunch of weird characters, added some jumpscares and violence, stirred, shook and voila, we have a real stinker. Do not recommend.Dear Netflix, start to employ decent writers instead of chugging out a senseless crap.

reviews.review_title: Not good but not as bad as other reviews
reviews.content: The film is just slow and cliche, it's less like a thrilling story and more like what could actually happen in real life which is why, I think, people are rating it so poorly.Some reviewers are saying it has no ending? That's odd because the ending, while predictable and not overly imaginative, is brought to a full conclusion with no open ends like some other movies of this type.So yes, a very average film, not utterly terrible and certainly wouldn't make me "angry", as some have professed (really??), but certainly not worth raving about or watching again.*SPOILERS*I don't know what people aren't getting about the ending. It's obviously just a psycho killer that goes around to open houses, plays some kind of mind game with the owners to frighten and terrorize them before killing them and moving on to the next open house. The strange neighbour is simply there to make us think there might be another element to the story, but no she just has altzeimers and seems odd because she's forgetful, that's it.

reviews.review_title: Don't watch this movie, you will regret it
reviews.content: This is probably one of the worst movies ever made. And that has nothing to do with budget, or even talent, but everything to do with the writing. Structurally, the story is stupid. It's like it has two acts instead of three, at least that is how it felt as this movie went in a very straight, overly predictable line the whole way through. And it is strange, because at times, on a few occasions, there were seemingly set ups for a more complex plot, suggestions of things going on... Then no playoffs. None. Just confusion. And... What? Stupidity. You know what else is stupid? That somebody funded this movie. That it was even made. It's not even got the 'it's so bad it's good' thing going for it, it's just bad. And boring. And a waste of time. Don't watch this.

I usually don't watch movies that got horrible reviews but when I saw bad reviews I thought there were to reasons that this movie was reviewed so bad. The first reason is they got the wrong movie (because the movie was actually pretty good) then the other reason which makes more sense is that the bad reviews were a product of a hired hand because of something personal behind the scenes. With that being said The open house was suspenseful, creepy and well writtenI obviously don't think I'd give this movie a 10 but for sure a solid 6.5. I've seen bad movies get good reviews and good movies get bad reviews but this is one of the worse cases of blatant movie smashing I've ever seen
Is this film amazing? No. Good maybe? No. The worst thing I have ever seen? Not even close. Its ok. The acting is fine, there are a few jump scares but the storyline is a tad weak.

reviews.review_title: A fantastic film - Negative reviews are unfair
reviews.content: I feel as though the reviews here for this film are unfair. I get that opinions are subject to everyone's personal thoughts but the lingering thread in almost all reviews about this have to do with the questions the film left unanswered. And I think sometimes, a movie doesn't have to lay out everything to the audience.It isn't really the point of WHO the killer is or WHY he is doing it. The point is that this type of thing could potentially happen to people. It isn't the point WHY the next door neighbor is weird. The point is that some people are just oddballs. You don't need a complete explanation to enjoy a good psychological, edge of your seat thriller. The film exceeds in acting, cinematography, and direction. It has some wonderful dialogue two between the leads. Imagine yourself in the situation (a situation mind you that can potentially happen) and you will feel quite unnerved by the end. Not every motion picture needs to answer every question. In fact, the best thrillers are always the ones that are realistic and make you think that this type of thing could happen to anyone.Highly recommended!

Nasty little thriller, with some nice scares and a lot of unsettling atmosphere. The acting is quite good and there are quite a few twists and turns through out. It's a bit slow at times and doesn't completely make sense, but it's still a fun ride. 
I honestly don't understand, why people hate this movie so much.
I wish I had read the reviewers before watching the movie. It has no point.. No deep meaning.Not rating.

Do not under any circumstances unless you are being tortured and forced to watch this film watch this film! I would get into the plot, character development and other features if there were any. If I could give it 0 stars I would. I still have to come up with 338 characters, please stop reading at this point and Do Not Waste Your Time With This Crap. The only reason I made it to the end of this totally awful film is that I had to clean up my email account. You know how sometimes when your multitasking and miss something in the film and you have to stop an rewind it? Don't worry, you won't have that issue with this film, so if you need to clean up your email this is the film for you!

reviews.review_title: Well, there's an hour and a half of my life that I won't get back!
reviews.content:
Really wish that I'd read the reviews BEFORE I watched it!
Particularly the one by "pleasantcow" on 20/1/18 who summed up everything that I thought about the film.
Nothing further to add except seriously, please don't waste your time watching this.

Movie started good and had an interesting plot, but none of the seemingly meaningful events and happenings wound up playing any part in the movie at all, it just stopped with the credits rolling and without any answers to what happened or what you had just watched. First review I have ever written because I felt the need to tell people to not waste their time on this movie like we did. Usually I like everything but this was wasted time for sure. Watch something else, literally anything else, watch Shrek again, you know you want to!

reviews.review_title: Literally signed up to write this.
reviews.content: I literally just signed up to write this review. Do not waste your time watching this garbage! Seriously, this movie stinks... It's probably the worst movie I've ever watched and I'm honestly one of those people that see a few bad reviews on a movie and I'm like ehhhh I'll give it a chance. Dont!

Obfuscated story that has the most charm in the various characters and storylines that end up going nowhere.Its soapy drama and pugnacious mother/son pair make me wish something macabre would come to teat them apart.It only gets more annoying as it goes on. Apparently the 51st lowest rated movie on here. This surprises me a little, given the amount of trash that's even worse but I most certainly don't feel sorry for it.

I've never felt so robbed of my time than I did after watching this movie.
I was sceptical about watching in the first place as the trailer looked drab... I was so disappointed.
There was literally no reason at all for the 'killer' (who I am presuming to be the plumber) to go around murdering everyone like he did in the end. What's more... all the drama when he broke the mothers fingers.. what was that all about? Just felt like it was added to make up for the bad storyline. This film is a pile of rubbish. The ONLY reason I am giving this film 2 stars is because it's really difficult to dislike Dylan Minnette (Logan Wallace) and he acted his part well, you could tell he was trying.

Reading a few of the reviews here I noticed that I was not alone in thinking what a disaster the movie was. It started off good, solid acting by the 2 lead actors, incidentally especially with Minnette, having seen him in two other movies. 
But the ending was just pathetic. I was beginning to think that somehow we would discover the identity of the killer, and he would turn out to be the deceased dad, who in an elaborate scheme in collaboration with his wife had faked his own death for a life insurance scam or something, but no, I guess that kind of scenario would be too complex for the writers! I did warn about spoilers though!
This is the single most boring movie I've seen ever. I've seen a lot of bad movies but this one is just god awful. Nothing happens. Nothing

reviews.review_title: Worst case of false reviews I've ever seen!!
reviews.content: Why are people so annoying? If a movie doesn't end with sunshine and rainbows, it gets a horrible review. The writing was excellent and acting was okay. The movie was unique enough, too. This is quite possibly the worst case of SMASHED reviews I've ever seen.

reviews.review_title: An hour and a half of pure drivel
reviews.content: I just had to come on here and say that this is probably the worst film I have ever seen in my life. Many films don't have a resolution at the end; they leave it open for you, the viewer to gleam from it whatever you may. And that's ok if the main content of the film is engaging, intense, clever, driven, etc. That it's given you something to work with in order to deduce an ending. This film is none of those things. It delivers absolutely nothing. I don't know who gave the authorisation for Netflix to release this miserable mess upon us, but I feel robbed of my time. If I could give zero, I would, however I think the two main characters are decent actors. That's the only positive. But basically this film is an unimaginative, boring, slow paced pile of garbage. Don't bother.

What a waste of time. I have a rule. i don't se movies directed by the person who wrote the movie. They leave to much out because they know what's going on and don't realise that the audience don't. This movie proved that point
The real crime here is the moronic premise. A new low in story telling.
This is the 2nd film netflix has made that doesnt have an ending. It just cuts to credits and you are not given any answers. More plot in a nature documentary. Traaaaaaaaash.

reviews.review_title: Have an open mind to watch the Open House.
reviews.content:
I was minding my own business, trying to fill a quota of things to watch when Netflix suggested this movie. I figured, "ooh, a scary movie on a Saturday night, starring Dylan Minette (13 Reasons Why), 'Don't Breathe' was good, let's go!"The trailer says, "You can't lock out what's already inside." Maybe we'll get lucky and this will be sort of like the iconic 'Scream' franchise. We follow Logan and his mother as they are forced to move to his aunt's big house in a very secluded location. The only catch is they have to leave for the most part of every Sunday because there's an open house where potential buyers come in and out inspecting the place. Big house, out every Sunday, seems harmless enough, right?When they get back, strange things start to happen like doors closing, things getting moved, and noises from places where there shouldn't be. At this point, everyone becomes a suspect, the kooky neighbor, the over-friendly store attendant, the plumber, the cops, and even Logan himself. Halfway through the movie I confidently said I've got the invader figured out and was just riding it out until the movie ends.
Boy was I wrong.I won't spoil it for you but you have to wait until the end credits to figure out who the invader is. Like literally, you have to read the cast credits. Then it's up to you as to how you will react. A Forbes review got pissed off, it has a 3.2/10 rating in IMDB, while I just laughed and figured to just charge it to Netflix's aggressive expansion for content in 2017-18 (see The Ritual, 1922, Gerald's Game and Hush.) As long as you don't have a lot of expectations and you have 90 minutes to waste, you might actually enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone's saying
reviews.content: This movie isn't a bad movie, until the end. It's suspenseful and keeps you guessing until the end, then still keeps you guessing after it's finished. Besides from not answering any of its watchers questions, it's a pretty good movie. If you get frustrated at not having any answers, however, this isn't the movie for you.

I saw the low ratings and thought, hmmmm maybe I won't bother but then I thought I've watched films with low reviews scores before and actually enjoyed them do I thought I'd give this a view. I'm glad I did. It's excellent. It's not your usual American/Canadian film with a normal ending whether good or bad. It just stops with no explanation to what the hell was going on and that's what I like about it. It leaves the viewer to make their own conclusions.
It could be a nice movie but there is no ending!!!totally waste of time....I have a lot questions about some characters and I wouldn't recommend it at all😭💩💩💩🍅🍅🍅

I found this movie to be better than most here. The people of the town were a bit strange, felt hokey, but whatever there. I found the movie suspenseful and fun. Watched it with my Mom and we were playing the guessing game like most everyone here, and like most everyone, we are still guessing. But, I kinda like that. Not everything is cut and dry in life, and not everything in life is explained. Im gonna go out on a limb though and say it was the plumber that fixed her heater. Im also gonna say he was the older neighbor ladies wife? Maybe they are in it together, maybe she has no clue? Just a thought. I had fun with it. Maybe not for everyone if you like answers in your movies.

Basically a decent thriller totally and utterly let down by the ending. I was expecting a good twist, or a tying together of various strands that seemed to weave throughout the story but they lead nowhere. It just was not the kind of film where lack of resolution could be justified. It was like budget or the imagination just ran out and everyone said 'Stuff it ...let's just get it in the can!' 
 I disagree with another review stating it did not depend on jump scares. It sure did. And a building, winding mystery that was looking very interesting but ended in blandness. I gave it five for the more imaginative effort before the disappointment.

reviews.review_title: This movie is not a waste of time if you actually paid attention.
reviews.content: Wow there are a lot of bad ratings and reviews for this movie. I wonder if I saw the same movie.Maybe everyone that watched it didn't understand the point? Most reviewers are saying that there's no conclusion, or it leads to nowhere. That's not true. There is a conclusion, it's just not the one we've been trained to expect. We expect in horror/thriller/suspense movies to find out who the bad guy is and they get their comeuppance. You find out that the killer has been in the house the whole time and he's an escape convict/lunatic! He's making calls from inside the house! But the babysitter wins in the end! That's what we want. A finality. This need to overcome the evil and scariness.But real life isn't like that.There are so many little bits in this movie that ties it together. You can tell from the beginning that Logan is closer to his dad than his mom. His parents fight and they try to hide it, but she's stressed and you can tell that she's feels like her husband isn't taking the fact that they're both jobless serious. This leads to her outburst blaming him for the situation she and Logan end up in. Or how Logan said that he wished his mom was dead instead of his dad, and he ends up accidentally killing her. Or how she thinks that Logan is toying with her with the hot water heater because they already have a strained relationship and he didn't want to be there in the first place. And the fact that he gets extremely upset because he sees that Chris is flirting with her, because he thinks that his mom doesn't/didn't care about his dad or even him. Or how we're introduced to Logan as he's running his best time. He has aspirations of the Olympics. But in the end, his running fails him. He was nearly frozen to death and practically blind. I'm not surprised the intruder could find him, I probably could have with my nonexistent tracking abilities. The thing is, this is a family that is falling apart and that had *nothing* to do with the intruder in their house. That's the point. The intruder has nothing to do with them. No history to the house, no history to the people.Sure there's some supernatural ninja ability, but it's inferred in the end, that this guy goes from open house to open house doing this, so he's probably got practice toying with people and being stealthy. However, this is also very similar to a lot of movie serial killers. How many other movies are there where the killer has some unnatural ability to keep getting up or sneaking on their victims? It's nothing we haven't seen before.But Logan even says that he finds the idea of an open house creepy, and that's the whole point of the movie! You put your house up for sale, you give your keys to a realtor, random people that you don't know walk through your house judging your curtains and cabinetry and the state of your floors, and then the realtor just locks up. Maybe they do a cursory walk-through to see if someone is lurking, but maybe they don't. And what if someone stays behind? What if they are homicidally inclined?We don't get to know who the killer is because *they* don't know who the killer is. It could be anyone. It's supposed to make you feel uncomfortable and think about why it makes you uncomfortable.

For Netflix, and its team of directors and producers, if I wanted to see about tragedies, unsolved crimes and anonymous serial killers, I would put the news on. Stop being such a#$%&/les and don't waste my time.

I don't even know how to express my anger about this absurdity. This movie should be burned and forgotten forever. I wouldn't act in this movie and humiliate myself for any amount of money. WOW these actors are really brave.
This was a complete waste of time. Don't even bother to watch it.

reviews.review_title: Tedious and pointless, just like others said!
reviews.content: This movie looks like it was carefully made, so it's a shame it's so AWFUL. Promising start to a haunted house flick, but then...is it? A possible ghost is seen, but it amounts to nothing and does nothing and it might have been a hallucination; you never find out. The main characters are blah. The crazy neighbor wanders in the woods, but does nothing. Finally, deaths occur and you have no idea by whom or why they have happened. At the end, you see an anonymous silhouette of someone driving a car down a road toward another open house, but you have no idea who it is, or if they're even going to the next house. No real plot or resolution. It's a good thing I saw this on Netflix, so at least I didn't have to pay extra for it!

reviews.review_title: A Good Suspense Film That Encourages Some Imagination
reviews.content: All in all I found the story, acting, dialogue, cinematography and direction of the film to be more than adequate and entertaining.Aside from a few 'off' bits of editing, very infrequent the film felt like it had been put together with apt attention to detail and care.Particularly the scenes shot within the titular house gave good scope in ensuring the viewer could feel the size and expanse of the house while also inviting them to get a sense of its layout.This contributed to the audiences involvement as the film created decent suspense through a tight cast of potentially suspicious individuals.This is where the film succeeds most at being a suitable suspense thriller. The supporting cast is just quirky enough, just suspicious enough that they could be perceived as a potential threat while otherwise coming across as mostly harmless. This keeps the audience guessing and trying to piece together the cause behind the house's suspicious events.Who is involved? What is their motivation? These are all points we are invited to analyse and guess at as the film progresses.-Spoilers Ahead-While the identity of the home invader is never revealed we are given intentionally selective shots that reveal his shoes, silhouette and the shape of his figure. This successfully keeps audiences guessing while revealing enough to give us a sense of how this invader is bigger, stronger and can easily overpower the main cast, as a result the threat feels real.Many other reviews for this film seem to take issue with the fact the ending is left open or vague. I will admit personally, after analysing, guessing and trying to create possible outcomes in my head during the film others are not wrong to state that the ending can come across as a little bit of a let down. To bash and completely say that it ruined the film seems highly unfair though. It comes down to expectations versus reality. Not everything needs to connect, not everything needs to be explained, because in life everything is not simply always packaged up in a neat little bow for us. The frustration this generates in viewers I feel almost points to how successful this film can be. That uncomfortable feeling it leaves audiences with is a success within itself by not playing into people's desired or generic expectations.So the film doesn't pan out as one would expect. The film sets up for an ending where it feels like the invader is targeting the family in a very personal manner - in fact with the use of the family photo, the flashbacks to the father's death and the intentional use of the song that was played in the beginning of the film when the father died, it all pointed to a bigger picture and deeper meaning behind the father's death (was the one harassing them involved in some way?) My imagination was running wild. So while the ending does reek of wasted potential, it is not necessarily as poor as others seem to think.Despite the ending the film still managed to keep me thinking and guessing, in suspense for these characters and trying to imagine the bigger picture. If everything had gone as I had suspected I might've been vaguely amused. However, the brutality, seeming meaninglessness of the ending by going a more daring route actually added to my enjoyment I believe.For those that didn't get it - we invite strangers into our lives our homes in all manner of ways - the question is, can we trust all of them?The film ends with the sense this is a man that has done this before and intends to do it again. Why? Doesn't really matter. It's real enough and vague enough that you can put yourself in the main character's shoes.Overall this was an enjoyable evening film - one I'd recommend to anyone with an open mind that wants to watch a decent thriller.
Watching pain to dry would be a better idea than watching this crap.

It drives me nuts how so many of the reviews here do nothing but cuss the writing and production staff and rate it one-star. I was just as frustrated as they were about the quality of this no-suspense suspense-thriller-horror movie, but there are real one-star movies out there, and this simply is not one of them.With that out of the way...
As other reviews have alluded (to or stated outright), you've seen this movie before, just never this vanilla. Actually, "The Open House" isn't even vanilla, it's flavorless-like the unsweetened horror movie! That's another gripe I have with this film; it really doesn't feel like a horror movie at all. It's a thriller with a horror plot. But let's not split hairs.The only things that stopped me from walking away from this movie after about 30 minutes was Dylan Minnette's acting. Even if Piercey Dalton got plenty of screen-time, it's Dylan's believably freaked-out teen jock character that was the one element of the movie that likely kept me and the other 428 reviewers watching. Piercey Dalton's role as a very recently widowed mother just wasn't convincing. Her behavior just isn't consistent with someone who's just had a loss, though it is very, very predictable.Predictability is the name of the game here. You wont be surprised by anything in this movie, aside from how ridiculous the characters' behaviors are. Something I'd add that I haven't seen mentioned is the use of cameras and sets (cinematography, if you will). How that one seemingly simple aspect of a movie can have a huge effect on how a movie feels. If you've ever seen a few Scandinavian films, then you'll know what I'm talking about-long, still, unbroken shots with zero dialog. The camera simply observes the characters like fly on the wall. "The Open House" could've used this to great effect. Instead, it used the very typical horror movie style of cinematography that's constantly following each character around and capturing everything they say. With this approach, there's nothing left for you to "digest"-nothing to think about. Yes, the writing is borderline awful, the acting is just on-par. There are absolutely more things than cinematography that went wrong with "The Open House", but better use of the filming equipment and a different way of using the set and setting could've ramped-up the suspense that was there, and ultimately would've made this movie at least as good as most horror fare. Anyways, there's really not much more to say; this movie's a stinker. Let's just hope some writers somewhere are cooking up some much, much better horror for the future!
Do not waste your time. This is a movie with no ending and doesn't make any sense. Investing those 1.5 hours in feeding ants is more useful and satisfying!

I thought the movie was a waste of talent with Dylan Minnette as I loved him in Netflix's "13 Reasons Why" and Prisoners. Not huge on scary movies as most like this aren't well done. I and a friend only watched this because of Dylan's previous endeavors. I should have passed, but still overall for me it was a watchable movie, pretty predictable though. Still overall I will say that the jumps, thrills, and screams at times were above average! So if you looking for something to watch and want some thrills on a boring night, then it might be worth a shot!!
Awful. Terrible. Horrible.Don't waste your time.Terrible ending. Horrible plot. No character development.And on top of that, the house decor is outdated and ugly.

reviews.review_title: I wish I'd read the reviews before I watched it
reviews.content: You don't even really need to read this review. Everyone else got it pretty much right. The movie is interesting enough to keep you engaged and there's not really any reason for you to be. Who is harassing this family? Why are they harassing this family? Who was that woman who came to the door and asked what they were doing in her house? What's up with Martha? If you want answers to all these questions and more, this movie says "Go f*&k yourself." There is literally no point to this movie at all. Is that supposed to be groundbreaking? Because it comes off as senseless. I kept expecting it the same old twist--it was the kid all along, he had a psychotic break after his dad died--but they couldn't even be bothered with at least a predictable explanation for what was going on. It's just nothing. No resolution. Thanks for wasting my time, Netflix!

reviews.review_title: Original, decent acting and plausible.....a good movie. Why the bad reviews?
reviews.content: I kinda want to rate it a 10 to lift the score bc I don't understand why it's so low. It wasn't a movie that will win an Oscar, but it was pretty good. I wanted to see what happened next and it kept my interest the whole movie, so that right there is a 4star in itself, then add on that the acting wasn't bad that's another 3 stars, and the plot was interesting, not overdone in hundreds of other movies, while it has and can happen I real life, another 2 stars.... If you like crazy overdone, predictable horrors, please don't watch it but if you like something new and fresh, ignore the low ratings idk what their issues are. It was a good movie, maybe bc there wasn't the everyday of the mill actors in it, Idk, but it was a good movie, try it.

reviews.review_title: Not bad at all! Definitely kept me engaged.
reviews.content: Seeing all the negative reviews I thought this was going to be a mindless movie which has no shortage of poor acting, horrible story and amateur direction, BUT, it was none of that. I feel it held my interest and the directors knew how to keep the audience captivated. It is definitely not a 3/10.

reviews.review_title: dylan could do so much better
reviews.content: This film triggered me so much i was complaining about it for a whole week, please do not watch this unless it's with someone you really hate, it wasn't scary, and there was no freaking ending, it says in the description watch to find out, but you don't find out, it's so stupid, i would rather eat a spider than watch it again and that's the tea

So if you watched the trailer that's basically the movie. You'd think that watching it would bring more detail to the story, but no. After watching it all I'm still left with questions and the story doesn't make much sense. I don't really fully understand the next door neighbor and what that all entails because it seems like they were trying to explain her character, but gave up. 
This movie could've been so much better if they stuck to a story line and put more sense into why these things are happening to the main characters.
