reviews.review_title: I wish I could rate this even lower than 1.
reviews.content: DONT EVEN BOTHER WATCHING. It SUCKED. What a waste of time!!! I like all kinds of thrillers and horrors and I'm no snob but there was absolutely no real plot. You don't even find out the killers intent nor does the ending really feel like an ending. So sad too because it was very gripping during the intense scenes and the acting was really good!! That's what held me on till the end. Was such a waste of time to watch & absolutely pointless of a film.

reviews.review_title: No Beginning. No middle, and no end
reviews.content: Awful to the point of embarrassing. How did this film get made? What was the point of the crazy woman? What was the point of 'moving things around'? Why the elaborate break in? To name but a few pointless scenes.

SPOILERS..... The whole film is a build up to the end (like most horrors/thrillers) where nothing much goes on except little hints here and there, and at the end the big finale comes and everything is explained perfectly and you understand or at least know what happened... Welp, this film thought fuck that, we'll build the whole film up as if it was a personal attack on them, but nope. Just a random guy who does it with no reason given except it being an Open House..... And they didn't even bother to explain it that way. Similarly to The Strangers (a great film im about to SPOIL) where they are attacked "just because they were home" the difference is in that film the pay off is actually there, where as in this absolute disaster of a film they try to keep the intensity up with jump scares and random things happening and utterly fail. The scene where there is a guy in Naomi's bed and she gets in and out without realising has got to be the most cliche and unrealistic thing i have ever seen. DON'T WATCH THIS AWFUL FILM.

I feel that most who started watching this movie must've felt the same way as I. It started well enough and then just gets boring. This movie is literally about a kid and his mother living together. We basically watch them eat, sleep and listen to music. Either than the gritty stuff at the end I wouldn't recommend this flick to anybody. The characters are dull and boring and I was hoping that they would die sooner so that I could watch something else.

The Open House has terrible critical reception, and it's easy to see why. Almost everything that happens turns out to be meaningless in the end, and the climax isn't that exciting, either.I will call it a good movie for those exact reasons (among others). There is actually almost nothing in the plot that is unrealistic, or even particularly convenient. The story is about a woman, whose husband just died, temporarily moving to what is currently an "open house" (i.e. potential buyers come to inspect it) along with her son.Some guy terrorizes and then murders both of them, and that's that. There are a bunch of additional plot elements that invariably end up not mattering in the end, and you could certainly call that bad writing - but if you consider the movie a demonstration of the randomness and lack of meaning in real life and real murder, then it actually does a fairly good job. Unlike most poorly rated movies, the dialogue and atmosphere in this one isn't bad at all. In fact I would say it's doing an unusually good job of displaying a believable dynamic between the two main characters.There are a number of reasons why I am willing to excuse the largely meaningless plot as being part of the point, which I would not do for other movies. One is how realistic and down-to-earth everything feels. Another is the straight-forward bad ending. Consider just how helpless the main characters are. Yet another is that the killer's face is never even revealed; this gives me the impression that the effect I'm describing was intentional. I come away honestly thinking that things could progress like this in real life.

This movie was a complete and total waste of time. Netflix has been putting out some entertaining content, but this was a total miss. I'd say spoiler alert, but they didn't write anything to spoil. The movie just ended. There was no purpose, no moral, no lesson, nobody to relate to, no gory murdering or action, and goofs galore throughout. Is it night? Is it day? It apparently doesn't matter. When is the open house? 10 pm? Sure, that's a thing that happens in real estate...I normally can enjoy a bad movie that has redeemable elements (even if it is just campy fun), but this actually had me wanting my money back from Netflix. It was like the guy that knew the story died during film making, and nobody had the script, but they were too far along to just pull the plug or hire another writer.Horrible. Not even good enough to make fun of.

No plot , no character development..just makes no sense whatsoever.
I would rate this below zero if I could

reviews.review_title: DON'T waste time like we did.
reviews.content: Stupid set up in stupid place, stupid not-story accompanied by stupid non-logic events and stupid actions of the most stupid double team of two idiots world have ever seen. Stupid cheap creepiness with cherry on top which is - you guessed it - stupidest end. (End which so arrogantly assumes that this "movie" is good enough to be able to finish like this).

reviews.review_title: If you enjoy watching movies where the ending leaves you angrily saying WTF then this is the one for you.
reviews.content: Be prepared to have a surge of anger at the end, while swearing off all Netflix shows forever.

reviews.review_title: Wish I had read review first
reviews.content: I don't read movie reviews before I've seen a movie because I like to make my own opinions of a film without outside influence...but this is one time I wish I had. The reviews are exactly correct -- this is one of the worst horror movies I've ever seen, and I watch at least 10 horror movies a month. Hands down the worst movie I've seen in 2018 - granted, it's only mid-February, but I bet it'll hold the title for most of the year, if not all of it. I say this as someone who will give almost any movie a chance. Repetitive, boring, uninspired, and a truly awful ending that was a massive letdown. I also felt as though the torture scene between the killer and the mother towards the very end of the movie was gratuitously violent, without much of a point. I'm fine with gore and violence, but it needs to contribute to the plot. This was definitely a scene that didn't contribute much.
I am fond of horror movies... But this movie changed my perception.. I will not watch again any horror movie unless the rating is higher.
I love all horror movies. Not this one though, It was horrendous

>>>First of all: WHERE can i find the mnovie on DVD?<<<Mysterious movie that leaves more questions than answers. Finally something new and a sense of reality-based. There are many who complain about the film because they do not get their answers and I respect their liking.In my case, I think this is different and exciting. Of course, you want your answers and a second movie would beexciting to see. So the viewers could get their answers. Must say that Dylan Minnette's desperate screams at the end were absolutely incredible. I could feel his fear and desperation. I watch a lot of film as it is one of my biggest hobbies. Anyway the scream deserved an Oscar so real it felt!

reviews.review_title: Not too bad as what others rated
reviews.content: I thought the movie had some good scares and suspenseful moments. The suspense was constant really. The acting was pretty good, especially by main character Dylan Minnette (Logan). It's just the writing that I have a problem with. A lot more could have been done with this movie. Disappointing ending though, but it's an open ending so maybe there will be a sequel?

reviews.review_title: Excellent, until it turned to absolute garbage
reviews.content: I don't even know how to rate this, because it was so awful. The movie was set up to be great, and there were good suspenseful attributes. There is literally no story line or ending though. It's like the writers were all fired 3/4 of thethrough.

reviews.review_title: If I could rate it a 0 I would
reviews.content: An hour and half of my life I'm never going to get back. So unbelievably boring, it's a bad film but the ending just makes it worse!

Wasted time, the watcher gets 1000 useless facts and none of them get explained, this is just a mild
idea, not enough for a good film. It would be a good film if they focused on only one fact and explained it to the deep end, this way they just confused the watcher. The acting is pretty bad aswell, this film was just a waste of production money and our time. Disgrace.

You know how that thing happens when an intruder kills your body guard, then ties up your mom and breaks all her fingers, and while trying to find her from the sound of where her screams are coming from you accidentally run into her with a knife and kill her, and then the intruder holds you down and takes out your contacts and it gets all blurry, and he tells you to run, and you do, and then while you're hiding in the forest from the intruder, soon to be killer, a nice old lady on a hike wanders by but you think it's the intruder soon to be killer, so you don't call out to her, and then the intruder soon to be killer strangles you? Yeah, me either....

Did some writer get up one morning and say "Let's make a movie where we kill off the main characters and end the story, explaining nothing as the credits begin to roll." I have no idea what I just saw, aside from a rash of killing that continues until no one else was left to film. Is Martha still walking aimlessly in the woods? No one will ever know. Everyone who has watched it is now dumber for having dinner do. Perhaps the production suddenly ran out of money.

There was a real opportunity to build a cool explanation for the things that happen to this mother and son, instead were left with half developed character relationships that turn out to have no relevance to the characters or story.The movie then ends abruptly with both mother and sone dead with zero explanation of what the hell or why the hell these things happened to them.Simply terrible.

I've seen a lot of bad reviews. And I mean a lot. This movie is so bad that can even enrage you because you'll get to the ending and you'll have just one question: "what was this?"
Still today I consider this the worst horror/thriller film I have ever watched. There's not a single good thing that could redeem this title.The plot starts with a cliché, not uncommon for horror films, the problem is that basically every scene is a cliché, UNTIL you get to the part of the film that is so rushed that very little makes sense: things happens randomly, characters appear but you are never explained why they're there, characters die like morons, and the the ending. The ending should be used in universities as an example of one of the most horrific way to conclude a film, it should become canon to explain what you need to avoid doing when making a film.The main characters are dumb beyond belief and at some point you'll just give up trying to get what they're doing. This film is lazy, poorly written, and disappointing to the point you'll feel like someone has just insulted your intelligence.

The most horrible thing about this movie is the house it's shot in. You can't build suspense and terror in a house with vinyl windows, golden oak cabinets and crappy tile counter tops. The golden oak is literally everywhere: kitchen cabinets, banisters, bathroom cabinets, door casings, floorboards, etc. The house appears to be no more than 15 or so years old, but the basement that you're supposed to believe is part of the house is dark and spooky with rotting wooden stairs that appear to be at 50 or more years old. At one point a character remarks that an unexplained noise (that was meant to be spooky) was probably just the "old pipes." Because we all know how noisy 15-year-old pipes can be! There should be a sequel to this movie in which whoever buys the house learns that their purchase contract included a clause which prevents them from redecorating.

After wasting 90mins of my life, i devoted 180mins towards finding a better word than "Crap". Sadly, my efforts met with a dead end which also runs parallel to this sorry excuse of a movie. I feel only actors hard up for work would consider this. If I were given the role, I'd beat the director and producer senseless which again seems synonymous with the movie plot.Started out with all the makings of a good movie. But apparently 30mins in, the reins were handed over to school kids looking to get their feet wet in the movie business. Cheap thrills and cheaper ending. It's a movie where dumbasses who don't know how to use a light switch or take a hint, waste our precious time with no concerted end in mind. Highlight of the movie is the Woman's butt. I humbly thank the director for leaving that in, it got you 1 star. Probably the most memorable part of the movie too. I'm sure if more was shown I would have gone up a few stars. Thats the only thing to save sh** like this which makes it's way on tv.Another takeaway: There are idiots working at Netflix

5 stars because the cast is good. Especially the one who played logan.
At first it seems so promising.
But then it leaves you empty.
Numb.
All dead in the end and the killer that we never knows who win and leave. The end.No motives. No background story for all the weirness in that house and that small town.
The movie just,,,,ends,,,we don't know who did it, why they did it, anything???? total waste of time

reviews.review_title: One of the worst endings I have ever seen
reviews.content: I honestly think this movie was pretty decent in the beginning, albeit the writing and some of the performances, especially from Sharif Atkins, who was easily the worst actor in the film; his character was also basically pointless and added nothing to the movie.About halfway through the movie, you realize that nothing has really happened yet. You start to notice the cliches and the characters' actions become kind of stupid. Things start to happen that aren't really logical and don't make any sense. The movie starts to throw in cheap jump scares that your average bad horror film would have. Despite all of this, it really isn't that bad so far.But then the last 15 minutes come. This is when the "action" starts. Naomi is tortured and killed by someone in black (who doesn't even show up until now) and Logan escapes into the woods. Soon after, the man finds him and kills him, too. Then we see a car driving down a road towards the open house. That's the end. Seriously. That is literally how this film ends. No actual resolution. No questions answered. Nothing. I bet the writers thought that it was smart or "deep" to end the movie without giving any answers. It's not. It's actually stupid and incrediblly unsatisfying. The whole point of a mystery thriller is the suspense of finding out who is the one behind everything, but the movie gives us so little characters, and the ones they introduce, we learn nothing about. The film tries to trick us into thinking it is this one lady, who is their neighbor, but we know nothing about her, like who she really is and what her motives could possiblly be. There is this one scene about halfway through the movie where she shows up in the middle of the night and is acting completely insane. The character that witnesses this doesn't really react and is never brought up again. Every time they see her after that, they acted like she didn't do anything. There was no reason for this scene except for the fact that the film was trying to convince us that she was the antagonist. And is she? I don't know. If she is, why would she be after them? I don't know. If it isn't her, who else could it be? I don't know. There is literally no one in the movie that could be the villain. It would have to be a guy, with us getting a very small sample of his deeper voice and with his credited name being just straight up "The Man in Black". There are like, 5 men in the movie, and one of them is killed by the villain, and the others are barely introduced. I hate to say this, but the movie thinks you are stupid. It thinks that it can get away with such a cheap ending, and sadly, it kind of does. Unless you want to see a disappointing "horror" film, I would recommend you stay away from this one. Definitely not the worst movie I've ever seen, but definitely one of.

reviews.review_title: Waste of time, waste of plot, waste of everything
reviews.content: Do yourself a favor and watch something else. There is no point to this movie. Some dude kills two people with no reason. That's it, seriously!
Absolute garbage, terrible acting, shameless director.

The beginning was great and I honestly felt like it was going to be a setup for something much better, but I was so wrong, the movie is just a kid living with his mom in a new house with a serial killer that kills them at the end, that's literally all you need to know to say you've seen this movie. I thought the mysterious guy was going to be one of the introduced characters but we don't even get to know who he was, and looks like he isn't even any of the other introduced characters. So many random scenes are pointlessly added, like the contacts scene. I still don't get why that was even added in this movie. The killer literally stops the guy to take his contacts out then tells him to run.... like wtf. All of the characters are introduced for no reason at all. Just a bad movie in general

Lazy scriptwriting, implausible time jumps, an incoherent plot, and no resolution. The only positive is that I could truly believe the mom and son were related, because neither one of them showed the slightest trace of a personality.

reviews.review_title: From Good to Bad to Tragic
reviews.content:
The movie starts off very promising, as most horrors do, it builds a story and eases you into what's about to happen. Just as it starts going somewhere it seems as if they ran out of budget and decided to kill someone off to make it a little bit interesting before going on to kill the two main characters.... for no reason at all.. very disappointing that after all that, not only did we not get to see the killer but we didn't even get an insight to his motives...
Just another mindless horror movie with no plot that relies purely on the build ups to the jump scares.
Thought it was an ok movie at first but THERE IS NO ENDING! Everyone just dies and it goes off! Terrible!
This must've had a very small budget. The sound effects were that of the 1980s.

reviews.review_title: Rubbish , It wasn't as i expected to be . .
reviews.content: No Ending don't waste your time !Is just not worth to watch.

reviews.review_title: 1 Star as I can't give it 0.
reviews.content:
I am basically reiterating what other reviews have said. Netflix has the laziest stable of writers in the world.
How their movies are written:
Something happens, you don't need to know why just accept it, you won't get a good ending and the middle is usually an hour of filler where nothing is explained. Lazy! Lazy! Lazy!

Definitely keeps you guessing the whole movie as your brain tries to find answers to the who and why. This movie explored the very real fact that sometimes there is no twenty minute discussion where the killer has an in-depth discussion with his victim to explain why he's a murderer. Murder defies logic and explanation. Sometimes the main characters die. There can't always be a happy ending. I thought the movie was interesting.

reviews.review_title: I literally made an account only to say how bad this movie is
reviews.content: This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. So much happens in the movie that literally contributes to nothing.One hour in I paused for a bathroom break only to realize I've seen 2/3 of the movie and yet nothing has happened other than a door moving a little bit.Seriously, avoid this movie. If I had the budget these directors had I'm 99% sure I could make a better movie than them.

Slow.
Great potential.
Nothing really to gain from watching this at all. Which is a shame because at the very beginning it looked like it could have blossomed into something truly unnerving.
Sadly it didn't.

After watching 13 Reasons Why from Netflix i was really looking forward to se Dylan Minnette in a thriller/horror film. But this movie just leads to nowhere... I really enjoyed the beginning of the film. Good acting, good build up and good music. But then you just get a lot of really bad and stupid horror film things thrown at you... Classic cheap jump scares, stupid dreams that they make you belive is real and a lot of really stupid decisions... The ending was one of the worst endings i have ever seen and it doesn't excplain anything at all... Do not waste your time watching this horrible movie! Netflix has proven to me that they can make one of the best TV Shows in the world but this movie was just the worst!

reviews.review_title: What the heck did I just watch?
reviews.content: The acting isn't bad, the scenery is quite beautiful, but that's where it ends. A huge build up with no answers. Spoiler alertEventually everything comes to an end, but you never know why or who is doing this. I thought the death of the father at the begging was a bit odd in that he is basically run down. You don't hear anyone trying to stop or screaming or anything just a car coming fast and running him down. Tie that in to the methodical attack on the rest of the family and it seems like someone was out to eliminate this family. Why? Maybe the father owed the mob, they had no money, the mother said he was irresponsible and left them with nothing. Was he a gambler, they killed him and his family over debt? Was this a vendetta killing of sorts? Did she have an affair and break it off or a previous marriage gone bad that left such animosity to lead to this? A revenge killing? Well guess what you will never know, make up your own theory, one is as good as the next. You may want to watch it over and over to see if there are any clues missed throughout that reveal the killer. I recall that at the beginning the mother and father are discussing something, but stop so their son does not hear, basically hiding something from him that they plan to share. However I don't recall what and I'm not interested enough to go back and see. That I think is the point. This writer may have been trying to create a discussion piece, a movie that people will pawn over, watch and rewatch like a puzzle you are trying to figure out; who the killer is and why (it was Colonel Mustard in the study with a candle stick). However, the movie itself is just not good enough to leaving you wanting to figure it out, so in the end you just feel cheated and ticked off for a build up that never delivers.
I created my account just to rate this movie 1 star. OMG

reviews.review_title: Excellent, if you are smart enough to get the story.
reviews.content: I don't want to just right out tell you the whole plot like many do their reviews. I am surprised with such negative reviews. I liked it, and it made sense, you can figure out what happened pretty early if you take in all the clues. It really builds and maintains. If you like a slow creeping horror, that makes you analyze exactly what is going on in the then this movie is for you. I would say that Patricia Bethune performance was quite lordly, if you catch my drift, and that the main characters (mother and child) are quite good souls, that makes this film a crash hit!

The characters are so flat, so one dimensional that I cannot sympathize with their plight. There are characters that have absolutely no point to them (re: Alzheimer diagnosed neighbor, unhelpful plumber and Chris the flirt). Why are they included in the film? And let's not mention the illogical and simply stupid decisions made on the part of the characters. How difficult is it to shut your eyes, Logan? Or lock yourselves in the bedroom until the cops arrive? And those cops! Someone is clearly harassing these people and they shrug it off to some kids just messing around? Kids? Sure, in a mountainous small town where it takes ages to get from the house to the nearest store (if the movement of the sun is anything to go by) it makes perfect sense for kids (who probably lives miles away) to sneak into a locked house, take out all the furniture from a living room and exchange it for dining room decor (which they got where?) only to be out within the hour before the residents come home. Yeah sure, totally believable -_- I was hoping the ending would at least be satisfying but I'm left thinking; "So what was the point?" We're taken on this journey with the characters, made to feel their pain (not really) and watch them struggle and fight and for what? Now if anyone is interested in a truly satisfying ending, watch Gerald's Game. That film got my blood boiling but damn was it worth it!
This was really one of THE most horrible movies I've seen. I feel dumber after watching it. Bad plot, flat ending...save your brain cells and skip this one.
Full of suspense and full of crap. The end was ridiculous. All a complete waste of time and money.
I absolutely don't understand why that movie has such an awful rating... It's a pretty good Thriller and far from "a waste of time"!

reviews.review_title: Avoid this movie at all costs!
reviews.content: Nothing, absolutely nothing about this movie is appealing.The acting is bad, the theme is bad, there is no build up and I sincerely hope that Matt Angel and Suzanne Coote never direct or write anything for the rest of their lifes!I would be ashamed to dedicate this piece of garbage to a loved one Suzanne, c'mon! The only thing you accomplished was to diminish a good lead and place "suspenseful music" to try an get some build up, well... you failed, please don't ever touch a camera again and try to avoid writing your name unless its absolutely neccessary

The movie revolves around a tragedy that we are never fully appraised of. The limited information and flashbacks the viewer is shown imply something 1) very unlikely based on the setting or 2) more sinister than anyone acknowledges. The unexplained plot development doesn't stop there, indeed it actually escalates as the story progresses. The acting is fine, however, the actors are not given much material to work with. It seems to be relying on the unknown being frightening. The plot pushes beyond the general scope of the "suspension of disbelief" and doesn't offer enough of thrill to pull the viewer into the movie as films such as The Strangers manage to do.

reviews.review_title: Your kidding me,some people are thick...no most
reviews.content: Well I've got to say it...some..no..lots are as thick as pig shit.1 star for this,really ..honestly.I give up on humanity,the clues were there if you looked.Is this a masterpiece,no of course not...it it a 1 star film,good Lord not even close...I give up.Imbeciles.

The movie started off great but what the hell was with the ending. I was waiting to find who it was guessing the person who killed them but no this movie was confusing and a waste of my time in watching this.

Dillan Minnette's performance was somehow more flat than in 13 Reasons Why. The story was boring and the writing wasn't even bad enough to be funny. I couldn't fallow what little story there was and it seemed like every settup fell flat. It was hard to tell if the writers even cared about their story. This movie is an uncanny valley of off beat scenes that don't fit. There was maybe one good scene in the entire movie. Its a wide shot. The mother walks off screen to go use the bathroom. The son goes off to the kitchen which still in shot. In the background a door opens. The mother returns from the other side of the room, its clear she didnt open the door. No one notices this and its creepy! It could have been good but they let the scene drag on too long. They tried to do other shots like this but it didnt work. Its just disappointing. They seem to stumble with even the most basic things.

I loved it for the exact same reason most rated it 1 star. At the end, you know nothing ! I think it is way more scary that way. If you know that is was payback for something, then you're safe but when there is 0 motive.... ;)

reviews.review_title: Waste of talent . Waste of time.
reviews.content:
I thought this might be a fun movie for a fall afternoon. The kind that is deliciously haunting . One that will give you a bit of mystery and a little scream here and there . But not so disturbing that it would you up at night . 
 Sad to say this movie was neither. If anything , it was a waste of time and talent for Dylan Minette and Sharif Atkins ! Both have been amazing in other roles. 
 This movie started out promising, but slow. 
 The problem is , the pace really never quickened. There were some mysteries or questions that I thought might be tied together at the end. 
 Unfortunately there really was no end. It looked as if the filmmakers said. " ok , let's leave this where we are ,and come back and shoot the rest tomorrow ."Then forgot to come back!
 No resolution , no mystery , no twist and no explanation ! This is truly one of the dumbest, movies I have ever seen . Completely pointless . Not the least bit enjoyable . I kept watching hoping it could be redeemed. No such luck. 
 What kind of a movie kills off both leads with no explanation. ? Who was the killer ? What was his story ? Was it the Alzheimer's woman? Was it her husband that she said died, then said he was alive ? 
 There were so many directions this movie could have taken to make it at least an ok . Maybe a 3 or 4 . Unfortunately it didn't take any of them.

reviews.review_title: Confusing IMDB rating makes no sense
reviews.content: I thought this movie was awesome! It was an edge of your seat thriller which I thoroughly enjoyed. I kept putting off watching it as it was one of those movies sitting on my Netflix watchlist for a while. Having said that, I am dumbfounded at the low rating on IMDB.Every once in a while I will watch a movie with a peculiarly low rating, only to find it was a hidden gem. This was one of those movies.
Wasted my precious weekend time on this so called horror movie.

I just registered in IMDB to rate this movie...
Really disappointed by Netflix...

If someone asked me how this film ended, I'd have to say I don't know...it just ended.There was such potential, it was tense at times, creepy at others, the occasional dark figure...culminating in what could have been a decent film.Did the writer die on the last page? Because that's what it felt like, it literally just ended...no answers, no reasoning, nothing, it wasn't even an open end ready for sequel, it just ends and that made it a complete waste of 1 hr 30.If you like disappointment, watch, otherwise steer clear.

reviews.review_title: I created a profile just to tell you not to watch this movie

The build is excruciatingly slow, then it throws away what little it built and leaves you wondering what you did to deserve to have your time wasted by the movie equivalent of waiting at the laundromat only to have your machine catch fire with four minutes left to go. I take that back. At least that might earn you a bit of adrenaline, making it way more exciting than this itchy sweater vest of a movie.

reviews.review_title: No ending? Here are 2 alternative endings for you!
reviews.content: I am giving this movie 5 stars because the main actress was very good and I liked the young man/teen who played her son, too. They did a great job and it's not their fault this movie stunk.What the heck? This movie had so much potential! The idea that when you have an open house, you're letting people in to your home, and this house was so big, and there was a possibility that someone had snuck in for nefarious reasons and stayed!And then there's the creepy neighbor lady. What is her story? And they come home and find Christmas music playing and candles lit. All of this leading up to....???? They just never explained anything! It's like they just gave up mid way through. I really liked the first half of the movie. Someone needs to give this movie another try and give it an ending! The basement with a tunnel going nowhere. What was that all about?Here is an ending for all of you who were wishing for more:The old lady neighbor used to own the house with her husband. They enjoyed one last Christmas dinner there before her husband ran off with another woman, then died (tragically, yet justifiably) in a car wreck. The old lady is now obsessed with getting her old life back. She wants to re-create that last happy night of her life. She sneaks in, sets the table, puts on music, lights candles, and is talking to herself as if she is reliving that night. There's a flashback scene that shows them eating dinner, laughing, then he gives her a present and kisses her. Then he gets a phone call and takes it outisde. It's his secret mistress. He excuses himself and goes off to meet her. He dies in a car crash on the way.Now crazy neighbor is in the house, and the mom and her son come home and find her. She attacks them and screams "get out of my house!" She nearly kills them, but they fight back and kill her. End of movie.Or:Someone comes to the open house who knows there's something valuable hidden in that tunnel under the house. He sneaks in over and over to try to find the buried money or treasure. He is just trying to scare the mom and her son to get them out of there so he can pull out the power equipment and do some real digging before the house sells.

reviews.review_title: If you've decided to watch this, change your mind immediately.
reviews.content: Please understand the importance of what I am about to write: This is the worst movie I have ever seen. Please. Do yourself a favor and forget you ever even saw the title of this movie. Whether you saw the title show up on Netflix or heard about it from a friend, just forget it now and save yourself the trouble. Because I just can't express to you how bad this movie is. I actually sat through the entire movie and now, after I write this review, I am going to build a time machine and use it on myself. Not even going to test it first. If it kills me, it kills me. Then I will go back in time and tell myself to not watch this movie. But this review will still exist somehow so that I can also warn everyone else. It's awful... Just awful... I mean this is actually a movie that was made... Like people sat down together and talked about... Making this? And then when they finished making it they thought that this was okay to release to the public? Like, they all agreed on THIS? Oh, wow... I'm still in shock... I don't know what else to say... I don't even want to talk about the film itself because that would consist of me thinking about it and I just can't. If you heed my warning, you're safe. If you don't... I'm sorry...
Don't really understand the bad reviews? It's good acting and the plot holds. Like it!!!

Don't waste your time watching this no plot and and no storyline this has got to be the worst film I have ever seen.
And please if the light is not working in the basement that would be the first thing I would fix !

reviews.review_title: The best worst horror film in years
reviews.content: Ok, I rated this movie an 8/10. And I realize this might be insane. But, here's the thing-When a horror movie changes the formula you're used to, it can make it linger. That's basically what this movie does. The ending is a twist by any means of horror. Sure, there's a body count. And you see the "killer" during the movie. But this movie stuck with me for a long time. 2 years now.I've seen a lot of horror, a LOT. And there's some gems out there. This one must be one of the most well put together films of Netflix horror. It's clean, slick, got good acting, good cinematography, good directing. Buuuut, the writing leaves you wanting more. And it here that I think this might be a hidden gem. Can you imagine a horror film that actually messes with you? That's part of the genre. And people aren't going to say, aww, what a poorly made movie. I'm slobbering for more. It's so creepy. Almost too real.
Terrible story, terrible cinematography, terrible acting. Rubbish "climax" and awful ending. Don't waste your time watching this
The movie ends w/o any explanation or any links to characters in movie. It leaves you highly unsatisfied after watching a movie that seems unfinished
Spoilers, there are none. Nothing is ever revealed or solved.

reviews.review_title: Almost, but manages to miss an open goal after so much promise
reviews.content: This movie had much going for it. The acting was good and generally most things about the movie worked. BUT there was seemingly no thought given by the writers as to where this movie was going in the second half. I cared about the characters and the relationship between the mother and son was well developed. If the writers had just given us some denouement in the second half then this would have been a 7 or 8/10 movie.

In contrast to everyone's reviews, this movie is actually pretty genius. The killer would have no purpose to be given a name. At the end this killer is shown driving to another open house, this shows that this person is clearly a serial killer. Serial killers don't necessarily have a motive. They kill to kill and it's very common for them to have a type of "thing". This killers "thing" is an open house. There are no questions you should be left with at the end of this film. Anyone that can put clues together and make sense of them would enjoy this film.

reviews.review_title: Quite enjoyable, ignore the bad reviews
reviews.content: I don't often write reviews but I felt compelled to do for this movie as the bad reviews don't do it justice. It is not a bad stiry at all and I found myself on the edge of my seat most of the time. It is a new idea, the actors are good, the setting is stunning and the tension builds slowly. It's one of those movies where you can't quite believe what's happening and it pumps up the pressure nicely, especially at the end.I am picky with my horror and I like this one. Give it a chance.

Wth!
What about the ending???
Enjoyed it
But i was really waiting for a proper ending !!!
Don't waste your time. The story line is horrible. The ending was horrible. No clue what all the action was about. Just pure crap.

reviews.review_title: Sometimes the Killer doesn't need an explanation as to why...
reviews.content: And that's exactly that. Everyone is so uptight about needing an explanation for the killer's motives and not every killer has one. Some just get off on it. I will admit this movie was misleading, but maybe that was the point? They wanted you to think it was someone we've seen by giving them odd behaviors, but I think it was just cause the town was so small and they don't get new shiny residents all that much, so they were acting strange. Overall, the movie isn't as terrible as the reviews make it out to be. It's definitely a one time watch. The acting from the two leads were great. If you're bored and want to give this movie a go then do it. You may regret it or you may not.

reviews.review_title: Not As Bad As These Low Ratings Suggest
reviews.content: Just my opinion, but I have no idea why this film has received such low ratings and I can only surmise that most viewers did not get what they were expecting.No other reviewer seems to dispute the quality of the acting, writing, etc but most seem disappointed, however, with the whole direction the film went in and the (non-existent) ending.I however, without giving anything away, was completely shocked with the ending and its simplicity, as it was not what I expected, and rather disturbed by it.I did flag slightly in the middle, like everyone else, wondering where it was all going, but glad I stuck with it until the end.

There are no words to describe how bad this movie is. Not even bad and cheesy in a good way that you just have to see it. Bad as in I would have rather spent 90 minutes eating glass than have watched this trainwreck of a movie. I swear I'm gonna sue.
Please don't waste your time watching this garbage. Worst movie I've seen. The movie is so unsatisfying and doesn't make any sense because nothing is explained

This is maybe the worst "horror"-flick I've ever seen. And I have seen a bunch...
It's not even bad in a good way. Just painfully bad. You just wish you could get your 90 minutes back and do something better with your life. Like... sleeping.

reviews.content: There is no twist and good plot eventhough acting was soo good...Director waste good castings and others effort...starting was soo good and ending was worst i have ever seen in movies...

reviews.review_title: Not As Bad As These Reviews Are Making Out, At Least Not For Me
reviews.content:
This is a b-movie. I like to give some credit for that. We have a high school aged, young man who, after a family heartache, moves with mom to a home in the mountains. The home is owned by a relative who is looking to sell but while in the process of the house being shown, i.e. open house, they are going to keep an eye on the property as well as try to work out some of their own issues. It's not long after one of the open house events that things start to get weird.
This isn't a scary movie. It has a good bit of drama. It could've used some work on the script but the acting decent. There was one character in particular whose purpose was extremely questionable for me. It was just ok for me. Not awful, not impressive. I don't, however, think it was as awful as some of these reviews made out.

Omg this is the worst movie ever! There is no ending! A total waste of time. I wish I would have looked it up before I watched it. I created an account just to review this movie. It sucked don't watch! I'm giving one star because I can't give 0.
I didn't liked the movie. Even though some scenes were scary, it wasn't a good thriller. The kills were ok, but the whole story was kinda silly. By the way the protagonist (Dylan) was really good.
Is not a movie it's like a daily news. Do not watch it if you don't want waste your time. Never seen a bad movie like this before.

reviews.review_title: "The Open House"- A complete and utter waste of time.
reviews.content: It's a rare film that can do so much, so well and for so long, and then completely destroy itself as badly as Netflix's "The Open House." But I suppose that's just the way things go. What begins as a wonderfully dreary and darkly touching tale of tragic loss and raw emotion stumbles and falls flat with what is perhaps the most infuriating third act I've seen in years. It's a shocking and indeed heart-breaking failure, feeling so misjudged and so contrived, that the entire experience implodes into a raging storm of fury and annoyance for the viewer.And it is for this reason that I can say with some certainty... "The Open House" is perhaps the single worst film of 2018.Gifted student and athletic runner Logan (Dylan Minnette) is left reeling after the tragic death of his father. Grieving alongside his mother Naomi (Piercey Dalton), Logan is left cold and hollow, in a constant state of depression. The two decide to get away for a while in order to deal with their pain, taking refuge in a large vacation cabin owned by Logan's aunt, which is currently listed for sale. However, things might not be what they seem, and it soon becomes clear that there's something dangerous happening. The two are plagued by mysterious sounds and strange occurances in the dead of night. Has Logan truly lost his mind in his sorrow? Or is it something- or someone- else?Written and directed by the duo of Matt Angel and Suzanne Coote, "The Open House" is such a frustrating film because for all intent and purpose, it starts off spectacularly. Their collective direction is methodical and deliberate. Their writing and handling of characters keen and thoughtful. And the performances of Minnette and Dalton are nuanced and exceptional. It's a movie that clearly has some great ideas behind it, and plenty of juicy themes for Angel and Coote to sink their creative teeth into. The movie spends much of its time delving into and dissecting the impact of grief and depression, and how it can destroy us from the inside. It also has some good ponderings on how we choose as individuals to deal with loss.Such a pity then that it essentially throws this all away. While I will not spoil the proceedings, I must comment that the film's fatal flaw is that it lacks any degree of satisfying resolution. It spends much of its first hour building up to something grand... building character and themes, with great misdirections and subversions of expectations. And then it trades it in for a sub-standard and cliché-ridden climax with predictable twists and turns that any fan of horror will see coming from a mile away. It's just so... dreadfully out of place in contrast to the rest of the film. I see many echoing these opinions, and I must agree. It's a film that feels incomplete... and utterly misunderstood by its own creators. The third act is not even out of left field. It's out of a different freaking dimension hidden somewhere behind the left field! A dimension where up is down and right is wrong, and where the rules of logic, reason and storytelling do not apply.It's a film that ultimately left me feeling absolutely betrayed as an audience member as the credits began to roll. Like I had wasted my time while the directors were snickering behind my back.There is almost no way to describe "The Open House" without breaking out into a string of profanity and venomous insults. It's just atrocious all around- all build up and no real pay-off. Coming from a creative team who clearly didn't know how to write an ending, and just tossed together a slew of anti-climactic twists without thought or reason, squandering the immense potential and good-will it had built up to. I'm sorry Angel and Coote. But you done failed. Big time."The Open House" easily earns a 1 out of 10. It's among the most pointless and unlikable films I've ever seen, and I have serious doubts that I'll see another film this year that I could possibly hate more.

reviews.review_title: Why does this exist. Good actors in bad movie.
reviews.content: Unfortunately, this movie is a waste of time. The story builds up in an ok way, raises some questions and got me curious enough to keep watching it, even tho there are long periods of time where.. nothing really happens at all. I am now stuck with those questions, since none of them got an answer to them. What is the meaning of this production? I feel somewhat bad for the actors, cuz they're talented and believable, but now they're in this pointless, low rated movie where they just end up tortured and dead thanks to some anonymous psycho boot-wearing man with dirty fingernails. Also, Logan urinates, flushes the toilet with the lid open and doesn't even wash his hands afterwards. Maybe that's the sense moral of this movie; stop being gross. I really can't tell.

reviews.review_title: Mystery leads to inertia and a dead end
reviews.content: An American horror; The story is about a teenager and his mother who find themselves besieged by threatening forces when they move into a new house. There's a basic plot with lots of foreshadowing and the usual jumps and scares along the way. It builds intrigue and tension quite well. The convoluted plot chugs slowly toward the end of the second act but just when there ought to be some pay off for the viewer's time investment, it all ends abruptly and the weary viewer has been cheated.

reviews.review_title: Wish I could give negative number rating
reviews.content: This film was a complete waste of my time from beginning to end. There is no reason given for ANY of the things that happen. They do not even bother trying to establish a plot. Netflix should lose subscribers for putting this in their rotation.

reviews.review_title: 5 Stars for the Acting, -5 for a terrible ending
reviews.content: SPOILER ALERT -Okay, I had to give this 5 stars for what is pretty solid performances from all the actors.Also I will admit the story, such as it was, was pretty engaging, in that I was honestly anxious about how things were going to go.Then, we get to the ending, which was a steaming pile of dog mess.From the beginning of the movie, the tone was depressing, this never lets up. There are some creepy moments, but when the culprit finally makes his appearance, it invalidates everything that happened before.I don't always mind the killer winning in the end, but when the protagonists have done nothing but suffer from the start of the film, it just makes for a total let-down. No revenge, no nothing, just 'evil wins, and look he's going to get away with it again'. What a gigantic waste of time. If I wanted that kind of reality I would just watch a tru-crime show or something.I don't always need a happy ending, I feel the need to stress this, but if you're going to torture and kill the protagonists, at least throw in a sin or two that they are guilty of, or maybe some overconfidence, or some contrast between how happy things are versus how dark things get in the end. None of this, just an absolute bummer start to finish.Meh.

reviews.review_title: Acting is decent, plot is terrible.
reviews.content: Just a fair warning, there are a couple spoilers in my review. I will make a broad critique and then more in depth critique that contains the spoilers, so if you haven't watched and actually want to waste your time watching this movie, do not read the latter part. Will say when I get to it.First the broad critique. The only reason I gave this 3 stars and not 1 star is because the acting from the characters was for the most part done decently well. Not really their fault they had such a bad storyline and stuff to work with. It's the story itself with absolutely zero plot to it and so many things that just didn't make any sense that made this movie absolutely terrible. I am a movie buff. It is hard to make me not like a movie. So, if I am rating it bad, it is REALLY bad. I kept waiting for something to happen to tie all the loose ends together and explain the point to the movie and it never did. It just ended with no questions answered and left you going, huh???Okay, this part will contain a couple spoilers. First off, it was obvious the father cared about the two of them, especially his son, so them having a fight and the mother being like he didn't care about either of us and all, really didn't make sense. They had financial issues and arguments, but what couple doesn't sometimes? There was nothing that led to her having that argument with him. There was nothing that really led to her actually believing her son would be messing with her like that. The story really needed a bit of a better backstory if wanted to make the issues between mother and son more believable. Then, I thought maybe there was a point to killing the dad in the beginning. I guess the only point was to create some animosity and give them a reason for leaving their home? Then, it never shows the intruder. What was the whole point to the intrusion? What was the point in setting up the table like they did? The boy said it felt personal, but there was never anything finally showing why someone would have something personal against them. Then, why the heck would the son leave his mother behind when trying to make a call? She had her fingers broken, not her legs. Would have made more sense for them to want to stay together, or better yet, they told the police to check back in the morning. Would have made a lot of sense to lock themselves into an upstairs bathroom or something til the cops came back and found Chris dead with tires slashed. You know the intruder couldn't have been one of the cops or they wouldn't have been trying to call the cops back. So basically you just have dad dies, family moves, family gets killed for some unknown reason making a lot of stupid bad decisions, friend comes to help in middle of it all and gets killed within minutes of settling in. All without reason or rhyme. It's like a slasher film that is just there to bring you gore without substance, only the gore is short lived in just the beginning and end of movie, so not even so good for that. Total waste of time.

Angel and Cootes' script is rough to watch at times, too many times, to be honest. The concept, though generic as it may be, held promise, but the indecision is a killer that just keeps hacking at moment after moment in this movie. A strong beginning worthy of any horror story setup quickly falls short as aimless and almost random moments clog the film's story. The effects are minimum, with most the film forcing the viewer to latch on to creepy atmosphere, character play that feels detached, and shock gags that seem more at home on shows like 'Evil Things' or 'A Haunting'. With on exception. The final act- my favorite part. It was bloody brutal and horrific in its cruelty. Still not enough to save "The Open House". Overall this is a sad "should'a', could'a', would'a'" experience through and through. The beginning should have catepolted "The Open House" into a nightmare setup. The mother-son in unknown environment,torment both by circumstance and evildoers, should have brought out scares and fears that took aim at the true plot, and the ending with the reveal and terrifying nature would have hit home and satisfied horror fans. But hey- "should'a', could'a', would'a'" -right.
Waste of time. Very disappointing. Like an alien movie that you will never see clearly.

It was the most horrible movie i have ever watched i m entire life..!!
Never watch it!
I lost 93 minutes of my life to this film, don't make the same mistake I did!!

reviews.review_title: Created IMDB acct just to ask others NOT to watch this
reviews.content: Let me spend 10 extra minutes in creating IMDb account and writing a review so they you all can save 90 minutes each!I have heavily depended on IMDb rating before watching any movie. However I didn't do my due diligence for once and assumed a Netflix content will be good.Acting was actually very good. There were cheap creep sound scare tactics here and there. The biggest put off other than the ending was logic. No logical person would keep doing the things which the actors did.Like most reviews here I didn't like the ending either. Many questions were left answered. Save yourselves some time, watch something else.

reviews.review_title: Who ever made this never again
reviews.content:
A goid way to destroy your own name to whoever's made this movie. Completely crap no story no twist just completely time wasting scam. Never watching a movie under those
writers
ever again

This movie started out ok. The acting drew me in and I was curious to find out how they would cope after the sudden death of the husband/father. Their answer seemed to be a house that the mother's sister was trying to sell. The house was basically a mountain mansion, fairly isolated except for a couple red herring characters; an older neighbor and a seemingly nice guy who works at a local store. The son is also suspect as it is implied that he may be breaking down mentally after witnessing his father's death. I figured it could also be supernatural, as their belongings were moved around the house, but I was open to any possibility. I didn't have a real problem with the movie until the end, when the happenings in the house were revealed to have been caused by a complete stranger whose face is never revealed. There were many close-up shots of gratuitous violence, which was completely senseless. I'm supposed to believe that some random person came in for an open house, stayed for days or weeks, killed three people, and left to go to another open house? Sure, Jan. I'll give it to the writers, yes, someone living in your home secretly is scary as hell. Open houses don't seem super safe, and the mom and son were desperate for a place to live, but it is lazy writing to not give the killer a motive, nor reveal who the killer is. I'm ok with an ambiguous ending if it's written well, like Session 9, but this was just so abrupt and senseless. If I'm going to grow attached to two characters, make their deaths mean something. There were so many ways they could've taken the story, and to end it like they did was just terrible.

I wont get into a full on review i'll leave that for the critics, but this movie was absolutely BAD. I remember thinking "ugh, another scary movie" and decided to watch it anyway because my nephew was interested. I assumed it would just eventually show who the killer is and they would kill the killer and hooray happy ending. I guess they deserve props for not doing what was expected but the ending they delivered was worse than expected. It leaves the watcher completely clueless at the end and completely unsatisfied. Unless there is a sequel coming, which im not sure anyone would be interested in after the first one, no one will receive any kind of closure. Basically what it boils down to is 'if there is a way to not do a cliche horror movie ending, this isn't it'

reviews.review_title: Please read reviews before seeing film
reviews.content:
Complete waste of time! Full of clichés. No ending.
The 1 star is for the scenery.
A load of s#1/!

If you fancy a quiet night in with your partner and you don't know what film to watch then just a heads up, don't make it this one. Easily in the top 3 worst films ever made. Literally nothing happens, like absolutely nothing. There's no plot, no back story, the characters have zero personality and the ending leaves you staring at the film thinking why on earth did I just sit through that. Netflix really let the ball slip with this one, would rather paint dry then this utter s***e. Would give it a 0/10 but I dunno if you can. This film belongs in the bin, sort it out Netflix!

reviews.review_title: No beginning, no end, no movie, waste of time
reviews.content: The movie is stupid, badly made, no beginning, no end, it is horrible, totally waste of time. No story at all. The tensioned moments with the creepy sound are also placed exactly to make you expect something it will happen. Nothing happens. There is no acting at all. Don't watch the movie, it's just waste of time. I haven't seem a movie as stupid as this one. It's is so bad that You can't even imagine a story of your own.

Found this on Netflix and throughout movie it seems the story will build up and explain all the mysterious and weird occurrences but na it did not crescendo just stayed flat story line and ohhhh so lacking that I fast forwarded the last third of the movie and as expected the end was absolute rubbish... 👎😴

reviews.review_title: What the F did I just watch
reviews.content: I just wasted an hour and a half of my life. I do not recommend unless you'll spend the whole movie on instagram going trough memes or something.

reviews.review_title: Genius in its realism, but only after lots of online research. Can't expect that from us.
reviews.content: When it comes to Horror, one might recognize two distinct plot types: first, the supernatural kind (ghosts, evil spirits, demons, hauntings, exorcisms etc.); and second, realistic horror (murderers, torture, home invasion, being hunted by man or beast etc.). The distinction os derived from the fact that while supernatural Horror can be frightening to the point of sleeping with the lights open (don't judge me before you watch a few Asian ghost stories) - the fear factor in realistic Horror comes from the same fear we feel towards murderers: it could be anyone and it could happen to anyone. It's real and nobody's is 100% safe. The Open House of the latter kind and indeed shakes the viewer's vey foundation of trust and security.The story is relatable enough, invoking feelings of empathy and pity even if not connection (at least I hope none of you would relate, and if you did, I'd offer my deepest sympathies). Following the death of their husband and father in a freak accident (driver has heart attack and dies, vehicle runs over man), mother Naomi and teenage son Logan move into aunt Allie's mountain house due to a resulting financial crisis. Huge house, pleasant neighborhood, kind neighbors (albeit a bit peculiar) with the only downside being the house is up for sale. Every few days Naomi and Logan must vacate the premises of their new home in order to allow realtors to present it and prospective buyers to tour it. Following the first open house occasion, Logan begins to suspect somebody has invaded their home and means to harm them.From that point on - things become increasingly discomforting leading to a crescendo of a horrific conclusion. As I need to refrain from any spoilers - let me just say that the realism factor of The Open House is very bluntly maintained in the end, as the viewer is left full of unanswered questions and rather frustrated. It took me two days of contemplation and reading quite a few online reviews to understand the sheer genius of the plot. Unanswered questions, untied loose ends, more question marks than facts - that is how most of the truly horrific crime scenes in history were concluded. Case closed due to lack of evidence. Many suspects, no arrests or convictions. The Open House leaves us in this exact position, same as such a crime scene would have had we had the misfortune of sharing the characters' fate.However, let's be bluntly honest. A film is not judged according to two days of research and contemplation. Most of you, I reckon, would finish watching this film and feel cheated, frustrated and disappointed, and justifiably so. Nobody (let alone Netflix) can demand of their audience such patience and consideration. True, in this case they would be quite rewarding, as one would really understand the depth of the horror the film presents. But that's not how films are judged, nor should they be. Adding to that the fact that many of the red herrings and bluntly obvious hints presented through the plot end up being completely unnecessary and nothing more than a cheap deception tactic - and you get a film that I personally can only rate high due to research and lots of thinking. Others prefer watching a film without turning it into a project. So, few of you would probably recognize the ending as fantastic and innovative, but most of you would be rather angry for having wasting your time.
Are you looking for a nice mystery movie to spend your night? Then stay away from this. The ending is totally stupid, makes you wonder if there is bottom on today's filmmaking industry.

reviews.review_title: See how many horror influences you can name!
reviews.content: My friend and I watched this pointing out every likeness to every other horror film ever, we only kept viewing to figure out who it was and then ...
Nothing creative about this movie. Killer is no one special, no cool or creative kills, nothing! Not even a good ending. It wasted my time honestly.

The movie started off really well, i enjoyed it very much. But then there were those last 20 minutes....i expected some closure, at least finding out who the man in black was, or at the very least seeing his face, but nothing happened. Everybody died and the movie ended without any explanation. Pissed me off....don't fucking watch this movie.

This movie was a let down, don't get fooled by the creepy trailer. There is really no ending to the movie and no explanation at all. And I'm all for endings like that, but then the movie has to be good all the way through(The strangers is excellent example).
In the case of "open house" there's no follow through on the creepy trailer and start. Just let this go by in peace.

I've never rated a movie in my life, but I had to figure it out how. The movie itself was good and suspenseful. The ending however was AWFUL! It leaves you completely irritated and confused. I've never finished a movie not knowing what the movie was about. Do not watch, it's very irritating.

reviews.review_title: Looks pretty good, but still one of the worst
reviews.content: I finally gave in to Netflix' promoting this movie on my "movie feed", but I had my expectations. I haven't previously very much liked Netflix' own productions, with the exception of the excellent Black Mirror, which I didn't watch until just recently, because I assumed it would be crap too. I don't understand why Netflix wants to associate crappy movies like this to their name, because it's really going to need a miracle to lure me into watching another movie carrying the Netflix logo.So what makes it bad? If you've read any of the other reviews, you already know that the script makes zero sense. We have a mother and her son who after dads death and financial problems move into aunts huge house up in the mountains. They can live there as long as they get out of the house every time there is an open house as the house is on sale. Big house, weird things happen, things change place, neighbour is strange. Everything is a bit "creepy" and most of the movie is about them going around the house looking all serious and worried.Here follows a major spoiler.. or a time saver if you will.There is no proper plot at any point really. A few characters are introduced and there are red herrings that make you think if some people are up to no good, but in the end almost everyone gets killed and we get no reason why. No resolution or a reason. The finale is just so insanely bad and frustrating. There is someone in the house who suddenly - after making small pranks for a few weeks - starts to crack fingers and kill people. We never get to know who he or she is or why this happens. There is a scene in the end where we see the nutty neighbour strolling in the woods as the boy is trying to escape the killer, but nothing points to her being the killer. Other than the fact that she happens to be in woods.My guess is that the movie makers had a grand idea that they are going to make having an open house a scary thing, that some nutcase might stay in the house and start terrorizing. The final image shows a car driving to another "open house", which makes it seem that the killer was just a random killer going from open house to another. But you can't just throw in random scary things and then have a random ending, you need a plot.The acting is ok and the movie actually looks pretty good, with proper color grading and nice drone shots up in the mountains. Those make up for one extra star.Avoid.

This was the most horrible movie I have ever had the misfortune of watching. Sucks! Do not waste your time. The only reason it got a one is that's the only way to write a review. They need to give the option of zero stars

This kept me awake not through the horror but anger, the movie simply ends and we are to believe some random serial killer selects open houses, hides in the house and then starts messing with them before killing them. There are so many good points the acting of Dylan Minnette and Piercey Dalton, the cinematography, some nice jumps but the ending ruins it, the idea that you draw your own conclusions are not valid because there is simply no linkage, was the father accidently killed, is the woman next door involved, who knows the film simply ends. What a shame, there is a decent movie in there sadly they blew it.

reviews.review_title: Harsh Reviews...Not as Bad as reviewed
reviews.content: I had nearly dismissed watching this film but glad I ignored the reviews. Granted its not the best horror movie ever made but in my view its way better than the reviews suggest and head and shoulders above many other films in this genre. So what if you don't get to learn who the murderer is at the end. I find that this approach was more appealing than a number of other scenarios that we have all seen before. I also thought the cinematography was good and the acting from the principles was also good. Overall I enjoyed the film and certainly didn't feel cheated in the way some many of the other reviewers did.

This has got to be one of the most unfairly rated movies I've seen on IMDb, I truly don't understand the ridiculous 1 star ratings. The acting is well above avg compared to most horror movies, and the plot, while it does have a few holes, is overall pretty solid. I thought it was well paced, creepy and suspenseful and really enjoyed it, I would definitely recommend.

This started off ok, but so many unanswered questions. Why was Logan in a continual strop? Why was the chalet the size of a mansion? And who was the killer? And why oh why didn't Logan survive to get the killer arrested? To conclude this film is depressing and dark with haphazard storylines and no ending.

reviews.review_title: YES! There IS an ending. The reviews are ridiculous!
reviews.content: I'm going to spoil the ending fer those who think there's no ending.The mother and son just lost their father husband. Already having money issues they move to her sisters vacation house which she's selling. So there's a open house every weekend. The son drops the hint 20 mins into the movie. Then strange things start to happen and then they end up getting terrorized. Point of the story, you never know who yer letting into yer house. Someone stuck around in the massive house until their job was done. I'm watching it a second time. I liked it that much. I love the kid who acts in this he's absolutely adorable! If I was years younger he'd be the new famous actor crush. Hahaha.
Dont usually write reviews. Just have to do one to make the score even lower. Cant help feeling tricked or pranked at the end of the movie. You would totally feel you had wasted your time.

Actually surprised there are still directors out there trying to make these kind of half-assed irrelevant pieces of trash, nothing in this movie made sense, the beggining was promising, but everything following that was absolutely irrelevant, non-original and straight up boring. The antagonist was never introduced nor did they have any reason for attacking the protagonists of this movie, really unreasonable and confusing. Feels like this movie was just compiled of random scenes and characters doing absolutely irrelevant actions creating a messy plot, if we can call it a plot, to be quite frank it really seemed very unorganized, nothing felt reasonable in this movie. When you do not have a strong premise for any actions in a movie, it is incredibly hard to create and justify the reasoning behind actions, so we can see in this movie, everything was utterly pointless creating a large mashup of boring and drawn out scenes leading into nothingness. Another thing i would like to point out, the sound effects used in this movie were absolutely dreadful, an utter pile of dire garbage sound effects thrown in every random scene to make it more suspensful for no reason, since this film did not have clever jump scares or scary moments the directors were reduced to creating suspense purely by sound effects, which failed miserably. Interestingly enough this movie does not have an ending so to speak or you could say the ending was so stupid it was laughable. Overall, a really bad movie, would never recommend to anybody, nothing original, plain stupid actions mashed together hoping people will enjoy it. A big fail of a film, do not watch!

reviews.review_title: Definitely NOT the worst movie ever
reviews.content: Ok peeps.. if you've read other reviews you may see some unhappy amateur critics.However, if you've been around long enough and seen enough horror movies you'll realise this is a LONG way from the worst horror movie.Unfortunately we live in an age where every twist and turn is explained, spoon fed to the drooling masses.That's not gonna happen here, life isn't always tied up in a nice neat little bow for you to unwrap with a blow by blow narration of every scene.If you want a movie that's well crafted, builds uneasy tension, great acting and well directed, stow your cynicism and you don't expect your life to be changed, this will do fine.

Trust me, this has the worst ending in the history of movies. Absolutely any build up towards a tense and fitting conclusion is utterly destroyed. You can see the director thinking in advance that he will create a totally open ended movie where you can draw your ow conclusions. I did and it is that this was a total and utter waste of 90 minutes.It starts off OK and you do wonder what the hell is going on, what is the motive?, who is the strange neighbour? This is a movie that cheats the viewer. It isn't clever, it is a con trick that treats us like idiots for investing our time in such an idiotic outcome. DO NOT WATCH THIS!!

Wow. That is how I felt about the last 30 minutes. This film is actually pretty good, chilling and full of atmosphere. Still, I do understand the negative comments. The end is not revealing, and some people might not be happy with such an unclear ending as to who the killer was, and lose ends.
The acting was actualy very good, and the film was dependent on it due to lack of many characters. The atmosphere was great, full of suspense. Some parts of the film were actually incredibly creepy and will probably stick with you. It is not a haunted house movie, but a home invasion one. It is true that possibly they could have better excuted some parts of it, especially towards the end, to wrap it all together. Some parts of the film were unclear. Why was the next door neighbour important? She played a significant part that remained unclear. Was it the boiler guy ? My assumption is it was him, which explains the water imbalance and the working shoes.
Creepy!

What was this story about? Who was that man? who was that crazy woman? What were they doing after all in that house?
Just nothing.
Why doors were always unlocked?
Why was she always taking a shower?
Why was the mom so angry about the kid?
Why didn't they left after they saw something was going on....
All that drama between the mom and the kid could have been avoided whether the mom weren't so selfish and stupid.
I wanted a better end, kid didnt deserve to die.
Did he die?
Last thing....the killer knew Logan was wearing contact glasses....how come?
Please do the movie again and change the end......that part were Logan stabbed his own mother sounds more like a joke...oh really!

Honestly a creative movie in a sarcastic way, this movie takes a new approach to thrillers. It is not a classic "storyline" in that there is a climax and resolution, more of this underling traumatic event experienced by the family, it is a more of a linear film in that each scene is a situation that "could possibility go wrong" being in a foreign house... paranormal activity, a creepy neighbor having an intruder, being alone for miles in the woods.. the worst events one could ever imagine experiencing. A great string of creepy stories that make you feel as though they could actually happen.
Only scary thing about this movie is that he didn't wash his hands after peeing.

Ughh what a waste of.......my time, any resources used to make this and get it out, air!!! Could have been a good story but it was fraught with slow very slow timing and idiotic ending. Teen and mom go live in sisters mountain house after dad dies, irresponsible woman she is. Things start being weird in the house which is for sale and on weekends there is an Open House. Slowly it moves through what you think is a character and plot buildup only to get to an unbelievable end. There is no one you really Care about in the movie, except for the store owner. The neighbor is a nosy hag, the mom is just unlikeable, the kid is ok but it doesn't matter because EVERYTHING in this movie sucks! We had to keep watching to see how it ends, but even that was a waste of time. Don't waste your time.

I can understand the negative reviews but I think the ambiguous ending made it even more creepy. No connection. No happy ending. It did was it was intended to do, scared me. And not only during the movie but thinking about it afterwards.

Were the writers executed before they could finish the script? Everything in the movie suggested the ending would be that the people in the town were all still living in the house: the lady saying she was disappointed when she saw the for sale sign, the guy disappearing after he took a look around, etc. For some reason, they decided to abandon that route and added a mysterious killer (who they never cared to show) to finish off the main characters. Who was the killer? What were his motives? We never find out. In addition, we heard noises but the police couldn't find anything or anyone in the house. So where was the guy actually hiding? The only redeeming part of this movie was the acting.

reviews.review_title: Don't waste time by watching this garbage
reviews.content: Just waste of time...No story..No plot..No climax..Ignore the movie.
This movie is very very horrible..and very boring.good to sleep
All the actors were good. It's just that this story sucks. I mean, it's starts well enough, it builds up suspense, and then at the end it just poops the bed. This movie doesn't deserve one star.

A slow, boring meandering descent into mediocrity. This moving had a good premise and could have been scary and horrifying. Instead it was stupid and a waste of time. *Spoiler Alert* The main characters just ignore when things go missing - like the glasses that you set on the nightstand every single night. Or how about, when you shower and the boiler is turned off so there's no more hot water and you fix it and then like magic the boiler is turned off again. It was all so insanely dumb from the very beginning of this mystery to the very end. The characters reacted in ways that logical-thinking-people would not have. Oh yeah, and then there were these supposedly suspenseful moments where the music is intense and the camera angle focuses on a scene in the woods or the basement and then there's nothing - just nothing. And then to end it all, there's no explanation as to why what happened, happened.
Absolutely horrible end. Story did build up as somewhat supernatural but it turns out total horrible non story end.

reviews.review_title: Decent production values and acting at first..Terrible movie that obviously was never finished and sold as piece of Junk.
reviews.content: It's not unusual to see, so-so or mediocre scary movies on Netflix. This one is so bad I had to comment. I feel sorry for the crew or actors. It's rare to find a movie this bad.....that is a slap in the face.It starts out okay, then degenerates into pointlessness and ends with no ending, not even a mysterious ending---with no tie in to anthing that occurred in the first half of the film. Just everyone dies and no one knows why or who did it, without a trace of continuity or reason connecting the end with the beginning. Devoid of any story resolution or even any sense of mystery.Congratulations to the producers and writers, you can fight it out as to who is to blame for this. I'm sure you are thrilled with the reviews.
I watch this movie and I dont understand it and it dont make no sence

reviews.review_title: The other 1-star reviewers aren't philistines. This is a mess.
reviews.content: I registered JUST to write this ONE review.I have loved many unpopular movies that get complaints like "It didn't make sense!" or "The ending left too many questions."
