So trust me: this film is NOT a case of artful ambiguity or clever deliberate frustration of audience expectations, or a film that's "playing with" or "overturning" the clichés of the genre. This is just poor writing. It feels desperate and awkward.The movie SAFE (with Julianne Moore) is one that raises predictable audience expectations regarding the genre (disease-of-the-week-made-for-TV-movies) and deliberately has them all dead-end or fizzle. Open House is not doing this, so don't look at all those 1-star ratings and think this might be a misunderstood arty gem. It is not. It is not LET THE RIGHT ONE IN; it is not THELMA; it is not GOODNIGHT MOMMY. It is not a clever art horror movie. It is generous to call it a movie.The son is an aspiring track star who actually has pretty mediocre speeds but who cares cuz his dad is dedicated to his training and the fam seems so happy. But the son's talent, dreams, ambitions, and Dad's sharing of all those have nothing to do with anything that happens later, at all. Of course the cliched thing to do would be to put the son in a situation where the track and field training pays off and because of his practice and pluck he's able to get out of a situation with sheer speed. Such a trite trope would be an improvement. Instead all this backstory is irrelevant, as the characters receive no momentum or impetus from what we learn of their lives before things go south. Every single last thing we learn about their very thin lives is utterly irrelevant to what happens later, and this is not some clever meta-point about pointlessness or over-done tropes.Then there's just the ineptness. There's the weird neighbor lady who can't remember whether her husband is alive or dead. She has nothing to do with anything. Then there's the strangely familiar cashier at the convenience store who is thinking of buying the million-dollar mansion in the mountains (?!) so shows up for Open House when it's not showing hours and so they let him in and don't check or notice when/if he leaves. He is also irrelevant. There's the tense and brittle sister of the mom whose unexplained wealth gives her a very well-kept mountain mansion she never uses so has been on the market forever, and there seems to be some tension between the mom and her sis. All of this turns out to be irrelevant as well. Then there's the strangely pushy real estate people who bring a little Kafkaesque humor to the situation; at one point the obsequious assistant is discovered in the home way past showing time who nervously gives a twitchy "We ran late" explanation before dashing out. Also irrelevant, having nothing to do with anything else that happens. Then there is the big imposing figure in big heavy workboots who somehow soundlessly glides through the shadows of the home unheard by people feet away from him. No explanation of who he is or why he's there. Then there is the by-now-curiously-common catacomb beneath the house (lots of those these days) with a tunnel going nowhere, blocked by rubble. No explanation of what/why/how/etc for that. Then there are the strange noises coming from down in the basement, heavy industrial sounds. No explanation.Workboots guy kills the convenience store clerk, tortures the mom, then chases and kills the son, after the movie has spent over an hour NOT basing this on ANYTHING. This movie is bad, and not in a funny, interesting, campy, unique, or any other conceivably redeeming way. It's a malicious insult to the unnecessarily good acting.
It was better written to be a sequel thriller I could see it's potential. But it falls flat. Pretty good acting is about all that strings you along.

reviews.review_title: Plot holes and no story line
reviews.content: So after watching this movie I am left wanting more, not more because it was so good and leaves you with a feeling of such greatness that only more it it will satisfy, but the more feeling of "that's it????"!! It was a total WTF movie and ends leaving almost every story line without any type of conclusion. Aside from the fact you meet a couple characters that seem to be an integral part of the story, however they could have never been in the movie and it wouldnt have made a difference. The neighbor lady who you meet in the beginning and how she says the sister emailed her about them coming? They are staying in her sister's house that they are trying to sell. There is no talk to the sister about this, nor is there anything from the sister about it. You also meet a plumber who says hes been I the house before, butbyet once again there is no mention as to when or why he has ever been there the plumber does end up leaving you a bit suspicious of him, but his time was a complete waste. Now getting to the mom and son this is what really drives me insane with suspense films. So the first night the incident with the car and the neighbor lady, he is woken up by a knock at their door and a car in the driveway shining its lights into the house. Now just like any suspense movie he goes out to investigate, he walks out after the car leaves and looks around. Then of course you are surprised by the lady who is standing behind him. Ok I get it, you want to play up the craziness of the neighbor, however the next morning the son explained nothing to his mom except for the lady being there. That's it, no car, no knock, no strange feeling about everything so far. Now come to the next day, open house day. So they are awoken by the realtors who are selling the house. They were told to be out of the house by 11 am sharp, but the realtors foyers say 10 am. Now given the fact that it is an hour early there is once again no mention of the earlier start time. Which brings me to the assistant realtor. When the two return home at what seems like10 at night, the house is dark and the door is unlocked. Now they walk in and the home is dark, no sound, no lights, and no one in sight, but them they are startled by the realtor who says they ran late and just rushes out the door? Now you may not think anything of it , but at the beginning of the scene you hear the realtors discussing a sign in sheet and making sure everyone signs in. When that happens and the open house starts you see thevrwaltor greeting everyone that walks in the door. Then you see it, the boots of what you are lead to believe are the "bad guy". You also know this because of how they are captured in the frame. So getting back to the realtor, he greets everyone that comes through the door, which by my understanding you would also say goodbye to everyone, am I right?!?! Well you are later left to assume someone didnt leave! Well now for the laps in the main story line. So they mom.and son are there, carrying on as a mom and son would. Oh and they just lost the dad of the family, but it doeant matter, because it really doesn't matter that they lost the dad because that has no bearimgnon the main plot! So they are carrying on with their lives. So at one point things start to seem strange, the son's bowl of cer eww al is moved from.one from to another, his phone also disappears, and when the mom is showering the hot water is turned off. Now the hot water just stops, which is completely wrong, especially how she then goes down and check the water heater and it is turned off. Ok, so far just in one night we have the son's cereal bowl moved, his phone goes missing, the water heater is shut off, and, now this is a big and, and the son hears someone in the basement! Ok at this point you would have thought, son and mom have a conversation about all this? Nope! Nothing, not until 2 more days go by and things continue to happen but again no conversation until the mom bursts into the soms room and tells at him for messing with her over the last few days. The son who at this point has had several things happen to him doeant say anything other than, it wasn't me. So now that we've established the flaws in the characters and the main story let's jump to the final night. So after returning home from what again seems like a 15 hour open house/showing the mom receives a phone message from her sister. The sister says we just got notified someone broke into the house! So what do they do? They drive home and walk up to an unlocked door and of course, walk right in! Now when entering the house they are met with music blaring, a table has been set and candles are even burning on the table. So they then decide, I think we should call the police! Well that is a joke in itself. the police are there and the "check the house" top to bottom. But as you guessed it, they couldn't find anyone! Well you would think if they couldn't find anyone it would be because the house is so big they seem to be in the wrong rooms at the wrong time. Wrong! They search a basement that has corridor type rooms that are literally no bigger than a closet and are made of stone! No where to hide! Well needless to say the cops leave and the son makes the first statement that makes sense, we shouldn't be here! Well of course, they stay there. So while this is happening you find out the "bad guy" I mentioned earlier, really didnt leave! He was, you guessed, in the basement! So after a few scuffles in the house between the bad guy and mom and son, the son manages to escape, but not because hes smart enough to fight back and run away, no. He escapes after he mistakenly stabs his mom and the bad guy wrestles him to the ground and with his hand over the boys mouth, removes the boys contacts and throws him out the door!?!?! Ok I guess the bad guy wants a challenge, no it turned into a classic Michael Myers or Jason scene where no matter how fast or how far you run, 5 seconds later he is there, and you die. Well I hate to say but that's it you die, the son dies the mom dies. With this happening it leaves you completely missing out on the story lines that were created, sister and sister's house, crazy neighbor lady, cops that were supposed to return in the morning, all the cliche thing that are introduced in your typical suspense movie. This was a complete waste of time and I would highly recommend passing on it. Oh and I left a few other thing out of this review, but it doesnt matter! None of the things that happen in this movie matter!

reviews.review_title: I would rather crawl on broken glass, then watch this movie ever again.
reviews.content: Seriously guys, it really is that bad.I'm actually sitting here, wondering what to do with the rest of my life.The movie presented all sorts of information that didn't matter AT ALL. And the information that DID matter, wasn't even in the movie.All that I understood was that there was a guy in the house, that got in during the open house and he didn't leave... And I'm not even sure that's even really true. Eventually, the son stabs his mother... for no particular reason... The bad guy says: NOW RUN... and he runs and dies of hypothermia.... What the hell?!

No clues. No reveals. No questions answered. Someone wrote a screenplay when they were bored and sleep-deprived, and someone was dumb enough to actually invest in it. The movie relies on camera zooming and jump "scares". Had I watched it alone, I would've turned it off from boredom. The only reason for the second star is the main character's expression of emotion to his mother and what he goes through at the end. What a waste.

reviews.review_title: Sort of okay until the missing end
reviews.content:
The only thing I'd like to add that I haven't seen anybody else mention so far (I haven't read through all the reviews to be fair) is that this is what crime like murder must look/feel like to outsiders: a collection of questions, no answers and in the worst case no motive to go by - in short: no satisfying ending/answer.
As a movie though utterly disheartening to receive no answers.

You could tell this was pitched on the idea and not the story. The whole movie builds tension and then releases it like an old man after dinner. First of all the suspense was reminiscent of Halloween build up, and you had your red herrings and suspects, and even thought well maybe it is the mom or the kid doing something? But all that guessing is for not, because the writers gave up on any pay off for those threads. Instead they make the stalker/killer completely anonymous, even going so far as to have him remove the contacts from the kids eyes so he would be blurry. Interesting choice I say to myself, where will it lead? NOWHERE. They start to have him torture the mom, and then he just stops. You then think, ok now we get a payoff for the kid doing all that running in the movie and its going to be a cat and mouse game in the woods with the kid having to run faster than he ever has before...right? Wrong. Nope the kid just ends up staying in the woods and finally coming out for a drink of water only to quickly be dispensed with...off screen. And that's pretty much it. A stranger plays games in a house for no real reason, we don;t even know if he's a psycho. A mom and a kid are scared to death, yet for some reason sleep so soundly the stranger can just walk around and take pictures of them, move their stuff, and they wake up just scratching their head trying to figure it out. Even though there is one land line phone, it makes a sound like an extension is off the hook, Even though cell phones can call 911 without a sim card, they have 2 that can't. Even though the police say they will stop by in the morning, they don't. By the way if this town is so QUIET, why are they so uninterested in a break in even if it was a kid prank?? Why does a big expensive house have no security system? Why does the kid leave his mother with a broken hand knowing the killer is still around. WHY?? Because the writer's wrote half a story and then proceeded to try to unpaint themselves out of a corner by having all the characters lower their IQ suddenly, and technology goes wacky. OR I think they were shooting and got to the point where the would be boyfriend is murdered, the mother being tied up and tortured, the kid just coming back to his senses and the phone wrings on set..."Hey Its Netflix, they say we have to wrap up shooting today..." and this was the end result...

SPOILERS!!
As horror movies go, this isn't the worst I've ever seen, the acting was actually pretty good, the story was somewhat original, and for a lot of the movie you are trying to figure out what is really going on in the house. It was a guessing game. You didn't know who, or what, or why. It wasn't until the end when things kind of go south, when the movie ended I was legit pissed off because as many of the reviews say, it didn't even end. It wasn't until a little bit after I watched it I realized exactly what had happened, the movie ended just like real life. People were murdered by a serial killer, and the murderer goes on to keep killing, until he or she is caught. They never show who the killer is, because he is just a random person, who stalks his victims and gains access through their open houses. The end of the movie shows him driving his truck and turning onto a road that has an open house sign, implying he is searching for a new family to kill. The concept is great, they could have executed it a little better, but it was entertaining enough. Wondering if there will be a sequel.

reviews.review_title: CLOSE this House and DO NOT go in
reviews.content:
There was ZERO actual PLOT LINE to this movie. It played out like a bunch of random scenes sort of thrown together with a vague sense of someone attempting a movieSometimes a character was thrown in that seemed to have wandered off another movie set and into THIS one.In the very beginning, the characters go into a gas station during the day, come out in the middle of the night ( who spends THAT LONG buying MILK in a convienience store) and suddenly it is daytime again. Did they shop in the TWILIGHT ZONE? And you just cannot follow something edited like THAT.They are in a scary house. WHY do they stay? 
Bad enough the husband gets killed in a PARKING LOT in a speeding accident (how fast can you DRIVE in a parking lot?) but now someone is STALKING them in a house. LEAVE. just LEAVE.I will save you the pain. The killer comes from ANOTHER MOVIE.AND there are chase scenes that take SEVERAL DAYS. they run throughout the day and night IN THE HOUSE. Who can figure THAT timeline??It is ONE PERSISTENT KILLER. I suggest he gets a JOB. WHY NOT JUST KILL THESE people OUTRIGHT and save us the PAIN of a very long boring pointless movie that makes zero sense and does NOT tie together well?

Movie starts like a standard horror with the usual elements. Continues similarly until a very unsatisfying end.The story is NOT pulled together by the end. There are better horror movies out there if you want have yourself a more satisfying scare!

... because I always check here first before getting too involved in a movie today, where I could see where the writer's medication began to wear off, it was that baaaaaaaaaad, wow!Whomever, whatever put this together needs better meds, or maybe an intervention. I mean, come on, why do this to your audience, and your bank account? Must be a trust fund baby.What an insult, for this was one of the reasons I canceled Netflix before, them serving us salmonella in the form of a movie like this.Argh!

This movie needs to win an award for most terrible movie ever made.The bad guy actually says zero lines in the movie. He is also a ninja and can't be heard walking around even though he is wearing giant boots.I hope whoever wrote and directed this movie retires and finds a profession they are good at.

reviews.review_title: Interesting to watch, but the end is very bad
reviews.content: SPOILERAs I understand the person was just random serial killer who firstly visits a house as a potential buyer, and then kills owners. No more sense, just this.
Hard sheathing movie. Burning director and sheeting on him.

This was the dumbest stupidest movie. I wasted an hour and a half of my life on this. After 13 Reasons Why, I ONLY watched this because of, Helmet, this movie was straight TRASH! Whoever wrote this should be HIGHLY disappointed in themselves. It COULD'VE been a great story but NO
I lost my time watching this movie, I don't recommend it to anyone .

I was actually pretty excited for this film considering I really loved Dylan Minnette in "13 Reasons Why" and I felt he'd probably sign on to a decent script. After watching the film, I got on here to check the reviews and I'm glad I wasn't alone. It literally had no meaning. We never learned anything about the who or the why or the what even? Here's what I had thought was going to have happened but didn't: Somehow this creepy house and town is full of dead people, who need to build their army of the dead. The secret villain was Logan's father, out to bring them back to him. I mean, that honestly would have been a better ending then what happened and that's with about two minutes of thought. Netflix fail! Don't rush things through, keep your story lines goof and your movie and tv productions top choice. You don't want to lose your loyal fan base.
It's not just bad it's unfinished. Created this account just to leave a bad review. If your considering changing the station do it. You'll save precious minutes of your life.

reviews.review_title: This movie is NOT as terrible as you're all making it haha
reviews.content: I saw the trailer and I figured "ok let's give it a go" and I looked it up here first and saw it had a 3.2 rating and I almost didn't watch it but did anyway. This movie is no where near as bad as these reviews are making it out to be. Some horror cliches (as per usual) and not the most original story but it's your typical suspense thriller and I actually liked the ending because it was different than what I was expecting. Best movie ever? No. Worst movie ever? Not even close.

reviews.review_title: Atmospheric + creepy for the most part
reviews.content: It had so much potential and was so solid and creepy throughout, I really enjoyed it.... literally up until the last 10 mins where I feel it would have fared a lot better if what transpired was of more of a supernatural element.

This movie was so boring. I mean, had decent acting but the story was sooo boring. I almost fell asleep, the weird neighbor had nothing to do with the story, the other guy was boarderline creepy stalker.Watch "the rental" instead, it has a lot better plot, better drama, more realistic (which makes it creepier IMO). You will get a better movie experience it too.*Spoilers*They both kinda the same ending but "the rental" is waaaaay better.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the Worst Netflix Orginal Movie That Will EVER Be Made
reviews.content:
It's been years since I've bothered to grace IMdB with a review (the axing of the beloved forums gives little reason to visit this site) but I must make an exception for The Open House, which is by leaps and bound the worst Netflix Original film I've seen, and I even stomached the Adam Sandler titles.This screenplay is so inept, I would think it was aiming for comedy if it weren't taking itself as serious as a heart attack. The buffoonery starts in the opening scene where the teenage son is running down the street. He asks his father for the time, and it's 5:07. They talk about how this is going to open the doors to scholarships. Note: serious runners want time down to the hundredth of a second. Well, dad is soon offed in a parking lot accident. So what's mom and son to do without him? The answer of course, move into aunt's vacation home in the mountains she just so happens to have on the market. You know, because exploring the "horror" behind an open house inviting strangers into YOUR home should probably have something to do with the protagonists' house being for sell and not one they're merely staying at. Instead, it's like they're on vacation and this is only one of the numerous terrible plot points. Hope you like characters who don't talk like humans. You're going to get a lot of that in The Open House. There's the creepy neighbor who reminds the widowed mother that her husband died on meeting her. There's also an overly friendly guy working retail whose sole purpose is to be everywhere.I hope the inept team that worked on this reads this review, if for no other reason so they can learn the following about horror:
1) Having the hot water in the shower repeatedly turn off is not scary. 
2) Making multiple trips to a "scary" basement unharmed diminishes the threat. 
3) Returning "home" after an open house to find a phone on the table is not scary.
4) Filling your movie with red herrings doesn't automatically make sense of the ending.
5) The one time a horror movie sets up the protagonist as a track star and he gets not payoff.IMdB, you removed the message boards, but can you please add a feature where users can select cast and crew to a personal list which flags all their past and future work?

This one definitely goes in to the category of movies that weren't supposed to be made. The begining is not so bad, one thinks it could be something but than it starts... So many pointless things you can't keep track. Wierd wtf remarks from the neighbour lady, than Chris who is just appearing as from nowhere, etc. I mean, terrible and pointless to watch. Ending??? I don't even wanna go there 😂 Only brigt side to this movie were the main actors.

reviews.review_title: Do not watch! Please save your time!
reviews.content: Highly disappointed. Writing has gone horribly wrong. Ending is just pathetic. They din even show face of culprit. Everything is bad.

reviews.review_title: Crumples in the end in front of your eyes
reviews.content:
A young man and his mother moves in here sister's house
after the death of her husband. But there's something in this
house that don't want them there, and what about the creepy
neighbour lady. The Open House begings and goes on like any
modern horror film, and it gives you a good hope for a good film
for a long time, because it uses a very ordinary pattern we see
so much in horror films these days. But then the end. We don't
know who the killer is, we don't know what his motive is
and he's killing people. The End.

reviews.review_title: So many plot setups for nothing to be used
reviews.content:
There was three main setups
1. Martha's husband nonsense
2. The blocked off tunnel
3. The broken staircaseLiterally none of these setups were even used. Martha was a useless character (great acting though), the tunnel was interesting as hell & would've explained so many things that went down in the house, & the broken staircase was again a pointless scene. Me & GF came up with a better ending in minutes: The tunnel leads to Martha's house, the big bad guy was her son who looked like her husband (therefore taking advantage of her Alzheimer's) & then when Logan/Big Bad is running out one of them trips on the aforementioned hole. Boom. Better ending. Netflix hire me. As it is right now, there are plenty of things to do with plenty of variables but they decided to abandon every single one. As it is, there are plenty of things that are damn near impossible, blatantly ignored by the existing characters, & overall MEGA DISAPPOINTING.TL;DR: Every single plot point abandoned, Impossible outcomes, Useless ending. Great acting though, they did amazing with what they had.

This movie left me with an empty feeling. There were a few weak attempts at misdirection regarding the antagonist, but that couldn't save a very thin attempt at plot resolution. The acting was adequate, and I think the director did his/her best with what was presented. Editing and cinematography were average.This one just had bad writing. Not sure how such an empty plot received a green light and funding when there are so many quality scripts are out there getting ignored. The movie industry is just strange.3/10 - an empty movie with an unsatisfying ending.
My roommate just kicked my @$$ for making him watch this. Over an hour of life lost AND a black eye...two thumbs down and a circle 👎👎

Real SNOOZEFEST!
PATHETIC IN EVERY SENSE OF THE FILM!
ACTING,DIALOGUE,STORY,DIRECTOR....
NOTHING GOOD TO SAY!
I ONLY LASTED 5MINS WATCHING THIS PILE OF !@#$

What a way to kill off a promising new star's acting career before it took off.
Minette was good, fresh and original in "13 Reasons Why" a stunningly surprising and exciting new Netflix production...... then somebody decided to cast him and waste him in this turkey of a movie.where to begin.. Spoilers!!!
A tired worn out old formula, grieving mother drags College son how to score runs away from his friends and studies up to the mountains to grieve at an empty (but extraordinary well kept) friends casual mountain lodge ( that just so happens to be the size of a resort hotel..)(really???) to get over the death of a father only to be haunted by said father's ghost...and other unlikely yarns.
you get the Drift before even starting except that the script was lame, the acting wooden, the plot ridiculous and yes the acting was wooden and unfortunately Minnette is reduced to a scouling teenager with no change in facial expression throughout the entire movie.Such a shame, the setting and the production and Minnette gave this film so much possibility but were all wasted on the predictable storyline.

Total spoiler review - and it doesn't matter, because there's absolutely nothing to spoil. That's the spoiler. There's nothing here.A little thematic eeriness, some jump scares, and some torture. And some odd, vaguely threatening but not-fully-realized characters. And murder. Mindless, meaningless murder. For no reason. By someone we don't know. That's it.No plot, no closure, no answers. I mean ZERO plot. A setting, yes, and a situation. But zero plot. We don't know who the killer is. We don't know why he's doing it. The victims, who are theoretically the protagonists but get absolutely no resolution, are irrelevant. Their story about being widowed/orphaned means nothing. They could have been hitchhikers. They could have been missionaries. They could have been two teenagers who broke into a house. The mother/son dynamic is irrelevant. Their lives are irrelevant. It's just some faceless guy scaring and murdering people in a house which just happens to be for sale. We have no idea who he is or why he's doing it. For a moment you might think the son is insane, because he seems to hallucinate his dead father, so maybe it's been him the whole time and he doesn't even know it? Nope. He gets killed, too.And then it ends. I'm not just disappointed, I'm rather pissed off.Horror writers are increasingly ignorant about writing, and about horror. And how they managed to pay for real actors is the biggest mystery in the whole film. Did these actors not read this nonsensical script? Or is this a complete failure of editing, where some hack just tore it apart and pasted together some clips that he found scary?The only reason this film would be worth watching is to exemplify really, really bad film-making for film students.

The premise sounded good and the scenery was nice to look at. Everything else went downhill from there. Every cheesy boring trope was thrown in with the kitchen sink here: bizarre/creepy neighbors and town folk, giant house with creepy basement, bickering family members who blame each other for stupid creepy happenings, the requisite shower scenes with nudity (do people really shower like this in real life?? Where's the soap? Where's the shampoo?), the improbable water heater turning cold that fast which then requires a shivering woman in towel to go into creepy basement (again, really??), who then SHUTS OFF the flashlight to fumble around in the dark lighting multiple matches (buy a damn Bic) so something "scary" can be peeping from behind, etc. Etc. The jump scares are lame and predictable and the multiple red herrings were the most frustrating part. I had more fun rewriting the plot in my head (using the creepy neighbors of course) than I did watching this. Is the ending supposed to make my heart pound? Weep for the poor bickering duo? Not sure what the intent was... especially when random killer removes the kids contact lenses- I felt like the joke was on me at that point. I'm guessing this guy moves in to open houses (they have to have secret lairs for him to hide in, though) and terrorizes anyone that still lives there?? Not buying it. Even so, I wouldn't be so stupid as the Mom to let a bizarre townie "look around" my house without supervision. But that was just another red herring, too. Do better Netflix!!!

reviews.review_title: The Worst Movie I've Ever Seen
reviews.content: I had such high hopes. The setup was great, the characters were interesting, the setting was ideal, and all the pieces were there for a great story. It's one of those psychological thrillers where your mind is constantly trying to put the pieces together and solve the puzzle of what is going on. Eventually there is an "aha" moment or a great twist, and it all comes together for better or worse. None of that happens. Nothing is ever explained, and no mysteries are solved. It just ends without any clue or explanation as to why everything we witnessed happened. If the director was intending to create a film to insult and waste its audience's time, this director wins the biggest award in the history of film.

The late, great film reviewer Roger Ebert often used the phrase "idiot plot" in negative reviews. He was referring to film plots that depended on the main characters behaving like idiots in order to move the story along (for example, a young, scantily clad coed goes to check out a pitch black corridor all alone because she heard strange noises coming from it). In short, nobody in real life would ever behave the way the movie's characters do. So it is in The Open House. A recently widowed mother and her seemingly none too bright teenage son move into her sister's palatial mountain mansion because she can't afford the rent on her own house after her husband dies. The catch is the house is for sale so she and her son must leave for the realtor open houses every Sunday. During the first open house, a sinister figure seen only from the knees down comes to the showing. After it's over and they've returned home, son says to Mom that open houses are weird because you give people keys to your house so they can look at it when you're not home. But how do you know they ever leave the house? Therein lies the entire plot. Given the massive house and the number of rooms in it, of course the ominous stranger who possesses those legs we saw earlier is still there stalking them. These two are so ignorant of what's going on around them that the homicidal stranger climbs into bed with Mom and she doesn't even notice. How idiotic can a movie character get? Pass this turkey right on by. I don't even know why I watched it to the end. I guess I was just curious to see how bad the movie could get.
What a load of........ Waste of time please don't watch not worth your time bad acting terrible storyline way to much. Omg what was that??? TERRIBLE!!!

They found money to produce that?
Not really scary, take too long to go... actually nowhere... no story line ... I don't think I can say more.
Calling this movie very bad would be an understatement.

The movie stars up in an unoriginal idea, but, nowadays, we get used to it...
The problem is that the tension is built, we get a couple of characters here and there, throwned into the screen, and then.... nothing... there's a killer that we almost have no glimpse, there's no motive, no reason, nothing...
The movie is empty... All of the characters die, but there are no reasons for it, no background story for the mansion, no nothing...
This isn't a joke, it's an offense to any horror movie fan...

Major complaints being.
Characters were too unbelievably stupid and unrealistic. I obviously always suspend belief especially horror movie characters, but throughout the film your going to be going "wait what?" "why?" "why?" "really?"
"dude mom why are you letting some random guy in the house to look around"
(protective, defensive, on edge, etc)
"grr, well, just gonna go to my room and shut the door and listen to music"
(passive, unconcerned)
this was literally moments later after his initial frustration.
based on his first reaction he would kind of follow the guy around and keep tabs on him.
later the mom: "oh he must have left I guess, dur"
didn't even see him leave, didn't check the house after he "left"
(doesn't matter because he's not the killer anyway)
stuff keeps happening with the water heater, constantly turning off mid shower, the lady's ass in the shower was the only good part of the movie. (kid "lost" his phone in the beginning of movie) so they eventually call a plumber, the house looked suspiciously like the shadow figure seen earlier briefly in the house at night (same gut). he checked the heater, said it should be all good, also "found" the kids phone by it. weird that the kid or mom didn't see it before unless it was literally behind the whole thing. STRONG suspicion. again though it never seems to pan out, the voice seemed different at the end as well.
all kinds of weird stuff happening, cops called ZERO times, not until the realtor told them "the house has been broken into" where they race to facecheck without phoning the police before THEY personally rush to the house.
which doesn't make sense due to their passive, write-offish nature the writers gave them. they are inconsistent characters, they make no sense, they are poorly written.
anyway they see a creepy living room setup with a candle and stuff, the phone rings, nobody there again, just another weird ominous phone call. finally they call the cops. cops do nothing, they "checked the house"
they stay in the house because they don't have the "money" for a hotel.
so call a damn family member or friend.
they get owned. also killer makes it look like the kid did it basically.
basically there is no real clues or indication who the criminal was, I guess it was some random psycho? nothing was explained. 
the movie needed more characters, like the game clue. you want the audience to try to figure out who and why. that's what would have made this interesting.
of course not ALL horrors need to follow this formula, but that is majorly the direction this movie was headed formula wise. and it failed. it's not a slasher, it's not paranormal. it was written very much as a slow burner mystery horror thriller, it had such an identity crisis near the end.

It's too bad they couldn't come up with a better plot?
Who was this crazy guy that never showed his face?
Why did he do what he did to 2 innocent people and why the hell wasnt anything explained at the end of this movie?!??

I have barely anything to say about this film because it is so awful. The characters are so unlikeable and the acting ranges from okay to horrendous! It fails to be scary and is building up to absolutely nothing. The sets and costumes are passible, with a conventional house setting. Even the ending of the film is unfilling, it can even be a bit confusing in the way it is shot. Not worth a watch, just plain boring!

The movie plot, is taken from later movie "The Boy". Only this one is dumper...like alooot!!!! Has no twists, no sense in "WTF is going on", and not giving you a satisfaction in the end. Please, don't do part two.

Save your time do not watch this!
Simply put this movie had me lost as to the point the reason and what it was really about. Where was the story telling to give the movie purpose and meaning. There was potential in the premise to be a great horror & someone ruined it by not caring enough to do any story telling. How do you get paid to NOT do your job and tell a story ??!??

reviews.review_title: Kind of a waste of time. I expected more from Netflix
reviews.content:
The beginning set us up for some creepiness; the glasses, the contacts, the water to wash them. Maybe there was already something supernatural going on.
A fatherless son and widowed mother in the bowels of grief. In the woods. 
Unfortunately there was just no payoff for the rather good beginning.
The writers must have sat in a room tossing out lines and characters with no consideration for overall plot.

reviews.review_title: Finish the story yourself...and colour the pictures......
reviews.content:
Immediately after the movie I felt cheated
such gaping open end...so many unanswered questions
I can imagine, many viewers are left with an unsatisfying feeling about this film ...
but after my first confused feelings where gone, I could see the humor in it and enjoyed my thoughts by filling in the possible answers.
the most important thing about a moviefor me, is that it entertains me ..
and this one certainly did!

Real pieces of crap put out garbage like this! Worse are those that pay for and encourage the production of disjointed ideas such as these. There is no relation to the title. You never find out who or why. Just meaningless drivel. SUX!!
I indicated spoilers because I revealed this is a waste of time with no resolution.

reviews.review_title: don't watch this movie it sucks
reviews.content: A complete waste of time. It was completely lazy and unoriginal with the setup and execution, a totally frustrating watch. I wish i could get that hour and a half back - the only good part was the cool looking house.

Very disappointed how this movie played out. Started out like a ghost story, then changed to a home invasion of some sorts and ended without giving any clues to who the attacker was and why.
What was the point of the black guy and the old lady? It lead to nothing. There could have been so many different endings and twists that could have made a decent ending and it wouldn't have cost more to execute them. Why go with the most pointless ending ever?

This pile of boring garbage made not one tiny bit of sense!!!! I had no idea what the story even was!!!!! Was there a story?! This is the dumbest Netflix movie I've seen this year!!!!! It was SOOO boring and dumb!!!! I started it bc I knew it was gonna be bad and YouTuber Chris Stuckmann made a whole commentary vid on the movie and I wanted to prep for it, while doing so, entertained myself by making fun of it, then ran out of things to make fun of and just...idk... the acting was corny and wooden... I just couldn't wait for it to be over when I made halfway through... Not one frame of this made sense!!!!! GARBAGE!!!!! This is on an even level to Death Note for two of the dumbest Netflix movies in general....
What does this movie want to tell ? who is the killer ? it's a ridiculous movie. don't watch and don't waste time.

This movie started off great! Could've done with less depressing scenes but it was good. Then the last 10 mins came and oh my god is it terrible. Its like they had a great budget and then ran out of money in the last 10 mins of the movie. Like come on the movie basically just cuts off. With ZERO explanation of what happened.... DO NOT WATCH!

Any reviews that identify the antagonist don't understand the point of The Open House. Which makes this film so very interesting.Well paced, plotted and conceived. Sure. The acting and writing wasn't great, but perfectly adequate for the film."Horror" movie? No. "Thriller" better captures the genre. A true "Who done it?"

reviews.review_title: This is why I never use Netflix's internal rating system
reviews.content: Honestly I never thought Netflix could make crap like this, but they did. The directing is horrible. The entire film was loaded with pointless tension. Early into the film Logan was just starring at a field and the camera suddenly pulls back and hits you with loud orchestral for no apparent reason. Nothing happens at all after that. That was when I knew this was going to be one of the worst movies ever made.

It was interesting in the beginning but then the rest was just awful.What is with the lackluster movies now? The endings either aren't endings like Cop Car (where you don't know what happens), endings that don't make sense to the rest of the movie like What Lies Below (where it's like X happens but Y ends) or endings that resolve nothing like this one.They all have endings where you don't get it.Why did they do what they did? Why? No answer? Awful movie. Period.

reviews.review_title: I've never been so disappointed and frustrated with a movie!
reviews.content: Absolutely awful! I highly recommend not wasting your time on this movie. Watch something else. You'll literally like any movie you watch better then Open House. It's to bad because the first half of the movie was good. It led you to think there would be some good plot twists and something really bizarre going on with the people going in and out of the house but in the end the only plot twist is there is no plot.

reviews.review_title: How does a script with so little content get greenlit?
reviews.content: Spoiler alert: the murderer is *just some guy*. I'm not kidding. Throughout the runtime of this terrible, TERRIBLE movie, plot points are set up, only to be completely discarded or ignored two seconds later. Nothing in the movie matters, because at the end, the murderer is... a murderer you know nothing about, who has nothing to do with anything in the movie. FUN, right? It's like a whodunit in which you're never even presented with the killer as an option. This movie is inexcusably bad; stay away from it like the plague.

Do not watch this pointless piece of crap!
What a pointless movie.

reviews.review_title: Drawn out story line with no pay off
reviews.content: The story slowly builds for 98% of the duration then comes to a climax within 10 minutes of the end. Hard to call it a climax as there is no explanation given for anything (motivation, targeting, Martha, or who the criminal even is). By the end I just didn't care anymore.Outside of the complete lack of depth, the movie is 2/10 in the scary category. Mostly just gruesome in a couple of parts (low hanging fruit). Would not recommend as a scary movie. Or as any type of movie. It's not good.

A good throw back to when horror movies were more about the scares and less about the gore and violence. Open House follows in the footsteps of movies like Halloween and When a Stranger Calls. You never see much of the killer and that works beautifully. It's a dark and terrifying thriller that will keep you glued to your seat.Watch it at night with the lights off.

reviews.review_title: Not everyone can pull this off, and they failed.
reviews.content:
This kind of ending was made famous by Black Christmas, even in that film it has a third act with an ending, this movie fails because a lot of plot elements were never even used, what was the point of the lady with alzheimer other than a red herring? what was the point of the visions of his dad?, if you are going to make a bunch of red herrings just to surprise the audience with a cop out because you had no idea how to end your script then be more straightforward and get rid of all the BS so many wasted minutes on this film. It is not original, it is not shocking, it is not well written, go back to film school how did you even get a 100k budget to do this.
The 3 is for the actors, they did fine.

This awful film is right up there on my 'worst ever' list. I thought Netflix was supposed to provide, exciting, cutting-edge entertainment; this is absolute dreck!
Horror fans, stay away! It's an absolute insult of a movie.

reviews.review_title: A Mire of Cliches and Boredom
reviews.content: The Open House is possibly the worst Netflix Original film I've seen to date (only in competition with The Ridiculous Six), due to nearly every aspect of the film being done atrociously. The plotline is boring and rushed (not helped in the least by a cardboard cutout lead performance by Dylan "White Bread" Minnette) and hampered by every B-level horror movie cliche of the last three decades. Nothing is resolved and nothing happens because this is a black hole posing as a piece of cinematography.
When a writer starts to write a story but don't know how to end.
No story no back story no reason wasted a great potential the writter director and producer needs to get their head examined by a psychologist

This movie was extremely slow, and I can't believe I wasted precious time watching this piece of junk. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME. Netflix needs a lot of help with the garbage they are putting out there, but this is definitely at the bottom of my list. Even for Netflix. The plot goes absolutely nowhere. Avoid this movie.Yes the acting isn't bad, but the fact that the storyline is completely all over the place and uninteresting ruins everything. I remember I had tried watching it months ago and turned it off. That seems to be a much smarter choice than to waste time trying to get into a movie that isn't worth my time.
What on earth was that ending? This is the most scary dumbest movie I've ever seen in my life.

reviews.review_title: How are people saying there's no ending?
reviews.content: There is one. It's not a cookie cutter ending. Its obviously set up for a sequel. I know who the killer is. They gave enough clues to who it was. The neighbor knows a lot more than she tells and the store clerk knew something as well. American audiences suck cause they always complain when something isn't spelled out for them. It's obvious the last shot of the movie is hinting at a potential sequel or at the very least the events happening at the house are not gonna stop.

Have you ever sat through a film you were convinced would pay off eventually only to find yourself cheated out of two hours of your life? Well, that's The Open House. This script wasn't just bad, it made no sense with an ending as confusing as it is unsatisfying. A mother and son move into the mother's sister's house located in a remote wooded area; the house is unoccupied (though it is an awesome house and lavishly furnished) and currently on the market. There is an open house conducted every Sunday so the pair have to clear out during the showings. When they arrive a series of odd events and even more odd supporting characters make an appearance. I can't even begin to describe how the plot develops beyond that because it was an unpalatable mess. There was no real structure to it, people come and go who you think are part of the story and then are never seen again. There is no sincere attempt to explain anything. Just weird, unconnected plot points that add up to dead ends. Acting was ok if not phoned in. It was as if the writers just threw together a loosely connected series of scenes without any plot development and topped it off with a cheap and nonsensical ending. Netflix has produced some good work but this film is a mangy dog. It sucks because it doesn't care. Netflix just wanted eyeballs on it to enhance their ratings. Sad that they dispensed with quality to increase their market profile. Don't do them any favors, don't watch this garbage movie.

I mean, come on!! The movie has so many plot holes and concepts that are irrelevant in the story. Don't even get me started on the ending. Extremely irritating, and unsatisfying ending to the movie. No explanation of the antagonist and irrelevant characters. Unless you want to be left angered after watching this garbage, steer clear for your sake.

reviews.review_title: Waste of money but not time
reviews.content: Bored, looking for something not too stupid, not too scary and playing in the background while you do something else, then this is the movie for you. There is absolutely nothing new and original about this movie. Great picture quality, the actors are pretty good but then everything else is terrible. The movie made no sense at all and none of the 10000 questions going through my mind are answered.

The point where his mom thought he was messing around - by putting his dad's photo in the bin and the shower.
I think in the end the murder was his dad, his mom mentioned about debts etc, so he maybe he wanted the money from insurance. Also at the end the murder removes the sons contact lense, how else would he know that?Overall ok, up to that point

reviews.review_title: The lead can't act, people do stupid things, Ambiguity works when you want more. This movie...you want to never have seen it.
reviews.content: Dylan Minnette is a terrible actor imo.I've only seen a few episodes of 13 reasons to jump off a bridge but I was so bored by the protagonist. He really has like 1-2 emotions and everything else looks fake/forced. Glad you can run fast, cuz that doesn't matter in the long run...see what I did there??? Anyway this is complete garbage. One point for the actress who payed the mother, she was pretty good. Otherwise everything was We Todd Ed. Terrible to the point i hope the film makers feel bad and do better. Seriously.

I'll give it 5 stars out of 10 because the cinematography and the acting were on point: Minnette is very talented and the actress playing his mother is quite believable in her role. Besides that, the movie desperately lacks originality and suffers serious pacing issues: the whole thing is goreless, some characters - like the crazy neighbor playedb by Patricia Bethune - abruptly disappear from the storyline and tension is very predictable. I didn't expect the final turn of events (thank God, I thought it would end with the most plain, stupid happy ending), but it's avery very weak movie. I've seen worse, tho.

reviews.review_title: I haven't even watched it but believe Netflix would show such s@#%
reviews.content: Going by what Netflix are showing these days I believe these 1 star reviews, so happily give this movie what it deserves
Answers nothing, ends with no point to the movie's making. What a waste of time.

reviews.review_title: This movie is just plain bad
reviews.content:
I don't even know how to start talking about this movie, it's just really bad.There seems to be no story line present at all, and some parts are just filmed so poorly you actually laugh out loud.
 Now is this movie scary? Absolutely not. This movie is incredibly bland and didn't scare me at all.The director uses jump scares a decent amount and it just gets annoying.The suspenseful music which is really important in all horror films is put in the most awkward places. When the story suddenly gets interesting and the suspense starts building, there's no suspenseful music, but when the characters are just walking around there is. This movie is also incredibly slow and just boring, the characters are never fully developed and the film doesn't get interesting until the last 10 minutes or so.
 The main problem or interest in the movie is the murderer, and we never know who it is. Maybe I missed some hints, but the movie ends extremely abruptly with absolutely no questions answered, and a huge question mark on the killer.My biggest problem is definitely the ending,there was just no closure or conclusion to all the killings.
 This movie is not worth your time, play with your kids, read a good book, and just avoid this movie for your sake.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as the score suggests
reviews.content: OK I agree there is no 'traditional' ending in this movie, but not everything in real life has a 'traditional' end.I must admit I do like the occassional film that leaves the viewer scratching their head at the end and this one certainly does.Overall this film is dark, creepy and has a few effective jump scares. The acting is pretty good too.If you like endings where all the threads come together, avoid this one, but if, like me, you enjoy unresolved mystery,give it a go.

I have to admit I was really into this movie. Had me on the edge of my seat. End of the movie approaching, I'm finally going to find out who did it...here it comes....and the killer is.....roll credits. The writers are a**h****s.

reviews.review_title: Not to sure what this film was supposed to be
reviews.content: This film has been on Netflix for a while. I just decided to watch it because I had nothing else to do.The acting was there. I think they did the best they could do with the story they were given. That is the reason for a two star. Otherwise I am not sure where the movie was taking us. The ending was a bit of a surprise. CAUTION SPOILER ALERT: Everyone dies! So then what is the point of the whole movie?Watch it with an open mind, or just have it on as background notice. I cannot recommend watching the movie. Sorry!

reviews.review_title: Almost a Complete Waste of Time
reviews.content: Since I watched 13 Reasons Why and fell in love with Dylan Minette's character Clay, I thought this would be a good movie to watch. For his acting chops, he does deliver. However, literally NONE of the bad or scary things that happen are explained. By the end of the movie, which just sort of ends, all viewers are left with is a very large bucket of questions with no answers. If you, too, think Dylan Minnette is a hottie and like to see people go through some super creepy small town weirdness, watch away. If you do choose to sit through it, just know that the last 5 minutes or so are going to leave you with your head cocked to the side and saying aloud, "WTF?!"

I am seriously considering canceling my Netflix membership over this con job. I have NEVER seen a movie start with such potential and then end up just leaving the viewer with no answers, no ending, no explanation, nothing. I will never even watch another movie with any of these actors.

I sat through this 1 hour and 31 minutes of sad content of something that called itself a film! Really who wrote this and why did NETFLIX agree to show it? One of the worst "Thrillers" I have ever seen. It answered nothing I mean nothing. It did not offer any type of explanation even a dumb one. So looks like the joke is on me. You all have been warned.

reviews.review_title: Annoying doesn't come close to describe this ...
reviews.content: I actually thought this was going to be a good film and right up until the last 15 or 20 minutes I kept the faith, wondering what the ending would be, what was really going on in the house, etc. The acting is not bad at all, both main characters give a decent performance. The tension is built well and it did keep me engaged but then it all goes wrong. I mean - what actually DID happen? Who IS the person and why is he in the house? Why is the neighbour so nuts? It's just all hugely unsatisfying, To me it felt like a lot of time and thought went into the first hour or so and then they either a) ran out of money or b) ran out of ideas. I've flagged this review as having spoilers but really it isn't spoiling anything - I advise people not to watch this, you will just end up frustrated!

Total waste of time. The movie is so bad, who can possibly be so stupid lol. You see weird stuff in your house and you dont ask yourself maybe there is someone in but u keep living in there. Besides the actors were bad and the story bad as well
Dad dies in an accident, mum and son go to live alone together in a remotes house and are killed by some crazy nut. THE END and a total waste of time!
If you like jump scares, loose ends, and the writers not understanding how things like water heaters work this movie is for you.

So, I am a new subscriber to Netflix, had a kinda boring day alone and wanted to just waste some time watching a good horror/ thriller movie.. Unfortunately this is the first thing that popped for me on the movies screen and I said yeah this could be decent, I was very disappointed I went to bed after watching and kept thinking, how the hell would someone create such an awful movie with such a random story, I mean I am bad at storytelling but really even I could get a pen and paper and write down movies with stories that are much more entertaining than this garbage..Don't watch it or let anyone watch it..

Who on earth wrote this awful plot. Acting wasn't even that bad but man, who was the killer, what was his motive. I couldn't believe my eyes when this nightmare ended. Why it even ended and why without even giving us any info why anything happened in this movie. Shame on you Netflix, you took time from my life. Hopeless!

I put this on hoping it'd be a nice lil movie to watch and get some goosebumps. i couldn't even get past the first 40 minutes. the acting was okay. the music and sound editing were so brogan and over the top. i was constantly turning the volume up and down. theres very little character building and honestly by the point i turned it off, i was rooting for the "ghosts". dont bother with this.

This has almost exactly same story as the "When a Strangers Calls" (2006) movie, except this movie doesn't have any conclusion or any point whatsoever. At least the acting was better in this one.It was kind of a waste of time with inconclusive ending, but there was some good suspense in some parts of the movie.

reviews.review_title: Had a beginning, beginning and a beginning....
reviews.content: I ticked spoilers "yes" but to be fair literally nothing happens so not much to spoil in truth. Loved the look of this until around 10 mins in. It has a good premise to start with, like the writers had a total brain fart to make a movie about people living in a big creepy house while it was in the process of being sold, therefore they were allowing total strangers to look around and then not checking to see if the house was empty. It then goes into home invasion, teen slasher territory treating us to a few suspects before an unnamed dude we never meet kills the main characters and then *drumroll# ROLL CREDITS! Go me for making such a great movie! Oscars here I come.....Summary: An insult to anyone with a basic level of intelligence. Netflix have now churned out crap like Bright and now this s**t! Stick to making TV shows or hire another comedian in crisis like Adam Sandler.

I came to IMdB hoping someone caught something that I didn't, but no, it's just bad writing. A co-worker warned me not to watch this, and I thought she was crazy since it was a good movie. . .then I got to the end. It's as if Netflix couldn't decide if they wanted this to be supernatural or just a crazed killer. This was really a good movie and then they just ruined it with no explanation at the end, and honestly the "Open House" has nothing to do with the movie. Clearly we're led to believe there was a death in the house and that leads to some unexplained things happening, but that story is never developed, and we're left with a faceless (non-supernatural) killer in the end. Since we are shown a vehicle at the end, and the neighbor, Martha, acts strange throughout the movie, I went back to the scene at the little store when they first met Martha to see if the vehicle at the end was in the store parking lot earlier, which would've given a little closure. . . . it isn't, don't waste your time. Here's what I was thinking the whole time (and what would've made the movie much better): Martha and her husband used to live in the home and she was forced to leave after his death. So now you have his spirit haunting the house, and her disgruntled for having to vacate, leading her to terrorize the new family. That theory was blown out of the water when the hot water heater repairman acknowledges that Martha does indeed live down the street, and no one in the movie mentions that she ever lived there (despite her making claims that it's her property in the beginning). Hmmm now I need to go see if we're ever shown the repairmans vehicle.Very disappointing, the movie had real potential and was enjoyable until the end. Some people are giving the movie a decent rating because 90% of the movie was good, but when the 10% that is awful is the end and failure to tie the story together, you don't get partial credit. Don't waste your time. You'll be like me, watching, thinking it's a really good thriller and the reviews were harsh and then you'll be sadly let down at the end.

I mean really...I love horror movies, but this one just didn't deliver. It started off promising and I was really getting into it. There were some little scares that startled me and I was waiting for more intense moments. There were some. 
Also I usually don't even notice some small mistakes in movies, but in this case they straight up bothered me. And also the logic or rather illogic aspects such as you can't call for help with no SIM in your phone. Or the stairs that were broken and then not broken etc. The son who heard and felt weird things in the house, but then didn't bother to look out for his mom when she went alone in the basement. And the way the boy really disliked the friendly male neighbour and then all of a sudden called him for help. At times I thought even why the hell they stayed in this house..didn't they have no other place whatsoever to go to or to stay in, any relatives or smth. And speaking of relatives, why didn't the woman ask her sister what's up with this weird house and the neighbours etc. 
Also the bad guy of the movie was so weird and his actions didn't make any sense whatsoever - breaking the mom's fingers, not taking the phones, but rather just taking the SIMs out and the way he killed everyone was also very random. I mean yeah, there aren't a lot of movies that actually kill their main characters at the end and it is always refreshing to see something different, but in this case they managed to ruin even that. The ending just didn't do anything for me. It was random, flat, not interesting and okay yeah it left me wondering oooh will the killer go to some other random house that is for sale and does weird things to the people in it or maybe to the open house visitors. But what are the chances that a house that is for sale and has open house days has people living in it. Oh yeah right, this movie doesn't do well with logic. 
Overall this was so disappointing that I just can't give it anything other than 1 star out of 10. Please don't ever make a sequel for that movie.

reviews.review_title: An Illustrative Reason why Netflix nixxed Reviews
reviews.content: You may have read a review and witnessed a rating that warned you away from wasting your time on absolute garbage.

Netflix has given film fans a revival in some brilliant independent movies, sadly The Open House is not one of them. When Logan's beloved father dies in a fateful car crash, him and his mother, Naomi, fall on economic hard times. Unable to financially support herself and her teenage son, she moves into her sister's reclusive mountain chalet home until they sell it. On Sundays, the pair had to leave the home until 5 pm so potential buyers can look around. When they returned, strange things started to happen, objects began to move around, loud noises and items went missing. They soon realized they were not alone and in the house with a sadistic killer. Living in the mountains there makes their chances of survival become more cat and mouse.
The Open House had the potential to be a good independent home invasion thriller, but with so many inconsistencies and lack of connection to any of the characters, it became tedious. It felt like the movie was trying too hard to be a home invasion, thriller and psychological at the same time.

reviews.review_title: Much better than reviews give credit for if you think deeper...
reviews.content: I haven't read yet this as a potential theory (though I'm sure it's out there), but here goes...My thought:is that the killer is neighbor's (Martha) husband, and they're actually working together. She's acting as if she has Alzheimer'st to cause confusion & add to the oddities/terror of the soon-to-be victims. When Logan escapes the house and runs to the woods and hides behind the log, Martha wanders extremely close to him, stares into the sky, then wanders away. I believe she actually saw him, got close enough to (again) add to his terror, walked away w/o interacting...and went straight to her husband to tell him where she saw him so that he could hunt him down to finish it. Add to that, it is possible her husband (and killer) is the plumber...which would additionally tie together some of his comments (being familiar/having been there) and finding Logan's phone, etc.Or....the actual killer is someone not introduced to the audience and everyone else in the movie is truly 100% innocent. We see stories daily in today's world/news of people being attacked or murdered, but we never actually find out all the details for closure on the vast majority of them. This movie captures that aspect amazingly in either of the above approaches. Look at this movie as if you were reading a news story, or the police involved...you have very little to go off, but at least have a couple additional possible clues that we normally wouldn't in real life.Kudos to this movie breaking the norm that 99.99% of movies follow to give the audience full closure. This isn't the first, and hopefully is not the last, movie where the ending either isn't fully explained or isn't fully a traditional wrapped up happy ending. We don't always get all the answers, we don't always get our way, life isn't always fair.ps: this is my very 1st movie review on IMDB, after giving ratings reviews for countless of them. After reading many reviews, just felt strongly enough to put in my perspective and thinking this was a MUCH better movie than most reviews give it credit for.

Very disappointing. The suspense dragged out so far that it wasnt even suspenseful anymore. It was about 50 minutes in before any action started. The movie actually had no plot or character depth. Odd characters were thrown in without any ties or purpose to the movie. Characters acted strange and you'd think their strangeness would have something to do with the "plot" but it didn't.The flow of the film was not cohesive. The nightmares the son was having I thought had to do with the plot, it didnt. Sure it showed his struggles with his father's death but the way in which it was showcased made it seem as though it would be apart of something bigger. That something bigger never came. Those creepy camera angles/shots were pointless and were of a great waste.I felt like I was watching the day to day life of any family. I also feel like the writer of this film was torn between trying to build characters to show how they process grief and rebuild their relationship and making a horror film. He seemed to have gotten mixed up somewhere inbetwen that process because character development and the suspense and horror were both lacking and very premature.What was up with the "mysterious" basement? Why even give it such great focus?I kept watching in hopes that it would get better but it never did and by the time it was over I felt so cheated.How can you have a murderer with no background, no identity, no reason? No one aware of him existing. Why did he kill? So many questions. The murderer was not developed, even he had no depth or true presence.If you watch this you'll be confused and frustrated.I don't like to give such negative views but I had to be honest. This film has so much potential.
I really don't understand the negative reviews and the complaints that nothing happened at the end.The man got away with it. That's what happened!

reviews.review_title: I see why the low rating
reviews.content: The movie looks like a 7. And the acting is great. Just no pay off, no levels to the story, no resolving mystery, just an unnessesary conclusion to an already over told house intruder story. I loved a lot about it. The story is the main let down.

reviews.review_title: Basic with a splash of uniqueness
reviews.content: At first, it's like the screenwriter forgot to answer to vital questions to complete the story: who and why, making it extremely frustrating to watch. Ironic since those answers usually nullify the terror and suspense that proceed the final act. Instead, it leaves us with far more questions than answers, an unusual approach to this genre. The best things about this one is its scenery and its acting - both above average for this kind of movie. But the lack of answers - ANY AT ALL - takes away from that. We get dropped into the middle of someone else's story but know nothing about them or their motives - an interesting concept. And when you get over that initial viewing, it's quite unnerving to think about going through what the family does. It's actually quite realistic in that way, a way most horror/suspense films can't touch. The twist in this one is that tragically, like most victims in real life, sometimes we just don't get the closure we want. Unfortunately, there's just something about it that fails to satisfy. The acting is on par - nothing Oscar worthy of course but solid; the cinematography is solid but the natural setting more than holds it own. Yet there's something missing in its entirety. There are no answers, and I was okay with that after a few moments of me being really angry at whoever thought this was a good idea; the second act is where it falls into the Stupid Trap, where the cops are called and they stupidly think nothing's happened and everything goes just as you suspect. Perhaps that is where the movie loses its charm. The ending stands out - how well its received depends entirely on the viewer - but is again nullified by the typical genres go-to for everything: dumb down the characters inexplicably despite their previous actions.Overall, there are way better movies that accomplish all of this and more without a Netflix budget.
I kept waiting and waiting for this film to go somewhere, before this happened the credits appeared! Pointless ending

Mum tired and afraid. Son tired and afraid. Someone is hiding in their house, but they couldn't afford a night on a hotel. So instead the mad killer, who we never see, kill them both. End of story. I love a good thriller, it doesn't even have to be very good in order for me to watch and enjoy. But this one is a waste of time.

What the hell? This movie made no sense and then right when you think it's gonna all come together then it just ends with still no answers and everyone's dead for no apparent reason. It feels like the writers just got tired of writing and stopped right in the middle of it

All I can say is what the Hell was that. Story made no sense, and the ending is a question. There is NO Story to this at all. No Answers, No explanations, Nothing. Don't waste your time.
Netflix needs to quit making movies.

Bad, real bad.
One of these movies where the trailer looks better than the film.
Avoid.

Can i know please what is the point of watching this movie !!
No end really !!

reviews.review_title: Life is too short to watch movies this bad
reviews.content: I started writing a review, with some spoilers, including my theories on where I *thought* this movie was going before it took a hard left into a pile of garbage.As I was trying to map out my review and realized how lengthy it would be, it dawned on me that this movie had already wasted 94 minutes of my life by watching it and it's not getting much more. Save yourself the time, brain cells and annoyance. If you still want to be confused but still entertained at the same time, I'd recommend The Room.

reviews.review_title: Really not that bad at all!!!
reviews.content: Ignore the bad reviews, this was far better than 3.3... I've seen far worse (Escape room 2017 for one!!). If you like a gripping, intriguing thriller with good acting - give it a watch! It may not have been fully explained in the end - but is that really a bad thing in a 'horror' film?? Could there be a sequel??

WHAT A WASTE OF TIME. SO much potential gone to waste. My boyfriend and I came up with so many endings that would've been better, and so many theories while watching the movie that would've been 100% better than this was. Can't believe we spent an hour and some change watching complete shit. So trash. Garbage. So many unanswered questions.. don't know who the (random) killer was, don't know why it was necessary for the dad to die in the beginning, don't know why everyone had to die, don't know what the whole thing was about the lady with Alzheimer's. They don't explain ANYTHING. Again, trash. Don't waste your time.

This isn't really that thrilling for a movie that's supposed to be a thriller. It kept me somewhat engaged due to the lead actor (Dylan Minette) who I've liked for awhile. There are also some great supporting performances, particularly Patricia Bethune in a nutty role. But ultimately it meanders through the storyline and has an underwhelming ending.
I would award this negative stars if I could. What the hell was this movie supposed to be? This is hands down the worst horror/thriller I've ever seen.

reviews.review_title: They made 2/3's of a watchable horror thriller and then completely dropped the ball.
reviews.content:
I thought the first half of the movie was pretty decent (albeit cliche) in a sort of slow-build Hitchcock-ian way. However, the last third rendered watching the movie a complete waste of time. I have no idea why they decided to go in the direction they did, but it rendered the entire movie useless and pointless. I rarely want my last 1.5-2 hours back after watching a movie, even really poorly made ones, but I really do with this film. Overall:Production value was a fairly solid 7/10.
Acting was an adequate 5/10.
Story direction was a very firm -1/10.

First half was pretty good then the characters did some really stupid things and the story went nowhere. It's like they ran out of money and needed to wrap up the movie quick and didn't bother really explaining anything.
Plot moved slowly and led up to absolutely nothing.

I know less about this movie then I did going into it.
I have no idea what I just watched??

reviews.review_title: Maybe this is a new genre. Still, I hated it.
reviews.content:
A so-called movie by two directors I watched in Netflix. I am still angry not to the producers/directors/writers, to myself for acting randomly this time and not checking IMDB.
This thing is full of nonsense that puts you in a mood that all these silly things are happening for a reason so you keep watching. Then, nothing! A huge nothing without understanding anything. What can I say? We are fooled and they made us watch it. Maybe in the future, this will be a new genre that we do not understand now. We want things that we understand or we are used to. That's why everyone, including me, is criticizing so harshly. If you watch it, just relax. Getting angry does not help you, in fact I relaxed while writing this. You may follow the mood change:)

reviews.review_title: yet another extremely boring and forgettable netflix creation
reviews.content: Three words: this movie sUCKS. it's boring, it's slow, it's extremely forgettable. Dylan Minette is a lovely musician, but he. can't. act. it makes no sense, and it's incredibly anticlimactic. please don't waste your time watching this movie like I did. your life won't be made better by watching this. there isn't even a satisfying resolution. spoiler alert: everyone dies. a grieving widow moves with her son who has less emotion and personality than my door lives in an open house. after two hours of being bored, they suddenly get tortured by the creepy, obvious antagonistic neighbours, and die. the end. that's the whole movie. the deaths weren't sad or heartbreaking - I couldn't find myself giving a singular care about them. the characters were flat, due to a mixture of awful writing and terrible acting. the only part I genuinely liked was when the characters died because it meant the movie was over and I didn't have to watch the actors struggle through this project anymore.
So i read those reviews and they say the movie is bad ,its not. Acting is accuatly good and the plot is awsome ,so you are not wasting your time watching this :)

reviews.review_title: Truly unwatchable due to lameness, not due to scariness.
reviews.content: This movie was almost inconceivably bad. You'd have to take the most obvious and overdone elements of some of the worst B-grade mystery/horror flicks and throw them all into the pot and see which ones bubble to the top with the fat, skim that off and use it to make this film. I can't say enough bad about it. With no plot, and every single "scary tactic" known to filmmakers everywhere used, I challenge anyone to just sit through it without fast forwarding to the end to see if anything happens.

"Mom. Have you ever thought about how, like, weird open houses are? I mean you give your keys to someone you hardly know, they stand in one room and welcome in a bunch of complete strangers, and those people just roam around the house. And the realtor doesn't check the house when it's done right, they just... turn the lights off and go?" If that quote doesn't scare you, then I doubt this will. The Open House really has no plot. It's plot is thin, even for the horror genre. Right now the word coming to mind is "stupid" and "waste of time" when it comes to this movie, if you can even call it that. I'm labeling this as a spoiler review, even though I'm not sure exactly how you spoil this movie, because nothing really happens? The first three fourths of the movie is spent alternating between scenes of Dylan Minnette panting after finishing a run, Dylan Minnette listening to music on his computer, Dylan Minnette walking around the house and then showing his mom in the shower. Obviously this movie was made cheaply because everything feels so insular, and only three or four characters seem to occupy the town where the mains have moved to.
