The killer isn't seen much until the last twenty minutes or so when he then kills a minor character, kills the mom character and then kills Dylan Minnette's character. All within twenty minutes! The garbage pacing makes it seem as though not a single thing happens for at least an hour. The fact that the killer is never shown doesn't add any real fear, and it basically makes the ending even more unsatisfying than it already is. The two leads had no chemistry, and the necessity of showing the death of the dad is questionable at best, but I'm guessing was included to simply add to the runtime, which only clocks in at about an hour and a half. There's a saying that if you can't make a movie good, at least make it short, and I'm guessing that was the mantra of whoever was behind this.

reviews.review_title: Potentially Fairly good Horror movie ruined by infuriating ending
reviews.content:
What saved this movie from a 1 star rating was somewhat interesting Characters and a suspenseful and heartfelt story line ,(Even though the plot line has been used in many films), Good cinematography in Big Bear California .The Interaction between the mother and son was interesting and heart felt and a story building suspense . This is what made the inconclusive ending more infuriating.Why bother developing characters that we somewhat care about and interested in and a back story just to have them killed off ,Without enriching the plot or adding to it ?The Scares weren't jump out of your seat scares but the did add a sense of uneasiness and fear and suspense that never got resolved and no pay off.The ending was abrupt and explained nothing. It didn't reveal who the killer was and what their motivation was . Thus rendering the previous part of the movie senseless .In short this film takes a long time to get where its going and goes nowhere and leaves the viewer cheated,the Ending makes the viewer want to shout " WTF ! ". yes it is that type of ending!
 
I am starting to get ticked off with these Netflix movie type of terrible endings;

reviews.review_title: I can write a better script!!
reviews.content: Who wrote this plot and decided it should be set upon others to waste their precious time watching a flop!?! From the start, the father figure was lame. It's like the story went from 0 to 60 in a few seconds then went back down to ZERO for the rest of the movie. The suspicious characters were just plain weird and the 'unidentified man' was a waste of a character. It would have better if ....""Spoiler Alert**Martha had committed the crime and got it over with. That would have made a much better ending by at least 20%. This atrocity would have been good with better direction and plot towards the end.. Dylan acted well, so he gets credit for that.

SPOILER!
Not sure if they thought they were making another Hitchcock film (he was notorious for leaving audiences to fill in the blanks, like in The Birds) but this fell so short a 50 foot ladder wouldn't have helped.The story begins solidly enough and does progress to where we're all wondering just who is messing with the mother and her son ... human or specter. But once we determine the intruder to be human, there's one really good scare and then it's all down hill from there. There is no explanation as to who the intruder is, where he's come from, why he wants the house or why he only started this deranged stalking with these two people. Surely if the mother's sister was having issues she wouldn't have let her sister and nephew stay there. You'd think, right? Maybe she hated her and this was payback? Maybe she'd taken out a huge life insurance policy on them and paid the intruder to kill them. Who knows? Those ideas at least would have given the story some closure. Too bad because it had enough scary moments to keep me on edge and then fell dead when the second shoe failed to drop.

Netflix are making a lot of films lately - most of them are quite good - unfortunately this is not one of them.The basic concept is one which should have been meaty enough to provide plenty of plot twists but, despite quite a capable cast, the directors fail to deliver any punches at key points during the movie preferring to meander aimlessly, apparently exploring the mundane human interest story instead of getting to the point. Perhaps too many cooks ??The run time is 1 hr 37 minutes, and whilst this isn't a long film, to quote Mark Kermode, it is overly long and baggy, so much so you could probably have left the 37 minutes on the cutting room floor.Unfortunately, it makes for a poor effort in a time when poor movies are not suffered by the viewing public. The only thing it has going for it is the fact it is shot beautifully but this does not make up for the lack of pace.

In my opinion this is not as bad as many people have been saying.
The open ending leading to a possible sequel didn't bother me at all and left me hoping for a sequel that reveals more about this serial killer.It did scare me a couple times and the curiosity about what was happening really got me to keep watching it.It may not answer to all the questions (maybe because there will be a sequel) but it does answer the central question of the movie that is: "Will Logan and his mother be killed?"I didn't love it but I liked it.

I understand the bad reviews. There is no neat resolution to The Open House. But, to me, that makes it even more disturbing. Lots of nice tension, very good acting and keeping the mind open equal a good time. No, The Open House isn't in the realm of Strangers, true, but it's that same feeling that good horror films create. No reason, no carefully laid out path to follow, just terror. But that's why we watch horror movies (even though this might be better classed as a thriller), to be afraid, to be disturbed, to think. Or at least I do. I can imagine he's the neighbor's husband or the man almost killed in the road. Or maybe someone completely random who gave in to his demons. It's really up to the viewer to decide and that's good filmmaking.
This was just a whole lot of pointless uninteresting events that led to...
I could write a better screen play than this! I am embarrassed for the writers, and of course any and all crew that worked on this POS. This was the worst movie I have seen, well...in ever!

This movie gets bad ratings but it actually is a great thriller ! It is way better then the rating 3.3 it's scary and engaging. The ending does leave you feeling unsatisfaied BUT overall this is a suspenseful movie I enjoyed !

The trailer looked good, so thought I'd give this a watch.Really wish I hadn't, one, if not the worst films I've ever watched. The best thing I could say about it is that the mom has a nice bum!!!Decided to watch until the end and I was disappointed, a lot of unanswered questions.A real WTF ending. If I could give this a zero I would. Netflix should be ashamed they commissioned this, and the people who made this film should be banned from ever making any more.

reviews.review_title: Building up to a reveal that never comes
reviews.content: Honestly, I thought the movie was not as bad a most people say on this platform. It has its okay story, likable characters and every potential to be a good movie. The weakest part of it is the fact, that it's building up to a big ending, a reveal, a big explanation and then lets you hang there with an ending so pointless that I felt insulted after spending 2h watching this movie. With a good ending the movie could have saved itself, but missed this opportunity to do so. Very unsatisfying.

The plot is so thin it's embarrassing. They don't even try to hide it and that is what makes me upset. They use good camerawork and music to keep you on your toes, but then suddenly the credits start to roll and you're left with nothing. Seriously, the bird that just passed my window was more interesting than this garbage. Mother and son are estranged and there's not much chemistry between the actors, thus making their relationship seem fake. I feel like saying I want my money back but since I'm mooching off my sisters account, ima go ahead and say avoid at all cost. This is so bad it's not even fun.

reviews.review_title: If you let me write a film i will do better then this
reviews.content: I don't want to mention the ending there was no ending maybe they forget it.

reviews.review_title: The Open Mind required for Open House
reviews.content:
Movies have kind of programmed our minds over the years to take on many styles of storytelling - linear, non-linear, found-footage, follow one character, follow one character then a second for the same story offering surprise shifts in perspective etc. Mixed with vastly creative directing, editing techniques, and camera shots, movies are making magic whether they're original or not.I enjoyed this film, and here's why -
1. I could follow the story line. I like a simple chronological narrative.
2. There were the weird characters that I assumed would be involved in an amazing "ah haa" ending that would offer a lasting impression (because these types of characters are in my thriller/mystery films). I don't necessarily like characters like this but I expect them in mystery films. (Spoiler for remainder of point 2.) What I liked most about these characters is that for once, they didn't have anything to do with explaining the ending. They were just weirdo people. No links to the confusion of the film other than themselves being a little odd.
3. I think the strange occurrences in the house were reality-based i.e., the characters could realistically 'get away with' thinking they're not losing their minds enough to go down the supernatural path.
4. I think many of the character's choices in response to ominous situations were realistic, because it's easy to rationalise away these simple strange occurrences. For example, "I thought I put my phone there. Hmmm. Now it's not. Okay, probably left it somewhere else". Rationalised - easy-peasy.
5. The film held a consistent tone of unease thanks to the camerawork, direction, score, lighting and editing. The production of this film is pretty effective.
6. Decent acting. Not over-the-top or unbelievable or cringe-worthy.
7. The final act gets pretty brutal. The ending will feel unsatisfying for most viewers but I kinda like that for a change.The story line is so basic, really.
I suppose I'm giving the movie only four stars because I am someone who likes a satisfying ending. The movie suggested there would be some amazing explanation by the end, or did it really? I've seen so many mystery/thriller films that I've come to expect twist endings, or a real Woooooow Wow ah-huh moment. When I got over my little hollywood brainwashed disappointment, I was left feeling sad for the characters and proud of the films creators.
All my English teachers were wrong. Apparently your final draft can be your first draft as it seems that's what the writers did.

Looked promising from the trailer and the beginning.House in the woods in some middle of know where town, classic.Story strayed known again for know reason and added nothing. No context to some characters, actions of the mum and son was ridiculous in those situations, no summary at the end.Might as well of down the children's story telling of they woke up and it all was just a dream.Spoiler - if you know your cereal bowl had moved my the F would you not act on it instead of going back to normal??Do not bother

reviews.review_title: This film should come with a warning!
reviews.content: -Spoilers- I don't understand how this movie was even released, it was that bad. It was worse than a bad slasher film because at least with those you know what to expect! It actually started out pretty well, caught your interest, then kind of fizzled out mid run, then suddenly went completely off the walls with nonsensical gratuitous violence and torture and everyone ending up murdered with absolutely no resolution, no explanation or discovery of who the crazed maniac was. Just disgusting with no purpose and not one redeeming quality. It seems like the only purpose of this movie was to make the viewers as angry as possible. I've learned a big lesson with this one though, don't watch movies without reading reviews first.
C grade movie trying to reach b grade. Pathetic production/direction of a crap story with no substance. Dont waste your time with this.

I can see how people have a problem with this movie. Weird things happen with the house, the mom is accidentally killed by her son, and then the son dies from suffocation after being chased by the killer. But after all this the killer isn't revealed. Many people feel like they have to know who the killer is, but isn't the fact that the killer got away with all of this the true horror of it all? He killed 2 people, then went on to the next open house. Now that's terrifying if you ask me. I definitely recommend this movie!

reviews.review_title: So much potential but fizzles into nothing
reviews.content: Frustratingly stupid in the end, I wish have the time back
At the end, when they show the vehicle that is turning down a street that has an Open House sign, zoom in and show the plumber driving it. That would have been a 7 star rating from me.

reviews.review_title: What a tense and atmospheric ride into terror..
reviews.content: After reading some of the user posted reviews I had to post a little note. Don't buy into all the 1/10 scores. People today can't stand creative work that doesn't fit into a neat little box. If you are in to the mood for a tense and atmospheric movie, look no further. Just don't expect everything in this movie to conform to your typical suspense movie.

reviews.review_title: Competent movie except for the endíng
reviews.content: A father is killed in a tragic accident, leaving behind his wife and son. The mother/son duo have economical problems and are forced to live in a relatives' house. The house is about to be sold, and once a week they have to stay away so that the broker can show it to speculators.Weird things start to happen. A friendly but creepy neighbor lady seems overly interested in our heroes. A mysterious car show up on the driveway at night. Things disappear without explanation. Telephone rings, but no-one answers on the other end. The mother/son duo start to suspect that something is wrong, maybe some speculator has hid away in the building after the "open house"?I quite enjoyed this film until the ending. Good atmosphere, good actors, and a fairly original plot. But what a disappointment the ending was! The heroes are both murdered and there is no explanation whatsoever! Don't know if I missed some clues but judging from other reviews here that is not the case. A big waste on what could have been a good film.
Starts well and a promising set up develops in the first act. Well acted with characters that engage then it all becomes a bit juvenile and unpleasant in the last third with no pay-off at the end.

If you are the kind of simple person that needs an explanation of everything in a movie then this one is not for you.
If you have a good IQ then give it a try.

reviews.review_title: Like an average episode of a horror anthology series drug out for 90 mins.
reviews.content: There's not much to say about "The Open House" beyond the fact that, while it isn't outright terrible, it's just incredibly mediocre. The plot feels like something that would have made for an average episode of a horror anthology series, ruined by making it an hour too long.I will admit that, at first, I was intrigued by certain events. Was the threat going to be supernatural, or human? Why did the realtor's assistant act so strangely? How did the kooky neighbor fit into all of this, and what was the deal with the flirty store owner? The goings-on in the house were appropriately creepy and served to ratchet up the tension factor while my brain tried to figure out what was going on. Unfortunately, my interest soon began to wane as the film drug on and on with no sign of livening up the proceedings to give us something new to think about until the final twenty minutes when, mercifully, some things finally begin to happen. And, as it turns out, most of those plot devices mentioned earlier end up being either red herrings or a whole lot of nothing.There really isn't a whole lot of imagination going on in "The Open House", despite first appearances. The execution is quite misleading in making us think there's something far more elaborate going on than what the movie actually reveals it is. One can't help but feel duped at the end. Tricked, if you will, into thinking the film had more to offer. Oh, suspense scenes are carried out with a certain aplomb, but when it all amounts to mediocrity in the end, was the journey there really worth it?None of this is helped by the fact that the film seems to struggle with its tone--something that can probably be attributed to the fact it had more than one director. The tone of the ending, in particular, feels out-of-character and as if it belongs to another, darker film entirely, given that until then the proceedings felt so very much like an expensive episode of a TV series.I'm tempted to give the film another star it doesn't deserve simply due to the fact that Dylan Minnette is nice to look at, but I'll refrain.

reviews.review_title: Logged in my account just to give 1 Star
reviews.content: Horrible. This is the pathetic film I've ever seen in my life.
So its a murder story and everyone dies...but you get no explanation why or who is doing it..and then it just ends...save your time and watch something else...

reviews.review_title: I knew I had to write a review
reviews.content:
At first this movie confuses you because it has a budget, great acting. It looks like a huge movie. The plot seems interesting. Although I did notice an alarming amount of jump scares. After the first half of the movie when I am expecting the plot to really take off- I knew I had to write a review after about four more stupid jump scares and ( this really happened) the kid walks outside and is in his back yard and the music swells and the camera fast films towards him with the scary music and then cuts to another scene. So essentially we have a kid who walks outside and nothing happens at all but music and weird camera angles. And that's essentially the plot of the entire movie. We have a neighbor who says weird things and then we find out she is actually diagnosed with Alzheimer's ( but still living alone) .. and a pilot light who constantly turns off. Everything centers on this pilot light. And bumps on the wall. I'm not kidding. Oh and throwing pictures in the trash.
I didn't even want to wait around for the big reveal. Which I figure is going to be that guy at the store. Who somehow killed the dad and now is killing them too by building a tunnel into their basement.
It's a movie that expects you to be dumb. And hopes you won't notice the inconsistenties and irrational plot devices. Yes. It is that bad. Turn it off and go watch Bird Box which is much better.

It can be a bit gripping at times until you realise it is quite empty lacking a good story content. The ending is not good either leaving you quite annoyed. Very weak in general although it could have been a good movie if more thought had been put into it. I wouldn't have wasted my time if I only knew it.

reviews.review_title: You Will Never Get Back The Time You Waste Watching This Movie
reviews.content: Everything about this movie is awful. A woman and her teenage son move into a house and don't pay attention to every red flag imaginable that someone is hiding inside their house. When their things disappear and end up in other parts of the house, one blames the other, and the other never bothers to deny it - they just slam doors and storm into different rooms instead of trying to figure out what's going on. There are so many possible scenarios in which an intruder could mess with people, but do the people always have to be brain dead stupid and oblivious? Also, the mom kept getting in the shower and the water would suddenly get cold. She would run down into the basement wrapped in a towel to light the water heater and the water would immediately be warm when she got back upstairs. Do these writers not know how water heaters work? And even though they have to keep running down into the basement, they never bother to change a lightbulb - they always have to take a flashlight because it's pitch dark down there. Oh, and would anyone in a horror movie ever consider closing and locking their bedroom door at night, so intruders couldn't just sneak in and grab them in their sleep? This was such a stupid and irritating movie. Don't waste your precious time watching it.

I don't remember ever watching a movie that doesn't try to make a narrative. Basically what it does is introduce the characters, put them in a series of random situations (that you might think will build up to something), and then it ends. It's like half a bridge built over a flatland. I can't say this movie has any redeeming quality when character development, acting, photography or whatever was made decently in the movie serves no purpose at all. I thought movies were supposed to tell a story.
This may have to be the absolute worst movie I have ever seen. It is literally and hour and a half of nothing.

Do not waste any time on this movie, you will be disappointed. The story was good until that man started to show up. It goes nowhere, the ending isnt really an explanation. A LOT of mistakes or non sense, here are some that made me cringe.
Why is the darn basement always dark without any light, isnt that a house that has open house's visits? The realtor even makes sure to point out that everything has to be perfect. Not a single bulb can be taken elsewhere in the house?Twice the mother goes downstairs in her towel just after getting out of the shower all soaked, surprise! When she gets downstairs her hair is almost all dry! That same mother can't pay the restaurant bill but spends money on getting her pictures developed, why is that? Hello priorities. At the end, the son has ice in his hair and eyebrows, ice that will not melt inside the house. The he runs all night in the woods, snow everywhere, then sun comes up and NO TRACE at all of snow anywhere but the kid still have ice in his hair!!!What a big disappointment.

Why do writers seem to think it's ok to finish a movie without having an ending? A story should have a beginning, a middle and an end. Where is the rest of this movie?! Why are they so lazy? How do movies like this get made? It makes no sense to me. If you want to sit through an hour and a half of a movie, only for it to end without finishing, be my guest. My suggestion is don't bother.

reviews.review_title: I don't believe the ratings higher than 1!!
reviews.content: Seriously, how could you not score this the lowest score possible.The acting wasn't bad but everything else was!I try not to read reviews on here before I watch a movie so it doesn't sway my opinion. I definitely will from now on!What a waste of time that was.

Quite possibly the worst film i have ever seen in my life. If you value your time and wellbeing, please shy away from watching this disaster. Extremely, utterly, outstandingly, unbearably disgustingly terrible.

This movie is absolutely stupid. Why did Dylan McDermott take this movie. I don't understand that. He has come in good shows and movies before. They didn't show that why is the killer going around killing them. He broke the lady's fingers. He was brutal. It seemed like it was the plumber but they didn't show it in the end. This is not an ending you leave your audience with. It had all the horror movie cliches. Very bad writing. I have given spoilers but I would recommend that you can miss this movie.

This had all the DNA to be a great Thriller/Horror... but... (there is a BUT).... they massively messed up at the end, by the time the credits come up I was shouting at the screen with anger.The first half is actually very good and had a solid story but felt it was rushed the end just to line it up for another movie.

This was so poorly writen and structured, it's sad. Honestly the beginning of the movie gives it a bit of hope, but then it's all down hill after nothing begins to become resolved. The story makes no sense and there is no reason for any of the horrors. I would say spoiler alert, but there's nothing to spoil. Everyone dies and there is no reason. Nothing is revealed and nothing is accomplished. The acting and cinematography were actually good, unfortunately, the writing cancels EVERYTHING else out.

reviews.review_title: good acting; bit of a slow build to disappointment
reviews.content: The actors in this film were fine. To that end they should have just made the movie solely about a mother and son struggling with the loss of a loved one instead of throwing that situation into another situation and keeping you guessing if something supernatural was afoot or if something in the psychological vein was brewing, but the end result was ultimately disappointing and added a bunch of new unanswered questions to the mix.

Slow, cheap tricks, fairly graphic violence to wake you up for the ending that...never came. Here is the entire movie idea: let's try to trick people in a way that they will never see coming. We will flesh out these characters in excruciating detail, misdirect them with boring backstory that seems like it is going somewhere, and then we will kill them all. The end. The point is that anyone could come in during an open house and stay behind. And do whatever they want. Like kill people for no reason. 
They got one thing right...there is no reason. No reason for this movie, no reason for anyone else to waste their time watching it, no reason for Netflix to buy such garbage.
Starts good ok middle one of the WORST endings EVER. Just bad writing.

The film isn't that bad, at least not as bad as many reviewers are saying. The acting is good, and there is a bit of a mystery to what is going on through the film. The could have ended the movie in a lot of interesting and different ways but the end they chose spoiled it for me. It all escalated so quickly and it just felt like I was watching a different movie. But I have seen some awful films and this is no way a 1 or 2 as many people have reviewed it. It is worth a watch.
They had no money to hire a writer or what? This movie is a joke.
Do not waste one second on this ... there is not plot nor do you ever find out exactly who is the creepy guy ... ugh ... I want that time back!
It seemed to start okay but soon just became weird. Then ended.... well at least titels appeared so I guess that was the end. I can't give you a story line, there isn't one.
This movie made me jump multiple times. Don't pay attention to the bad reviews this is a great scary movie.

This movie pulled me in throughout, only to leave me extremely disappointed and aggravated at the very end. There was no ending. It was abrupt and explained nothing. There's pushing the envelope, but this director crossed the line. I have a feeling many viewers will be upset like Inwas.
What was the deal with the tunnel? They should not have made it a thing if they were not going to address it properly.

This movie was awful, both the direction and the writing were complete flops. It felt a lot like they were trying to be clever or have a sense of fun and play with tropes, but they way they did it was not fun it was staid and boring and was most decidedly not clever since I think that is a large part of what led to the downfall of this movie. They entire opening of the movie which was pretty engaging was completely without purpose, and it contrived to lead to a setting that was also great, but in the end served no purpose either. Hinging the story on the idea that open houses are scary (they're not BTW) would have been better served if they had just stayed at their suburban home which they would have had to sell to cover the debts, instead of having to move out because of the rent into some holiday cabin of the super rich sister (who for some reason can't help her in any other way, and who we never see or hear from again) which is a super evocative location, but a set up for a completely different movie. This movie never decided what it wanted to be, and it was no closer to figuring it out by the end than it was in the beginning.

So usually I check IMDb ratings before I decide to watch a movie, but seeing that it was a Netflix film I expected it to be bearable at the worst. However this movie is reconsidering my expectations. This movie is the single worst movie I've seen in years. Whether it be the horrible acting, the ridiculously dumb plot, or the ending that made absolutely 0 sense, this movie is a disaster from start to finish. To be honest I'm glad I watched this so I could bash it on this review, I beg anyone reading this not to watch this movie, please for the sake of your time do NOT WATCH THIS.
If I could give minus stars I would, the film is totally pointless and a waste of a couple of hours. Folks do not waste your time, it goes nowhere and ends the same.....
.....I'll let you know if they ever write an ending! The movie just ends! No explanation for the things that have happened and nothing in the movie even hints at theory. What a waste.....

As other reviewers have said, the first 85% of the movie is interesting and I was eager to see how things played out. The ending we get is extremely anticlimactic and disappointing. It also rips off several concepts from The Strangers, a much better horror film. Don't waste your time with this one.
Waste of time. No explanation or plot. There is no resolution or reveal. It goes nowhere and stays there. One of the worst movies I've ever seen.

This is why you check average ratings before watching a movie. Only reason we watched was because we liked Dylan Minnette in the series '13 Reasons Why'. He basically plays the same person in this. The films biggest problem is the writing though. There is no plot. Skip this trash.

Spoiler Alert:. It sucks!!This is absolutely one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Not only is the plot useless but it's almost like they were different writers along the way.some movies you can say I'll watch it and form your own opinion but this simply is the worst movie that I have ever seen and I'm surprised at Netflix..

reviews.review_title: 1/10 is even a high score for this "movie"
reviews.content: There is no plot, a non sense story with bad characters, this is the worst movie I´ve ever seen, just dont watch it.

I watched since Netflix produced it, which I thought was a mark of quality. That's the last time I'll make that mistake. I gave it 3 stars because the acting was okay, but the so-called plot isn't worth mentioning other than the absence of one.
I like dylan too much so thought it will be good movie to watch. But there's nothing good about it. Ending is bizarre. What a waste of time.
What the actual eff? Don't waste you time like I did.

Complete waste of time, really only useful for background noise. Thought this might be a fun movie with a bunch of jumpscares and cliches. Instead, it becomes more of a comedy after the first couple of minutes and only goes downhill from there. During the few scenes where you're laughing out loud because of the characters' stupidity you'll be in for lazy writing and poorly executed scares.Also Dylan Minnette is in it, so if you've seen '13 Reasons Why', what little this movie has got to offer will be ruined for you right from the get go.
Hopeless, no sense whatsoever. No possible reason for anything happening. "Mysterious" stuff happening, nothing to find out. Senseless meandering. Why did I watch this piece of junk???

reviews.review_title: Decent intriguing beginning and then all down hill from there
reviews.content: I'm not going to give this film a 1 like most people have because I have seen worse movies. Believe me this movie sucked and left me questioning why I spend time watching anything. But it started well enough to earn some points. The plot itself is rather weak, it is a overused premise and nothing new is really brought to the table. For a moment I thought it was heading down an interesting path and it certainly could have been a lot better if they had taken the time to sit down and actually think about what they were writing. But instead we get this. The movie goes from being semi interesting to suddenly making little sense. The characters witness things moving around their house and yet go on with their daily lives like nothing is happening. If that doesn't upset you, by the time the movie is supposed to hit its peak point you already have lost interest and the killing scenes further upset you because you never see the killers face and he some how knows how to magically move around without being seen. The climax or lack there of is literally just a huge disappointment and by the very end you are left wondering what, who, and why the whole thing happened in the first place. News flash leaving your viewers questioning things at this extent is not a strategic and philosophical achievement. It's pure laziness and movies like this should not be allowed to be made EVER. Save yourself a lot of time and do not watch this trash.

reviews.review_title: Decent beginning that plummeted to the depths of abysmal.
reviews.content: This may be a a long-winded one, with lots of spoilers, but I'll give it a go.I'll start off by explaining my 3-star rating; which according to numerous prior reviews, is high. I give one star for each of the main characters, and one for the setting. But it ends there.First off, although I'm a fan of horror, I'm not a huge fan of psychological thrillers, especially ones with rampant stalkers/murderers; I prefer a paranormal element, or at least something clever or unique. Having said that, the movie looked compelling and I gave it a shot. I watched the entire film, even though the last couple of minutes hinted at a disastrous ending. I wasn't disappointed.Let's start with the positives. Both main characters were decent actors; and the setting, this monstrous palazzo, was beautiful. I'm a sucker for secluded houses or cabins in films. The husband is killed at the beginning in a somewhat baffling and curious manner, that really had no connection or tie-back to the story. And what was the deal with the camera reminding us he forgot to get milk? I filed this away, thinking it would come back and be significant, but it never really did, other than the hesitation when mom also bought milk later in the story. Were we supposed to think that had the husband remembered the milk, that extra 5-10 seconds delay would have prevented him from being run down in the parking lot? We will never know.Thankfully, the movie quickly moved past dad's death, and we were on our way to the mansion. But again, we know mom is having huge financial problems, and with the husband dead, it's gotten worse. Could not her sister, the one who owns a second (vacation) home the size of a small castle, throw her a couple of grand?They arrive at this gorgeous home, by my estimation, several million dollars worth of real estate. And it isn't an 'old' house, it's a new modern build, so mom saying the noise in the basement is just the 'old pipes' doesn't register. Sure it may have been built atop an older structure, but it's not likely. And what's with the rotary phones? It's not like the decor was from the '70's. The basement was also is curious. The stone walls, which was very obviously faux brick/stone, actually looked quite cool, and I thought 'nice choice' for whoever added that touch to this wonderful. It wasn't real though, as I think the director had intended. And why did we get a glimpse of a basement passageway that led to a dead end, stoned piled up to the ceiling? They never followed up on this, or even revisited this creepy basement hallway. Another red herring? Was it a hidden tunnel that led underground to their crazy banana bread making neighbor? Your guess is as good as mine.And I'm sorry, but a 6000 square foot mansion does not have one 60-gallon water heater. Not even close.The whole 'Open House' concept was never fleshed out. If you name your movie after something as specific as this, there should at least be some connection, explanation, or clever plot twist. There wasn't. There was just a couple of random open houses with non-nonsensical characters running the show.Even though I liked the character they met in the clothing shop, his actions are completely ridiculous. First of all, anyone who pulls up to that house saying they're interested in purchasing it, better be at least driving a BMW 7 series, and have a $25,000 Rolex on their wrist. No looky-loos. This guy did not strike me as a person who had a few million burning a whole in his pocket. Also, later on, the fact that he volunteered to spent the night with complete strangers, was even more ridiculous. But I imagine his re-arrival at the house acted as another potential red-herring, keeping the audience guessing if in fact he might be the killer.Past reviews mentioned the continuity issues of their arrival at the home (day/night/day) so I won't add to that. However the ending went abruptly from night to daylight, and the boy was still running with his flashlight on, miraculously, not yet succumbed to hypothermia.Having Police tell you there's nothing more they can do when your home has quite obviously been broken into, is baloney. This was clearly a break and enter, they would have fingerprinted, photographed, etc. Also, one officer cannot check a 6000 sq. foot home for intruders. Even with both of them searching, clearing that house properly would taken hours. One person clearing (the other Officer was apparently keeping the mother and son company), doesn't work. Anyone hiding could just move room to room, and avoid detection.I enjoyed the first 2/3 of the movie, I would have given it 6 stars. But it quickly deteriorated into a free-fall. We never know who the killer is - is he the plumber (looked a lot like him); the crazy neighbor or her (dead/not dead) husband? Was the plumber the husband? Was it someone who sneaked inside during the Open House and never left?There is no tie-in, no attempt to dispel any red herrings, no sense to the ending. Brutal violence, a killing spree, crazy neighbor lady wandering through the woods in the middle of the night, the killer pouring water on the unconscious boy (inducing hypothermia?), removing the kid's contacts.All absurd.The director/writers can't claim they intentionally left an ambiguous ending because they wanted the viewer to draw their own conclusions. Conclusions based on what? Random red herrings that never panned out? Nothing made sense, there was no attempt at unifying 90 minutes of confusing plot, wrapping it up so that we'd walk away thinking, "oh, I get it now.".Never happened.I agree with the 1-star reviewers on the ending. cheap cop-out. This was a non-conclusion. It's as if they had filmed an ending, than said, you know what, we're fifteen minutes over, just cut it here.Just cut it here.Full of promise that abruptly fizzled.

Good acting. Really, REALLY BAD script. No end.
And I want writers to know that; writing a senseless and pointless end, is not creating an artsy open-ended movie.
I thougbt this would prove to be promising. BOY WAS I WRONG! The whole 1 hr. And 34 minutes that went by and i still was left with no answers.Netflix got it wrong with this one
Never ever felt like I've had my time wasted this much. Wow just worst movie ever award goes to 👆👎

reviews.review_title: The description at Netflix is misleading and wrong.
reviews.content: This movie can be summed up in three statements... Psychopath, Bad Ending and Makes No Sense.There is nothing eerie. There are no "unexplained forces." The ending is not only bad, it makes no sense. There is no way for what happened to have happened. Oh and the killer, whoever he is, must have the strength of Michael Meyers for some reason, because nobody seems to be strong enough to fight him.
The only good thing about this move is the acting , I wish I could get the 2 hours of my life back .Absolutely horrible! What is the actual point of the movie ?

Let's put it into perspective.Once upon a time, something happened to some people. What happened? I don't know. Why did it happen? No idea. Who was involved? Beats me.
The end. Wow!I am actually amused by this because I must be missing something. Why would this film get created?

reviews.review_title: So Bad That I Created This Account to Post a Review
reviews.content: First of all, the whole "good enough for the Olympics" thing was pointless and took up too much of the show.Second of all, the nude scenes by the mother were unnecessary and added nothing to the show. Having the mother nude and the son sticking his head into the bathroom and casually having a conversation with her was plain weird.Third of all, the story itself sucked.SPOILERSYou never find out who the killer is because he picked out the kid's contacts before he showed his face.Then the story immediately ends once the kid was murdered for no reason.Lastly the stereotypically senseless behaviour of the protagonists was highly prevalent in the second half of the show.Nice scenery though.
This movie is packed with suspense and is an excellent thriller. Lots of one star reviews do not do this movie justice. For a free Netflix movie, it is worth watching!

I don't recommend it not even if it's after apocalypse and it's the only movie left on the whole planet! Because:
Logan is cold. Logan is freezing. Logan's head gets hurt. But Logan a professional runner can't run. Logan crawls. Logan runs upstairs and downstairs and outside and up hills and down hills and still Logan eyebrows are frosted no sign of getting warm. Logan shaking and shaking and shaking. Logan can't call 911 although everyone knows you don't need SIM card to do call.
Spoilers!!! (Not sure if matters) One person is dead Woman is tied up and still a frozen shaky weak Logan doesn't run for his life and to get help. He is a professional runner!
I should ask compensation for the time I spent watching this pointless film. It's an example eny actor or director should avoid .

This was not The best scary movie but it was definetely different. There were not answers for many things in the movie, maybe they were just for the audiences' imaginations. So this movie should be thought as different movie for sure. It can be thought as an innovation from one aspect and a director should be very brave for such an end.
I am sure that everybody watched it till the end of the movie since it was making people wonder. It means it should not be so bad, like many audiences rated it as "1".
So for me, it was a movie with a full of mysterious even in the end and it was different and fine for me.
I didn't like movie because this movie was the first killer movie who didn't tell who was the killer and whether there was a ghost or not

This is literally wirst movie I've ever seen and I've seen a lot.
Do not spend a minute of your life for this cuz I guaratee you will regret 100%.
Terrible how bad this was.

What the f... did I just watch???!!!
This movie pretty much stops at the very moment something finally happens.
It was like watching the first act of a three-acts story and then they just stopped filming! I even wondered if this was in fact supposed to be the pilot of a TV show, that's how abrupt the ending was.
This so-called movie was an exercise in frustration. Just questions and no answers. A build-up to a non-existing plot. 
F... the people who made this movie. I hope they never get to work in the entertainment industry again (I'm not talking about the actors though, the actors were fine).
Do yourself a favor and trust the negative reviews on this one. This movie is a SCAM.

One of the worst build ups while explaining nothing in the film! Idk what Netflix, the producers/writers or the director was thinking! This was a complete waste of time! I'd rather chop my finger off again than watch this gargbage!! Save yourself the horror of watching this film!

reviews.review_title: Title sounds interesting but the movie could never be worst
reviews.content: Like seriously?? What's the plot about? Why is the main character an idiot, dumb and stupid. You get annoyed by watching it and you'd wondering how could that happen? So much could have been made better

The house is clearly the star of this film. It's huge, it's beautiful, and it has an amazing kitchen with a fantastic view. After you get a good look at it, go ahead and turn this film off. There's no real plot and no character development. The ending is vague and unfulfilling. There's no particular reason to watch this movie.

This movie is a great reminder why I should check IMDB ratings first prior to watching a movie. A total waste of time. This movie got me so pissed, and I'm really easy to please, that I wrote my first ever review.
Very boring and dull explains nothing no motive or reason for a killer to be stocking these too very annoying the only funny part is when the son stabs the mom or at least I found it funny lol.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as others say...
reviews.content: This wasn't great, but it held my attention well and is not nearly as bad as the low star reviews would have you believe. The ending isn't a neatly wrapped up ending, but if you pay attention to the movie, it's pretty obvious what was going on. I thought the ending was creepier than the normal cookie cutter Hollywood ending.Anyway, it's not that long. Watch it and decide for yourself. I'm just chuckling at the people who are literally enraged over a movie they thought was bad. Don't let them put you off.

reviews.review_title: Better than most contemporary horror movies
reviews.content: Deserves a much higher rating than the 3.2 it currently has. Solid movie, good cinematography and good acting. Kept me guessing the whole way through.
This is a poor movie. Now I am just talking because my review was too short. This is a poor movie.

reviews.review_title: Really wish I'd read here first...
reviews.content: Clicked on this randomly on Netflix, knowing absolutely nothing about it and was mildly intrigued at first. The acting is very good but the writing stinks, as this film doesn't seem to know whether it wants to be a psychological thriller, a ghost story or a slasher flick so it tries to be all three while failing miserably and ends up being a mess that simply presents a bunch of situations that are never resolved or explained. Don't waste your time with this crap, except to give it a thumbs down on Netflix.

SO SCARY!!! After reading the reviews I went in with low expectations but I was proven wrong! I thought it was shot really well and the acting was great. I liked that the ending wasn't what we expected...who likes a predictable movie?? I'd say Netflix scored getting this thriller!

reviews.review_title: THE WATER HEATER GOT MORE ATTENTION THAN THE VILLAIN - An insult to the entire low budget film genre
reviews.content: The premise of this Netflix original is promising, but it was entirely wasted. I gave this movie a 1 rating instead of not reviewing it at all because the acting of the 2 main characters ( mother and son) was pretty good. After losing the husband/father it a tragic accident, the mother and son move to her rich sister's mountain home which is for sale, to look after the place until it sells.Apparently, one of the people who visited at one of the open houses stayed and hid in the house to terrorize, torture and kill the mother and son. I guess it's up to the viewer to know why. No aspect of this is ever revealed, except that the villain is some kind of random psycho who likes open houses. Maybe???This movie could have been redeemed by inserting a story element revealing that (for example) the husband of the sister who owned the house was a secret killer who didn't want to sell the house. Although I just thought of that story element, i truly think that is more thought that the writers put into this screenplay. They could have spent less time with the water heater to include something, ANYTHING, that revealed more about the killer.There are a lot of good low budget horror movies out there, but The Open House isn't one of them.The only horror that I got from this movie was when the credits rolled and I realized the time wasted on this movie.
Hands down the worst horror/thriller I have ever seen... and I have seen A LOT. I was left feeling angry at how bad it was and that I wasted my time watching this trash.

reviews.review_title: Hard To Give Even 1 Star. Such Potential with NO ENDING
reviews.content: The ending of this movie is the worst! I would say, there really is NO ENDING.....I just knew when the car was driving down the road, we would be treated to WHY or something....NADA....just the closing credits.It's too bad, because I liked the overall story line....made for scary stuff when you leave a house you are temporarily living in so that an OPEN HOUSE can be had.................and this house was CAVERNOUS....really huge. What could be lurking behind each door.............AND THEN THEY BLEW IT......gratuitous violence at the end ...and no real ending or glimpse into WTF? STAY AWAY.........NOT WORTH YOUR TIME....trust me.
Nice and scary buildup, but then a totally stupid ending...... leaving nothing resolved, and not even doing that well. So basically.... a wasted 1 hr., 34. min.

reviews.review_title: This is it for me with Netflix. Canceling.
reviews.content: This is simply the dumbest movie ever written. Is it a film school project or something like that? Typical Netflix bs just to fill their library. Quantity over quality.

The Open House is a horror thriller centered on a son (Logan) and mother (Naomi), whom after a family tragedy, move into an open house that all kinds of potential buyers come to check out during business hours. The realtor is trying to sell it but having a difficult time acquiring a purchase.The film sets up an interesting premise, in a fancy house with a dark and eerie basement that becomes a main focus in this feature. Logan and his mother Naomi are trying to cope amidst hard times, while becoming increasingly suspicious of foul play transpiring.The tale weaves decently; however, the longer the reel rolls, the more you realize this flick has no direction, a severe lack of storytelling and fleshed out explanations. You can't expect an audience to be satisfied if you're not revealing or elaborating why what is happening is happening. Sure there are few subtle hints sprinkled but ultimately this one falls disappointingly flat at its conclusion.Wasted potential? Very much so. You have serviceable acting, a strong premise, a promising-looking film and all that is washed away with a lazy, incoherent script that goes off the rails by the climax. Netflix, you better watch what you buy and recommend.4/10.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely Absurd "Don't Go In There!" Horror-Comedy
reviews.content: If you have never watched horror films in your life or are above 60 years old, then this movie might be for you. Otherwise, it is a tedious test of patience watching these mindless pawns move around the board, with Every viewer watching thinking the entire time "Seriously, what are you doing."Skip this one in entirety. The Only good thing it does is set up a great atmosphere and a great serial killer that his utter silence is only matched by his criminal intelligence. Also an amazing scene with contact lenses but other than this it is just silly. Silly and Boring ultimately. +2 stars for that scene but sadly it only lasts for about a minute and is not worth watching just to see this 1-minute happening.

I pity, absolutely PITY, the writers of this movie. I have never seen a more plot-devoid travesty of poor writing than this movie. Pointless. Non sensical. How are writers like these given a chance in Hollywood? I thought it was hard to make it in this business? Well guess what folks! I guess they're accepting anything nowadays! Get those screenplays in!

reviews.review_title: This is a genre bending film
reviews.content: I don't understand why people gave this film 1 star. It's incredibly paced and well written. The film lives up to its horror genre because you get the shrieks and screams you expect from a scary movie. Then suddenly, unlike your typical horror movie; it jolts you into a different genre, like Psycho. This is such a fun movie. A definite hit and a refreshing movie in a genre that is often stale, unoriginal poorly executed and poorly written. This is an excellent film.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as the reviews
reviews.content: Well we sat with trepidation to watch this new netfix offering, unlike most of the reviews others have left, I found it not so bad, yes the editing left a lot to be desired and no I probably wouldn't watch it again but it wasn't the worse film I've ever watched, it reminded me of a tales of the unexpected episode, everything left unanswered.
Don't waste your time watching this movie. bad story, acting, .. etc.

The production values are good and the scenery is nice, but other than that, the writing is so horribly bad that I mainly just kept score of how many bad choices the writer made along the way, and at one point had to choose between making the same error multiple times counted as one bad writing choice or counts as one error every time he makes it.Either way, I lost count of how many missteps. I agree with the other review describing it as a "frustrating watch" because thats exactly what it is.I would have given it a star for the supporting actress, and another star for production, but the writing is so bad, it effectively erases any positive effects. Terrible use of devices that don't make any sense. I deliberatly wrote kind of badly just for this. Maybe this will give you a sense, but no. The movie itself is worse.

When I started watching this film, I assumed it was going to have a supernatural theme, but I'm not sure what it was.The film begins with Logan, a teenage boy with aspirations to enter the olympics, witnessing his father dying after being hit by a car when they go to the shop to buy eggs.Distraught Logan and his mum, Naomi move into her sister's huge country house, until it's sold. Regular weekend open house tours for prospective buyers are held, where Logan and his mum are required leave the house for several hours.Strange things start happening, noises from the creepy basement, the water heater being turned off, Logan's phone and glasses going missing. Initially Naomi thinks Logan is playing pranks on her, until she wakes to find an unknown man in bed with her, who subsequently ties her up and breaks her fingers.The outcome for Logan and mum Naomi, isn't good, but we never find out who the murderous man is, we only ever see his boots. We don't find out how he got in the house or why he wants to harm them. The ending is disappointing with no explanation about anything.There is one scene where Logan and his mum arrive home after the open house afternoon has ended and the Realtor's assistant who is running the event, looks flustered and panicked, again, we never know why this is.Then there is Martha, a strange woman in her sixties who keeps bumping into Logan and Naomi. First she says she's a widow then claims she isn't. In one scene Logan hears noises at night, goes outside and is startled by Martha who tells him to get out of her house.Naomi is told by a plumber that Martha has Dementia, but I'm sure I saw a part where Logan goes into the woods, where Martha claims she lives and the house has been knocked down. So does Martha exist, does the plumber exist? And why are all the characters in the same clothes everyday.The film was entertaining, but there was a beginning and a middle and pretty much no ending. Disappointing.

This movie had such great potential but the random guy killing for NO reason in this house was DUMB. THE SUSPENCE was great but NO EXPLANATION on who or why......and everyone acting weird locally.....soooo disappointed EVERYONE DIES for no reason at all......waste of my time watch in ng this.......COULD HAVE BEEN GREAT.....This Movie SUCKED!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: Movie is promising at first but the last 10 mins was horrible!
reviews.content: Actors acting was super good. Too bad that the ending sucks and lousy!!

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen
reviews.content:
This is the most garbage movie I've ever seen.
Nothing but crap , it's not a horror movie at all it's just bad a movie.One of the worst movies I've ever seen in my hole life.

reviews.review_title: I hate to pile on but it's pretty bad
reviews.content: Everything every one has written about this "film" in the comments is true. Totally incomprehensible movie. I rarely see a film that really doesn't try to wrap up the story. I have seen many hurried lame wrap ups but rarely the non wrap up. Simple put strange killer appears, never identified or motives linked to anything. Gratuitious violence entered for no point. Take the advice, skip it.

reviews.review_title: Will keep me up at night
reviews.content:
This movie will keep me up at night, but not for the right reasons. I guess it succeeded in being a horror movie for achieving insomnia, since I will stay awake, staring at the ceiling, wondering what's up with the crazy neighbor and her possibly dead husband, why the dad got murdered, who the killer was... I could go on like this forever.
I couldn't bring myself to give it just one star, because of the acting that was pretty good if you can see through the terrible writing and because of the potential, but the end of this movie makes me want to stick my hand in a deepfryer just to see what will happen if I do.
Yeah the movie is and of cliche, but the acting is good. i see this becoming at least a trilogy of movies.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie I have ever seen, ever!!
reviews.content:
This ending, I mean, what the hell?
Everything is ruined, it was okay until the last 10-15 minutes, but the ending will leave you with no answers to anything. There is no connection to anything and you will be left feeling completely ripped off.
Super bad
Don't bother, this is right up there with the most pointless and ridiculous movies ever.

reviews.review_title: What the hell i just seen?
reviews.content: Well, I took some time to think about how to review this movie...it makes no sense at all. If i could review just the first 50 minutes, that should be at least a 7 stars, but damn, they really know how to screw a movie. No words for the ending, if u didn't watch yet, don't do it, but if you already watched, i am sorry for you, rs.
Dont waste your time. Not even worth watching. I was expecting a lot more from a Netflix film. Too bad.

Are there negative ratings below zero can I click for this WTH movie? Father killed in an accident; mum and son went to their county house to open it for viewing to sell. After that nothing made sense.

This is my first review on IMDB... I have watched some awful films in my time but this one... I fell asleep through it the first time and thought I'd give it another chance. Well, what a complete waste of my time!!! 
This film had really good potential even though its all been done before!
There was a bit of suspense and one part really made me cringe! However there is literally 0 point in the film! I wish I had checked the IMDB rating before wasting my life on it! 
Who was the killer? Why couldnt we see him? Was it to do with the dads death? Who the bloody hell was that woman? So many unanswered questions! One of the worst endings imaginable! Honestly do not bother wasting your time! This is the only Netflix Original that has disappointed me. Netflix... what were you thinking???
What the don't ending 😡😡😡 What the don't ending

reviews.review_title: Luckily did not read the reviews before watching it
reviews.content:
Great movie
Very suspenseful, weird , scary and an interesting plot
I expected something better about the ending but nevertheless it has an explanation and it is in the movie title... open house .. anyone can get inside even killers
The performances were great.. the setting, the sound and the effects were also greatI liked it.

I wanted this to be good but I ended up very disappointed. This movie had so much potential but they then ruined it by making it another movie where you don't get any answers as to why this is happening , but to be honest the characters were so bland that you really didn't care. Dylan Minette is a rising star at the moment and its a shame that he lowered himself to this movie.

Just lazy writing, my least favorite movie in recent memory. I actually feel angry that I watched this. The movie was just a bunch of loose ends, some people get tortured and murdered at the end and you don't know why anything happened.

reviews.review_title: I was confused at the ending...
reviews.content: This movie definitely had potential to be good, but it definitely failed to be that. I was sort of hooked at the beginning, then it just dragged with little suspense and no horror. The only horror was at the last 30 minutes of the film with the guy killing the mom, Logan, and friend Chris. What let me down, however, was the movie never told us who the killer was, nor their backstory. Which made me confused about what happened at the end. If the movie had a good climax, revealed the murder and their story, had horror throughout instead of the end, and maybe better acting, this film would've been superb. I want my 90 minutes back.

reviews.review_title: Watch two capable actors try to do the impossible
reviews.content: I rated my review 2 stars for the two main actors unlucky enough to try and make this mess watchable. They both do a decent job with what's thrown at them. One even gets naked for the proceedings in scenes that feel unnecessary and border on exploitation for the sake of seeming "edgy". Putting it another way, if you cut out the swearing and nudity this could be (should be?) A Lifetime Movie of The Week. The makers of this sloppy, drawn-out, mean-spirited movie should thank their stars (both of them) for elevating this to something anyone would watch.The other star of the movie is the Jump Scare Noise Machine, used over and over, every time a character sneezes. I tried to square my feelings for this movie in my head before writing a review. Was I just mad how it ended? Did I not "get" it? In the end there is nothing to get though and without spoiling much I'll just say the last 10 minutes feature laughable makeup, horror movie cliche pile-on (the phones don't work! The tires are slashed!) and a chase scene so dumb and illogical it honestly makes me wonder if the production just ran out of time and money. If they ran out of time and money I'm glad they did. Hopefully everyone involved in this film including the viewer can move on to bigger and better things. It's hard to sink to much worse.
No real plot. Villain is never seen and has 0 backstory. Awful ending. Possibly the worst film of all time

Waste of time and energy to watch to a endless ending of a non productive plot.
Maybe the shower scenes were the catch all. Nothing remotely close to a solid plot that bounced around to the point of "what the ^*\\ am I even watching this movie"!!!!
If bad reviews draw you to a movie have at with the unknown and faceless FORCE within the basement.

reviews.review_title: Netflix is producing the worst kind of horror
reviews.content: Cheap scare tactics. A bare-bone story. If it can be at all called a story. Nice acting. That is about it. Wasted two hours of my life. What an absolutely disgustingly poor film. Stop making these kind of shows Netflix. It sucks. The ending? I can't give any spoilers because no one can. It is a movie with no coherent plot. Curse you for wasting my time.

reviews.review_title: Seemed like a bunch of missed opportunities
reviews.content: Looked like it was going somewhere then ended up going nowhere. The acting was good though.

The movie started off with some intriguing plot devices but as it rolls along this movie fails to do anything new, interesting, well executed. They use horrible done jump scares that anyone could've seen were going to happen, a nonsensical antagonist that doesn't make any sense, and an ending that is equally bad. This movie was made on a crap budget and is just another horrible movie that uses Dylan Minnette's recent success on netflix to get you to watch it. Trying to sell a movie on him alone it fails to do anything else. DO NOT judge this by its cover and avoid it at all costs.

reviews.review_title: Everyone's a Critic it's not Bad
reviews.content: I don't like that everyone dies. I mean that's kind of different. I would like to know who the killer is. I had a feeling the sister had something to do with it if not directly, indirectly. Makes me not want to have an open house. It's not a bad movie. Definitely isn't a 1 or less I mean come on people.

reviews.review_title: I'm not sure how this got through...
reviews.content: Anyone associate with this movie should never be allowed to deal with the entertainment industry ever again. There is nothing to this time waster. It is akin to a child sitting at the piano and nonsensically playing random notes. I'd be terrible ashamed if I was associated with this travesty.
Please stay away from this movie. Every second second watching this is a second to many. Crap x 1000.

If you are looking for a good thriller or scary movie, don't bother with this one! Not scary at all and very frustrating ending. The only good thing I could say is it really made me wanna now what the deal was! Because I had NO idea what was going on. Why is some guy terrorizing this family? For a while I thought it was the dad's ghost, that for some reason haunted them. But I had nothing to back that up with. And that's part of the problem, you don't get much backstory on the characters to actually build a theory, or feel for them. The second huge problem is that when the ending is near and you think you'll finally get all the answers, you get NOTHING. No explanation what so ever. The only thing I could think of was that maybe they tried to go for something like The Strangers with people killing for no reason at all. But that movie was actually scary! At least I thought so. And well made. 
Or maybe they tried to go for something like The Invitation with a cult that kills people for fun. Maybe the Open House sign at the end of this movie was to signal crazy cult people that this house had people to kill. Or like in Hostel, the guy had paid for getting to kill them. But who the hell knows! They could at least give us some clues to why the hell this was happening to them. But no.. Anyway, the actors did an ok job with what they were given, but this is a mess.
I want precious moments of my life back. There is no reason for anything happening, its just happening...
This is the dumbest movie ever! It left me with more questions at the end than I had at the beginning. Absolutely dumb, and so is the ending!

The movie hooks you in with a couple good actors and a decent early story, but then it goes nowhere. Along the way there are plenty of stupid character actions that forego any reason. I wish the ending just came earlier in the movie.
Uhg.

reviews.review_title: Don't have the words to describe this
reviews.content: Don't bother watching this. I think the reviews adequately cover just how embarrassingly bad this "movie" was.

This one just felt like it was going nowhere fast so ended up skipping forward at a quick pace after the first 15 mins just to see how it ended. Glad I did not waste much time on this one. Don't waste your time. Embarrassing effort by the producers.

Okay, where do I start? So, to begin the movie started off well and I could see it being a good film. However, had it progressed, the story went downhill and completely got lost. As far as the actors go, they're great but this was a waste of their talents.You have a family that suffers a tragic event. You have the mother and son move into a remote home in the middle of nowhere. But then you have random stuff happening because a guy stayed behind and hid in the basement during an open house to torment and eventually kill the mother and son. We don't even get to know what the killer looks like. We only know he's got the whole Jason Vorhees clothing style going on.Don't waste your time.

The movie wants to be misterious but the only misterious thing is the screenplay. No explanation, no ending, random reasons behind the actions. Better to spend that one and a half hour in a restaurant.
There are SO MANY THINGS TO SAY about this so called "MOVIE", but it DON'T EVEN DESERVE IT. Simply DON'T WATCH IT. You've been warned.

From the beginning, it seemed to have a good set up and introduction. Good direction making the viewer feel uncomfortable and uneasy. A bit repetitive. An all round easy watch although a disappointing ending.

reviews.review_title: Should change the Name to "The Out House" because this was a giant Turd
reviews.content: I really don't know what happened here. It started off well, but then it just kind of fizzled. The acting wasn't bad, but the writing was. Certainly nothing original about the plot. I was really expecting more from this movie. Overall its just 90 minutes of my life that I can never get back.It almost seems like they just ran out of money and decided to just go ahead and end it.It will leave you unsatisfied and with a bunch of questions that will likely never get answered. Netflix must have acquired this movie for a bargain basement price not caring about their subscribers. Please no more recommendations Netflix

reviews.review_title: A movie or a mish mash of cuttings on the editing floor?
reviews.content: I don't know much about movie making, but I wonder how anyone with an IQ of 30 could make something this bad. I think Netflix owes me a year's worth of fee, for making me watch this abomination of a motion picture. I say motion picture, because there was motion...and it was a picture, but this was a work so bad....so pitiful....so aimless it defies description. A reasonable premise.....dad is killed....poor mom and son go to a relatives mountain cabin...then...what? Weird things happen.....cell phones disappear....strange sounds......mom gets tied up then a stranger murdered in car, then son drinks from a river then he's dead...? This movie is the answer to this question: If your canoe ends up on the 50 yard line of the football stadium, what time is it when your dog barks after you drink wine?
Slow movie, no resolution, dumb. Don't waste your time. Not even a fun, campy movie.

reviews.review_title: The Worst Movie Ever - Not even Close
reviews.content: At least when you see a bad movie, it starts off bad so you kind of know what to expect so you are not that upset at wasting your time.This was just the worst. You invested your time thinking this was going to build to some great ending and you are left with a WTF did I just watch feeling.If the director's vision was to give the viewer the impression that they have been PUNKED.Then well done.

Reading the other reviews on here, I dont understand what all of you guys are complaining about. This movie is actually pretty good. Is it the best horror movie in the world? No, of course not. But it's decent. It really reminds me of The Strangers, with it not tying all of the loose ends up at the end.**Spoilers**Not every horror movie has to tie everything up at the end, and have an ending full of sunshine and rainbows. Everyone is complaining about there being a lot of questions left to answer. I also dont understand this. The two main characters left at the end, the mom and Logan, are both dead, obviously. And just like in The Strangers, we never find out exactly who the killer is. That makes, in my opinion, the story more real and scary. The scary truth is, people break into houses, torture and kill people for no reason what so ever all of the time. Not every serial killer in the world is caught. The very ending of the movie shows someone driving off to another open house (via the sign on the road he turns down), hinting that it's the killer and he's going to do this again, and it probably wasnt the first time he killed people by hiding out in an open house. It really doesnt take half a brain figure out what's happening and to close any "unanswered questions" you may have left.I dont know if the creators of this movie were inspired by The Strangers, but Open House is very reminiscent of it, which I found really entertaining. If you're a fan of The Strangers, this movie is definitely worth watching.

I enjoyed most of the movie. Then came the end and I was furious. Completely ruined it for me. Obvious that they plan on at least one sequel. Did they just run out of ideas? I thought the character development was good. But too many unfinished story lines and characters. For the amount of suspense, casting and set construction, one would expect professionals to have come up with a better summation. I hate it when I invest time and emotion in a story only to be left dangling and unsatisfied. The leads were convincing and earned my attention and sympathy. But again, I hated the ending and I am sure I won't bother to watch any sequel.

reviews.review_title: If you have something else to do don't waste a minute here
reviews.content:
One of the most boring and stupid plots ever. Absolutely nothing worth here.
Netflix is worse and worse. Terrible Waste of time.

reviews.review_title: This was pretty bad...unheard of for a Netflix Original
reviews.content: Being a Netflix original, I really thought this was going to be an incredible roller coaster ride of a movie.It turned out to be a tea cup children ride...those kind of rides that are so old, so boring, and so predictable.Forty Five minutes into the movie, I wanted it to be over. There were no real character development. Supporting characters were haphazardly thrown about as movie filler and the protagonists had no sense of believable dialogue. Also, I understand most directors like to have the typical naked lady shower scene but the movie was about a mother and her son and the mending of their relationship. You really didn't have to have a nude shot...twice in this movie.Furthering on the plot of a mother and son movie and the mending of their relationship; this movie did not take that direction at all. It's as if the writer (who is also the director) completely forgot about the first 33% of the movie's premise.All in all, it really felt like this was a undergraduate film that was directed by a couple of brothers who wanted to fit every cliche moment into a movie that involved their rich parents' home

reviews.review_title: It had potential, it really did. but the ending kinda ruined it
reviews.content: So the acting was good, it had potential. i felt that anxiety you should have through a horror movie also. I mean all in all, before the ending, it was really, really good. But the fact that you don't know who the killer was, doesn't make it mysterious, it just makes it annoying. i deffo think that they should of showed the killers face and given the audience some answers. Who is this man? What is his motive to kill a woman, her child and a guy living near by? First i thought it was maybe it was Chris or a guy that had been stalking The mother or had an obsession with her. Like that would have been a resonable motive (for a horror movie) for someone to attack them. But the fact that you don't get any possible answers, makes it go from an 8 to a 5. Disappointed a bit, not gonna lie.

reviews.review_title: Wish there was an option for no stars
reviews.content: What a waste of time. Blew my Saturday night movie time watching "The show with no ending". Wish I had looked at the reviews before I watched it. If you read the reviews, please listen to the people on here. Not sure what a couple characters were even worth in here....something ended up on the cutting room floor I guess...along with the ending!

reviews.review_title: I'm honestly dumbfounded that people got paid to make this movie.
reviews.content:
This is my first time reviewing a movie. I felt compelled to write this review for the common good of the Netflix community.
This movie made no sense whatsoever. No questions were answered, the plot had so many holes in it, and the script seemed ridiculous. I was not convinced with any of the dialogue; it all seemed canned and unbelievable.
The music was good at times. But what in the name of all things holy was up with those scenes with the suspenseful music, where nothing even happened? For example, at one point, suspenseful music crescendoed while Logan walked in the basement. The camera focuses on a bunch of wood, and then the scene ends. What the hell? Was that wood supposed to be a foreshadowing of something? At another time, intense music builds up and ends with the camera just focusing on the woods outside. There were multiple instances of this. It's like the directors went to film school, learned about suspenseful build-ups, but completely fell asleep while the instructor covered how to use them. There has to be, like, a reason!
I'm thoroughly astounded that Netflix picked this up. You mean to tell me that a Netflix executive watched this, liked it, and made the conscious decision to pay for this movie? I honestly can't believe that.
My honest (but maybe a bit crazy) suspicion is that this movie was made by artificial intelligence. A crude, experimental AI algorithm designed to configure a set of factors such as sets of characters, plot points, sets of dialogue and such, into a set amount of time. And the Netflix community is unwittingly the user testing group.
There's no other serious explanation. The dialogue was so forced and unrealistic. The characters weren't believable. The plot, especially, was incoherent.
AI is breaking into everything, and it has to start somewhere. If this really was AI, at least in some capacity, calling the shots as a director, I'd say it was a good first effort. But if this was an actual human production, may God have mercy on these producers' and directors' souls and careers.

So the movie isn't actually bad at all, until you get to the end and nothing is explained. and i mean NOTHING.The hours for the open house change several times, i.e. 11:00am, 10:00am, & 1:00pm. I thought maybe this would be explained somehow, but it was not.The basement seems to have many winding paths to go down, but they only ever check the main corridor for intruders??? Not the smartest people...You never see the intruders face for more than .2 seconds, so you never find out who he is or what his motives are. Not a damn clue. I thought, maybe he wants the house for free??? Or maybe he's just a crazy killer???I really expected this movie to hold it's own, but it was a serious let down. Please do not watch it, unless you like disappointment.

reviews.review_title: There is literally nothing to spoil
reviews.content:
But allow me to spoil it for you anyway.
The mom takes a shower the water turns cold
The kid goes on a run
Suspenseful music leading up to nothing
The mom showers again the water turns cold again
The kid goes on a run again
Stupid jump scare due to nothing
the kid loses his phone
Then the movie ends in the most stupid way possible, that's it.

Eye candy for males and females - Check
Lots of scares - Check
