Good Acting - Check
Doesn't have to explain everything to the audience which is awesome because that means they don't think we're a bunch of monkeys - Check
Leaves you with the feeling that you might be running into this killer someday - Check

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as people would have you think.
reviews.content: Well, you can read the reviews on here and decide not to watch, or you can see it for yourself and decide what kind of film it is. I just about turned it off five minutes in after reading the reviews. Glad I didn't. I will say, this flick does not have you typical ending tying up all the loose ends but that is what it is meant to do and why it makes the plot even more terrifying. I think what people did not like about it was how realistic the story could possibly be.
It is really the saddest hour and a half i spent watching this movie. So bad i cant even describe it

reviews.review_title: Its a VERY GOOD suspense movie
reviews.content: I think the general audience didnt understand the movie... because the movie is GOOD! It has a perfectly understable history, with a good ending. I recomend it for the fans of suspense psicological movies

The suspense is pretty good, the music was great for setting up those scenes. The acting was decent. The scenery gorgeous. Everything else? Horrible. What was the point of Martha, the neighbor? And just who is the guy living in the house? And why did he do what he did? I like having answers. This ending gave no answers whatsoever which left me feeling like even with the worthy suspense it was just a waste of my time.

I won't go into it. There really is little to tell. This is because not only do I not know why what did happen happened, I also have no idea why the film was made. It wasn't an attempt to be arty. It wasn't a "work it out for yourself" type scenario. I was so apathetic about the film that I wouldn't take the time to work it out. For your information, if you feel the need to watch it you can catch it after Sharnado 26 and Camel Spiders on Syfy channel in a year or two.
Waste of time. I jumped in a few spots but overall the whole plot was dumb and too many holes

reviews.review_title: Like the first draft of a news article...
reviews.content:
... when they just tell you what happened but there are no more details yet. That's how this movie felt.
I'm one of those that are unlucky enough to be, most of the time, in the wrong side of the common opinion. I don't do it just for spite or to be "original", not even to create controversy where there is none. It just happens that a lot of times, what most of the audience finds good and worth celebrating (e.g., Marvel/Disney) I find lacking and worthless; and what the masses find bad and disgusting, I end up liking and sometimes even defending if I find it worthy of being called art. So, after reading the comments referring to this movie as one of the worst ones ever made, I assumed that I may find a jewel in a pigsty.
But I couldn't!
The audience is right one this one: this movie sucks. Everything that's being said about it is true: lame plot, unnecessary characters, a senseless ending.
They why a 4/10?
Well, for one, the whole first half of the movie (when you're watching it and you think that this has potential) was pretty good - not amazing, but it kept on flirting with the kind of horror that is so difficult to execute but so gratifying if the movie pulls it off: depressing horror.
The second half just forgot about the combination of depression and horror and became horror that is depressive, meaning, it watered down to a level of realism that it's just worthless in a movie. And I mean realism in just ONE fact out of all the implausible situations, the fact that (SPOLIER) strong killers do tend to kill everyone without leaving a hero" alive at the end (SPOILER END).
If you REALLY need to watch this, just make sure that you are doing something else at the same time (ironing clothes, shampooing the dog, running the treadmill, etc.) so you don't feel that you've entirely wasted that hour and a half of your life. Oh, and do NOT expect any answers in the end, for there are none.

This movie sucks at all aspects. The whole time you are expecting something that will never happen. Please to all people who read this review: DON'T LOSE YOUR TIME!!!!!.Script awful...I don't know what producers had in mind.

reviews.review_title: Guess what: a script needs some thought put into it
reviews.content: This story belongs in the "Crimes" section of a newspaper cuz it's about as imaginative. So do the movie's producers.
Stupid plot. Horrific ending! It had no closure. Just a waste of life!

Wasn't terrible until about the last 20 minutes. Man, oh man, did this movie go from a solid C+ to an F in those last minutes. It's like someone just gave up on writing the storyline and decided a serial killer would do. Huh? No tie-in to the entire movie and then he just moves on to the next "open house?" Really, really silly. If I could give this movie a zero, I would. And, that zero would 100% be due to the ending. Sad, because most of the movie was watchable until the ending. Please, I beg you, trust me and the others who say DO NOT WATCH IT!
This film started off great, but by the halfway point I was losing interest. This film put me to sleep.
Not great but watchable. The ending however is ridiculous. Probably 5 or 6 stars except the end.
Okay i know this is informal but this was actually not good at all..the only thing i liked was the score.
Open House spends nearly the whole movie developing the characters only to have them tortured and violently killed. That's all I'll say.
It makes no sense. Starts off like it could be something. I struggled to stay awake just so I could at least get a "who done it" payoff at end....nope. Nothing. Nada. It's frustratingly bad.

reviews.review_title: Wow what a horrible boring non sensical movie
reviews.content: Cant believe Netflix has this garbage movie among others. I really dont even have words for how non logical this movie was. Absolutely no plot. Imagine you lose power and your phone dies... that's what this movie feels like the entire time. BORING. The ending was the best yet. It felt like while I was watching this movie the TV got unplugged. Whoever was involved in the making of this "movie" should feel ashamed.
Oh, boy. This was stupid. The plot was terrible. The ending was dumb. Contacts removed yet he doesn't kill him at that moment? Um, kay.
It's like the writers just gave up 3/4s into the film and went to the pub. What a waste.

I have to say I really liked the movie about 85% through it's runtime. It had some really got classic horror stuff without using the supernatural "There's a ghost in my house!" trope. We got a nice backstory, some eyecandy and a weird neighbour, that wasn't really doing anything to further the plot.Then, finally the villain of the movie steps out of the dark and faces our protagonists... or does he?The film leads up to this intense moment where the kid finds the friendly stranger he asked to look after them, after all the weird and creepy things happened to them while police was indifferent, with a cut throat at the wheel of his car. Almost immediately and before he has time to react he gets knocked out by the killer, who pours water over him, in an attempt to slow him down I guess. He then goes upstairs, and lays next to the mom in her bed. She first doesn't notice him until she looks at some photos that were taken of her while she was asleep, turns around expecting her son to be there and freaks out when she sees the stranger in the bed.We then wittness some torture of the tied up mother, son wakes up tries to help her hut ends up being responsible for her demise. Nonetheless he can escape to a creek where the killer catches up to him and kills him.We then see the killer drive to another open house and that's were the freaking film just ends... We do not get to know who the killer was, why he did what he did, where the connection to the family was, if he did that before and whatever happened to the senile neighbor... Nothing. We got absolutely no freaking resolution of the events whatsoever...I've rarely been as disappointed in the ending of a horror movie as I was with this... You could oiterally stop watching in the middle and you'd know about the same about what happened and why as if you watched till the end.What a waste. A joke.
Awful, empty plot with the dumbest ending I think I've ever seen. ALL of the protagonists wind up dead and then the movie ends. End of story. Stupid stupid stupid.
Netflix has stepped up their game, but this was a total fail. This was a badly acted pointless flick. How did anyone involved agree to film a movie with absolutely no plot?

What a waste of time. Wish I read reviews before watching. The end is a joke. No resolution. Pointless! What is the tunnel about? No one knows.Why jus why. I can't write anymore about this garbage and have to use characters before I submit this.He was good at running that's all I know? Who is the killer, why is everyone in this film creepy for no reason, was there people living there I don't know, this deserved 0 stars all that suspense with no answers. Keksekjdjdo shekels if nejekejd jejekejd. Kekekejd Melekeok is jerk kekekej fjfigigigijhbskskdbdjdkdjdjidkd just filled the word count finally.

Like every other reviewer on this movie, my main question is WHY to EVERYTHING. It started out strong, moved to slow, headed down the mountain on a fiery sled, and then just fizzled before it hit anything. You don't know who, what, why, how, or when for ANYTHING out of this movie. The only thing you do know is don't go down in the damned basement. I think the actors were wasted, the scenery was spoiled, the set was exquisite but totally ignored, and pretty much a story line that really could have gone somewhere ended up going backwards. It's like they were given a deadline to get the movie out and didn't get it completely finished before it had to be printed and set in stone. Too bad I couldn't give it a negative review.
Painfully slow.Ridiculous dialogue.No plot .. and more importantly no ending.Absolute pile of rubbish not even worthy of a TV release,let alone DVD or Blu Ray.

reviews.review_title: The movie has inspired to write a review after a very long time.
reviews.content: This was such a great feel good movie, it actually inspired me to write a review on this. I wanted to write a review in this movie. The movie has two characters, and they are killed by a guy who entered their house in a open house event. The entire production team were so talented, they made a movie, that ran for an hour an half to tell this. Trust me, that's all you get and absolutely nothing else. The movie has no good start and the ending was an absolute crap. Actually, the ending was the one that made the entire movie lose all the sense. Just stay away from this. A suggestion for netflix - Please sack your entire content selection committee that involved in selecting this garbage and recruit a new one. Even a group of amateur 10 year old kids would perform better than them.

Save yourself the embarrassment and at least explain what you tried to do here. I mean i watched till the end believing i would have questions answered like why them with a proper motive and who did it! Not leave us guessing everything down to the meaning of all of this. You focused mostly on a room with a water heater being turned on and off. The only understood thing to me is the name of the move. Sorry.

reviews.review_title: A film that chased genre and left the story behind in Act 1
reviews.content: Performances were solid, production offered value. Strong story to start the film, but instead of following the heart of the story and telling these characters truths, this became a forced suspense/mystery that leaves you feeling pretty down about the entire experience. Definite pass, unless you're an aspiring film maker or screenwriter as this is a good lesson on how to lose your story by choosing the wrong direction after the inciting incident.
If you wanna waste time watching and trying to understand a no sense movie, this is for you.

This movie is so profoundly badly written it was astonishing. It takes forever to actually get to any of the meat of the plot, with the first 3/4 of the movie spent faffing about. When things do finally happen it happens all at once and the characters do every possible bad choice they could possibly make.The villain is never revealed, his identity kept hidden for no reason other than to withhold the information from the audience. His face is literally never shown. When he arrives at the house all you see are his boots. When he shows up in the background skulking about all you see is his shadowy outline. This serves absolutely no narrative purpose, there is no mystery to unravel as to qualify for a mystery there has to be hints, clues, bread crumbs for the audience to puzzle over.So when the climax hits (in the last 1/4 of the movie) everything goes wrong all of a sudden and like I said, all the characters make the worst choices possible, for no other reason than that is what the writers wanted them to do so that they could get to their ending.Ah the ending. It sure... eventually stops and shows the credits?? It isn't an ending story wise, the movie just... stops.I feel very bad for the actors, most of them are rather fine actors, just written to be absolute idiots. They squeeze out the best performances possible with very little to work with. The music score is positively incompetent. The typical 'Scary thing is happening!' violins show up but... nothing is happening? Legit. It plays randomly and for no reason. Nothing creepy is happening, nothing interesting is happening, the camera is just lingering on stuff.So yeah, hard pass on this movie. There are far better bad movies to watch.
I wish I read the reviews before watching this load of crap. I almost lost it when the movie just ended, no questions answered. Do your self a favor and skip this one!

Don't waste your time on this, I ended up laughing at the end as the kid's hair and eyebrows were frozen after being outside for 5 mins... and then 12 hours later he still has the same frozen patches after being indoors and out..

I don't know who commissioned this bs of a movie, but they need a serious talking too. How do you have a movie without an ending! There's a beginning, somewhat of a middle then that's it.A weirdo creepy lying woman who claims to be a neighbour keeps popping up, a missing mobile which has the battery life of a Duracell. The shop worker (Chris) who no one sees leave the home yet asks lots off questions being super nosey every time he conveniently bumps into the only middle aged woman in the whole of the town, what could it all mean? Well the script writers don't even know themselves.Questions:The mobile phone goes missing for days yet not one of them rings it, but surprise they can ring for a maintenance man on the landline. The son has a laptop yet again doesn't click on find my phone foh.Why did Chris have to die? I mean the killer pored petrol all over the son yet he wasn't set on fire. When the said son goes to rescue his mum why didn't she smell petrol? Again why not use the laptop to call the police? How did the killer know the son wore contact lenses?Way too many questions and nothing to relate too

This dedication to when a stranger calls and the strangers is pitiful. They want you to feel for the family due to their loss and conflict but in the end all that happens is NOTHING! The killer is playing with his food and he is just a stranger who can hide in a big house even when the police look for him. Makes no sense and they absolutely could have been more creative. Spoiler: when he drives off in the end it shows he is on his way to the next home he will terrorize...leaving the family dead....then it's suddenly over! For a micro budget film with 100k budget it did well but with the actors it had it could have done so much more. It was predictable, lack of story, and was badly edited. You won't hate it until the end!
Words can't describe how bad is this movie. It's an example of how a network have thrown so much money just to get a piece of nothing.
Come on!!! The ending! Really! What tha! unbelievable! Leave people hanging! Geez! Uh!
This could have been a good movie. So disappointed with the ending.

After watching this movie I learnt a very valuable lesson. From here on in I will never watch a movie until I have checked out the reviews on IMBD. Why you ask, the answer is Open House. I sat and watched the entire movie, yes the entire movie I put myself through an ongoing nightmare and realised at the end that the whole thing was just an utter waste of my time, it had no resolution and had no point. Cant blame the actors well perhaps... if I had read the script I wouldn't have signed up for this piece of garbage. Trust the reviews what ever you do don't waste your valuable time watching this movie. I honestly believe there should be a zero rating on IMBD this film has nothing to offer, I use it as a benchmark at its true rating 0 to rate every other movie I watch, it sticks in my mind and haunts my thoughts, so unless you want to live in perpetual torment DONT WATCH OPEN HOUSE.
Why can't you give a rating of zero stars? This movie has zero thought put into it, zero acting, zero point

After a reasonably promising start, the moview begins to meander without any clear direction. The pacing is off, badly, and you find yourself taken out of the movie time and again as a shot lingers way too long, or a setup drags on and on.
The "plot", and I use the term loosely, looks like it was written by a large committee and makes no sense whatever. Not even "horror-movie" sense.
And after all the build up, there is no ending! None! The screen goes black, the credits roll, and you're left wondering, "What just happened?"
TL;DR - an incompetent movie. Netflix got screwed over.
Mediocre foreplay with no climax. Waste of time. Not only was there no ending, there was no real story.
Believe the reviews it's 90 minutes you won't get back

I don't know how the average is 3.3. I scanned through several reviews and saw an incredible amount of 1/10. This movie was complete garbage. Not a horror movie--a thriller, I suppose, although I don't feel thrilled. I do feel horrified that I wasted my time watching it.
 
Do not bother watching. Ever.

As others have stated, even a Netflix film, started out well, expected something, Got nothingIntroduce characters who have absolutely nothing to do with the movie. Let's spend 20 minutes with this person, but not relevant at all. Now let's build and build and build, or try to, and then sorry, hehe, you're screwed. I understand that not all movies need a final touch, but at least give some sort of plausible answer.What were they thinking. And again here a character, there a character everywhere a character, but none of the relevant to the plot whatsoever. My lands.Do your self a favour and go watch the sun set or rise, or nothing, you will be better off

Okay, for 3/4 quarters; but I kept wondering whom the killer could be, ya know, had to be someone already introduced. Nope, no killer identified. Just ended. No resolution, just nonsense. DOES NOT deserve the 3.5 rating.
The worst movie I have seen in 20 years. Do not waste the 90 minutes of your life on this disaster.

This is the first time I've ever watched a horror movie about a hot water heater because there was nothing else in the movie that was relevant No story no plot no resolution everybody dies......
Hate to spoil it for you guys but....
I believe Martha's "dead" husband is actually the evil hot water heater.

Not your average scary movie... mainly because it wasn't actually scary. The premise was good (although nothing revolutionary), but nothing really happened throughout the movie; just a bunch of cliché suspense scenes that fizzled into nothingness. A storyline was nowhere to be found and I spent the whole movie wondering when something was going to happen.. spoiler alert: nothing happens.
That was a total waste of my time watching this movie. I kept hoping it would get better but it only got worse. Story was disappointing but acting was good.

First of all.. this should have been a series, not a film. the first part is great, but then it spirals downhill. It almost feels like the writers ran out of time and then didn't bother putting any effort into the second half.Despite it being a fairly well made and well-acted movie, the plot simply makes it crumble apart. Don't even get me started with the ending... watching the second half, I got excited when the plot finally started picking up again - but then I discovered that there were only ten minutes left of the entire thing. what a letdown! The film asks thousand of questions that are never answered. As the plot develops, we never really gain more knowledge about anything, which is frustrating and feels almost like a waste of time... All in all very disappointing - you can (and should) do better Netflix!

Perhaps there is a misunderstanding about the genre of this movie. This is not the typical horror movie plagued of jump scares, but a story with a continuous feeling of intrigue and alert mainly because we don't known what is going on with the strange things happening in the house and with the constant feeling of paranoia due to we don't know each character deeply, i.e., we as spectators are in the same level than the protagonist.On the other hand, it seems a movie without a real ending, nevertheless, this void felling is a consequence of the previous common stories we are used to in this genre, whit a hero saving the day at the end. Here, a real ending is stated, where a serial killer commits another murder and nothing good happens, as in the real life.Personally, this movie is not only a well directed story, but also an excellent picture show in each scene, making it an outstanding thriller masterpiece of the last years.
The writer and director should get a day job ok I'll elaborate sorriest horror movie I have ever tried to view
I've watched a lot of bad movies. I go out of my way to watch bad movies. This is the worst movie I've ever seen. This might be the only movie that I truly hate. Do not watch this movie.

The movie started off good enough and actually held me pretty well until the end. WTF kind of ending is that???? No clue about batty crazy neighbor lady or even why she's in the film. If they would at least allow us to have closure and see what the hell the movie was about I might go higher in rating. As I sit now, I've wasted 90 minutes of my life I'll never get back.

🤔😩👎🏾 Whose idea was this to even end a movie like that?!? I mean. I'm not too sure how to feel about this one except Netflix need to maintain its integrity on good content. Stop trying to just make money. Anyways watch it if you want but I wouldn't recommend it. 😒

The worst movie I saw in my entire life. I don't have words to explain how bad it is.DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE.I Spent 1h an 40 minutes and I was sure that everyone will die by the end of it, however I just keep continue watching with hope that something will happen.

I am sick to death of these movies that attempt to be a cliff hanger but end up being just another story with no ending or even an explanation. I will find out who produced this film and never watch another of their movies again. I am so mad that I wasted time watching this!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: i don't understand the low ratings
reviews.content:
Not all horror movies have happy endings. The plot was good, creepy, kept me at the edge of the seat. It wasn't amazing, but i certainly wouldn't give it one star.
Give it a shot

reviews.review_title: Trash takes its latest cinematic form
reviews.content: Words almost fall short of truly describing this sub-mediocre excuse for a movie. Came in knowing next to nothing about this film and left questioning my Netflix subscription as a whole. Don't waste your time its riddled with cheesy acting, forced dialogue, stupid decisions(even for a horror movie, if it can even be called that), and almost negative resolution with a plot "twist" that makes one ponder the countless things they could have done in the 94 minutes wasted watching this.

Acting was fine. Story was doing fine. Then when you finally think you're about to get an answer as to who the crazy killer is and what their motive was, the screen goes black. I'm actually...kinda pissed. I just watched a 1.5 hour movie for no reason because I never got to see who the killer was or what their reasoning was. We didn't even really have any hints given to us, so I was prepared for a real shocker. Don't waste your time.

Utterly pointless movie. A story, even a bad one, should have a beginning, middle and an ending. This has a beginning, a partial middle but no end and certainly no clue or explanation as to why events unfolded the way that they did. What was the point?

reviews.review_title: It's was OK up until the end
reviews.content: It was an interesting story but felt very underdeveloped. It's probably has one of the most unsatisfying endings to the run of them mill "family in a mysterious house" thriller flick. There was a lot of emotional build up between characters that was ultimately meaningless and literally went no where. The backstories of the characters seemed important (why put seemingly important information in a movie if it's not ever going to be expanded on?) but then nothing else is ever acknowledged after these dramatic moments.It was like they started filming it and never got to finish it so they had to wrap it up in the most mundane cop-out of an ending ever.
Literally the worst movie I have ever seen. Not only should these worthless directors feel bad for themselves, they should never be involved in ANY movie ever again. GARBAGE

I can't believe I just wasted 90 minutes I could done better with my simply going to bed and sleeping.The storyline ia at best a jumbled hash of old and tired cliches - grieving mum and sun leave city and move to mountain house after death of father/husband (in a senseless and unexplained murder). Tings go bump in the night in their new home, blah blah blah.What makes this movie even worst that just bad is that it doesn't even give the viewer a conclusion! Is the boy dead? WHo was the murderer. The movie treats the viewer like a idiot not worthy of a satisfactory ending. That or the budget simply ran out!Tip: Give this a wide berth! Go can't up on some shuteye instead! I wish I had!

I want to start this review by saying that I rarely dislike movies hit this
One has almost no redeeming qualities other than it's pretty good first act somewhere in the third or second it went to complete and utter trash killing it's two main characters abruptly ending the movie and leaving their character arcs unfinished almost as if they ran out of money and had to wrap it up so they filmed a death scene for the main character (portrayed by tye Sheridan) and ended the movie there.
Never written a review, so feel this as to be said! Painful waste of time. A disgrace to Netflix!

Don't even try to. No plot whatsoever. Only some scares without any context. NO PLOT. NONE. ZERO. THIS BS OF A MOVIE SHOULD BE ILLEGAL. THERE'S PORN OUT THERE BETTER DONE THAN THIS ATROCITY. 
Spoilers? Spoilers to what? What plot should I spoil? There is no plot, just 2 hours of nothing at all. Pathetic, literally. Just don't, please.
I would describe movie as excrutiating. The tension builds at a slow pace. No rhyme or reason for the ending. Waste of time!
I dont know what everybodys problem is,only because it doesn't have an happy ending doesn't mean that the movie is bad. I liked it.It was very creepy.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone says
reviews.content: A lot of reviews complained about the lack of an ending for this standard creeper/someone's in the house flick but I'm wondering if those people watched the whole movie. The plot sets up a few suspects to some funny goings-on in the open house scenario then delivers us an alternative culprit along with some nice little jump scares. Not my usual kind of horror movie but all up, not a bad effort by the cast.

First of all, don't waste your time like I did as well a many others!
The movie had so much going for it, suspense, intrigue, great filming but by the end you will wish you had spent that last hour and a half clipping your toenails or watching your grass grow. Totally sunk at the end and just ends up irritatiing you off!

Literally the worst movie ever made. Who was high while writing this?
Staring at a wall For one hour and a half is more productive than watching this movie.

There is an interesting movie somewhere in here. The two lead performances wre fantastic and there are some scenes with legitimate tension. The writer however ran into a problem with this film, they had so many ideas and questions to raise but they had no answers. Some films can handle this well such as It Comes At Night but despite the director's best efforts they could not save this film. I would not say it is one of the worst films of all time like all the other reviews, but I can understand why this isn't being held as a classic.

The movie started great and the first hour was actually quite good with many great spooky scenes. But I guess both the director and writer got tired - the last part is really a pain to watch and has no meaning at all or gives just a single answer.

Very boring , you won't understand the ending
Not recommended at all
Literally the worst ending! It just stopped. Like no answers at all. No idea who the "bad guy" was. No clue if they survived. NOTHING!
Why do Hollywood think we want to watch movies with no conclusion.
Bad bad bad film...i think we must qatch another film than this

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies Ive ever seen
reviews.content: Literal junk!It started off well, setting the mood, introducing the characters and such.Then not only did the story feel like it was stalling but there was nothing new at all, like no buildup, very few """"scares"""" and scenes that felt utterly useless.And finally, the end. While the ""Story""" is pretty straightforward you feel like you wasted your life. And let me tell you what. You didnt feel it. You actually wasted your time. There were whole scenes/characters that were supposed to play a part but nothing???The ending is just so stupid it feels like the "writers" got bored of the film and decided to hand the script to their kids.Good job netflix, continuing the tradition of plain bad movies.

Dylan Minnette and Piercey Dalton are turning in some solid performances, but ultimately the plot goes nowhere and you're left with a very unsatisfying ending. It's a shame, really, because I found the mother-son dynamic quite interesting to follow.

Unfortunately I watched this whole movie. And like the other reviews here, if you are lucky enough to be reading this before you watch it - DON'T.There are several scenes where the main character (mom) has to go down to a scary dark (no lights for some unexplained reason) basement to relight the water heater pilot. She does this multiple times, and then her son takes a turn. Neither of them seem to notice that the control knob somehow turned itself to "off" each time. What's amazing, is this repeated cycle of stupidity is actually one of the most entertaining parts of the movie, making you wonder if the water heater is somehow malevolent (kidding). Hopefully this gives you some clue as to how horrible this movie is.Do yourself a favor and do something else - anything else.

Read a quick blurb to see what it's about and then jump right in. No reviews, no spoilers, nada... maybe I shouldn't trust so blindly but usually it's fun... Today? Not so much. Usually I either get a pretty good movie or a bad movie... However, I don't know what the hell this was. Originally the tag line had me thinking this is more a supernatural thriller so I was a bit disappointed it was not. But, throughout the first 3/4 of the movie I was caught up. I wanted to know who it was. Each red herring got my mind turning and anticipating who the killer would turn out to be. Sadly, the ending was like the air being let out of a balloon and it flying away... There was no ending, no resolution, no whodunnit, no why, no tough as nails survivor who makes it to the end. NOTHING. I'm literally looking at the screen saying.Normally I don't review movies and I especially don't leave bad reviews because I usually like even some of the crappiest, campiest movies out there. But this? Just... no... I definitely would like to get that last hour and a half back. Thanks

reviews.review_title: Netflix original? Not even worthy of Lifetime.
reviews.content:
Everything you need to know about this movie in seventeen words: Boring. Boring. Boring. Boring. Boring. At the very end, something bad and utterly nonsensical happens. The end.
What just happened to the last 90 minutes of my life? Don't watch it. Don't say I didn't warn you.

Pretty much what everyone else said, with a few other observations. Let's take a closer look. Started well, then slowly built the suspense with mom and son's arrival in the town and the clearly not all there neighbour and the weird real estate guy reaching out for Logan in his bed. Then we get the mystery card Chris thrown in. Is he a good guy or a bad guy? Meanwhile, the water heater keeps getting turned off, which actually made me laugh. Water heaters don't run cold when you turn them off, they just get gradually cooler. This was a really dumb oversight. You just knew with all the red herrings they were throwing out that the water heater guy would have to show up and get added to the mix. Maybe this was his revenge for all those stupid house calls? If that weren't enough, the writers even have the mom turn on the son. Keep how hard the writers worked to throw all this misdirection at you in mind for later in this movie when they apparently all died before completing the thing.In the middle of all this, the creepy is being served up in the form of mother's bare bum in the shower while the son talks to her via the open door. Later, he hears noises so he rushes in and gets a good look at his mother in the buff, not quite having got the towel on. Later still she asks him if he'd like to stay in her room, which he agrees to. But does he get on the floor or in a chair? Nope. Teenage son starts to crawl right into bed with mom (yuck!), but gets detoured outside to find...well, a surprise and an icy reception. Come to think of it, that was one of very few chills in this crap fest of a movie. Back upstairs, mystery killer gets in bed with her instead. At this point, they could have revealed Jason from Halloween and I wouldn't have flinched.Spoilers coming - be warned.When killer guy breaks mom's fingers one by one, we get to thinking this is very personal. What terrible thing has she done? Arrange to have her husband killed maybe? Sonny even notes it seems personal when he sees the earlier table set. Two misdirections totally wasted and left unused. Later, we cut to the basement, where Logan is searching for his mother and accidentally stabs her, presumably to death. Wait a sec. We suffered through all this drama just to have the son senselessly kill his mother? Well okay, but you owe us! So off we go for a run in the woods with no contacts and very little vision for poor sonny. One of them has to get away, right? Nope, chased down and killed by the faceless killer. Which seems like it could have happened earlier, instead of turning him into a human Popsicle.Final scenes, and here's where the crowd gets ugly. We get no explanation, no killer identity, no motive, no nothing. We get the family vehicle being driven by mystery killer back up to the house. That's it. Roll credits.Did the producers think this was clever or cute? No, it was just a wasted investment of time, you naughty movie people. Remember earlier when I mentioned all the effort that went into the misdirection? The writers must have used up all that creativity early on and ran out at the end. Never have I watched a movie of this kind end without any answers to all the "plot" they spun out. What were the writers and producers expecting from this? If it was a pissed off audience, congratulations. If you watch this, skip right to the end. You'll know as much as you did from the opening scene.

reviews.review_title: I wish I had come here first...
reviews.content:
I normally read reviews before I commit to a movie. I should've this time. I just scrolled through a crap ton of 1 star reviews that are absolutely justified! I remembered wanting to watch this movie months ago when I first saw the trailer, and when I came across it in my Netflix tonight, apparently I had already started it and killed it at the 12 minute mark the first time.
I should've left it unseen.
What. The. Actual. EFF. Did. I. Just. Watch.
I genuinely believed they were going to have it turn out to be the dad. Some twisted plot that the dad faked his death because he was having an affair with the blonde who told them to stay in the house... financial problems, an affair... as trite as that may sound, even THAT would've been a better way to tie up the movie. The scene where he thought to take the contacts out of the kids eyes was what had me convinced of it.
But.....
No. Ending.
Who does that??
Literally no ending.
What a horrible movie.

Ok so here's horror classic in a nutshell, suspense and edge of your seat...with , get this, imagination! If you actually watch and listen you will get it! The killer is revealed but you have to pay attention! I actually enjoyed this as did my 16 year old son who loves horror and suspense. Definitely not a story book tale of the victim always wins. Crazy movie, good job!

This is one of those movies that starts out great, but ends up tilted in the end.
It's the same story for all other 6/10 rated movies, good potential but god damn. Overall it's barely an above average movie at best.

Such a waste of time. I never do reviews, but for this piece of sh** I am willing to do it in order to save 2 hours of life of other fellow netflix subscribers. Sure it had some moments and every body was looking forward for the ending and a plot twist, but there was none. Nothing was explained and there was no ending. Sure everybody have died, I do not mind that! But why have they died?! I guess nobody would know and again nobody would give me my 2 hour back.

reviews.review_title: It doesnt know where it wants to take you...
reviews.content: Note: I rated it 2 stars because the acting dynamic from the son and mother is actually not that bad, and is pretty solid... however the plot does nothing to serve them well...this movie does not know what it is or where it wants to go. It tries to spam suspense piano notes and music it completely random places, think youre in your kitchen and about to cut your tomato DUN DUN DUN! No its not needed. It doesnt know if it wants to be a thriller, psychological mystery, horror, ghost story or invader story. Good movies will be able to SHOW the story it wants to portray smoothly. This movie basically, after the first 10-20 mins leaves you really confused as to what it is. And the ending... will really anger you. Because the movie is so confusing and the ending is literally pushed upon the audience in such a forceful way. Think of it as an adult pretending to put a spoon of food in a babies mother only to continuously remove it upsetting the baby to then suddenly show it into the baby.tl;drthe movie suddenly tell the audience what it really was in the last 10 minutes. Dont bother wasting 1hr for this watch a tv series.
Huge waste of time. They use all of the typical scare tactics; ominous music trying to make you jump. You don't even get to see who the killer is and the they all die. Wish I could get my time back

One of the worst suspense movies ever. They tried building up the characters and their backgrounds but not a single one of them were properly used in the movie. So many idiotic scenes which were not realistic. No resolution whatsoever. I do not recommend watching this. Total waste of your time.

Netflix needs to invest in a user/critic rating system instead of wasting my time and money on this movie. I don't normally have a problem with bad production quality, if a plot is reasonably good. But this has the most predictable, least interesting plot of anything I've ever seen before.

I wouldn't say this is.... I think I can safely say we've all..... The ending really..... The acting was g..... The directing...mmmm....wellll....Are we seeing a pattern here? Yes. That's how the movie ended..............

reviews.review_title: I am actually sad about this
reviews.content: This movie has SO much potential! It's got mad throwback to old school slasher/suspenseful movies and it's got some great foreshadowing, red herrings, suspense and creepy/weird characters but then it just literally has no ending. Like AT ALL. I am actually fuming. There are about 50 plot holes and all of the good lead up and "foreshadowing" are for nothing. I gave it 3 stars for the jump scare/classic horror movie moments and for Dylan's acting because I've never seen a "final girl (guy)" acting so true to how someone would be in that situation (a blubbering mess) and I thought he was outstanding in this movie. If it didn't have that then it'd be a straight 1 like everyone else. Watch it if you don't mind being tense and then extremely unstatisfied.
I think this was the worst movie i've ever seen.Literally waste of time.

Wonderful germ of an idea -- what can happen if you let strangers inside your house -- that built and built and then jerked the rug out from under you. Good acting, nice suspenseful moments, hints and false trails are all done nicely.Then the two central characters -- already traumatized by death in the family -- are tortured by an unseen character. The ending makes the whole thing just an exercise in sadism, with no satisfactory resolution. Evil triumphs and already injured people are done in with no regard for a satisfactory resolution.Very bad. Awful. Pathetic waste.

reviews.review_title: So Bad I made this IMDB account to tell everyone
reviews.content: I have never much felt the need to write reviews probably because I have never in my life watched such a pointless and rubbish film.Starts off ok, odd yet interesting characters. Lots of tension with the story line developing slowly. To be honest really slowly, 20 minutes left of the film and nothing major has happened...Then boom, ending starts to reveal itself and nothing...I mean nothing in a broad sense as a typical amount of people die for a thriller but why? and who? Unfortunately you will never know.The film ends at that point, no meaning and no purpose, a slight nod towards a serial killer but nothing else as to an explanation.

It seemed interesting to watch, but wallah I don't recommend it to anyone .. such a waste of time and probably money too to make this nonsense movie!!! Frustrated to see an ending like this !!!!! (If you call it an end) !!!
The Open House is ended with open ended ending, like suddenly the movie director called a stop.

All of the build up amounts to nothing. Here, let me save you an hour and a half of your life. A mom and her son move into her sisters mountain house after the death of her husband, they meet a few interesting and weird characters who have nothing to do with the man who snuck into their house and then murders everyone before he goes to another open house. Roll credits. Absolute waste of time and the director should be arrested for time theft.
Shocking acting and script/ you won't care about any of them! Two stars for the beginning, quite scary. Watch the first 25 mins then go watch paint dry. There is NO ending.

reviews.review_title: Is Netflix buying their movie scripts on Fiverr now?
reviews.content:
I made an account just to review this because after tonight, I never want to think about it again.The only theory I have as to why this movie is the way it is, is as follows:Neftlix: Here, Bob. Produce a movie about an open house serial killer with that 13 Reasons Why kid.
Director: Ok, sure.
*3/4 through an otherwise mediocre but tolerable movie*
Director's mom: Bob, your idiot brother wants to be in your movie.
Director: No, mom, we've talked about this.
Director's mom: He's your brother, let him write the rest of the movie. Just this once."
Director: Fiiiiiiine.Hence, the utter mess that is the last 1/4 of this movie.

Matt Angel and Suzanne Coote need to do something else for a living.
The kind of horror movie where you want the protagonists to die as they're so useless.
Wouldn't even know how to give any spoilers as nothing really happened, there is no plot or story, and there is no ending other than the obvious.A movie so shit you make the effort to warn others. Like planting trees for which you'll never sit under the shade of.

Horrible movie, no action, not horror at all. The cheapest movie ever. Do not waste your time in this.
It does not even deserve a star.

I have my fair share of bad movies ..
But this one exceeds them combined ..
I don't recommend it even in the movie night in any prison ..
It started off really well, acting was good, it had everything it needed to be a good movie. Half way through it just stopped going anywhere then ended without explaining anything. Such a shame.

reviews.review_title: I wish it was less than 1 star rating option
reviews.content: The worst movie ever. We wasted our time ,we choose that movie ,before checking the rate..... unfortunately... otherwise we definitely didn't decide to watch that

This movie started off kinda OK. After an hour you realize that yes what you thought as an obvious thing is really what's happenening. Fair enough. After the useless 3rd character dies you say "it's starting!" but no, once again nothing really happens. And what about the alzheimer woman? She just wonders aimlessly in the forest and enjoys the cries for help. In the end you just don't know who, what, why? And the truth is, I don't care. One star and if I could I would give it a minus rating. The actor of 13 reasons why is ok here, but it had to be a movie he did as a favor, because I can't see what he gains from participating in such a bad movie.

reviews.review_title: Awful Movie, Do Not Waste Your Time (Spoilers)
reviews.content: I have watched countless scary movies and the stupidity of this movie was baffling to me. The movie starts out with a story of a boy losing his father and moving to a new house with his mom. Odd and possibly paranormal things begin occurring in the new house such as objects moving, doors closing on their own etc. There is also a neighbor who seems suspicious and may be part of what is happening in the house. After at least an hour of this, completely randomly there are killers who emerge and eventually everyone ends up dead. This makes no sense because the movie did not account for various things happening such as phone moving from one floor to another, the mom and her son coming into the house and seeing the table set with candles lit etc. Why would killers break into the home, set the table, light the candles prior to the killings. Why bring in the mysterious neighbor to the story? Nothing that happened in this movie made sense including the motive for killing these individuals.
This movie had no plot and no ending. One of the most pointless movies I have ever seen.
Bad movie , bad acting , bad story, wast of time.. don't see this movie... bad movie, bad everything
I couldnt agree with all the reviews below more! Worst movie ever! I made an account just to rate this because of how horrible this movie was!
Very frustrating to realise there was no actual story: seemed to be going well but it is as if the people who made it ran out of ideas. Terrible.

reviews.review_title: Horrendous... wouldn't even give it 1 star.
reviews.content:
Never seen a film as bad!
Don't waste your time.
Absolutely shocking story line.

reviews.review_title: What utterly unsatisfying bag full of turds
reviews.content:
Spoilers, but doesnt matter. Before we watched it, i said, with this actor it cant be garbage. oh boy was I wrong. nothing in the plot was connected to anything.
why does the dad die? why does he get killed by a car. why is martha a nutbag. how is this related to anything? why does the cop look like he is a stripper? too sexy for my taste. why does chris die. why is there wood in the basement? (sounds sexual, dont mean it that way). what does logan do all day on the laptop in his bed? why does the killer let logan run for half a day to the next river to only kill him then? Why does Martha find Logan everywhere, but not in the woods when he is running away with a flashlight in his hand, breathing like an elephant? Did the killer only go in the basement to push the mom in the knife? why does the killer not like the house? the end? you are missing 90% of the plot... Just the most unstructured, unsatisfying, disconnected plot I might have ever seen.
Good acting though.

reviews.review_title: Doesn't have an ending, doesn't make any sense
reviews.content: Absolutely terrible. Didn't make any sense at all. They didn't even try to justify anything that happened in the movie and every piece of information we got during the movie that was supposed to lead us somewhere was irrelevant. Many horror films have plot holes, but this just didn't make any sense at all. If I could rate it with zero stars, I would. Complete waste of time.

reviews.review_title: If i could give it 0 stars I would
reviews.content: This movie is a waste of so many people's time and energy its unbelievable.

Being completely honest, I definitely thought the idea was cool and had potential but the way that it was portrayed was not as good as it could have been.I do love Dylan Minnette however and I will support him in whatever movie or tv show he is in.The movie overall was fun though- the ending was a little intense for me but I liked having some action before it was completely over.Overall, the idea was good and I love the main actor but the movie sort of fell flat.

Startes fine and ends bad . Can watch one time.
Acting is good.

First of all, if you really need to know every detail in a movie, dont watch this one because you wont like it as the other users. yes there was some weird scenes that you might not fully understand but on the whole it was not a 3,2 point movie. it makes you feel their terror and you feel the tension. but although the ending doesnt give you that person, it has some little clues that you may guess what happend..

Don't bother watching this. You will hate yourself for using time that could have been spent on something more productive. All the main characters, but the wacky next door neighbor who roams the woods, die. Why is she always in the woods? Why hadn't she been killed? The killer is never revealed and his motive never given. He just comes in and kills everyone after scarring them for about a week. Horrible movie, horrible ending.
Poorly directed, poorly executed, terrible plot. I mean, the only thing kinda good about this movie is the casting. Other than that, it's a total sh*t show

It had some creepy scenes and slightly scare make you jump but absolutely the worst ending of a movie ever. Saw this with 2 friends and we all just freaked when it ended. It was if they said oh well we are out of movie going to have to shut it down. There was no who did it, why did they do it, why was the neighbor out there that night nothing and everyone just died.

There's a lot of hate for this movie and I can understand why as the ending carries no explanation.
In 1971 the film Duel was released directed by Steven Spielberg. In the movie a driver is tormented, chased, and ultimately he is attacked by a driver of a huge lorry. At the end the driver of the lorry is never shown. You leave the film wondering who was this guy? Why was he trying to kill, what did he look like and those questions are never answered.In a similar way this movie leaves you with the same questions. There are some scenes that I didn't expect like the broken fingers and the ultimate fate of Logan. It's unusual neither of the main protagonists survive unless there was a 2nd movie in the works to answer those questions. But its not the first film to leave an ending open to the viewers interpretation.On the whole it wasn't as bad as some ratings
This movie had no point. There was no explanation for anything that happened. There was no climax to this movie, it was just really boring and pointless.

I wanted to turn this off soooo many times and wish I had. Such a colossal waste of time! The mom in the movie made me want to scream. How her only concern was the shower... I was hoping for something supernatural not a stupid psycho that goes to open houses to get access to house mess with family and kill them eventually. But the things I had problem with we never see his face. The things he move and take soooooo dumb.By the end I was just heated cause it was a flat out mess. No gore just broken fingers.... lame
I wish I had read the reviews before I wasted 90 minutes of my life on this. If the script writers were in front of me right now, I would beat their a#$.
1hr 34mins I will never get back. So bad, just so so bad.

If I can rate a zero star I would for this movie! Such a waste of time. I felt I wasted 90 minutes of my life! Worst movie I have watched for awhile! I hope this sent out a warning to others! I rarely leave a rating unless I love it or I super duper hate it... Obviously, this falls to the second category! Great job on wasting my time!

I gave this review a 2 because it kept my attention throughout the movie and was creepy. The music was also creepy. I thought I found a great thriller. I've seen plenty of horror films where there were not any survivors. The difference here is that all of those other films explained the reasoning behind the murders and most showed who the killer was. This did neither. No idea who he was and no idea why he did what he did. No explanation. All of the reviews I read, unfortunately, after I watched it, were absolutely accurate. A creepy first half, with no explanation. I'd skip this one.

reviews.review_title: I want the last 94 min of my life back
reviews.content: I've never written a review before, but I had to with this one. 'The Open House' is absolute garbage. Let me save you some valuable time: they all die in the end with no explanation of who or why. There, you just watched the movie. Go watch The Spongebob Squarepants Movie instead.

Hey Netflix! You left off the ending. You set up the neighbors character and did nothing with it. Is her husband alive or dead? Who is the murderer? Why is he in the house? What is in the basement? Anything? Is the plumber relevant? So again I give it a really low rating and would encourage everyone to save yourself the anger of a ridiculously unsatisfying ending. Unless, Netflix would agree to do a sequel that answers all of the above questions and then put them together and call it one good movie instead of half a movie. The only actor returning would be the neighbor and maybe the plumber and maybe Logan. That's it.

Spoiler:This movie sets up an interesting premise and then does nothing with it. It just ends. Period. You will be angry. You will want to call the writer to get a different ending. Who was this person? What was the relevance of the neighbor. Nothing happens in this movie. And then..no epilog that explains the premise. Just black screen and credits. Is this one of those movies where the "artist" is trying to set up a metaphor on man's need for blah blah blah? And then leaves the ending open for discussion and interpretation? You will be angry. Don't do it to yourself.

reviews.review_title: An hour and a half I'll never get back!
reviews.content: I wish I would've read the reviews first. What a waste of everyone's time, including all involved in making this movie. So many things don't add up, and at the end, well, let's just say there really isn't one. It sucked.
Looked good from the trailer, got worse then nothing! Waste of time. Feel like I got ripped off. Will think twice before I watch a movie suggested to me by a Netflix email.

I thought The Meg was bad. Open House makes The Meg look like a classic. This movie starts off well which is what kills me because it duped me into believing it was all going to be worth it. It was completely pointless full of questions that are never answered. A faceless killer with zero motivation for anything he does. Cliche after cliche, and an ending that left me angry and annoyed. Buy some effing light bulbs btw. Total piece of excrement.

This is the first time that I have seen a movie without an ending! And yet the premise showed a lot of potential and I was gearing up for a thrilling climax but alas! It seems like the scriptwriter must have forgotten to give the script a formal ending. The acting is good and the atmospherics quite believable but the viewer will be left with an utter hopelessness as the end credits suddenly begin to roll on the screen! The movie 'When A Stranger Calls' also never shows the face of the culprit but that movie had a satisfying end whereas The Open House literally keeps the ending wide open, and that too in a terrible way.
Don't get fooled by the bad reviews and just watch it! When I saw that one of the reviwers has noted this movie with a 1 and Scream 4 with an 8 it was crystal clear that I had to watch it!
This film obviously ran out of money and wasn't finished. There is no ending, no conclusion.

reviews.review_title: Predictable movie with a poor plot
reviews.content:
Experimental film. The start has an anticipation of a rivetting horror movie. What follows is a poor plot with predictable noises to send scare-waves among audiences.
The actors weren't bad but they weren't used right. Poor cinematography. Second half of the storyline had little/no corelation. Laughable scenes at the end especially when the boy hides behind a huge wooden log. The story fails bringing no connection to the basement of the house where the problem initially triggered.

Misleading. What a waste. Beginning and middle good, end..bad. It's like eating an apple pie and realizing it's mock apple pie (no apples at all).
 
Don't bother .

reviews.review_title: Please do NOT watch, unless studying pointless plots.
reviews.content:
Watched the trailer of this movie the other week and thought it looked like a film worth watching. How wrong could I have been?!
The storyline is absolutely pointless and leaves you wondering what the writer/s were smoking at the time. There is no explanation of why, what and how anything is happening and it leaves you feeling completely empty!
The acting was good, but I do feel sorry for the actors who gave their time and exceptionally good skills to such a poor project of a plot.
If anyone reads this, I would advise you to not bother pressing play, unless you feel extremely bored and just need something to keep you occupied whilst you do your tax return.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies i've ever witnessed
reviews.content: Just wasted a very precious night watching this movie, no ending, no nothing, hope it made 0$ in its winninga

Do not waste your time. Awful movie. It's like they put chunks of other movies together and called it new. The problem is they aren't the GOOD parts of other movies. They didn't finish a thought, so you never understood what one thing had to do with anything else, because it literally had nothing to do with the story. Completely random things that they try to make you think are important. They also added really dramatic and suspenseful music when nothing happened. Plain old curiosity is the only reason I watched that horrendous movie to the end. If I see anything else by that Director or writer, I think I will avoid it like the plague.
Extremly boring and there was no ending . the acting wasnt that bad . but theres literely nothing hapenning in it . it was just pointless.

reviews.review_title: I lost my will to live after watching this
reviews.content: If you wan't to waste your time by watching the worst movie ever made, see this one.

reviews.review_title: Truly the worst film I have ever seen.
reviews.content:
I would rate this 1 star, but I gave the extra star for making me laugh at how horrendous this movie is.The kid makes a bowl of cereals, brings it upstairs, then goes downstairs, and the bowl is now in the living room. Yeah...
Some of the ideas are cool, like an all knowing Alzheimer's patient showing up to your house at 3am; I guess that's creepy, right? But in terms of explaining any paranormal events, this movie skips right over that. It's as if a kid wrote down a bunch of scary ideas on paper, the directors added it in, and left them there, without explanation. Atrocious ending, don't waste your time with this.

Randomly watched the new horror film on Netflix, The Open House, and I have to say that it's one of the few horror movies in recent years that had me glued to the screen and biting my nails. The other two were The Invitation (I guess more of a thriller) and The Devil's Candy. I can't figure out what the universal dislike for the film is. I was surprised that I had enjoyed it and thought I'd write what I liked, loved and didn't like about the film.WHAT I LIKED ABOUT IT:The story explores a mother and son's process of grief and reconciliation.Death and grief are used to create an emotional and logical fog that blinds and confuses our protagonists as to what's going on and how to behave. I like how this is thematically reinforced by the film's focus on our main character's poor eyesight and macro shots of his eyeballs when removing and inserting his contacts - while using POV shots to show just how blind he is - when his glasses go missing and with the use of silhouettes and his revolving door of nightmares that can't be distinguished from reality. During periods of intense grief, people suffering inside this emotional and mental fog often make a series of bad decisions that can quickly spiral out of control. You can experience a sort of dream like state where life passes you by and people move in and out of your life like ghosts. Everything seems inconsequential so it's hard to distinguish between good, bad and evil. This explains one critique of the film where we are warned that the main characters aren't really paying attention to who is coming in and out of their home or to what's going on. People kind of pop in and out of existence. This is not out of character for people who are lost inside the abyss of grief. This is thematically reinforced by the neighbor who recently lost her husband and is now suffering from alzheimers. She's lost in a fog of grief and a disease that will eventually kill her.An innocent open house can turn into a nightmare. It helped cement the film in a version of reality that felt real. I liked how the film explored the danger of allowing strangers into your home without much consideration.WHAT I LOVED ABOUT IT:The killer is incredibly intelligent, methodical and committed to his murderous goals. He's quiet, imposing, cunning, confident and in control. I loved how our protagonists were outmatched. His motives remain a complete mystery, which makes sense. I'm tired of stories having to explain why an insane killer does what he does. It was his bad parents, ghosts, drugs, the Devil, the government... whatever. Sometimes people are just evil and that's that. No explanation necessary. We're just along for the very tragic and inexplicable ride.It's not gory or full of needless swearing.The film is well cast and their performances serve the story well.The film uses shadows and silhouettes to hide the villain instead of a mask or computer. We never see his face and he only says two words the entire film.Pacing throughout the film is well controlled. The tone is consistent, even if a little too heavy sometimes.It made me very uncomfortable. The camera is always framed in such a way to leave enough of the negative space to see the background and heighten your paranoia as a viewer. Gore Verbinski and his DP used this to great effect in The Ring and Matt Angel, Suzanne Coote use the same technique in The Open House with good effect.It was a simple, simple story.The ending is unconventional and open ended.WHAT I DIDN'T LIKE ABOUT IT:The killer is too smart and the story structure telegraphs - at least - one moment so well that I knew it was coming.The direction seemed a little off here or there for some of the supporting characters. For instance, I couldn't figure out why the real estate agent was acting so nervous, as though he had done or seen something bad. It feels like we're missing a scene that explains why or it was simply heavy handed misdirection. Did he see or hear something that made him so nervous? We'll never know.The color correction and palette didn't work for me. It was too blue at times and the colors felt... muddy. That could be video compression, but I don't think so.Some scenes felt rushed.I wanted the main character to have at least one or two decent victories before the end. The villain is such a badass that this never happens and leaves something to be desired.Production design was lacking, but I think that's more of a budget thing. However, it would have been nice to see the production design play more of a role in the character's development.The music telegraphed too much too early, felt a little overdone and a little cliched.There were things that were set up that were never used - like a stair that breaks at the beginning of the film. I guess that isn't necessary, but it does beg the question as to why so much focus was placed on that broken stair. Maybe I missed something.The supporting characters weren't developed enough. I wanted to know more about Chris and see him have his own moment that fleshed him out. Same thing goes with pretty much everyone outside of the mother and son. I would have been fine with ten extra minutes that let each character shine a bit so we miss them when they're gone.Despite these flaws, I really enjoyed this flick and recommend it for some casual, horror movie watching.

reviews.review_title: Better watch the trailer NOT the movie
reviews.content: There is no story at all. Its a garbage garbage garbage garbage

reviews.review_title: The scariest thing about this movie is that Netflix actually paid for it and put their name on it. I'm saving you.
reviews.content:
Terrible, and not even in an 'it's so bad it's funny' type of way. It's so terrible I want a prorated refund from Netflix for the 94 minutes they stole from me.Here are some legitimate questions/comments for the people who let this movie make it this far.-If you had a filthy rich sister, who had a giant vacation home- and your husband dies- wouldn't she pay your rent on your crappy little rental house so you don't have to uproot your entire life and kid? Instead, she has you move into her giant vacation home- that's for sale. Spoiler alert: As a real estate agent I can tell you with complete confidence that when a house is listed for sale it can be sold at any time. Like, even the day they move in, or the day after, etc. Having to move again in 30 days when you still don't have any money, and now have to find another new place to live sure makes a lot of sense.
Since you moved up to the vacation home does that mean that the teenage kid no longer has to go to ANY school? The characters aren't likable and by midway you're actually hoping they die.The killer just happens to have a large bucket of water available to pour on the kid's head in the middle of winter with snow on the ground? Why would you call a practical stranger over to spend the night on your couch? And in a giant house how is there not a bedroom for him to use?How does the kid end up in the middle of nowhere in the woods? If you were running to escape a murderer wouldn't you run down a road TO civilization, and a phone? Or geez, even to a neighbor's house?He can't make 911 calls supposedly because there isn't a SIM card. Um, you can dial 911 even when your phone isn't in service with a carrier. His mother, who was in a bedroom, somehow ends up downstairs in the basement screaming for no reason. Kid goes downstairs to find Mom and she yells his name standing literally right behind him and he turns and stabs her not realizing it was her. I think I've seen that one a time or two. And then some stinky cheese when she tells the kid to "run" since we know he's a fast runner. Didn't see that coming.-The real cheddar cheese is the last scene where you see an open house sign- and the killer drives in that direction! You mean he's going to go to another open house and do the same thing again? No way!Ok, I have to force myself to stop typing now and step away from my computer. I could just keep droning on like this movie did. The guy named Dan Angel who put his name on as the writer, director, producer should quickly deactivate all social media accounts, change his name, and recreate a new identity. This is a career ending piece.

reviews.review_title: No point and not much real horror
reviews.content: To be honest, I was really quite disappointed with this movie.The characters were unlikeable and had no real story - this made it quite hard to even care about them, or anything that was going on.The 'scary parts' mostly consisted of cheap jump-scares, rather than making the watcher feel truly disturbed, as a good horror does.I was felt quite let down at the end due the the massive number of unanswered questions - even finding myself wondering why the man in black even did what he did.The movie itself was also rather boring; I found myself talking to the person I was watching it with throughout, as I just lost interest completely.To give the movie some credit where it's due, the movie seemed to have an interesting idea behind it, unfortunately it just wasn't executed particularly well.
Worst movie I have ever seen. I am so mad at the director for wasting my time.
For God sake don't watch this utter rubbish. Save yourself the pain.
The movie started off great! I just don't understand what happen. Acting was good.

reviews.review_title: If you liked Strangers, watch this!
reviews.content: There's an awful lot of reviews slating this film, but it was good old fashioned suspense, building up to the finale.No it doesn't wrap everything up in a neat little bow, but equally, that's what's good about the horror genre, you don't always know why the bad guy is bad, who he is or why he does it.Definitely worth watching if you liked Strangers.

I generally shy away from plot-twisting, content-reorienting flicks, but after watching the trailer for The Open House, it had me intrigued. That was until the last twenty minutes of the film.First, the cinematography was brilliant. Lighting, hues, angles, and the locations were stunning; even the shots of the landscape illustrated the story's setting in way that most viewers readily forget when they are watching a movie.As for the story, the film opens with a horrible accident affecting both son and mother. The family copes by staying at a relative's house that's on the market and is currently hosting an open house (re: the movie title). As the plot moves along, the relationship between mother and son builds, leaving the viewer with a sense that the traumatic incident in their past can start to resolve itself. The acting between Dylan Minnette (Logan) and Piercey Dalton (Naomi) melded into a seamless, integrated arrangement of blended emotions. For example, the scene at the diner where the mother has trouble with the credit card and the son pulls out money to handle the bill. The movie's writers nailed the tone. Even the fraught, emotional scene where the two are angry at each other after Naomi receives Logan's phone from the repairman. All great examples of contextualizing dialog. So what went wrong?Whether it was production costs, time constraints, a last minute rewrite, or someone's attitude spoiling the whole project, I was left scratching my scalp. 
Throughout the film, the viewers get to peek at interesting tidbits that make for a build up of an interesting whodunit or a Two Thousand Maniacs!-inspired town with a dark, cult-like reputation for handling strangers. Martha shows up in several scenes to relate sometimes contradictory accounts and statements. The camera follows Chris, the flirtatious retail clerk, as he tours the house and makes a suspicious dip into the ominous basement. Even the realtor's assistant gives off an air as if his being in the house after hours is seemingly innocuous. Finally, the plumber makes what would be a simple troubleshooting fix into a repair that takes quite a while for something as simple as a pilot light being turned off. These instances would ultimately negate themselves by the end of the film, a confusing amalgamation similar to the nutraloaf that prisons dole out as punishment-food for a prisoner's bad behavior. Simply put, the last twenty minutes were as painfully confusing as watching a beaver build a dam in a bathtub. I'm honestly glad that the movie didn't require payment for admission because my foot might be in someone's ass at Netflix's headquarters.To those people responsible for The Open House's release, stop trying to placate your audience's sensibilities with cheap, derivative schlock in place of honest, thought-provoking writing.

I just watched The Open House for the first time....thought the trailer was worth a watch! At first I thought it had something to do with Martha... then I thought it may be the service guy who fixed the water heater (becoz' the silhouette of the creepo' resembled the build of the service guy)....I even thought it could be Chris.... SOOOOOOOO WHO was the creepo' in the basement? I thought he was a ghost/spirit when we first saw him go past the door.... why was he in that beautiful house? Did Allison know he was there & put her sister & nephew at risk? Why did he put the pic of the family in the garbage? Why did he break Naomi's fingers? OMG Was he jealous? Did he want her for his own? I am sooooooooooooooooo confused!!!!! Was that him at the end by the stream with Logan? Did he kill Logan? (coz' I couldn't see him breathing?) Why OH WHY did it end like that??? I wanted Logan & Naomi to be safe....I enjoyed the beginning & middle, even had a pillow in my face (our lights actually went out & freaked me out even more!).....BUT I couldn't figure this one out, too many unanswered questions! :(

Even a predictable resolution would have been better than no resolution at all, which is what happened in this flick. There is NOTHING redeeming here. For the love of all that's holy, don't waste your time!
Worst movie ive watched. Save yourself some time and dont watch it.
This film have so many holes in the plot, so many incoherence things, so stupid people doing stupid things, it makes me wonder who approve the financing to take this script and do the film.
Again a movie of Netflix where you will not get the answer on why and how to get a grip on what you watched. I'm even wasting my time by writing this review.

This was an infuriating example of children playing with a medium for which they possess little skill. Did the writer/director team have NO one around to tell them - gently, but if necessary FORCEFULLY: that their little mutual attempt at self-gratification was devoid of even the most basic logic necessary to the form? Plot holes galore make this thing resemble a round of Swiss cheese - except for the fact that cheese can at least provide a little nourishment. The abysmal direction was second only to a truly wretched script - one of the worst cases of cliches passing for development and constant ancient red herrings galore to the point that you could literally smell their stench through the screen I've ever seen. And I have seen a LOT of poor films. Ultimately, there was NO explanation for the events leading up to the "climax," NO resolution of who or what was responsible, nor any reason offered to tie things together. Who WAS the perp? By the end, who cares? Likewise, the treacly attempts to make us feel something - ANYTHING for the unlikable central protagonists were transparent, useless and totally ineffective, and the kindly neighbor, the friendly store clerk, the RE agents - NONE of them were relevant to this thing's missing thread. Ultimately: recycled moments do not a plot make and a meandering, unstructured series of stepping stone ideas, poorly executed: result in nothing more than a totally useless, maddening waste of time. I rarely review films on IMDB, but the dismal experience of watching this piece of garbage strongly compelled me to warn others lest they - unlike my wife and me: be robbed of what FELT like 80 hours of our lives during this miserable thing's 94 minutes.No. Please, NO - don't even think of trying it just to see if it's as bad as I've described. Because it's WORSE.
What a waist of time shame on Netflix for fronting this.

I'm a big fan of Dylan, as '13 Reasons Why' is amazing and the odd other movies I've seen him in have been pretty decent; so I went into watching this movie with hopeful expectations since the preview looked relatively thrilling. The acting overall was plausible and I don't blame the actors for this monstrosity. reviews.review_title: MUCH better than the IMDB average vote!
reviews.content: I'm perplexed at why the average vote is so low. I suspect the ending (no spoilers) didn't leave viewers satisfied by tying up loose ends in a neat bow like much of this genre usually does. I felt compelled to write this review to defend, as for the most part this movie really works. It isn't perfect by any means but at least worth a 7/10. I score it higher as I'm a fan of this new wave of slasher movie much like 'Hush' and much earlier 'When a stranger calls'.There is an eerie tension throughout the entire movie and some genuinely scary and brutal moments. The damaged single parent dynamics work well with the pace of story and the acting very believable. Some of the supporting characters perhaps were a weak link but not detracting from the value of the film.If anything, for me, the idea that a maniac could stalk without any rhyme or reason is truly terrifying and at such a cost to this poor family. The fact that no backstory or motivation to the killer is explained just adds to the authenticity of 'The Open House'.
Wish I'd read reviews beforehand! Waited for something to happen, nothing happened, bad plot. Ending utterly rubbish

Whatever vision this man had for the film was the absolute worst possible senerio you could possibly imgine happening. Matt Angel should never be allowed to write or direct a film ever again. The product of film school is this lousy, wasteful, and utterly pointless plotline. Don't waste your time unless you watch 75% of the film and then make up your own ending. This film is the result of a 
kid who never finished his homework. Not that he didn't have the time or resources, but that he was just plainly an idiot.
Wow these reviews are more entertaining than this movie The only reason to actually sit and watch this movie is to better enjoy the reviews there great 😂

reviews.review_title: What kinds ending is that? I'm freaked out.
