WELL, I do believe that the killer is cooperating with the people who are helping her sister sell the house...look I'M NOT GONNA SAY that it was a good movie, but WHO SAID that he was in the basement entire time ?? he was definetely not there the entire time, he was probably cooperating with the people that her sister hired for selling the house, THAT'S HOW he knew the exact time and place for his killings, AND THAT'S ALSO HOW HE GOT TO GET IN THAT EASILY... and they went around other open houses for killing spree too

What's up with crazy Martha? What was the point of handsome Chris? Just to have someone else to kill? Why is mom always running around in a towel? WHY on God's green earth not show who the killer is or even WHY he's doing what he's doing? Just leave us checking out everyone's shoes the whole movie. I love me a good thriller and this was getting there until they all died with no explanation - wtf??

I started to like. As other watchers expecting, I expected the same thing. Who is this Martha ? Who is this mystery? What are their backgrounds? why they are doing this ? So before getting all this answers, the movie was over. Really, it is over in sudden. This is not based on a true story . I can not even say that it could be better tie. Because there is no even a tie. After seeing this scenario, I started to think about being screenplay writer seriously. If this job is so easy, I want to be screen play writer.

reviews.review_title: Getting a sunburn was more thrilling and less painful than this

It was like watching "Groundhog Day", as to say that it was like they were redoing the same scene over and over again only to have a little to no explanation at the end. I get the creators are trying to tell us that someone was living in the house the whole time, but we never see the face, everyone dies and you're left thinking once again: WHAT THE HELL, NETFLIX?!

This is the worst "Horror" movie I have ever seen!!! Erie m scenes where nothing happens, the killer moves items to different rooms like that is scary, and they never show you who did it. Honestly, don't waste your time! You are bettter than this, Netflix! I don't know how anyone screening this movie would say, this looks good.

reviews.review_title: Kind of a review, kind of commentary with questions
reviews.content: So I think this movie was fairly entertaining for most of the time, but yeah, the ending was a huge letdown. Some of the questions/comments I had about the movie were:1. So was the death of the Logan's father really an accident? It sure as heck looked intentional to me, and I figured that would come up later in the movie (but it didn't).2. I got really suspicious about that guy Chris, when he was caught looking into the front door of the house, and he claimed to be interested in possibly purchasing the place. Really, on a retail cashier's wages??3. So was it Alzheimer lady who did it? We are lead to believe that the antagonist is a male, but the person never made a sound, so it conceivably could have been her. Otherwise, we really have no idea about the identity of the killer.

I had to make an account just to write a review because of how bad this movie is. The movie started off good and had an interesting concept but there were so many flaws. Things that were hinted at like zooming in on the milk at the store and when they moved were never explained. Neither were any of the characters like the weird lady who obviously had something going on that I was so curious to find out what it was. The movie started to get stressful when it was OBVIOUS that there was someone else living in the house with them. Stuff would be moved or turned off downstairs when they both knew they were upstairs. It got even more ridiculous when the son let his mom go into the basement herself right after he made the point that he heard some stuff down there. It was also insane that they didn't even mention half the stuff they noticed to each other. Near the ending at one point, when the kid was running away from the killer, he literally could have ran out of the front door that was already opened and had a car out front that was already started, but instead runs out the back door. It literally reminded me of that part in scary movie where the blond girl was in her backyard with the signs "live or die" and chose die. The worst part of all though is that absolutely terrible ending. Did they run out of money? Because all that happened is they quickly killed off the main characters and it ended. No explanations or anything. I can't believe a movie ending could leave someone so frustrated. I think Netflix should be forced to pay everyone who watched that heap of garbage to make up for the waste of 90 minutes they will never get back. Overall, please don't watch this garbage.

If there was any reference to an Open House killer earlier in the film, perhaps the film could have had some substance.I had to leave a review to spare people from wasting their night watching this film.

reviews.review_title: It's all about a different perspective.
reviews.content:
Here me out people.Spoilers.......
This movie isn't your normal slasher movie. Try and think of the shows that revolve around unsolved crime. This movie is all about the families expierences becoming murder victims. We're only seeing it the way they see it. That's the only perspective the movie is giving us. We wanted a happy ending, we wanted them to make it out alive, we wanted to know why this happened. But we didn't and that's just how it happens in real life sometimes. This mother and son are just another couple of victims of this obviously very experienced serial killer. We don't get to know why or who did this because the victims didn't know. This plot focuses on more real life emotions and outcomes than most slasher movies. And I appreciate that. I really hope they don't bother with a sequel. But Netflix is money hungry.

reviews.review_title: I should be doing homework and I wish I did instead.
reviews.content: Okay, so, there was definitely potential in this movie, but there were so many unconnected and unexplained parts.First off, the random old lady with Alzheimer's... kinda odd most of the time. What is her importance in the movie? It's never explained.We can clearly tell Logan died, but the producers DID NOT have a resolution. We don't even know who the murderer is, I wondered was it the plumber? (Based off of body build). But. We. Have. No. Idea.Why is it so important to Logan to get the time it takes to complete a mile under 5:36?There's so many leads in this movie that are cut off too soon and left unknown. It's like reading a Harry Potter book and stopping a quarter of the way in. I was so disappointed.
The "horror" was just watching this thing. I've watched some bad films but this was probably the worse.
Thumbs down!!!!! never have i ever felt so disappointed in a movie.. Tsk tsk tsk!!!

If they'd thought the ending out better it would have been a good film, but the ending ruins all the good parts because it's that bad.

This film starts off with an all too familiar premise: a recently widowed woman and her son move into a new home and are played with by an unknown force. What this film fails to bring is originality and satisfaction. There are good horror films out there that can finish with several unanswered questions and still be enjoyable because the film as a whole has satisfied the need to be frightening and has an engaging story. The Open House did not do a good enough job of creating a story to enjoy the luxury of leaving the audience with questions. It felt rushed and tired. This movie was so painfully a made-for-TV film that I felt robbed of the time I spent watching it.

There's so many other worthwhile options out there.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie I've seen
reviews.content: So, this wasn't a terrible movie and I don't regret spending 90 minutes of my life watching it. I recommend it if you're bored one night and can't decide what else to watch on Netflix.**SPOILERS**Let me start off by saying I definitely have mixed feelings about this one. It was by no means a spectacular blockbuster, but I have to give it some credit for providing suspense and great acting by Dylan Minnette and Piercey Dalton. Some people are rating this movie a 1/2 out of 10 and I personally think that's just unfair.. I have seen movies that were WAY worse than this, so rating it that low is way too harsh in my opinion. It got me to jump, kept me intrigued, and the fact that you hardly ever see the killer throughout the movie even though you know he's there made me feel incredibly uneasy. The cinematography and ambiance were great as well. For these reasons, I'm giving it a 4/10.With that being said, there are definitely flaws as well. One of those flaws being how people in the town (even the real estate agents) were acting so strange, as if they knew something bad would happen or were in on it somehow. But in the end, any questions that may arise about those characters are left unanswered. It's like nothing was tied together and useless things were added to the movie just to take up more time. I almost feel it was pointless to add those typical "small town so everyone knows everything" characters because the killer ended up just being a random psychopathic serial killer anyway. Like honestly, what even was the point of Martha...? I was also very disappointed with the ending. The buildup during the movie was so good and I was really counting on an awesome twist at the end, but unfortunately the audience is only left with a billion unanswered questions and disappointment. I just feel as if it started off with so much potential but fell short and left way too many loose ends.
Absolutely one the worst movies I have ever seen. Even Sharknado makes more sense! Yepp.

The plot is a) ridiculous, b) idiotic, c) total nonsense. You know the type of movie that is so bad that it's actually kind of fun to watch as you snicker and roll your eyes throughout because it's actually silly? This is NOT one of those movies. "The Open House" is bad on a whole new level. Watching it through to the end just leaves you pissed off at the filmmakers for producing such a moronic turdfest, and pissed off at yourself for not having the good sense to turn it off earlier. This cliche storyline has been done at least a billion times before, but not this badly. Stay the hell away from this piece of crap.
Liked it up untill the end, the problem is, there is no ending!!!

The mother spends half of the movie in the shower, the other half screaming her son's name. There were absolutely no answers and it made no effort to answer any of our any questions. A lot of buld-up, a lot of tension and zero payoff. This must be how most women feel after sex.

reviews.review_title: Do NOT waste your time on this movie

reviews.review_title: 90mins of my life I will never get back.
reviews.content: If I found a genie in a lamp and he granted me 3 wishes, they would all be to erase this films existance from the universe.As an avid fan of cinema, I quite enjoy being taken on a journey by film makers. Whether that is being lightly entertained for a couple of hours, being taken to a different world, or perhaps even simply being moved emotionally, I really don't mind. Once in a very rare while however that journey culminates in me wondering if my time would have been better spent hammering bent, rusty old nails into my face rather that subjecting myself to 94 minutes of this horrible horrible farce of a movie. If I had to put into one word the emotion that I feel upon viewing this film, it would be 'Regret'.the creators knowingly made it JUST good enough for JUST long enough to get you invested enough watch what turns out to be the worst 3rd act in cinema history and the laziest ending in living memory.  'Oh I know let's make a film that is so bad it will ruin a person's day...'I didn't even pay for this movie and I want my money back, I literally want the creators of the movie to come to my house, give me $14 and a written apology.

Like others noted it starts off promising but then... It takes a turn down fail lane.
Who's the man in the house? How did he get there? Why did he set up the dinner table? Why did he have a grudge on them? Why, why why is all this train wreck of a movie left me with. Do not waste your on this one.

Congrats Netflix!
We can see that you cannot make any movie. Keep trying on series.
On the past movies that you made, you had a terrible writers. 
This movie is a compilation of the worst of terror and without end.
If you need a good story, please contact me. We can produce to you a 7 star movie.

I was really excited for this movie cause the premise was right up my alley. I felt it was gonna be about a possible haunted house. Those are my kind of movies and they don't make enough good haunted house movies to suit me these days. The movie was a bit slow with no real shock value. Even when the strange man came in and laid in the bed with the mother. I thought it was gonna be her dead husband. She got up and and went to the bathroom and came back and got in bed with him. How the hell do you not notice a strange man in your bed? The movie ended up with this man whose face you never got to see killing both the mother and son. They both acted like they knew this person but it was never revealed to the audience who it actually was. As the credits rolled I waited to see if there was gonna be some actual true ending but there never was. I was really pissed off that I wasted my time. I expected more from Netflix cause they have lots of good movies and shows so I was truly disappointed. Dylan Minnette is an up and coming good actor and he tried his best with this script but they gave him little to work with. If you wanna see him in something much better check out 13 Reasons Why. That show is well worth your time, but this movie is not!

reviews.review_title: No ending, no plot and no conclusion
reviews.content: Cheap budget movie. Waste of time. Avoid it at all cost.

I absolutely LOVED The Open House. It is full of scares and suspense, but what makes it so fun is how masterfully they cut scary moments short with comedy and vice versa. Truly always keeping you on your toes and you never knew if you were about to get a good laugh, or a real real scare. I loved it and couldn't recommend it enough.

reviews.review_title: A shamefully underrated example of truly smart, sinister horror
reviews.content: In reality, The Open House isn't a 10/10 movie. It is a solid, well deserved 6/10. But in today's ridiculous ADD-addled instant-gratification-worshipping movie culture, I have to give it a 10 in a futile attempt to help restore the balance against a storm of insanely clueless negative responses from folks who seem to have developed their critical faculties through years of intensive study of the Pokemon canon.So right off the bat, ignore all three star (or fewer) reviews. These are all almost invariably written by people who casually toss around terms like 'cinematography' and 'pacing' to appear as if they have the slightest shred of a clue of what these concepts mean or how they function in a good, non-Pokemon-related movie. Well, guess what? Yep, they don't.The Open House, surprisingly enough as it turns out, is that all too rare example of a truly dark and unsettling Netflix horror movie that makes few or no concessions to the familiar expectations of its viewers, in an age of audiences weaned on cookie-cutter CGI superhero/monster fights popping up every five minutes and scripts that explain every point in idiotic detail so that actually paying minimal attention to movies is hardly necessary these days. In its refusal to compromise itself to please lazy viewers or to soften the edges of its darkness, it is very much a throwback to old school horror classics like 'The Changeling' and 'Let's Scare Jessica to Death'.I won't spell out the story or spoil anything here, but I will address the movie's central, cunningly crafted enigma. Yes, there ARE questions left unanswered, deliberately so. In an age when crudely obvious explanations are so often shoved down audiences' throats, it is telling that such an approach draws such rabid animosity from so many. It used to be that movies left viewers something to chew over afterwards, to talk about with friends and have some fun trying to work out or interpet among themselves. I guess those days are long past us, sadly, as the insanely hostile reception for this intelligent, well made chiller proves.The simple fact, however, is that by the end of the movie reasonably intelligent viewers should be entirely capable of working out what was happening, and why. The clues are there, admittedly a little thin on the ground, but perfectly obvious to anyone observant who can reason deductively and put 2 and 2 together without cheating. For the filmmakers to have said anymore would have been to spell things out crudely and destroy the sinister mood of the movie, as well as being insulting to the audience's intelligence. But perhaps audiences today prefer being insulted to having to think for themselves? Judging by the responses this film has provoked, it appears that they do.
Seriously that ought not be the ending, there has to be a part 2 to this. Else there is no other sane explanation for making this movie.
I'm embarrassed to admit we wasted our time on this. Turn around now.
What a complete waste of my time. Like the others have said it started out so well, with so much potential but NO it ended just like they, no explanations no nothing. Absolutely awful, lazy writing.
Don't watch. Just don't. Sleeping is better. Go to sleep.

reviews.review_title: Worst 1.34 hours of my damn time.
reviews.content: The person that wrote and directed this piece of crap need to find another job .

Why would Netflix bother to produce such poorly written films? It's not like they don't have good content and don't know how to do quality shows/movies. I started watching this and it was actually engaging during the first 20-30 minutes. But then...nothing. There's not even an attempt to fill out the glaring plot holes, to get to a decent ending, to somewhat rescue this movie. Nothing, utter waste of time. Do yourself a favor and forget this movie even exists.

I thought the idea of this movie, which was creating horror from the concept of "open houses" a good starting point. The son even mentions this once. Problem is, I kept waiting for the payoff. Was the house inhabited by ghosts? Had tragedy befallen the previous family who had lived in the house (The Grudge)? Was there a stranger living in the house (The Boy)? Were the two lead characters dead but didn't know it? (per the Others)? However, all through the movie I was looking forward to the ending to see what the verdict would be. Unfortunately the ending was so muddled with so much left unexplained I felt like I had been ripped off in a sense (and not in a Sixth Sense kinda way).Anyway this "could" have been a good movie until they ruined it by not explaining it. I would recommend a movie like "House Hunting" instead.

Let me sum this up. If you want a movie that has no character development, writing that seems to have been done by elementary kid, the stealthiest stalker ever to wear steel toe boots, main characters who are dumber than dirt, an ending more disappointing than your first time, and more questions than answer...this is the movie for you....

This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen in my life. I'm so disappointed because the premise seemed worth while during the preview but its seemed like they forgot to actually write a story for the movie and the ending was horrible.

reviews.review_title: The writers of this *** should be ashamed of themselves.
reviews.content: Just shy of two hours of lazy under developed cliche strung together in a plotless shamble.
I wish I had read the reviews before I wasted 90 minutes of my life watching the suckfest.
There was enough weirdness to make you want to get to the end. Then poof, there is no ending. Don't waste your time. You'll regret it like I do.

So this movie followed all the rules for suspense and build up! It had a beginning to drive the characters to their current scenarios and built up a bit of a past.It has the odd occurrences and mysteries that needed to be unraveled. There was tension and thrills. Then it sort of ... stopped...Yes, the plot has no plot! WHAT?! You hang on up to the end, trying to unravel the mystery and then the credits suddenly roll.It's like watching a magician show you an empty hat and nothing up their sleeve... you build up to the trick and instead of showing you a trick they just go "TADAAA!" like the build up to the trick was all you needed!Wow, just--- I imagine tons of people watched this before it was meant to be released and I imagine the conversation went something like..."Hey, mister writer... won't people think this is a bad story since you're just leaving everything in the dark for the audience?""No no no! This is pure genius! The message is that some things are just mysterious!""... uhhh... are you smoking crack?"

The trailer looked good, the acting is good and there are jump scares that are predictable but made me jump out my skin. There is some weird characters and your trying to work out who the bad guy is, what the basement has to do with the movie, who the crazy neighbours are, the noises. SPOILER...... The car incident (it looked deliberate) So many things to find out and piece togeagher and than it ENDS! Like literally the film ends and you don't know nothing . Is it personal? Who was he? Where did he come from/hide? What's the relationship between the neighbours. It actually takes the Mick. It's like a jigsaw, they did the edges and than couldn't be bothered to do the rest. Did they run out of budget? The director die or something. If you want to be annoyed and right out perplexed about how stupid an ending could be I would recommend it. Maybe there will be a part 2 with some much needed answers.
This is like "The Room" but without Tommy Wiseau. No story, no direction, no anything.

As an author I agonize over the motivation of my characters and why they do what they do. I spend many late nights planning reveals and plot twists because I feel like I owe my reader the very best. reviews.review_title: Has some good elements that are absolutely wasted
reviews.content: I'm pretty sure there's a couple of unspoken rules about horror, first being that somebody has got to survive, and another being that the killer has to have a motive. This movie messed both of them up, ending up being pointless torture/horror. Or well, rather, "I think house viewings are stupid," the essay.First off, the son getting away then being killed at the end? A pretty big middle finger. Especially since he didn't even see the killer - could've easily been left alive.As for the killer, so it's somebody that bunks in open houses, basing his entire shtick on incompetent realtors, which... weak. And to make something like this work, for example how the Night Stalker (killer) still freaks people out, you need really good writing and camerawork on how terrifying it is to have your stuff messed up with. Something this movie kinda tried but utterly failed.I honestly started thinking the elements will build up to a story - everyone suggesting it's just some townie that's upset the house is being sold; the neighbor lady having alzheimer's and going between saying her husband is dead or that he's alive - imagine if a creep took advantage of her and lived in her house only to get angry when something happened to the house next door. I would've taken that over "random faceless killer kills people randomly for random reasons. Random.". Plus the whole bait and switch ... pretty sure the only people who enjoy that are pretentious kids, and the majority of watchers want to see foreshadowing and stuff come together coherently.All in all, a waste of time. The characters did end up growing on me so I'll give it a 2 because of that. And only a 2 because once I started being invested, they got killed off senselessly. Bad writing, there.

Spoiler alert? There's nothing to spoil. This is complete nonsense. Plot holes big enough to drive a fleet of 18 wheelers through. Absolutely no explanation of anything that happens. And in the end, the main characters get killed off by...someone? We never know who or why, they just randomly die.First, someone keeps turning off the gas to the water heater. Of course, that would make the water very gradually get cold as the tank full of hot water is depleted...but no, in this movie it's instant. Then you relight the pilot and presto...instantly the 40-gallon tank is hot again. Um, nope.There's an alarm system they never use. Townspeople who randomly act weird with no explanation. And all kinds of things that happen with no real reaction from people who should be freaked out and searching the house. (Insert a dozen other sloppy plot holes here...)The kid goes to the basement, sees the water heater is turned off...he didn't do it, mom didn't do it, so... umm, he just relights it. And on and on and on...And then they die...the kid kills his mom when she quietly sneaks up on him in the basement, wtf? If she knows it's him, why not at least whisper so he knows she's there...if she thinks it's the bad guy, why...oh never mind, the whole thing is nonsense.Then someone we never see kills him for some unknown reason. The end.To end on a happier note, the actors soldier through it gamely...they're probably good with an actual script.

reviews.review_title: My friend and I have never been so entertained
reviews.content: This movie is hilarious! Every scene is like a well set up comedy show. It plays with this "supernatural or not" vibe. It's not a good movie by any means. Can't talk about the story, characters, editing, directing, but man can you have a great laugh as you watch this!

Maybe the writers thought we'd find them witty for letting us resolve but there is no resolution to come to. Left hanging.

reviews.review_title: How did it go so wrong?
reviews.content:
I'm literally writing this review so that I can expunge this movie from my headspace and never think of it again.Adequate beginning..It starts with good drama, several moments of introduction that bring you along with the widow and her child.. Ok.
We are driven into the mountains by a plot point that could not have been stranger.. The woman's sister says "Stay at our house that's for sale. But, you'll have to clear out every Sunday for the open houses." Huh? Why? Who offers their house as a temporary abode to decrease stress after a death and then says "I know your husband just died horribly leaving you with a ton of bills to pay, but you have no job, so move all of your stuff into a giant, remote, mountain house that we could take off the market.. but were not going to. Also good luck paying for diner meals with even less prospects of a job in the boonies! Bye sis!" Even on Birdworld, that's kind of a dick move.Then a series of weird people start to loom about while the tension increases.. The neighbor shows up acting crazy. Meh, it doesn't stop the boy from becoming besties with her, while she helps to train him for some sort of running down the street in angst medal at the teenage angst olympics. They award extra points for dramatically stopping in the middle of a country road without a care in the world of who's driving towards you. The realtor and her confused assistant. Spookily lurk around and watch the family sleep? Huh? Nobody writes a letter to the realty agency? A random dude from the supermarket that immediately starts showing up to check on them. Also why does every character tell them that they stopped by during the Open House? Is that a mountain country code word? Then in the middle of a randomly gratuitous shower butt scene. THE HOT WATER GOES OUT.. AGAIN! This is the driving plot point that moves the entire movie forward. They argue about the hot water heater going out. There are phones found near the hot water heater. The pilot light won't stay lit! Various repairmen show up with ominous admonitions that they'd "been there before" oooooooh scary. My feelings during this 2/3rds of the film was man, they better hope that doesn't show up during the inspection, because adding a new hot water heater to the sale of this giant remote "cabin" in the woods will cause holy hell with the resale value. But.. still doesn't begin to explain what the hell is going on. Tons of long drawn out moments. focusing on a basement door. spending 38 tries re-lighting the pilot of the water heater. (IT JUST WONT STAY LIT!) Dramatic racing pauses. The son has a problem with the mom making friends. The dad is never mentioned again.. except for when it's posited that he may not have been killed by accident. wait, what? During strobe like flashbacks of a horribly mangled Dad, blood pouring out of his mouth. "Hi confused he gurgles, I'm dad." Long moments where the house phone randomly rings and nobody cares.. Get on with it. What is happening here? Is this supernatural, is there a problem with one of the cookie characters we met? Did the dad fake his own death?The sister calls and says that the neighbor told her that their house was broken into, how the hell did the rumor train follow that idea around the mountain? So the mom stops the son during one of his epic runs! That somehow took eleven hours from noon til dark, and as a personal side note, Why is that kid allowed to run on random mountain roads with zero reflective gear? Not safe mom. They rush home to find the candles lit, the phone on a pedestal and christmas music playing?From this point on the movie and this review will go downhill faster than a homemade redbull racer. The dude from the store show up. Wha? It's ok mom, i called him! Hooray, maybe the son is ready to bury his grief. And their new friend is staying the night, Hooray! Things are looking up.Then everyone dies.. I wish it was a little bit more detailed than that. Literally some unknown dude, kills the friend, steals the kid's contacts, breaks the moms fingers, and vanishes again. Then the son stabs the mom, THE SON STABS THE MOM (oops) She tells him with her dying breath, to run, and does he run? Nope, all that training was for naught. He hides in the woods until he's killed by whoever that dude is.Cut to a random California driveway where a car that we've never seen before pulls into a random driveway.. On the fencepost, a sign that reads OPEN HOUSE. What?

It is not worth watching. It is waste of time because the plot is so simple and I felt nothing from beginning to the end. I expected a piece of originality or a new perspective but I found nothing in this cheap film.

This is the first review that I've written on IMDB, largely because I felt compelled to do so. There was a time when a Netflix Production offered some assurance of quality. In the case of "Open House", you have decent production values and a competent cast. Aside from that, this movie is a train wreck.The first half starts promisingly enough, and you want to believe that the plot is going to take some interesting turns. Instead, it gradually fizzles and then degenerates into a ridiculous and pointless fiasco during the last 15 minutes.Why Netflix would give the reins to the clowns who wrote and directed this turkey, I have no idea. I wanted to gouge my eyes out with a pointed stick when it was over.
Thank you to this horrendous film for showing me that my life is not the most pointless thing on this planet.

Okay so for thes first 1 hour of this movie nothing major happens to contribute to the story, all we know is his dad dies and thats why they move away, the death of the dad has no bearing on the rest of the film and is irrelevant, fast forward to the end where you do not find out the killer, you don't find out why he's doing it, you don't find out if the mum actually dies, you don't find out what connection the weird lady with the beanie has to do with it, all that happens is a random black guy who strangely stays in there house the night dies for an unknown reason, this film leaves to much to the imagination and has you asking 2538464 questions at the end as none of them are answered , this movie is a waste of 80 minutes of your life, with a great young actor they majorly let him down, i would not watch this again if you offered me 100$ cash, don't put yourself through this, it'll just leave you confused and annoyed by the end and you may be abusing your tv. Just saying.
This movie starts off so well, with a really good suspense but then leaves you empty! I'll give it a 2 just for the beginning and the music was good but that's it :<

I love thrillers, horrors anf films with a great twist for an ending. This was none of the above!!!! Do not watch unless you are absolutely bored stiff and even then don't!!! You don't get answers like who or why so steer clear of this absolute load of rubbish!

-3 points for the nonsense the mom had in this movie. I gave it a 7/10 for the rest of the movie written. I found it to be story that left room for interpretation - somewhat like life - you don't know what you're getting but you know there's something you're to get from it. Yes, the mom was insensitive at times to her son who had more commonsense than she and yes, the story had no ending but that's where the interpretation comes in at. It left room for a broad discussion i.e. who done it, why and who was involved. Should every story have an ending or should we just allow ourselves as screenplay viewers to be open to personal or group discussion. It's not a question, it's rhetorical. It certainly leaves room for a sequel. :)

reviews.review_title: Utterly pointless watch. So so bad. Steer clear. Regret not checking reviews before clicking play.
reviews.content: Utterly pointless watch. So so bad. Steer clear. Regret not checking reviews before clicking play.
Please DO NOT waste your time watching this horrible movie. The movie goes absolutely nowhere and it is a complete disappointment.

I had this playing while I cleaned my bedroom (a tedious activity requiring little mental or physical engagement) and I believe, post-credits, that the activity would've been more entertaining WITHOUT this movie.A cast of talented actors do their best to deal with a half-cocked, tepid script as they fumble through stilted, blunted dialogue from one muddled scene to the next. The plot is unnecessarily convoluted, especially considering how little of it actually matters...which is to say, virtually none of the character building, worldbuilding, setting, or even the actual linear events catalogued by the film ever come to fruition. Literally none of the plot matters. Instead, the film ends up being somewhat similar to "The Strangers," but only if "The Strangers" had absolutely no payoff at all and left the audience wondering why they'd bothered to spend 90 minutes of their life staring at a screen. 90 minutes that could've been spent doing absolutely anything else.If I could give this flick 0 stars, I very much would. I feel bad for the poor cast, being made to jerry-rig such a terrible script into something resembling reality. And what of the ending? Well, if you're interested in films that vaguely trail off, and if you like to see shallow metaphor delivered by lingering camera shots, then maybe you'll appreciate it. If you want something that feels like effort, or like anyone on the creative team actually cared about the project, then maybe pick something else. Anything else.Rarely do I loathe a film so much as to post a negative review, but this lukewarm retread of horror's most overdone tropes did its absolute best to make good on none of its promises, and my rage at being so misled drives me to heap as much abuse as possible on this godawful movie.My advice would be, of course, to watch *literally anything else.*
Ok, that is 5/10 first half, then it went downhill. The end was... not good, but good it (the movie) ended. 3/10 is too be kind. It's a pretty crappy flick.

reviews.review_title: 90 minutes of my life I will never get back...
reviews.content:
The second movie Steven Spielberg directed is a relatively unknown television title called The Duel (1971). The main protagonist is an ordinary family man, who is driving an ordinary car home to his family through sparsely populated territory. Fairly early on, for some unexplained reason, this man manages to piss off a psychopath driving a huge 18 wheel truck, who makes it his mission to ensure that our protagonist never sees his home again. What ensues is a tense, vivid cat and mouse game through no-man's land. The driver of the truck is never shown and the movie leaves you wondering why this all took place. It doesn't matter. It is one of the most intense experiences I have ever had in television. Even though Spielberg was still a beginning director en still very much honing his craft, you could tell from this movie that he would one day become one of the greats. Some people are just blessed with talent. And then there are directors who make movies like The Open House, the second movie for both Coote and Angel. We should all give props to the editor that cut the trailer, because it sure made this garbage look good. The premise is somewhat like that of The Duel. Dad dies and mom and son are left to fend for themselves. The mom has no job and can't take care of herself and her son, but instead of going to look for a job, they decide to move into a huge mansion, owned by her sister, in some deserted stretch of woods and mountains, where they are then, yes, continuously confronted by the fact that they have no money. And again, for some reason, some psychopath takes an interest in them and procedes to make their lives hell.Nothing will make you lose all sympathy and caring for the main characters faster than them doing stupid stuff. And the stupidity comes in abundance, from the mom going into a cold and dark basement wearing nothing but a skimpy towel 3!! times in a row, to the son going out in the middle of the night to check out some creepy stuff going on in the driveway. His phone goes missing from where it was 5 minutes earlier and even though they are the only two people in a 5 mile radius, we don't think much of it. A normal person would call the police and sit tight. You basically stop caring whether they live or die at some point.For the first 70 minutes or so however, the movie is entertaining. The directors know how to add in some good jump scares that literally had me off my feet. After watching the final 20 minutes for the conclusion, you realize that this is all this movie was ever going to be. On top of that, it contains some needless cruelty that really did not need to be in there. Here are some of the things you can expect: (spoilers)-Like The Duel, the killer is never revealed nor is his reason. In this case however, it will leave you staring at the screen why you just sat through this pain.
-There is a token crazy female neighbour who comes into the screen at the strangest times to freak you out. Is her husband dead or isn't he? It doesn't matter, because nameless psycho killer was there.
-There is the mysterious guy from town who seems to want something from our main characters. Why did he go into the basement and was he all of a sudden gone, to later pop back up unexplained? It doesn't matter...he gets killed and nameless psycho killer did it all without telling.
-Our psycho killer is a huge guy, but still is blessed with supernatural ninja powers enabling him to move through any room unseen and at will. He also has the ability to make the whole house shake.I have read this in other reviews but would like to say it again: whoever gave this mess the greenlight at NetFlix needs to seriously consider another career. To people looking for a frightening experience, you can do a lot better. Give an oldy like The Duel a chance ;)

This is a waste of your time, a waste of bandwith used for streaming, a waste of all the money that was spent on this garbage...
Just one question: why the hell there isn't at least one light bulb in the basement? In a house worth a few dozen million it's unbeliveable that you have to use flaslights there.
This was actually a pretty good scary movie up until they lost the last 3 pages of the script and just decided to stop filming.

Open House was a painfully generic horror film. Red herrings all over the place, impossibly quiet antagonist, and plot threads leading everywhere but somewhere reasonable or satisfying. This type of movie usually requires a reveal of the killer, and some understanding as to why. If it had been done cleverly, it would've been subtly woven in to the story as it progressed. Instead, about 2/3rds into it, I began worrying because there was no contender as to whom it could be that would be satisfying. Sadly I was more right than I imagined. I could've lived with a cheesy last second rant/montage revealing some hidden history here and why the killer did it. Sadly, we just get the most unsatisfying, lackluster, and cop-out ending I have seen in recent history. The great camerawork and performances given in this movie don't even come close to holding it up against an atrocious screenplay.

reviews.review_title: WORST movie i ever saw! Keep away!
reviews.content:
God damn Netflix, this was horrible experience. WTF?!? Literally Netflix producers before movie: "Hey, let's make a film about some guy killing some strangers in the montains and then ending it without explanation!" "What a great idea!!!!"
WTF?!? I am 35 years old, i took my share of bad movies, but this movie is this garbage, that i created my account on IMDB now to leave this comment. I never felt so much repulsion towards an artistic act, that i felt the urge to warn others to keep away from it. YES! Is that horrendous!!!! Do yourself a favour and watch how plants grow, it's more entertaining than this piece of shit movie. God damn, how can anyone can release this terrible thing in the wild? How come at the first preview, the Netflix executives haven't shut everything down and burn all the roles of movie or hard drives where the raw footage was residing?! Those questions will remain unanswered like those about the movie plot.

I feel like we were watching a serial killer in action. Somewhere in the middle of his killing time line. He had obviously been killing long enough to be sure of himself, but not long enough to be over confident. I'll bet somewhere, in this timeline, there is someone noticing unexplained deaths related to open houses, or house sitters.

I've never seen such a poorly put together movie, and a thriller/horror at that, that I actually enjoyed (and was able to watch all the way through) strictly because of the cast. Normally, I'm all about Netflix originals.

Seriously, what happened here Netflix? It all started it out nicely, building up to a thriller I could sink my teeth into. The filming was really nice with the beautiful scenery shots of the British Columbia and California regions. I was hooked about a third of the way in ... then WTF?! The storyline just went sideways. The worst was the ending. I'm still clueless as to who the villain is? Not even a clever ending to make you think back as to who it might be. It just ended as though the writing staff themselves was snuffed out. Just horrible. Don't waste your time with this. Trust me!

For this crap, we can turn on an episode of Dateline or 20/20. Unforgivable. The sad thing is that the movie started out with a lot of potential - both leads are likable characters with a relatable story.

reviews.review_title: The last act/ending killed this movie, plain and simple
reviews.content: To be completely honest, I watched half or two thirds of this movie thinking the acting and story were great and building to something. I even thought about texting my friends and telling them to check it out but decided to wait until the edn, and I'm glad I did. Once it ended I sent a text informing all of my friend not to waste their time with this movie. The ending made zero sense and made me want my time back. If you are a glutton for punishment, go ahead and watch for yourself, but trust me when I say that you will regret it once you watch the final moments play out. This movie used good actors to draw you in just to let you down with a plot that didnt live up to its potential by thr time the credits roll. Viewer beware.

I'll say that I enjoyed the acting, music and atmosphere but I'll say the ending was definitely lacking to be nice.Personally I thought that the Dad died owing a debt to someone bad and that person came to collect in anyway possible. Breaking fingers and punching a woman in the face? All seemed loan sharkish to me. I also had an idea that maybe there was a fortune in the basement that people were coming in and out to find? Chris looked suspicious heading down there and then just disappearing at one point like maybe there was another way out? Anywho may have been more interesting. At least more so than just a random dude going to open houses stalking and torturing people just for the fun of it.Anyone else feel the same way?

Absolutely no explanation given for what is happening and why does everyone put up with a blown bulb or whatever in the basement and rely on torches? Do not waste your time with this one.
Don't bother! You will spend 90min to finally discover there was no end!

reviews.review_title: A very interesting try and exceptional good result
reviews.content:
Despite the most ratings here, I think that this film provided a new approach to the common horror/thriller movies: Precicely because of the minimalistic way to suggest and not to "cheap" exposing of everything and the open interpretations to several occurences, the viewer stays always on and after the end keeps thinking.And no, the typical "american" film with "heroes" who win and thrive at the end is not here to find. At last something new, different and above all, more realistic.
It is not a fairy tale, it could happen to you.The overal sound of the film is fantastic assumed you have a descent home theater unit, the photography even good and the overal result very satisfying.

I don't want to give spoilers, but I don't think the ending was confusing at all. It was the single most disturbing moment of the whole film, and this is a film full of disturbing moments! I hope if you're reading this, you will give this film a chance. Go in with no expectations and enjoy the ride!

reviews.review_title: Would give it 0 if I could
reviews.content: Well that's 1hr and 34mins that I will never get back.... It started of pretty good and kept me guessing what was going on, then all of a sudden the movie was over? I still know as much as I did when it just started, no idea who the killer is, if there is someone living in the basement, why the next door neighbour lady was acting strange and always seemed to be at the right spot at the right time, and she kept saying her husband was dead and alive so was it her husband that was living there? if so, then why? My goodness my brain hurts. Possibly the worst movie I have ever seen. The acting was fantastic but it was just terrible
I wish i could get back my hour and a half wasted watching this garbage, one of the worst movies i have seen in my entire life
Worst film I've ever seen. Please do not watch it, if you have free time rather go out and take a walk.
The fact that this movie doesn't have closure is  excellent. Many think it's a waste of time, but the spine tingles came from that he won, the killer won. So spooky and so underrated.

reviews.review_title: Open House? More like Open Ended...
reviews.content: No ending. No answers... none. Everything was for nothing.
Thought it was a really good movie, till the end. Damn, I have a way better ending.
If you're going to kill everyone at least say why.

reviews.review_title: Doesn't deserve the hate it gets
reviews.content: This movie was very interesting and suspenseful, very similar to the Strangers. It keeps you on the edge of your seat the entire time. A lot of people said the ending was terrible and didn't make sense, I think that is completely wrong. I watch a lot of horror movies and this is easily one of the most suspenful and gripping horror/thrillers I have seen in a long time. I'm not one to write reviews, but after seeing how horribly people rated this I had to write a positive one. Netflix did a bang up job keeping you on entertained and scared.

Great acting, and the location was beautiful! I was on the edge of my seat and guessing throughout the whole movie. The directors did a good job at making you believe one thing, then switching it up on you. I thought this was a very smart film, not quite like other thrillers I've seen.

I actually loved this movie. It is a little slow, but the main actor makes it worth it. I took it as, what happens in that newspaper article where an unknown person murders a family and no one knows why or who they were. I loved that they left no one alive and love the aching feeling of knowing he was so close to living had he just looked at who was walking by. Not sure why everyone hates this movie so much? I love the intrigue of not knowing who did it. I love unsolved mysteries, and this is like an unsolved mystery played out. Don't take it so seriously!

reviews.review_title: Easily the most infuriating movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: I created this account to solely inform the movie world about how bad this movie was. Honestly, the movie had A LOT of potential but failed miserably in the end. Matt Angel had many ambiguous/mysterious/intriguing shots and scenes that insinuated that there would be this twist at the end of the movie that would reveal the killer, but NOPE. You never find out who the killer is and you really don't have a clue either. Truthfully, I would be cool with the ending if the the director didn't build up the ENTIRE movie to be a mystery where you have to guess who the killer is. If Angel just wanted to make the movie about a mother and son fending off a mysterious stalker, then focus on their storyline rather than the pointless fillers added for no reason. What was the point of Martha?!?!? I'm done. Simply, don't see this movie.
What is a good movie with no conclusion? A bad movie.

Nothing during this movie makes sense. The characters are fine and the acting is very good but the general plot line lack depth and meaning.
It's as if a situation was created to put vulnerable characters in a threatening situation without any ground work to explain why.
The ending leaves you cold, the why's and what's are not answered and the movie exits your life very much as it entered with zero in terms of intellectual justification.
Who was the murderer? Why? What was the motive? Why where they in such dire straits they needed to move so far away and in the middle of no where?
It all seems completely contrived without any substance.
Although at the beginning it seems interesting, the film is really bad, it lacks a consistent argument and it is not clear if it is a horror movie.

Poor script, poor acting, poor character development, poor story, and I would say poor payoff if there was a payoff, which is as non existent here as the talent of the filmmakers behind this poor monstrosity.

reviews.review_title: It was good, loved the sound effects!!!
reviews.content: The movie was awesome until the end, then I had to fast forward. To be completely honest, Martha's character annoyed me for some reason lol. Always walking around in the woods at 2 and 3 am, making claim to a house that isnt hers, making poisonous banana bread for the neighbors, no husband then has a husband, making the new comers scared with crazy faces and comments, vanishing in the dark at night, and showing up when the son is sick after his run(because of course she poisoned him). It was crazy! But overall good movie.
No plot, the end had nothing to do with the rest of the movie- like they just wanted to get it over with. A waste of movie night. Must contain 150 characters. Dumb, dumb, dumb.
2 HOURS GONE FOREVER. ITS NOT EVEN WORTH A STAR AT ALL.

I didn't like when the writers had Naomi tortured and eventually die and I didn't like Logan dying at the end; I watched it and when the credits came on, I was like "That's it; that's how it ends? That sucks!!

reviews.review_title: Worst Story and Worst Direction, You will hate yourself if you watch this movie

I am not sure what all the hate on this movie is really about- especially considering the genre of horror movies that lives on Netflix is dismal at best. I am a huge horror fan, and I have seen some really bad horror movies. This is NOT one of them. Now on to my review about this movie. I will really focus on what worked, I won't even really comment on what didn't work since everyone is spewing it too much any way. I really enjoyed the initial sense of confusion the film brought, is it a ghost? Or is it a killer? Were they set up by the sister? What is with the neighbor? Will they live? These are all great senses of confusion the filmmakers brought to the table in a horror flick, you shouldn't know where the film is going and it creates a great deal of confession as a viewer- which I really enjoy. These types of atmosphere for horror are rare, but when done right- can keep you watching it till the end since you don't have a feeling you figured it out at any time.My favorite aspect is the unexplained backstory- Halloween (78) is a great example of why someone (or something) can be so scary- because we don't understand it. We shouldn't need backstories explained out for why someone kills people in scary movies. Again this is a horror movie, if you want that level of detail- check out MindHunter. This is about creating a villain that is so uncomfortable- you don't understand them at all. (Side note on this: this movie is riddled with homages to the original Halloween). And no- you as a viewer should NOT be connecting with a horror villain like this in order to enjoy the movie, you would feel confused and weirded out. That is how the filmmakers want you to feel.Lastly- this movie did a great job making everything look and sound great. I think the score was fantastic and the locations were beautiful. Even down to the small shots of the basement tunnels. My main and only complaint is this film does require a larger sense of need to suspend reality. Although- I can't think of how many times I lose my cellphone and "swear" I just left it plugged in. I think this movie tries to show you a sense of confusion within the characters that makes you feel bad for them. They are not in their "right state of mind" to begin with, however- most people don't call the police or move when you have misplaced something. How many times have you left a light on and swore you turned it off? It creates this sense of how do you even keep track of those things when large issues are on your mind? IE money and family death. I see it too often in people who don't usually watch horror movies: "I would never go back upstairs". Overall, this was decent. It didn't have any hype that I knew of, I just turned it on and watched it. It's fun and has a lot of moments that keep you guessing- until the end. I also didn't find the end confusing at all. I this the final shot made it pretty clear what happened and what will happen again.

I'm a pretty big fan of horrors and thrillers so I decided to give 'The Open House' a go on Netflix and this movie made me more angry than I needed to be. This was an ugly movie. An ugly execution, an ugly set, a character who made ugly choices this movie was just a trainwreck. It was a complete waste of time, unecessary details were added every 20 or so minutes and there were still so many unanswered questions by the end. How does the killer get into the open houses? Why did our main character keep his eyes open when a strange man was sitting on top of him trying to remove his contacts? The (main characters) aunt clearly has money, so why didn't she invite her sister and nephew to live with her for a little bit? I understand small details are needed for a movie to be fun to watch and try to solve along with the main character but this movie only added information because why not? I feel like the plot was okay, but (as I said before) it was so poorly executed and the acting was so mediocre that this movie wasn't enjoyable.If you want to watch this to kill time, then by all means, go for it. I just can't see anyone willingly putting this on after looking at the Rotten Tomatoes, IMDB and Metacritic scores.

Actually what is the theme of the story. What actually director wants to tell to the audience. Who is the murderer? Why he is doing the murder?..What is the storyline?... No Answers .. Confusing film...

reviews.review_title: Wish I could rate this 0 out of 10
reviews.content: What an absolute waste of time. Halfway through, I had hope for this. One of the worst endings I've ever had the misfortune of sitting through. For the love of everything holy, save yourself an hour and a half of your life. The writers and directors should be ashamed.Aside from that, the gratuitous nudity of his mother was pointless. Then there were a couple of glaring holes. The first time Mom goes to check the water heater, the son magically is nowhere to be found? Even after the basement door slams?Then, Chris' flimsy excuse of looking for her and not finding her after she'd let him in to look at the house is implausible because she was on the main level. How could he NOT find here?And when the son is laying in the woods, and Martha walks by, there's no way she would t have heard him. Sheesh.

When Netflix recommended me this movie, I thought it will be good since the one who is playing the main role is Dylan Minette who performed very well on 13 reasons why.The first part is good, like it was really planned and scripted. But the good part only last right until the road scene only, where they saw a man standing in the middle of the road and thought they bump into him but the guy disappeared. After that, the movie will just give you a boring weird jump scare, weird characters, unrelated characters, unrelated circumstances, and no info about what is happening, its just that, all you is someone is in the house. They didn't even introduce anyone except Martha and Chris, so you wouldn't know who is this psycho guy killing people. And because of that, I don't find it scary at all but instead I really find it weird and awkward. While watching the movie, I didn't think, or have any speculation, guess and analogy and it is because of lack of info in the movie. And to make it worse, they made a vague ending that makes the movie vague. They didn't even indicate how the guy can get in, is he a man with supernatural powers? The doors are locked yet he is inside but at the last part of the movie, the guy is human and is physically alive. (I really thought the guy is flying, creepy lack of clues)I graded the movie 4/10 because the story is bad but the camera positioning, quality, and the actors acting is so good. Logan and The "Mom" has committed a good and wonderful performance. It could be better if the storyline is so good.Expectations: Right after the road scene that I said earlier, I thought it'll be a good movie. Like, good as old horror movies but it really fails me. Speculations like maybe Logan saw the guy in the car who killed his father and at the ending he saw it again killing him and his mother (atleast he died with purpose). I thought Marta can give information about something, or chris, or the guy who fix the heater but none of it happens. I thought they will be introduce around the town and the director/writer will let us think "who among them is the killer" but ta-duhhhh none of it happens. The only details they gave us is the ending part it tells the viewer that there is a psycho guy who can get inside the house and yeah, he will start killing because its a "creepy" legend story about Open House

reviews.review_title: An hour and a half of my life I will never get back

The acting is poor, the storyline is just wierd and stupid. And the ending, well what ending..The story starts off with some promise, and throughout the while film there are bangs and bumps and the suspense is all there as it says on the tin.The problem in my opinion, is it is literally a clusterF a neighbour who actually doesn't need to even be in the film, she serves no purpose. A shop worker who likes the house, lives in the "everyone knows everyone" but had no clue about the open house although it's been on the market for quite a whileBottom line is what is the point of the movie that literally has no ending?

reviews.review_title: 1.5 Hours You Will Never Get Back
reviews.content: This colossal failure of a movie is an absolute waste of time. This film is so void of meaning, plot, character development, and all other elements that make up a good flick. The pacing is awful; it's slow and chalked full of overly drawn out and suspenseful lead ups that end in complete anticlimax.I am baffled at the notion that there weren't people throughout the filmmaking process saying, "maybe we should rethink this whole thing"At the end, all my husband and I could shout was, "that's it?!"No idea how this film went through all the filtration of production without getting thrown out.

reviews.review_title: Wtf is with the low ratings? Solid home invasion horror.
reviews.content:
I had to register purely on this movie's ratings. I genuinely can't believe how this has a 3.3 rating when there are FAR worse horrors rated much higher.The majority of people seem to be moaning about the fact the movie doesn't explain who the killer was, why he did what he did and tie it up in a nice little bow. I watch A LOT of horrors and home invasions being my favourite. The thing I found most unsettling about this particular movie is that the killer didn't seem to have any real motive, other than the fact "they were home", to quote one of the more popular home invasion horrors in recent history.***Spoilers***
I also liked the fact there was no Hollywood ending where the son saves the day and they live happily ever after. A psychopath breaks into a large open house, stalks and toys with his victims, kills them and moves on. Exactly what would happen if this were to unfold in real life.
***Spoilers end***3.3 is criminally low, I was honestly about to give it a miss completely. I'm glad I didn't. If you like home invasion horrors, I'd recommend giving this a go. It's a solid 6/10 horror.

I don't know what to say i'm not advising anyone to waste almost two hours of their life watching this movie.I'm really disappointed, it's nonsense. An invisible one who kills people without knowing who and what is the cause. I only lost almost two hours of my life.I do not advise anyone to see it.

04: Pretty decent sound accompaniment
05: If you came here for Dylan Minnette well, there he is, but it's a home invasion movie, not a teen drama
06: Home invasion movies are always upsetting, if you're not in the genre just stay away
07: SPOILER ALERT If you can't cope with unsolved mystery and open endings, just stay away, cause that's a feature that often goes with home invasions
08: SPOILER ALERT The fact that the movie would go unexplained is pretty damn obvious since halfway through, only Marvel franchise crybaby fans would complain about that
09: Why complaining the waste of time then wasting more writing useless reviews?
10: There's no jump scares abuse
11: Of course there's plenty of clichès, just as any other horror/thriller movie
12: It's not cheap nor pretentious and it's a low budget production
13: Just watch the movie if you're seeking for some chills, in that sense The Open House really does his job, if you were looking for a masterpiece maybe go on continue your search.
 
7 out of 10 even if a 6 would be more appropriate

-it introduced characters and bits of backstory to make you further speculate
-characters acted wildly daft given the situation they were in, a lack of self preservation I've never seen in horror and that's saying something
-it never took a supernatural element to make you think oh ok maybe it's just a random haunting thing
-it never gave any indication it was just some random slasherThen leaves you with no explanation and no answers.I really wish this could get an alternate ending cut which would easily take it to a 9 or 10 star.Great job by the actors and crew, but for me the writing for the ending just didn't do it at all.

This film had potential - a mother and a son trying to cope with a loss of father and a husband, who in the end wasn't such a role model after all. After the mother's sister decides to lent them her big vacation home, they move into a strange town with strange residents. The viewer is wondering why everyone else is acting so weird, why do the realtors seem scared of the house, why is the lady next door always watching over them?Not spoiling the third act of the movie, they didn't do anything with the themes from the first and the second act. The loss, the weirdness, the unsettling feeling of it all, has nothing to do with the final conclusion of the film. Most of the unsettling tones of the film are, in the end, red-herrings. The overall feeling of the film is nice and creepy but I wished that the plot would've made sense in the end.

reviews.review_title: For those who aren't so small minded
reviews.content: The other reviews in here were so poorly written by folks who have don't have a clue so here's a real review. The movie has a decent plot with decent characters and decent acting. The pacing is good and it sets up itself up pretty averagely. Sure there are moments when you're talking to the tv telling the characters to do something different from what they're doing on screen, sure there are a couple cliches. But I think the direction that it goes is pretty cool. The killer is reveleaved to be a guy who likes to go to open houses and murder anyone in the house. It's simple. I don't know how people can't wrap their heads around it. It's the closest thing to a real life event as you can get. There's no grand scheme there's no personal connection to the killer. He's just a serial killer who enjoys the chase. Plain and simple. I loved the ending. It leaves you feeling different than a lot of movies like this. I applaud that.

It was a total dissapointment, not only because the story has no plot but also because anything there has sense. Who's the fucking killer? why did he wanted that house so bad? Tell me about the crazy granny and Chris? WTF??

reviews.review_title: Great promise at first, but then....
reviews.content: The first half was great! Well acted, interesting camera work, connection to the characters. Then it just fell apart. Still well acted, but no explanation of why the neighbor was creepy, why mom considered dad to be such a loser, and what the hell was that creepy stone hallway on the basement for? Also, no answer to whodunnit!

This movie was so bad I really wish I could get my mom a portion of her Netflix subscription price back. This was truly awful story telling. Bad writing, bad directing, bad cinematography, garbage plot. There is an interesting concept here: the idea that everything that seems off has no deeper sinister meaning and everything that happens is completely unrelated. But the movie did such a terrible job of showing that that I'm not even sure if it was intentional. I should not have to sit on my couch doing the writers' jobs for them. I am so angry right now. What a stupid movie. Netflix if you're reading this please email me right now. Why did they almost hit the killer on the road that makes no sense. How did he hide for so long in this house. how was the house broken into if he was already inside? why did the police not care about a break in like thats literally illegal. How did Martha get back home after her Alzheimers episode and why did she not have anyone looking after her if her condition was that bad? if anybody would like to get together to write a better movie please contact me

reviews.review_title: Thats 1 hour & 34 mins i'll never get back!!!
reviews.content: Wow this movie could of really been something, but it just is something I wish I never watched! It just ends...so unsatisfied!
I watch a lot of movies, and there are some really bad ones out there. The open house is by far the worse, DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!!
Never ever ever ever watch this movie!! Waste if time
I totally didn't get the ending at all with this movie.

reviews.review_title: THE BIGGEST DISAPPOINTMENT I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED! ABSOLUTE RUBBISH!!
reviews.content: I have never been so angry at a film, and so let down by being strung along for the duration to not find out the reason for what happened. A COMPLETE waste of time. Terrible acting throughout also. I won't get that time back so do yourself a favour - DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME.

This is the stupidest movie I have seen in a long time. Maybe ever. At least since Splatter University. I kept with it because I expected it to have a plot and explanations for the things that went on, but nope. If this is what Netflix is buying I can make a killing.Is 0 stars an option? 0 effort was an option for the writers.
It had its share of like who done it, but you will never figure out who it is. Disappointed in the end really???

There isn't much to say here that hasn't already been said by countless other reviews. The movie started off fairly strong, and set out some clear pathways for the rest of the film. The characters and the tension both developed nicely, with solid acting all around. Then came the third act. I don't know if they were going for something more artistic and open-ended, but I feel like they missed the most important mark - making the viewer feel like they haven't wasted their time watching the movie. I would have preferred an overdone cliche or deus ex machina to what they've offered in the climax. Imagine going to a football game, and after three riveting quarters of exciting competition, the players all dropped dead and everyone stood up and went home. It's hard to tell if the writers were trying too hard or not trying at all.

Like the other 1 star review, this movie leaves you with many unaswered questions that are critical for the viewer to know. Please save your time and do not watch this movie. It is utterly dissappointing.

reviews.review_title: Great until the end. No explanation
reviews.content: This was great movie and I was on the edge of my seat the whole time.... until the end. The ending was so vague that it made the entire movie suck. There was no explanation at the end for any of the prior events so the audience was left confused and disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely terrible!! Save 94 min of your life and don't watch this!!
reviews.content: Started off good but got worse and worse as it progressed. Over and over again they would play the dramatic horror music to try to make it scarier but it would reveal absolutely nothing and just made everything seem like it was done by a complete amateur who doesn't know what they are doing and that's not even mentioning the completely horrible ending that leaves you asking yourself what the hell you just watched. Trust me don't waste your time!

Most reviews were terrible. I agree movie is slow but ending in my opinion is worth the wait. A semi twist ending that gives you that Oh My Goodness didn't see that coming feeling. No happy ending. Just a sick person going from open house to open house. I enjoyed it.

reviews.review_title: Should have release on April Fool's Day
reviews.content: After the first 10 - 15 minutes, I was tempted to quit watching; the suspenseful music was too much, there seemed to be a lot of fake surprise camera work, and the characters did stupid things. But for some reason, perhaps pure laziness, I kept watching. Things continued along the same line, but it began to go from scary to annoying to somewhat humorous. One annoying part was that the hot water would suddenly go cold while the mother was in the shower. It was a standard hot water tank, and anyone knows that the water doesn't suddenly go cold, but gradually gets colder. But relighting the pilot seemed to make the water get instantly hot again. And the hot water tank was in the cellar (which was very dungeon-like), with no lights.Also kind of dumb was that they were living in a huge house that was being shown each day by realtors. Anybody could come in, wander around, and find lots of places to hide after the people left.The whole movie seemed so bad that I assume there was a reason; Netflix isn't stupid, so I'm guessing they either wanted a movie so bad that people watched it to make fun of it, like many cult classics, or more likely, it was a parody of all the bad horror films from the past, with the overly dramatic music, stupid characters, almost no plot, etc. This, to me, makes sense but I haven't seen anyone else propose this theory. Comments welcome
Dont bother I've seen some bad movies but this takes the cake. Broken plot and story

This movie felt so incomplete and that's maybe because it WAS incomplete. It literally tells you nothing about the killer. The movie and ESPECIALLY DYALN MINNETTE (no hate for him, i love him) moves so fuggin SLOWWWW. Like the whole movie it's just like move, move, move, move, move fasterrrr!!!!!The story line had potential just extremely bad directing and lack of depth in writing. As is if it wasn't bad enough, the main freakin actor dies. The End. Bye. No kidding that's it. We watch the actor walk around like a snail the entire time, then he dies. Finish. Lol.Waste of time.

Very few films achieve the kind of bottom-dwelling awfulness of The Open House. There is no plot, no point, no drama, and no logic. A documentary about how my cat spends his day would be 1,000 times more entertaining.
This is one of the worst scripts ever made. Just don't waste your time watching this!

reviews.review_title: Finally get to use my own imagination
reviews.content: The movie was very good one. I felt as if I was in charge of imagining my own ending. I decided weather or not the bad guy was real and or a ghost. I mean sure it's nice to get the info from the movie. It's deffinetly a good movie of you have nothing to watch on Netflix.

reviews.review_title: What was the point of this movie?
reviews.content:
Sat down to watch this today and was thoroughly disappointed. The plot throughout is bare, seemed promising at a couple of tension points and then the ending was a complete let down. The only thing that kept me going to the end of the film was to find out who the intruder actually was, when there was 0 resolution to the film this was abandoned by the writers completely.
Don't waste your time, watch a decent intruder film like Panic Room.

reviews.review_title: I would have given it a 0 if I could.
reviews.content: I have no idea why Netflix would bought this movie! Horrible and no meaning.

reviews.review_title: The film makers owe me money!
reviews.content: The people who made this movie should never be allowed to make movies ever again. That includes home movies and videos shot on their smartphones as well. Complete waste of time.
No answers. No plot. They all die. It was terrible. With it being a "Netflix original" movie, I don't know how I feel about Netflix. Complete garbage. Total waste of time.

This was an entertaining movie, with plenty of scary/suspenseful moments. The two leads displayed solid acting ability, showcased through an artfully shot film. Although the conclusion may not be for everyone, I enjoyed having some of the information left open-ended; It made for a good after-movie debate!
Only enjoyable if you watch it with a friend so you can go 'WTF' and make fun of it the whole way through.

reviews.review_title: Dont you ever watch this crap
reviews.content: Totally waste of time ... search for another movie

SPOILER ALERT: the film begins with a lot of suspense and it is working towards a plot. But the plot does not clearly follow. At the end, however, you will see a car driving towards another open house. This suggests that this unidentified man visits open houses to kill the residents of that open house, just like he did with the main characters. Well, I think that is the plot, but then again it is not clearly shown in the film. This is more a one time watch. All in all, a bit disappointing.

This movie started off decently strong in my opinion. It was mysterious and a bit creepy and then it's like the writers just gave up and said there we go. Good enough! I don't mind movies that don't ever show the murders face or kill everyone in the end. But it has a lot of misleading. Like the fathers death at some point almost seemed like a murder. But it all just leads to no answers and just a cheap ending. Was a very disappointing movie that seemed to be a decently strong and intense start
Anyone noticed satan in the killer belly there are also horns it's definitely a sacrifice !!!!

reviews.review_title: I really did enjoy this film but.....
reviews.content: I have a few questions. And maybe they were left unanswered on purpose...... When the cops searched the house where was the guy supposedly at? I didn't understand how he kept eluding everyone. When Martha was at the door in middle of the night what was the business with the headlights and the car leaving?

The movie summary was made it seem good, kind of reminded me of the Collector series.It started off good; good back story, husband dies leaving the wife and son in a bad-turned-worse financial situation. Her sister let's her stay in the house she's trying to sell, but she needs to leave for the open house. Seems good. Guy comes in and starts messing with wife and the son. Cliche blowup between the son and mom and of course, cliche make up when they realize someone is trying to hurt them. Up until literally, the moment he was hiding from the neighbor, thinking it's the killer, I was ready for more. But it was such a cliffhanger. Like horrible. Who is it? Why did he do it? Do I need to watch it again because maybe he's in it like in Collector, the killer was one of the exterminators?
I'll try to compare it to Jurassic Park since most everyone has seen it. The very first movie, if it cut off where they lock the doors from the Raptors and you hear the shots and the grandpa screaming "Grant" and never got to finish it, that's exactly the kind of cliffhanger they left.
I get the point behind it, not really sure if I can explain it though, but I'd only recommend this movie if there's a sequel or series to it to explain the events from the first one. No sequel means this movie is a waste of time
Even though acting was good, the ending was really bad. Things just don't connect and the plot was weird. I do not recommend this, find a better way to waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Good chemistry between the lead characters earns this film 2 stars, instead of 1.
reviews.content:
WARNING: SOME SPOILERS AHEAD
The Mother-son chemistry between the lead actors is palpable. The early part of the film succeeds at portraying them dealing with their "new normal", but even the second act has some plot holes. The young man is an athlete in high school. So why wouldn't the sister ask them to stay with her, in town, rather than sending them off to her remote, (albeit palatial) mountain home?
