Some of early scenes, set within the "open house", are also absurd. 
Oh no! It's The BASEMENT DOOR - (Cue the eerie music!) 
Plot development was also very slow. Then, the rushed ending, coming after several weak attempts at misdirection, (i.e., "I would kill for a place with this much privacy!" ; or Logan vomiting during a run, after Marsha gave them her 'special banana bread'.)
What the heck? I expected - and hoped - for more. And better.

This move isn't something I would go out of my way to watch, but something to settle for. It is not complex whatsoever. Dylan Minnette captured my heart in the Netflix original series "13 Reasons Why". When I saw he was in this movie, I watched it immediately. From the beginning of the movie to the end, I felt confused. Many, many things didn't make sense or didn't add up. Every time it seemed they were going somewhere, they wound up at a dead end with a dead plot. By the end of the movie, I was thinking I had missed something, but I had not. I rated this title 6 out of 10 stars because although the storyline was a bit confusing, the acting was still tolerable; the concept was intriguing, and it was overall a decent movie to settle for.

Okay...here are my problems with this mess of a horror film.1. The main characters are stupid. The mom and son kept making the worse choices. If you need the charterers to do dumb stuff in order to move the story forward...then you are not a good horror writer. 2. The inconsistency of the scenes. There is no point. There is no reason. The guy just wanted to mess with the family. That's it. I understand that. I've seen many films where the badguy/s are doing bad things just for the hell of it. What I don't get is why the writers had the badguy mess with the family in THAT way. It was as if the badguy was a stupid corny 8 year old. Before the ending, all these loose strings were bothering the hell out of me. I wanted to know WHY? The writers made it seem like it was a grudge..like there's a story. Even crazy has its reasons. This crazy asshole is all over. At one point I thought he was trying to frame the boy. That would have been great...but no... no reason... no twist. and what was the point of that crazy lady from that one single scene? 3. It draaaaaaaaaags. Slow pace is fine if you put good dialogue. This movie didn't have much. So I was bored for so long. 4. The scary scenes are annoying... not scary. Annoying because they make no sense. This guy is hiding yet comes up random times and is never seen? Really? He pranks them. He annoys them. These scenes are suppose to be scary but seem just silly. When he finally attacks, I wasn't scared. I was like ..meh. Just annoyed because I was still thinking what the hell is happening. Why a three and not a 1? There's one good scene. When the mom and son have their fight. It was well done.Do yourself a favor and watch "Before I Wake" instead.

Upon finishing this movie, i immediately came to the imdb comments to see if i had missed something. turns out, the writers just "forgot" to include it. i've seen a lot of pointless movies in my day, but none as pointless as this one. the entire movie seems to be leading to the last 15 minutes--which are almost exciting--and then, when you think you're about to find out who is doing this and get some resolution, the movie just sort of...ends? the real horror here was the writing, and the only scare was how horrifically terrible the ending is. pointless doesn't even encapsulate the putrid ending. this movie could've been very good; i thought it was going to be more like hush, but it doesn't even compare. if you're thinking of watching this movie, do yourself a favor: don't.

reviews.review_title: What just happened to 90 minutes of my life?!
reviews.content: I created an account on IMDB just so I could give this movie a one-star rating. Ridiculous. Nothing of any substance happens in this movie. The ending is terrible. It's so forgettable, but unfortunately I haven't forgotten that I watched it yet. (I guess it takes more than 5 minutes.) Netflix is just green-lighting anything now, I guess.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie ever, don't waste your time
reviews.content:
This movie keeps building things, you try to guess who the antagonist is with all sorts of clues, then the movie ends up without us knowing ANYTHING, we don't know who the antagonist is, what his motives are, not even what he looks like, this movie spend 95% of its time building up a story and details, and you think this huge twist will be revealed at the end, but nothing ever happens, it just ends.
I'd compare this entire movie to the scene in "The Room" where Lisa's mom says she has breast cancer, and the story never goes back to that detail.

reviews.review_title: What a waste of my time.
reviews.content: So , did Logan have a breakdown and do all that to his self. I am so disappointed.
Totally pointless to watch this movie, it has no ending
Why the hell they decided to shoot this film? It doesn't have an end either..

This is my first review on IMDB and I'll keep this short and sweet.If you're considering this film, look at the other reviews asap and avoid. This film leads no where, it's a dead end. The main characters have little development to them, and the supporting cast fare even worse - and then it just ENDS. Not sure why this is even on Netflix or why they snapped up such a poor title.

reviews.review_title: The actors ought to be ashamed for accepting their parts
reviews.content: Though the scenery was beautiful, that's not what makes a movie good. A good movie has a good storyline, and this one doesn't appear to have one in the first place. The movie is basically a sequence of random occurrences that aren't explained. Though the two main characters obviously portrayed their roles well, I can't wrap my head around why any actor would agree to be in such an awful movie. I can't give this piece of crap more than one star. They ought to stop cluttering Netflix with this junk or just stop asking money for their services. You don't want to be paying for this crap.
The writers had a premise, not a story. It must have been self-funded, because no one would ever back this movie. Except Netflix. Such a huge misstep for such a profitable company.

I've never taken the time or made an effort to write a review, however, i wish i had read the reviews before i watched this movie. I would rather have an ice pick in my ear than to watch this or recommend it. Shame on you for wasting my time.The spoiler alert is the waste of oxygen it takes to watch it.
The movie is too vague, toooo slow but I gave it a shot and I waited till the end hoping for something to surprise me... nothing...a waste of time

reviews.review_title: WORST HORROR MOVIE IN HISTORY-NETFLIX AND DYLAN MINNETE SHOULD BE ASHAMED
reviews.content:
Warning: Many spoilers ahead. But, don't worry about it because the movie is so horrible it's not worth seeing. The script was terribly written, the movie tripped over itself constantly, and it was full of plot holes and useless scenes leading up to absolutely nothing. I came across this movie when I was going through my Netflix feed, searching for a scary movie to watch. Until, I stumbled upon Netflix's almost-impossible-to-avoid 'featured' section (which is mostly Netflix Originals). The first movie in this section was 'The Open House'. From the looks of the graphic design and the trailer, it was a horror movie. At the time, I was particularly in the mood for a horror movie, and the trailer was well-made and it was presented as though it had an interesting plot. And to make the movie seem more promising, it starred Dylan Minnette, who plays Logan in the movie, and Piercey Dalton, who plays his mother, Naomi. Although I've never heard of Piercey, Dylan was one of the main characters of the popular Netflix thriller '13 Reasons Why'. His performance in the show was not only fantastic, but it seemed like he had good taste in choosing shows and movies in which to take part. 
Netflix was setting up expectations from the start, and I'm sure that this was their intention with the way they plastered Dylan on the cover.
So, at this point, I was already popping my popcorn, but can you blame me? My high expectations had already started to sink, when the movie began. The screen was pitch-black, with generic high-pitched scary movie "strings" music overlaid onto the escalating pants of Dylan Minnette. 
The first frame appears, it's Dylan running, his father holding a stopwatch, telling Dylan that he broke another running record. 
"Ok," I thought to myself, " he's clearly fast at running, this scene will play a crucial role somewhere in the movie, maybe when he's running away from a murderer or something". It didn't. At all. Exhibit A, useless scene number one. 
They enter the house to tell their mother (Piercey Dalton), who is preparing dinner, about the record break. She tells Dylan to wash up for dinner. 
As he enters the bathroom, he dramatically removes his contacts, and clumsily reaches over to a pair of glasses laying on the sink...it was literally right there, and he knocked over like two bottles trying to reach it, clearly an attempt to accentuate that he's completely blind and helpless without glasses or contacts. This foreshadowed probably one of the silliest and least thought out events in the history of horror movies. I'll explain later.Dad drops the eggs in the kitchen, and goes with Dylan to the store to buy more eggs and Naomi urges the dad to also get milk. 
They pull into the store parking lot, dad gets out to get the eggs, and as he exits the store, a car comes out of nowhere and plows dad. At this point you might think, ok, this is where the story picks up and gets interesting. Maybe the dad was involved with some bad people or a hidden past that's coming back to haunt him. Nope. Just cuts to the next scene, the dad's funeral. No talk of who was in the car, why they killed him, if they got away, not even whether it was an accident or on purpose. I guess the directors just thought they didn't need to include that, or it would be too much work to build a plot that's remotely interesting. Maybe, we'll find out as the movie progresses. Nope. You don't. Plot hole, much? And the worst part is, the dad forgot the milk.At the wake Naomi's sister tells her that she can stay at her mountain house because with her husband gone Naomi can no longer afford rent. 
So, Naomi and Logan decide to move into the house. It's the middle of the night, the road is empty, they're driving to their new home and a man in black (that's literally the name of his character on IMDB) is ominously standing in the middle of the road. They swerve, and miss him, turn back and he's not there. At this point, Naomi's nose starts to bleed. I thought that maybe here was when the story would start to pick up, maybe the nosebleed is hinting at something paranormal. Nope. It's not explained later on, and doesn't occur again. Useless scene number two. 
They go to the grocery store, to finally pick up that milk that the father had failed to retrieve, and they bump into an old woman named Martha. She gives them a rather odd welcome to the town, making it seem like she would add something to the story. Nope. She's just a creepy, random old lady. Her character makes absolutely no sense and is completely useless to the movie. Her only purpose was to be creepily hint to or foreshadow absolutely nothing. 
They pull up to her sister's huge house and for some reason it's morning now, even though it was night just a second ago at the store. I guess they ran out of time for that day because they were too busy wasting time making useless movie scenes and wasting everyone's time. 
Logan is exploring the house, and he stumbles upon a typical scary movie "don't go down there!" basement that never has working lights for some reason. 
What made this movie even more pitiful, was that there was an LED light bulb visible in this scene. They didn't even put in the extra effort to try to hide it. So, the basement had no electricity for some reason, but the rest of the house did?
 At this point, I was only hoping that Logan was going to the basement to look for a fusebox. 
He continues deeper into the basement and comes across a pile of wood and stares at it like it's a pile of baby bones or something. He goes back upstairs and one of the steps of this "super expensive" mansion breaks. Wow, I'm shaking. I wish you could hear the sarcasm in my voice. 
They go to sleep and Logan is awoken by a strange noise. He looks out the window and there's a car with its headlights on pointing to the house, and it honks. Logan goes outside to see what's going on, and if you guessed that the car vanished, you're already getting the gist of the way this movie works. You don't hear it drive off, or see it driving out of the long driveway. Was it the same person that killed his dad? Was it a hallucination or ghost? Nope. But, the movie will make sure you never find out.
Logan weirdly stares at a fake lawn animal, like he did with the pile of wood. I realize now that he liked to stare at things with no significance, as if they do have significance. After he shakes himself out of his trance, he turns around and Martha appears behind him. Yes, Martha. Out of nowhere, in the middle of the night. She asks Logan why he's living in the mansion and then gets scared and does a frantic old lady run into the woods. 
Logan goes back to sleep. Unnecessary scene number 4.
In the morning, he wakes up to a hand getting close to his face, like it's about to grab it. This interaction is paired with some more high-pitched 'strings', like that's supposed to be scary or something. It's the realtor who's selling the house trying to wake him up, telling them that they have to leave because of the open house and to return in the afternoon. 
Then, there's a scene where the people from the open house walk inside. One of the visitors is a pair of evil black boots. I know it's a pair of evil black boots because the music suddenly switched to ominous and they didn't show the visitor's face as he creepily stepped inside, one evil boot at a time. 
So, they go out to eat and shop, even though it's been flagrantly stated in the movie that they are low on funds, which is why they are living in that house in the first place. They guy behind the counter at the clothing store starts making small talk with Naomi, as he sees that she's new in town. Logan gets triggered, has a tantrum and they leave, because nobody can strike a conversation up with his mother without him getting defensive. 
They get home and there's an extremely weak jumpscare. It's the realtor leaving the house after cleaning up. I'm still confused as to why the realtor was scared, because he had been hosting a open house all day? He freaks out like he just saw a ghost and hurriedly scurries out of the house. Yet, another plot carrot that they dangle in front of your face that leads up to and means nothing. 
Logan and Naomi are watching a movie. Logan goes to get more popcorn. "Evil Boots" opens a door in the background for some reason, no one even noticed it. Then, the phone rings and all you can hear is echoing, meaning the call is coming from within the house. So, Evil Boots is calling them from within the house. He doesn't say anything over the phone, so he called for fun I guess? 
After the movie, Naomi takes a shower, and Logan brings a bowl of cereal up to his room. He notices that his phone is missing. 
He goes downstairs to find his mom's phone to call his phone, and he sees bowl of cereal has been miraculously transported to the table downstairs. 
Evil Boots, a 6ft tall, grown man (he's shown later), somehow snuck up and downstairs in his hefty boots, taking bowls of cereal downstairs and opening and closing doors without anybody noticing, let it also be known that there was only one staircase in the house to the upstairs, so he somehow snuck by Logan during this entire interaction. 
Logan hears Naomi scream from the bathroom, runs upstairs, and busts open the bathroom door, getting a glimpse of his exposed mother. She tells him that the water went ice cold randomly.
 Naomi goes into the generic scary movie basement to light the pilot. The presence of evil boots is clearly prevalent in this scene, but instead of killing her, he shuts the basement door. Because, killing one of the main characters would bring this painfully and unnecessarily long movie to a much needed halt. 
Logan and Naomi go out for a run and there's another useless scene with Martha. She seems to have no recollection of the encounter with Logan from the night prior. 
They go back home and see the cashier from the clothing store, peering through the windows. He claims tha
Brilliant film until the end. No loose ends are tied us and the audience knows nothing more than they did at the beginning. No narrative arch. Good film ruined with a horrific ending.

Having seen Dylan Minnette in 13 Reasons Why, I watched this film expecting it to be half decent because of his casting. Although it started promisingly with good acting, beautiful scenery and a couple of scares, the story ended up being a complete and utter disappointment. The story quickly went nowhere, and although horror films don't always wrap things up nicely at the end, this film ended with the writers obviously having no idea how to give an explanation for what had been happening , and then deciding not to give one.If you want a film with killing, pointless torture, characters who are weird just because they live in the woods, and no reveal as to why anything at all was happening in the film, then this is the one for you. As for myself I will be giving these writers a very wide berth in future ........ if I remember their names. I sure as hell won't remember this film.

reviews.review_title: No ending! Don't waste your time.
reviews.content: I'm getting tired of these movies that are nothing but a rip off. They make a lot of promises, but in the end they can't deliver. It's easy to create a mystery, but what's the point if there's no ending? There's no motive. You don't even get enough information to speculate what happened.

reviews.review_title: I want my two hours back
reviews.content:
Worst movie. Ever.
Heck, it's not even worth calling a movie.

I totally agree with the review that said if they could rate this film a zero they would, Despite the low rating on here I decided to give this movie a go, Netflix original movies have a pretty good reputation on making entertaining movies and tv shows, be a shame if more movies by them turned out like this one, Good acting by the main character, but geez this movie absolutely TERRIBLE probably the worst movie that I have ever seen in my life, Was a totally waste of time and money, I always look forward to seeing movies or tv shows produced by Netflix, VERY VERY disappointed with this one, If Netflix was to throw out more movies like this, then I might even consider cancelling my subscription with them
If you're reading this review you already wasted your time. There was no point, none! Ugh I'm so annoyed I watched this horrible movie.

I was really into this movie. It kept me in suspense and I found myself thinking that every character the mother and son came in contact with had the potential to be the "stalker". At one point I was thinking the movie was going to lead to the dad being killed on purpose or something like that. But the end came and the two main characters are killed by this "stalker" but they never show who it is or why he's doing this. It was very disappointing and such a waste of time. What was the point?

reviews.review_title: Terrible ending, to a movie with great potential. Waste of 90 mins
reviews.content: First time I ever review a movie. Just felt like I had to contribute to the ratings, because 3.3 is way too high. Started off good, but the ending is the most frustrating shit I've ever witnessed.

I have never written a review before, but I'm compelled to after watching this movie because it was THAT TERRIBLE. I can't begin to list all the things that were wrong with this movie. By the end I was so angry I wasted 1.5 hours!
The acting and setting were good, but the "story" was about as bad as possible - save yourself the time. No resolution at the end. No meaning. Awful, Awful, Awful.
This is just a waste of time to watch. I should check the IMDB rating first before watching this movie in netflix.

reviews.review_title: I've seen better films on MST3K
reviews.content:
This script meanders through every pointless, stupid horror movie trope ever - but with no payoff in the end.Most horror films are stupid - but they at least TRY to explain who the villain is, and why he behaves as he does. Not this idiotic film. The antagonist is never revealed - to the characters or the audience - nor are his motives. Tons of questions are raised in the film - none are answered. There is no point to anything. No one learns anything. Nothing that seems like foreshadowing actually is.You think the main character's olympic running dreams will be a plot point later?
Nope.
You think his dad's death somehow figures into the ending?
Nah.
You think the parents' financial troubles dropped in the beginning have some meaning in the movie?
Sorry.Nothing is revealed about anyone. No one changes. No goals are accomplished. Everyone just dies for no discernable reason, and then credits roll.I can only imagine the actors in this film were being extorted in some way to make them participate in this experiment in plotless filmmaking. I hope they can get somewhere safe and dial 9-1-1 (which, for the record, doesn't require a SIM card).I feel Netflix owes me for the hours of my life wasted watching this "unmovie."Please avoid at all costs!

reviews.review_title: Where is the rest of the movie?
reviews.content: Great acting, and great start to the film. Creepy atmosphere throughout and really great build up to the ending. But they seemed to have cut off the end of the movie? Maybe there is an extended version where you actually get to watch the last 20 minutes because you won't find an actual ending that ties up the story in the original. Just terrible.

reviews.review_title: Starts off good, but ending is VERY unsatisfying
reviews.content: I was really excited to see this movie. The idea of it is very good, the acting was wonderful, and it's suspenseful. But low and behold, the ending will leave you disturbed, upset, and finally, dissatisfied. Don't bother with this movie. If you really want to know what happens, read the synopsis as it starts out very good.

reviews.review_title: I Should Get Paid BIG Just To Watch This
reviews.content: How can the writer, director, and actors draw someone into this film so artfully, and then make you wish you killed yourself for watching it? The whole point of this movie was actually done very, very well...to piss you off. If I had gone to a theater to watch this, I would've wanted to burn the place down. No wonder they put it on Netflix! I've never in my life written a review of a movie or any other product...but this...this just brings out the worst in me. Somebody's laughing their butt off that they got so many people to watch this. I wish I had read the reviews! If you're thinking about watching this movie, take a break first. Go slam your head in a doorway a couple of times. It'll be more enjoyable than watching this, and you'll have saved yourself some time. If you really want to know what happens at the end of the movie, just fast forward it to someplace, any place in the movie, and pretend it's the end. You'll be more satisfied than waiting to see how these morons ended it. In all seriousness, I'd rather wear a barb wired jock strap than watch this thing.

Dylan Minnette and Piercey Dalton give amazing performances in a creepy, atmospheric horror thriller from Matt Angel and Suzanne Coote. There are so many things I love about this movie, and the ending leaves you wanting so much more. Watch out for Martha... she's up to something.
94 minutes of my life that I will never get back. Could have taken a shower with molten lava and that'd have been more productive and entertaining.

Wtf! What is going wrong with this scenario?
So bad ending.who's the killer. We will never see his face!

reviews.review_title: If I could give it a 0, I would.
reviews.content: Don't bother. It's completly pointless and has no real ending.Can I have my 90 minutes back please...

reviews.review_title: Absolutely no direction, destination or plot.
reviews.content: Don't waste your time. You have some nice scenery, but those moments of pretty mountains and trees don't make up for a pointless film. I NEVER write reviews about films, I made an exception in this case. Please don't waste your time like I did. If you have 819 reviews all saying the movie sucks--listen to them.

I rarely ever review movies but I feel obligated to warn others on this one. It was a complete waste of time. There are no answers. Nothing comes to a conclusion. There is no reason I can think of to waste your time watching this. The acting isn't that great. It's like they forgot they were making a movie and not a series and they left us on season 1 episode 1.

reviews.review_title: A movie that should not have been made.
reviews.content:
This movie seems like it has something. The horror element is coming but no. This is a total waste of time. I can not say a single positive thing about this movie. Why? Several times you get to a point like this is it after this something is going to happen, something will be revealed, the reasons behind all these suspense will be given just about now and BAM! you do not see that.Good acting? No, just lazy acting. It looks like the cast are into it but no. The story feels like there is some buildup but it goes on for so long that the movie ends. I just don't get it, where is the horror element? Even when it all got to the point of getting interesting and after all the time you want to see what's going to happen... NOTHING HAPPENS. It's like, yeah, that's it then nothing else to see.This is the first movie in my life that want to give a rating or 0. For real.
The worst movie I have seen on Netflix.My recommendations:
1. No need to waste your time to watch this no make sense movie.
2. If they really needed to make this movie this could easily been a short film. 1 and half hours is a waste of time.

reviews.review_title: Wasn't great but have definitely seen worse
reviews.content:
Like most reviewers, I enjoyed the first 70 minutes of this movie. It was suspenseful and had a few jump scares. If the movie would of had a better ending, I could have given 7-8 stars.
Here are a few issues I had with the ending:
1. No reason to focus on if the old woman's husband is dead or not if you aren't going to show us who it is at the end or a picture of her husband.
2. It felt very rushed. It went from the suspense of the dinner table being set when they got home to someone going through the house killing people.
3. It was pointless to break the mother's fingers torture style other than a cringe factor.
4. Who waits until you are right behind someone before yelling their name in this situation?? You yell from the stairs!
5. I don't care how cold he was, after running up and down stairs, your adrenaline pumping from being chased and saving and killing your mom, and being wrestled to the ground and struggling, you would not still be too shakey to walk.Now, I feel like from the other reviews, I need to defend the ending a little bit. I'm not going to argue whether it was a serial killer or someone who was seeking revenge and may now be a serial killer. I believe that the audience not knowing who it was increases the suspense that it could literally be anyone. It gives a feel of The Strangers to me where it could be just a random person for no reason, so I kinda liked not knowing. I just wish that not knowing, wouldn't make all the other hints and clues in the movie not matter. Based on how other reviewers seem to really want to know who it was, I can understand the 1 star reviews.

I got my hopes up because this movie starts off strong and intriguing. It had so much potential. Don't be fooled. You will be throwing things at the TV when the credits start rolling. What is the point if this monstrosity?! There is no ending. No conclusion. No "ah ha moment." The movie just stops. You are just as confused at the end if the story as you are halfway through. A complete waste of my time. I feel so cheated. How do I get my time back?! Save yourself the frustration and anger and choose a different movie. Pretty much any other movie will be better than this one. You have been warned.
The first twenty minutes were good, but after that it just became creepy

reviews.review_title: Not Necessarily a waste of time....
reviews.content: So, it seems the best horror movies are those that keep you guessing and make you think you've pinpointed a suspect, but you were wrong! This movie is just like that, except it wasn't necessarily this big *surprise* ending you had hoped for. The storyline makes you think it's the house, makes you think it's the creepy town folk, makes you think it's some evil spirit, etc, etc. But in the end, it's just basically a serial killer who specifically targets open houses (as shown in the last scene where he's pulling up in his vehicle to the next 'open house', aka next victims to terrorize and ultimately kill). The problem is we wanted everything tied together to a greater, more interesting ending/explanation. But nope, just your average serial killer targetting specific victims. you also never get to see the killers face, or so you think... but if you pause at JUST the right times you can see his face almost perfectly in a couple scenes. Overall not a bad movie, the acting was very good... storyline just needed to lead to a better ending.

I watched this movie on Sunday the 3rd of February, might have been the best choice I have ever made:
It made the superbowl look really really good this year !
Horrible movie.
I cant believe I wasted my time on this rubbish. No ending, no explanation nothing! It's like the writer got bored and couldnt be bothered to finish it.
This is the most crappy, total waste of time movie. I think it's STUPID!!! Logan is a no brain character. It's worth CRAP I'm saying.

reviews.review_title: This isn't a typical horror movie
reviews.content: This isn't a typical horror movie and if you watch it with that expectation, then you will be disappointed like most of the other reviewers. I think a lot of it was deliberate misdirection (red herrings and horror movie cliches) intended for those who have seen a lot of these type of movies and try to guess which way it is going to go, so pay attention to everything. Watch it with a friend and have fun discussing it at the end.

reviews.review_title: Acted their hearts out, poor things
reviews.content: Unbelievably. Unfinished. Uncool. But the son, especially gave it everything he had...good acting overall...lacked an ending. Period. Someone please rewrite the ending.
Dreadful. There is NO plot or character development.

reviews.review_title: Should have read the reviews first
reviews.content:
The previous reviews, which I failed to read before watching, were right. It felt like they ran out of time for an ending or just couldn't be bothered ..... the acting was pretty good considering it was such a poor script, it kind of felt like they were leading you into a story but stopped halfway there.
The upside to this movie was I was snowed in and had nothing better to do for an hour and a half ...
It's perfect if you don't like a conclusion to your movies or any real depth
Wow Netflix got rid of some their good movies but not this one...smh. This movie shouldn't be a movie of a Hollywood film. Some independent movies are better to put out then this crap. Waste time

What happened and why.The scariest part of this movie is the fact that it exists.And the fact that it's not scary is not why it is so bad, it is bad in everything. I have no idea what the idea behind the movie was but if the goal was to create the worst movie there is then good job.I'm disappointed I can't rate it 0/10 because now I feel like the bad movies that got 1/10 rating didn't deserve this to be amongst them.
The movie keeps you entertained. There's no ending, but so what?!

reviews.review_title: Switches from day to night randomly!
reviews.content: Did anyone else notice while they are going to the mountain it is day time with snow on the road. When the almost hit the guy on the road it is night and no snow. They arrive at the local gas station/store, still night and no snow. They continue to the house (which must be close due to the neighbor being there) it is suddenly day with snow on the ground.

Generally surprised how awful this movie was. It starts out okay, and then continues to get worse throughout the rest of the movie. The acting in this movie if the only decent thing about it.They make an attempt to build suspicion about the locals in the area. They try to make you think that some how they're involved, or maybe one of them is the person in the house. And then by the end of the movie you find out the person is.... a complete random, who is such a nobody they don't even bother showing his face.If you want a movie with bad writing, an uninteresting, unoriginal story and an ending that doesn't feel like an ending, then this is the movie for you!
Other then that don't waste your time.

Why? Just why? I have this as one star only because I think I have to have one. Imagine walking into your new house and you saw....and some called on a random phone and.. and then the pilot light went out...and then bad shoes approached and... and then they hosted an open house.
There you go. You've just seen this film. I have to cleanse..

I don't know what else I should write here. The movie just simply doesn't make any sense, doesn't explain anything. Throughout the whole movie I had no idea what's happening and why. The ending is one of the worst I have seen in any movie to date.
I want my 1 hr and 34 mins back!!!Stay away from this movie
It hs been a long time since I have watched a movie that was less worth having been made. Plot was mindless, story barely there, and ending a black hole. Who the hell thought this was a good idea?

reviews.review_title: Get on up out of my Trash House.
reviews.content: Seriously, this film had promise with in the first 5-10 minutes. Then just went nowhere, fast. The premise of an open house could have been done really well but this was poorly executed. The scares, if thats what you want to call them were predictable and played out. It was tiresome watching the mother and son constantly going in to the basement turning on the boiler. The useless and awkward Realtors, as well has the useless and non-investigative police officers 'who'll check on you in the morning'. Just poor and there was no explanation as to who or why the 'killer' goes round doing what he does. Just trash. Don't waste your time, netflix already wasted their money on this.

I kind of liked the ending. It's like those ID channel shows where the case is unsolved and yeah it's annoying, but a lot of crimes go unsolved so it's a reality. I also perceive that the last scene hints that the serial killer uses open houses as a way to gain access to the home to stalk, terrorize, and kill his victims. So it's not necessarily someone who lives in town or knows the family but someone who just picks their victims based on the easy access of the Open House.

Never bothered to write a review until I saw this movie. I saw lots of movies and some of them bad but nothing came even close to the disaster that this Netflix original was.The beginning wasn't so bad, a bit slow, not great but I gave it a chance hoping that at one point the story will begin... well when I saw that I had 10 minutes left and nothing had happened I gave up hope.I cannot even begin to explain what this movie is about, it's not worth it, just stay away from it.

reviews.review_title: Why are people hating so hard on this?
reviews.content: To me, it seems more or less there's a band wagon on review artist here. By no means is this the best horror film on netflix. In fact this shouldnt really be classfied as a horror film, more suspense/action. You can definitely tell this was a minimal budget movie but by no means is this a bad movie. I dont get whats so hard to understand about the ending? Its clearly a serial killer that preys among open houses. He stays for the visit and doesn't leave? It shows him driving up to the next "open house", so we know "why" hes going to the next open house, we know "what" his mission is, we sort of know "who" he is. There's nothing Confusing about this movie at all, except at first i thought this was paranormal stuff happening vs someone physically, but was easy to figure out.

If you're looking for a movie where every major character is murdered with no explanation, no solution and no line up for a part two, this is the movie for you. I was so angry at the end of this film that I would like to make it my life's mission to keep others from watching. It's a shame, really. I liked the characters, the setting was cool, they could have done so much more. No one explains the weirdo towns people. No one explains who the murder is. I just feel lost and confused.

Though it is bad, it's not as bad as everyone's saying it is. The plot does make sense yet it is a bit contrived and messy. The beginning has absolutely nothing to do with the end, the father dying doesn't connect to the ending at all.That being said I'm a huge horror/thriller fan and this film, despite playing off beat to sh*t horror cliches does manage to be decently unnerving and disturbing. This film had a lot of potential considering it's decent cimatography, and good acting even with the completely flat and underwhelming script. If you want to make a movie about some as*hole that goes from open house to open house killing people, drive that point home and don't try to make it seem deeper than it is. This movie tried to be something it wasn't and for that reason became watered down and hard to digest.This film didn't know if it wanted to be the strangers or the killing of a sacred deer but I'd recommend it to a bored horror fan as a decently attractive, yet sensless, quick scare.

There is even no explanation for this story. But you can't even tell it story. The whole movie i thought: Well, interesting and thrilling.But nope. This film is less than a waste of time. Netflix: I am disappointed
Movie starts out great; good performances by the actors however the story has no ending. Even kids can write better ending then this.
Worst load of kak ever. Don't watch it and waste your time!

Total waste of time.
The film start pretty good, with is dad dead and a dream to do the olympic.... A moving into mountain and a mysterious house.... Everything was there to keep your attention.
But after that a random guy wants to buy a big house on is own ?
The crazy lady give a banana cake and the day after the kid vomit...
Seriously the last 20minutes doesnt make sense... Like we dont know the killer, why that free violence ?
Who was the lady and chris ??
Why such a weird scenario around them and no answer?
Why they didnt do anything about the fact that he want to do the olympic and he run fast?
Dont waste your Time, you just gonna be angry and without answers.

reviews.review_title: Do not waste your time!!!!!! Go awayy!!
reviews.content: This is the first time i really dissapoint in the plot and ending of the film. Ohhh that excitement then bring to nothing?! No explanation? Even just a little?! No reveal of the murderer?! Uggggghhhhhhh still the worst scenario ever such a waste for good actor and actress.. you can do better netflix!

The acting is really good and there are some good scares in the first half of the movie. Howeve, it completely falls apart the last 20 minutes and has the most unsatisfying ending I've ever seen. It had a lot of promise but amounts to nothing.
Start writing a ending for this movie, ending with no resolution.

This movie very closely mirrors Disturbia with a hell of a lot less satisfaction.It always bothers me to see really great actors in such crappy films. Dylan Minnette is very likable but is being held back by such terrible choices in films. Either he is chooses these terrible films, or these films are the only ones that are being offered to him. It's quite unfortunate because I see such potential for him.
This movie has amazing scare tactics, but that's really all it had to go on. With the main characters both dying at the end and never revealing who the bad guy is, this movie promises to disappoint. I honestly would not waste my time on this film unless you want to watch it but accept that it is okay to be left in the dark and stop watching it 20 minutes before the end.

The Open House is a movie that builds and builds; yet, nothing significant happens in this movie. The first two acts were filled with pacing issues and terrible storyteling. The thrid act was slightly better and a bit entertaining to watch. However, this movie overall has no compelling characters, a terrible story, uses every chiché in the book, and a horrible repetitive score that annoyed me.
Nothing stook out.
Just a boring, uninteresting, bland movie. Save your time on this one.Unless you look at it as an unintentional comedy. This movie is hilarious from the beginning to the end.
The worst movie ever I wasted my time on this!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Acting is good.. Story nonsense.. Don't ever watch this.

Probably one of the worst movies I have ever seen, and there are some shockers out there. I have no idea what the point of the movie was. So many random story elements that did not come together at all. Really bad movie, don't waste your time.

All the questions, never get answer.
I watch this because of Dylan Minnette.
Cannot believe he in this super-sucking movie.

reviews.review_title: Do not waste an hour and 34mins of your time watching this
reviews.content: If you're reading the reviews and thinking to yourself "I gotta see this myself", trust me, you just don't. It has no plot, no story, no character development, no development of any sort, it's like someone had a good idea and then didn't work on it at all, and then came the deadline and they did the whole story and the movie in 2 days. Yes, it's that bad.

reviews.review_title: First thought-What the Hell Just Happened?
reviews.content:
Like everyone else, I am floored by the lack of resolution in this movie. And as one reviewer pointed out, the level of violence at one point was completely unwarranted- Why did he break mom's fingers like that??? And one by one, but then they never even showed how he killed the kid? Did I miss something? Where was he when the kid stabbed his mom? Why did he leave the kid alive in the driveway in the first place? Why kill the other guy but not the kid? And what is up with the neighbor lady? She had nothing to do with anything? 
 So many questions!!
I actually Googled the movie to find out who the bad guy was and to try and make sense of it! This could have been a good movie-but it's not. 
Don't do it to yourself!

If you enjoy watching a movie and feeling completely unsatisfied and confused at the end then this movie is for you. This is a total waste of time because nothing is explained in the movie. It's like the writers got lazy and just decided to stop writing.

As a previous film student this movie just sucker punched me in the nose. I really enjoyed it up until the big reveal, which.. wasn't a reveal at all.I understand that it was supposed to be ambiguous. That it was supposed to leave you in shock, but when a film makes you feel like you've completely wasted your time watching it.. that's a failure.The acting was solid, the storyline up until the ending was pretty okay, I wasn't scared at any point which to be fair isn't the movies fault as horror doesn't spook me anymore (not that the movie was scary to begin with oh dear)A massive chunk feels like it's missing. At least with movies like Scream you see the killer and you find out their motives, no matter how bizarre. The ending felt rushed, like the writers had just given up and that's sad. There was so much that could have been done with it but it just felt so lazy.10/10 broken fingers, 3/10 stars

reviews.review_title: Alternate Title: Everybody makes the worst decisions possible for 90 minutes
reviews.content:
Such a waste. 
Literally every decision that every available character made was the worst possible decision they could have made. 
And the plot didn't even make sense... "My phone is missing. I guess it's just gone." Everyone would have turned the house upside down looking for their phone- especially a teenager. It all went downhill from there. Actually it was already going downhill when that happened. I seriously cannot even put into words how awful this was.

I thought this was going to be a great suspense thriller. I don't have anything more to add than what other reviewers said, but I wanted to add one more negative review to show how much the ending of this movie sucked. Like other reviewers stated, the acting was great and it was building up to be a decent thriller...but then nothing was explained. NOTHING! The son had flashbacks of witnessing his father's death which I thought might be foreshadowing something...like he owed money to someone and couldn't pay and was off'd for it. What was the point of the weird neighbor lady, or the water heater repair man, or the black guy that mentioned being there before and looking around but not saying goodbye?? Why was that family targeted, who killed them and why? I wanted to give it 1 star, but added a bonus star because the acting was good. I haven't been this disappointed in a movie in a long time.
The plot itself is good, and this movie had a lot of potential. It was suspenseful, a little creepy, keeps you interested....but the end is TERRIBLE. DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE.
Acting, cinematography was good. Making was also interesting and that drives us to some expectations,which was totally ruined in this movie.

If you're looking for a horror movie with a strong start that seems like it's leading to some big reveal, but doesn't, then this is the movie for you. I wasted 90 minutes of my life, and they didn't even show the killer's face. The ending is basically "haha, you get it? Because it doesn't matter who he is, he just kinda kills them because he wants to. Original, right?"Please don't waste your time.
Don't bother watching. The ending is terrible as in there is no ending. The whole time it's leading up to something and it never goes anywhere.

I only watched it because Netflix showed me a 96% match! Should have checked IMDb before - lesson learned. The movie had nothing. No twists, no mysteries, no real ending...
Furthermore, the movie wasted many opportunities. There was some potential, like the reason of the initial tragedy (was it really just an accident?), the old lady living next door who has Dementia (or does she?), what's up with the helpful black guy that they run in from time to time?
I don't even want to waste any more of my time dealing with this movie, like writing a proper conclusion for this review. Well, I think I've got one:
DON'T WATCH THE MOVIE!
And tell your friends not to watch it. But recommend it to people who you don't like ;)

reviews.review_title: I will NEVER get that time back!!
reviews.content: What happened when they were writing/filming this??? Did no one tell them that there needed to be a reason???
Absolutely pointless movie. It has no ending. After setting up the whole plot, it just stops and rolls credits without any explanation. Don't waste your time!

Really wished I had checked out these reviews first. 
Started off ok. That's it. Total waste of my time.

Was so looking forward to watching this movie after all the hype on Netflix.... did not live up to any expectations. Nothing happened and I was left feeling confused, disappointed and annoyed at the crappy ending!

I've never written a review before - no matter how much I loved or hated a movie but I feel compelled here. Bear with me.It's not a bad movie, not really. There's some great elements - the acting in particular from Minnette and Dalton. ((spoiler)) The former really pulled at my heart strings and I genuinely was upset in his last scene - which I can't say I often feel for horror movie protagonists. They're sympathetic characters and while their goals aren't fully fleshed out, they've got a decent bit of depth to them. Their set up and the movie's first half are quite strong in that regard - on top of some decent cinematography and mood. The threads laid out there eventually fall flat, however.So much seemed to be put out and then never picked back up. Why the constant preoccupation with the boiler over anything else? Why were the realtors so off? Why replace the glasses? What happened to the whole set up feeling "personal"? Martha in general and what happened to our olympic runner? It honestly did not feel "clever" that the movie didn't make use of moments (such as Logan getting sick or Naomi blaming his father for their situation OR harrassing the mother-son duo on the same level as some vapid teenagers playing ding-dong-ditch), just empty. I think it would have been neat to have it edge into weird towny territory, which could have filled out some of those connections. I may be biased, admittedly because ((spoiler)) I'm pretty tired of horror movies with empty connections between victim and assailant. It doesn't feel scary anymore to know "it could happen to you," just unsatisfying as a viewer... but that's just me.Overall, not an awful watch but if you're looking for something to really sink your teeth into, I'd look elsewhere.Also, as a contact/glasses user, there's no way he could have taken those out of Logan's eyes so smoothly. I call bull on that one. Anyway, thanks for reading!
Conpletly open ending. You don't even know who the bad guys is and why (SPOILER ALERT) he killed evryone.

As soon as I started this movie, it became clear what I was getting myself into. After a father dies in a car crash, his wife and teenage son move into a new house to get over their grief. It's an overdone premise with no originality to offer, but the cliches don't stop there.
Over half of the jump 'scares' in the film are mere misunderstandings - accidentally surprising someone or bumping into them by mistake. Along with loud sounds heard off-screen, the 'horror' elements are treated without care and executed lazily.
The dialogue and characters are often forced and unrealistic. The subplots of the son's running career and mother's photography ambitions are thrown in without purpose, just to fill screen-time (it barely passes the 90-minute mark). Scenes feature dark basements, shaky flashlights, creaky wooden doors, and mysterious locals, adding to the canned atmosphere throughout.
The film isn't all bad, however. The performances from Piercey Dalton and 13 Reasons Why's Dylan Minnette are solid. They perform well with what they're given, even if the dialogue is difficult to deliver realistically.
The cinematography is well done too: beautiful landscapes, elegant wides, and voyeuristic birds-eye-views. These shots hold long and racket up the suspense, though without any effective payoff.
The relationship between mother and son doesn't feel like it belongs in a horror film. The movie is almost split in twain; half about a ghost and half about a family drama. Bouncing back and forth between these is a nightmare for tone, scarier than the 'thrills' the film attempts to provide. 2014's The Babadook combines horror with family drama well; even when it's just the mother and son, there's a constant unsettling feeling and when the creature does show up, it hits like a truck.
All in all, The Open House is not worth any viewer's time. Its performances and cinematography are good, but the constant cliches, poor dialogue, unoriginal writing, and generic score weight it down. Not to mention the weak ending, predictable plot and worst of all, it's not scary. There are a few good moments scattered throughout, such as the hauntingly beautiful "Silent Night" sequence, but repetitive scenes and overall lack of creativity cement this as a failure. It's beyond the point of being a 'so-bad-it's-good' flick like The Room, Birdemic: Shock and Terror or the Sharknado series. The Open House isn't enjoyable, just bad.

Give this a skip! Terrible all round! No real scares, no thought or care put into the story, awfully written characters. Misdirection all around and an hour and a half of that would be better spent looking at actual open houses rather thanThe Open House.
Imagine a movie where nothing that happened matters and the end is just it and that's all. That's what this movie is about. Pointless

At first I thought it would be an average horror movie. But it was less than bad. In this movie nothing was explained, everyone just died. And why do always a black man dies first?! There was a woman with alzheimer who showed up and disappeared, I guess the writers put her in there just so the film would look scarier. I want my time back. The movie was unrealistic and cheap!

As a fan of horror and horror-thriller movies i constantly search for movies in this genre that can give me a certain range of emotions or scare me in a way that not many have before. this movie kinda got me through its dark 
sinister athmosphere, its direct, no mercy approach. no explanations, no twists, no magical final.
this movie doesnt try so hard as so many horror movies nowadays do. Just for this fact alone the movie deserves better.
a movie review/rating is always objective. but this movie is rated like a b-movie with a badly written storyline and horrible acting - but is far from that. its not a masterpiece overall but its certainly above bad or OK.
Never been so angry and felt wasting my time like this ever

Started out great and literally NOTHING happened until the final minutes of the movie. Then the final minutes leaves you with no answers or explanations regarding anything throughout the movie. Complete waste of time honestly
Was hoping for at least a good ending. But nope, waste of time

I gave this movie 1 star because I didn't know how to give it negative stars. This was without a doubt, the WORSE movie I've ever seen. The acting itself was not bad but the script went absolutely nowhere. I had so many unanswered questions when it was over. Who was the killer?, Why did he/she kill these people? Did this person just have a hatred for "Open Houses"? Why did I waste part of my life watching this movie?
Was this supposed to be a joke??? Netflix, shame on you!!!

reviews.review_title: Just got so pissed after watching
reviews.content: First time writing a movie review. This movie is just totally bs.

reviews.review_title: Probably the worst movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: The Open House was one if the worst movies I have ever seen. The movie had a very interesting premise that had SO much potential. The early scenes start out great giving you this creepy feeling and making you anxious for them. But at the end LITERALLY NOTHING that got set up is paid off. You don't know who the killer is or what happened in earlier scenes. When the end comes, you realize how pointless and stupid the earlier scenes were. It uses the clever tropes that are so obviously stolen from better horror movie like Get Out and The Shining. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME.
I just wasted hours watching this film and I'm not wasting more of my time writing an in depth review. That was boring, slow and all-round terrible. Quickly reviewing it just to warn others away.

It starts off well. The cinematography is nice, the location is beautiful, the actors seemed to do a good job with what they had... but they didn't have anything to go off of. It starts off like many, many, MANY movies of this style do and you're left to guess what's going to happen at the end. There is literally no guess work here because there is no story and no plot points to drive. Mom and son move after death of the father, move into creepy mountain house, some psycho decides he's going to kill them. End of story.0 stars for writing, 2 stars one for actors and one for location.
Total waste of time, bad plot, the movie has no point. Wasted 90 minutes of my life
The acting is superb.The setting is mesmerizing.The director sucks.

reviews.review_title: 90 minutes of nothing. 4 minutes of action. No explanation at the end
reviews.content: This movie gets 1 star f presentation (cinematography was very good) and 1 star for a score that made this seem not actually bad.I sat through 90 minutes of almost nothing happening with annoying characters. Seriously. Nothing. And when something does finally happen at the very end, you get no surivors, no clue who the villian is, no explanation. Waste of my time. They tried to be artsy and took themselves way, way way too seriously
What a steaming pile...doesn't even deserve a review. The only bright spots in this 💩 are Piercey Dalton's shower scenes. If only they'd filled the gap between the opening and closing credits.

reviews.review_title: I'm not sure if I have even seen a worse movie
reviews.content: Just brutal. Just absotlely brutal. Please don't even entertain watching this movie
Really bad. I'm pretty easy to scare and this was nothing. It's predictable until the last 20 mins. Then it's just stupid.

Life is short, yet I unwillingly gave two precious hours of my time to a film that lacked one simple thing ... a damn ending! Not only am I pissed off, I'm now on IMBD sharing my frustration because I cannot believe that this film was ever given a greenlight! The beginning of the film had promise, and the actors pulled me in. In fact, they did what they were expected to do, which was act! The setup seemed like it would payoff, but I was so, so freaking wrong. Then there were the lackluster shock scenes that became trite and tiresome, plus the nearly predictable on and off camera violence that made the plot unravel into something less than pointless. The movie tried to take me someplace, but ended up nowhere. It all swirled into this wasted, directionless ending ... which by any standard was completely pathetic! WARNING ... do not waste your time, because as I said ... life is short. You could take sit on the toilet for two hours, whistle to yourself and daydream about marbles and it would be 1000 times better then watching this movie.
It is so bad it's almost impressive.So badSo so bad...
What the actual heck? Absolutely dead-end story with zero reasons to have seen it.

I don't know why there are so many bad ratings. It was exciting from beginning til the end. The end isn't really open, but it is clear that the murderer is a total psycho that has fun in scaring and murdering people who want to sell their house. He gets to know them and uses these information to play tricks on the families. 
So you don't need to see his face, because he is just a stranger that loves to kill. I'm fine with that. In my opinion there doesn't have to be a deeper sense.
So much potential. Such a letdown. I want the last 90 minutes of my life back. THERE WAS NO CONCLUSION TO THIS MOVIE. SO ANGRY.

I wanted to like this movie, I really did. I didn't mind the acting. It was not the best but it certainly wasn't the worst. Throughout the movie I kept asking myself who could the stalker be? is it Chris? No. Is it the weird neighbor? No. Is it the real estate Agent or the kid with her? No again. Was it a total stranger? It appears yes. A total stranger who takes the time to take out someones contact lenses. Really? Why when ypu are just going to kill him would you bother taking out his contact lenses. Why didnt the real estste agent call the police when she found out the house was broken into? Too many holes in the plot with a cheap ending.

I personally love when the main characters die in horror films. Just so long as it is justified, in some way or another. Give me context. Thats all i ask. I dont care that everyone died. As long as it was just. But since i have no idea why any of it happened, i cant justify the outcome. If i had some context, i would be able to concieve my own theory. But its one of those films that says, "fuck you!" At least the strangers gave some context as to why everyone died. "Because why not." Thats better than nothing at all, which is what this film gave us, along withh the proverbial middle finger. Thank you Netflix, for once again wasting my time!
The worst part of this movie unexplained and without logic end
Do not waste your time. I was home with the flu and I regret giving up that time. Yes, I'm saying I'd rather have the flu than watch this.
If you hate someone, suggest this movie. Such a waste of time. **why the neighbor was in the movie by the way?**
Writers/directors fault, not Dylan's. Brilliant acting job. Super engaging. Very believable. Ending was confusing... but @dylanminnette is genius!!

reviews.review_title: What a horrible piece of crap
reviews.content: What a waste of time. No story whatsoever. Umpteenth time I'm disappointed with a Netflix movie. Get a life.

reviews.review_title: Need to fire the writer and the director of this movie
reviews.content: The worst ending for a movie I've ever watched in my entire life.
I've never left a review for a movie before. But this might be the worst movie I've ever seen. No plot, terrible character development and the laziest ending of a movie I've witnessed

reviews.review_title: Could have been a decent film.
reviews.content: I gave it a 3/10 because I didn't feel like it was a horrendous movie, but it could have definitely been better. The acting was good but nothing was new at all in the story line.. one thing I will say is that the addition of the contact scene was a new one for me. (Maybe it's because I have contacts.. I've always had a fear that I'll lose them and not be able to see anything!). Being in a situation where I cannot see where I'm going or people scares me. Other than that, it was a slow movie until the last fifteen twenty minutes that are a huge let down. Questions you have will never be answered and you will no doubt be a bit angry by the end. Overal, a not so terrible movie with a terrible ending that makes no sense.

reviews.review_title: Like a cold stop mid orgasm!
reviews.content: Good suspense up to the end, but then...What the hell?! No ending? Like stopping & abruptly walking away mid orgasm!
This movie is terrible. I dont like this. Everyone pleas listen to me!!! Dont watch. This is a waste of time!
Just wasted an hour and a half waiting for what could have been a great ending. Too bad the writers kid spilled coffee on the final scene script and Netflix just ran with out it.

Read the spoilers. Please. Save yourself 90 min of your time.This movie (and I use the term loosely) started out OK, but I have no idea what happened to it other than it left more questions and no answers. It seemed to be something that would be used as an example in a high school drama class as how NOT to make a movie.
Very little character development, and then after I watched it I could see why. Who hit the dad? Who was Martha and what did she have to do with anything? Why didn't the sheriff show back up in the AM to check on things like they said they would. Or did they? Who was the killer? Why were they so terrified when they saw his face?
The ending was enough to frustrate anyone who watched it. Sooo many unanswered questions. I feel like I watched a football game where in the 4th quarter the players just came out to the field and milled around aimlessly till the final whistle. No closure whatsoever.Worst. Movie. Ever.

But then, just like that, the promise of a decent thriller vanished. The idea behind the plot was good, a family recovering from a tragedy moves into a beautiful home for free until they can get back on their feet only to have strange things happen to them while they are there. Could it be a ghost? Could it be a serial killer? Unfortunately, it was the latter, but we weren't given any further information about the reasoning why. For awhile, I thought, hmmm, could it be someone who knew the family but we were left hanging with an ending that just left us with more questions, and the sad realization that I will never get the 90 minutes of my life back that I devoted to watching this movie.

reviews.review_title: Would give it a 0 if I could ...
reviews.content: What the heck even?!? Started off on a good note then 8 minutes into it .... pffffft. Then the ending - no ending at all! Seriously - I'm kind of pissed!

Okay here's the thing the movie started off great and actually was heading somewhere plus the acting in the movie was pretty good. But you get towards the ending and it's absolute garbage. The plot was for sure throw down the drain and had no connections or the characters didn't share a motions and connect to each other and the events happening. This movie literally made no sense what so ever. It's a monstrosity of a movie. Me being movie fan of horror and thrillers was offended on how crappy this movie was. I'm very disappointed with how this all played out. You my as well remove it from Netflix. Literally wasted an hour of my life from watching the movie and writing this review I could be eating or doing something better with my time like eating food or sleeping but I'm so pissed of that I had to write a review of this dumb a** movie. My revie is pretty accurate if you ask me. I mean how do you have random weird people just kill you in a forest for no reason. It's very confusing and leaves you with a bunch of questions that Likely won't ever be answered. I've made a great decision on nominating this worst movie of the year and made me want to chuck my remote at my TV. It had multiple suspicious creepy people in it but didn't link to the plot which there really wasn't one. This is literally the movie- Logan's (kid) dad dies and mother can't support logan because they are broke. Moms in need of a place so moms sister lends her an old huge creepy house that's for sale up in the mountains in the middle of no where. Then creepy shi* happens mostly jump scares so it kind of sucks. And it makes no sense these people have no background indormation and the son logan mad mom just end up dying bc some random guy kills them. You don't even know who they guy is and why he did it. Maybe he is psycho but I know I am from watching that movie. To be fair I'm alright with a movie leaving behind some questions or a final thought. But when a movie like this just leaves out so much information it's doesn't make sense it's like they didn't even finish the movie. When I found out the ending I thought wow I would of fathered clean my room and be productive for once. Sorry for the spoiler but just so you know this movie is a disgrace and is just depressing if I could rate in for rotten tomatoes it would be at 1 or 0% fifty shades darker did better. What's even more messed up is Netflix rated it the top movie to watch. Whoever watched this played yourself. RIP movie.
It's a waste of time. there is no motive for the crimes, the peculiar behavior of some characters have nothing to do with the killer - it's a huge BS

First of all. I'm a 55 year old woman. ( signed in on hubbys account ). 
It's 4:30 am here on the east coast. I got a late start on the movie. I just couldn't go to sleep until I watched the end to see whodunnit!! 
But the whodunnit never came! So, thank you poor writers. Now I'm going to be puffy under my eyes for nothing! I'll take a few dark lack of sleep circles for something that's worth it. Actors did a decent job especially with what they had to work with. I hope the writers are young and inexperienced. That gives them time for some much needed improvement. If at first you don't succeed...... And you didn't succeed lol.

I gave it 2 stars just because some jump scares in the movie. Most of the time NOTHING happens until last 30 mins. The ending is just strange. The disappointing thing is the climax is just unfair. None of the events in the movie seem related at all... what a waste of good suspense build up and scrambled in the end.
Please don't waste your time on this one. Thanks for wasting my time Netflix.
It started good, but I interrupted to read Imdb, and then I gathered it is not worth seeing, so I stopped.

You just keep waiting for something good to happen till you realize credits screen has just showed up!Expected quite a lot from the movie, but there is nothing good in the movie to watch, I just kept waiting that something good would happen, but it never happened.

I'm sat here in absolute disbelief.
The film doesn't have an ending - I don't understand!
Whether they ran out of budget or the cast & crew were beamed-up by extra terrestrials, I dunno, you're waiting for the conclusion & there isn't one - beats me. *shaking head*
My advice is save yourself losing 90 mins that you'll never get back & do or watch something else - seriously!!!

reviews.review_title: More interesting than other reviews suggest
reviews.content: It's brooding and atmospheric in a way somewhat reminiscent of "The Shining." This movie kept me on the edge of my seat until the literal end. Perhaps those who didn't enjoy this film simply couldn't go along for the ride without expecting some grand "payoff" to the "mystery" at the end? As a practice in both "red herrings" and "realism," this film is really much better than it seems at first brush. Perhaps a tad long and meandering, and the ending leaves one with more questions than answers, but it is tautly suspenseful throughout. And really, the ability to maintain that suspense and my interest for so long is better than any "reveal" could hope to be. I am definitely hoping for a sequel.

Absolutely horrible. Netflix should give everyone a free months rental fee as they wasted 90 plus minutes on this garbage. Plot started out fine and then it turns into many movies that we've seen and then the end was absolute garbage. I hope these writers are never allowed to do another piece of trash. Thank Netflix for posting this as something I need to watch.DO NOT WATCH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

No payoff whatsoever. This movie essentially has no ending. There is nothing to justify or give any significance to any of the events that do take place before the credits roll. You watch things happen, formula style thriller things, and then wham! The credits roll. There is literally no reason to watch this.
Starts of promising and then everybody dies. Never find out who kills them. Zero ties to any characters. Zero motives. Absolutely pointless.

I only gave it two stars because I feel it was well acted but in the end this movie is cliche as heck. Every plot twist is easy to call and tailor made to squick people out. Basements? Check! Gratuitous eye touching? Check! A tropey list of side characters that could maybe sorta kinda be involved? Check! 
 
Sound like I give something away? Nope! Because in the end you get rewarded with only half of the story. There is no closure and no "The End". We get no why or resolution. We get a huge downer of an ending (I own't completely spoil anything). As a viewer you are rewarded with completely diddly and you'll leave with less than you started with because you're not going to get this 94 minutes back.
 
As a side note for the people who care about these things: The camera shot choices are obnoxious.

reviews.review_title: That's time we'll never get back!
reviews.content: If you value your time then avoid this awful film. Can't abide a film with no ending! Total waste of time!

reviews.review_title: Just go out for a drink...
reviews.content: Don't even try to see if it's going to get good it won't!

reviews.review_title: Not sure how people said there wasn't an ending.
reviews.content:
I honestly don't know how people reviewed this saying there was no ending. The ending was clear: they died.
I feel like I watched a different version than everyone else because I was satisfied with that ending. The elusive nature of the film added that creepy vibe, I feel like the characters were explained just fine, except the murderer, but we didn't really need to know that information.

reviews.review_title: Dramatic music, NOTHING else! Don't waste your time!!
reviews.content: I watched this movie because the main male actor is one of my favs..but this movie was HIGHLY DISAPPOINTING! It started off good, but that's where it ends. The music was extremely dramatic but with zero legitimacy behind it. The writers failed big time with character building and everything else! The ending was ridiculous with no answers!! Total waste of time for anyone!
Nothing good about this movie. I was left with so many questions,with no answers.

Terrible film, although it had its suspenseful moments as any horror film should, I couldn't even tell you the plot of the film. Was it paranormal? Was it the neighbour? Was it a house viewer? And saying the point of the film is to leave you guessing is a cop out..absolute drivel.

If you want to waste 1 hour and 30 minutes of your time, try this flick. 
No ending whatsoever. 
I should have read the reviews here and instead of watching play a game, go for a walk or even use the toilett. All of that is way more entertaining. 
Actually a pity since the acting was good. 
Anyway.. pffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff

About 20 minutes in I got the first hints - I noticed they were just moving right into the "weird stuff happening" phase, and I remember thinking "Oh, I guess they're not gonna both much with a plot." They actually started off with some interesting ideas, making it seem like there was something weird going on with the open houses, for example (you know, the title of the film). But alas, nothing was ever explained, nothing happened with the open house aspect - in the end, it was just a creepy house and they were killed for no apparent reason by a no-name dude.I think what makes it really bad is the writers seemed to know how to come up with good ideas that made the movie interesting, but they just literally decided not to have any of them go anywhere. Plenty a movie has started with a good idea and taken it in a bad direction, but this movie started with a good idea and then just took it in no direction. tl;dr don't bother with this movie
Just finished watching this! What a waste of time. Loved it up until the no end... no explanation or story to finish! Gutted and wish I never started haha

This is without doubt the worst film ever made. It's worth watching simply because it's so bad. The director has no idea at all how to create suspense, ambitiance or any type of scare factor. I do have a few recommendations for improvements (warning spoilers ahead, however you should be concerned as there isn't anything to spoil):1) the only remotely interesting scene is when the Mum is tied to a rocking chair, tortured a bit and then the atactor inexplicably disappears for a bit (I personally think he went to make a cup of tea). At this point the film would have become a cult movie if she had used the rocking chair as an escape vehicle by rocking herself out of the room, down the stairs and away to freedom. Unfortunately she just sat there; such a missed opportunity.
2) most of the film is spent with Mum or Logan (her sun) going up and down the stairs to the cellar to relight the boiler. I have a boiler too although I've never considered that me relighting it would make s great central plot for a film or any other type of entertainment for that matter. The film would have been much better if they just bought a new boiler.
3) Logan (the son) is the worst hero ever in any film, he's a complete whirl with absolutely no survival skills at all. The film would have been vastly improved if they had cast a boiled potato as the hero.
4) the film just ends, they forgot to make the last ten minutes which in some ways was a relief. However to the writer/Director/producer if you ever again have the misguided idea that you should make a film again please have a point.
Great plot, scenery everything just perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
The writing has room for improvement. But this is not that fizzled as most negative reviewes say. I quite enjoyed the thriller and btw Dylan is so cute.

reviews.review_title: Please do not waste your time!
reviews.content:
Oh boy I regret wasting my time with this movie! I wish I'd checked the reviews first... 90 minutes I'll never get back. 
I really wonder what was Netflix thinking! Based on the trailer the movie seems good so I was so surprised how shit it turned out to be. Utter nonsense! The movie has no plot and it is literally missing and ending. 
So basically there is a mom and a teenage boy, weird old lady that has absolutely nothing to do with anything and apparently s psycho-killer. Everybody dies and thats it!!

First of all, I need to apologize to my son.
It was my idea for both of us to watch this film.
I thought it would be one of those nice little horror films, you know - kind of like "The Shining", but on a much smaller scale and with actors I never heard of before, since this is a Netflix film.
All the tell-tale signs of a bad film were there - various scenes borrowed from classic horror films, the loud music that played every time something "horrific" was going to happen, the classic weird neighbor, the nice guy who befriends the mother and son.
You just know this guy is going to be a victim of a grisly death, very predictable..
Still, we plodded on through the movie, thinking that soon enough the scattered and random pieces of what was supposed to be a plot would all come together in some suspenseful scene at the end.
But it was like so much fluff, it was not even worthy of the one lousy star I gave it in this review.
I still feel queasy after watching it.
I think there should be a support group for all who watched this poor excuse of a movie.
My advice: never go to this open house.

1 hour and 30 minutes I'll never get back... Utter trash and a waste of time!! I should have checked the reviews but next time I will... Netflicks dont send me anymore emails about move that have less then 6 stars...

What were high hopes for this film were dashed to pieces and whats worse you sit through the entire run time to find out you wasted that time. This movie seemed like it would be rather interesting when the trailer was viewed on a top 10 thriller list via YouTube. But the unfortunate truth is the film is lacking in so many ways. The acting is bad and seems forced in many instances. Character development of the staring actors is inadequate and supporting actors seem to be thrown in with even less development. As for plot, you'll waist the entire film asking where it is. Cinematography is decent, but not good enough to add another star to the rating. There are plenty of thrills and chills, if you like cliche' "oh look there's the bad guy" moments. Ultimately the film generates 99 questions, but answers not one. In conclusion if you are going to watch this movie be prepared to come out of it drawing conclusions for yourself to apply even some small measure of closure.

reviews.review_title: Could have been a GREAT movie without that RIDICULOUS ending.
reviews.content:
